title: Add delete option to episode's context menu
body: Closes #2548. This PR makes following changes: - Adds delete option to episode's context menus in queue and feed list - Adds a storage preference that allows episodes to be automatically removed from queue when they are deleted (by clicking delete in context menu, or pressing trash can icon on `Completed` tab of `Downloads` page) - Adds a test for the aforementioned preference ---

title: Possibility to cast/stream to Sonos
body:
It would be nice to be able to cast/stream to Sonos speakers.
In this way, when I come home, I can continue to listen to the pidcadt I was listening in the car.
Thanks!

title: FR: Allow per-podcast sort and download order option
body:
As a threshold, it would be useful to be able to choose sort order in the podcast view (the view of all episodes in a given podcast), and for this setting to be remembered for each podcast.

Ultimately, it would be great if, for each podcast, a user could choose not only the sort order, but also the download order. This would be useful for certain podcasts that are meant to be listened to chronologically (e.g. History of Rome).

As an example, for a podcast like the History of Whatever, I would like the episode list to be filtered to show unplayed episodes (this can already be done), sorted from oldest to newest, and set to download the next oldest unplayed episode (so that whenever I finish an episode, the next one auto-downloads).

For this to be truly useful, it would have to be remembered for each podcast, so that once I set these things, the episode view for the podcast defaults to my chosen settings.

A further enhancement would be per-podcast download settings, where I could select how many episodes of a given podcast I would like to auto-download, following that podcast's download order preference.

One example of an app that handles these use cases quite well, though I am sure that there are others, is Player FM. I'm not much of a fan of that app for unrelated reasons, but the ability to customize how a podcast is displayed and downloaded is admirable.

**App version:** 1.7.1 (Google Play)
**Android version**: 8.1 LineageOS
**Device model**: Pixel OG

title: Mobile updates setting: Allow covers
body:
The mobile updates setting currently controls downloads of episodes and covers. It would be great to have an option to allow icon updates but not episode updates. The current option could be changed to a multi-select option:

Mobile updates:

- Icons only
- Icons and episodes

title: Auto feed update fix in airplane mode
body:
Closes #2906

`DBTasks.checkShouldRefreshFeeds()` is also refactored and moved to `AutoUpdateManager`.

Also, `checkShouldRefreshFeeds()`, a (somewhat) workaround to address #1942, is not really needed for devices with Android 7+ / API 24 anymore. The new (in v1.7.0+) `FeedUpdateJobService` fixes the problem without the workaround.

title: Improve integration tests
body:
Most integration tests are either really slow or fail.

#2870 fixed at least some of them but there are many more to do.

title: Feature Request: auto-enqueue last N unplayed episodes
body:
As a user, I want to set a feed to keep the latest N episodes in the queue so that I always have the last few episodes enqueue and I don't have to remove older episodes manually.

Acceptance criteria
- Each feed can be set to keep N episodes in the queue, where N is a user-selectable number > 0
- When a feed updates, if there are more than N unlistened episodes available, the most recent N episodes are added to the queue, and the older episodes are removed from the queue.

title: Feature Request: sort or filter by audio vs video feed
body:
As a user I want to select "only audio" or "only video" so that when I'm listening to audio at high speed while driving, I don't suddenly have this low speed video playing that I have to fumble around and try to skip.

Acceptance criteria
- Audio and video episodes are not mixed in the same queue.
- Or they are automatically skipped if the player is set to one or the other for playback, e.g., when set to "audio only" the player automatically skips playback of video episodes.

title: Feature Request: view Favorited episodes
body:
As a user I would like to click a drawer item to see all items that I have Favorited, so that I can listen to episodes I marked as favorites. Right now I don't think there is any way to locate or identify these episodes.

Acceptance criteria
- An option exists on the drawer to see Favorited episodes
- Favorited episodes can be sorted like the regular queue

title: Feature Request: Multiple Queue's
body:
As a user, I would like to have a multiple queues so that I can select one set of podcasts to listen to on the way to work, and another set to listen to on the way home.

Acceptance criteria
- I can add each podcasts to one or more queues.
- Each queue can be named so I know what they contain, e.g., 'music,' or 'morning news,' etc.
- Each queue can be sorted with it's own criteria, i.e., queue 1 can be sorted by episode title, and queue 2 can be sorted by episode publish date.
- When each podcast updates, it's current episode is listed in all queues to which the podcast belongs.(Similar to current functionality.)
- All podcasts download updated episodes, regardless of which queue they are assigned.

title: Add configurable behavior of the back button
body: This PR allows users to change how the back button functions. Closes #2196 Possible choices are following: - **Default** - back button functions how it currently functions (closes the app if there is nowhere to go back to) - **Go to page** - back button opens chosen page (Queue, Episodes or Subscriptions) and closes the app if you're already on that page - **Open navigation drawer** - back button always opens the navigation drawer instead of closing the app - **Double tap to exit** - like default, but requires two taps to close the app - **Confirm to exit** - like default, but prompts user if they really want to exit ---

body:
[From Google Group](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/antennapod/n8A-GEOc5GM/YLw9NDDAAQAJ):
> Is there any way to hide the popup that says the podcasts are updating? I receive pushes on my PC, receiving that every hour isn't ideal. Ultimately I would like to know when new episodes are released, not when it's updating.

Discussed already in #613, but with the set-up described above, I can imagine it's annoying. A setting to disable feed update notifications could help in this case.

title: Add 'back up' to settings title
body: Users may be searching for this in the settings, adding this phrasal verb to the title hopefully helps.

title: Improving queue lock UX
body:
Currently, the queue is unlocked by default, but still many users get confused about why they're not able to reorder the queue (see eg #2091; #2235; #2396; #2897). The snackbar notification we currently have doesn't seem to do it's job (of informing all users indefinitively).

There's two things we could implement:
- Replace queue lock snackbar notification with 'pop-up' on first toggle: if users have to press 'OK' before they can proceed, we can be sure they will see it (even though remembering this functionality is another thing)
- Use more clearly distinguishable icons for the lock state (suggested [here](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/2235#issuecomment-271792004) they're very similar, and I must say I agree)

title: Misleading error message upon feed retrieval fail while disk full
body:
**App version:** 1.7.0 from Google Play Commit 4ba36b82

**Android version**: 8.1.0

**Device model**: Nokia TA-1012 (N8)

**Expected Behaviour:**

If the storage space is completely full and fetching the feeds fails because of that, show an error message saying that.

**Current Behaviour:**

Yesterday, all of my feeds would come back with an "invalid type" error message upon refresh. This persisted for about 12 hours, until I listened through a podcast, thus freeing up memory via auto-delete. Refresh worked again immediately after that.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. *Completely* fill the disk (this is somewhat difficult to do by hand)

2. Press the "refresh" button


**Environment:**

I'm currently running my device with my memory almost completely full. The amount of space still available varies depending on the podcasts I delete/download.


**My hypothesis:**

Refreshing the feed needs some minuscule amount of storage space. If that space is not available, it will fail. The error message returned, however, is an "invalid type" message, because the error case was not foreseen and the "invalid type" error is returned from the first error check that fails.

title: Mark as played is applied on wrong feed item when refresh is in progress
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
**App version:** 1.7.0 from Google Play
**Android version**: 7.x 

**Expected behaviour**:
When selecting an Item in the "New Episodes" screen, and then doing "Mark as played" it should mark the item which was selected when i opened the context menu.


**Current behaviour**:
If a refresh is in progress and new items are added to the list, while the context menu is open, a click on the "Mark as played" item in the menu, applies the action to the wrong item. This probably also applies to the other context menu actions, but i didn't try them explicitly.




**First occured**: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago
Happened to me a lot of times and is not a recent regression, but now got around investigating it.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Import a big opml with lots of feeds (to have new entries appear while already having some in the list)
2. Go to the new view
3. Mark one episode, open context menu
4. Wait until another episode gets loaded into the New view
5. Press an action
--> the action will be applied to the wrong item

```

Issue as described in https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/63622293

Fix adapted from https://github.com/evernote/android-job/pull/502

title: Allow to select all above/below in batch editor
body: Closes #2722

title: [Feature] Download only latest episode
body:
I currently subscribe to news podcasts and use the auto-download feature but I am not always caught up. I am not interested in old news, just the latest episode.

Is there any way to download only the latest N episodes of a podcast?

Thanks for a great app!

title: WIP: Upgraded Glide to version 4.8.0
label: [Label(name="do not merge")]
body:
Upgrading the support libraries was necessary because Glide uses 27.1.0 internally. 
https://stackoverflow.com/a/51095720/4193263

The app crashes (without stack trace) when starting, but at least it compiles. For debugging, we probably need to enable logs: http://bumptech.github.io/glide/doc/debugging.html

title: Delete episode doesn't work / deletes the wrong episode
body: Running 1.6.6-RC1 on Marshmallow.  I download all episodes on wifi and then play via the 'Completed' tab.  Sometimes, when done playing an episode, I will hit the 'trash can' icon and nothing happens, even if I click it multiple times.  If I switch to the 'episodes' tab and then back to 'completed', the screen will refresh and show that a different episode was deleted than the one I selected.  It only seems to delete one episode if I hit it multiple times, not multiple episodes.

title: master and develop have diverged
label: [Label(name="project issue")]
body:
master is 500+ commits behind develop, but also has 18 additional ones.
Merge master into develop after the release of 1.6.6
We can either merge develop into master after the conflicts have been resolved or when 1.6.7 GA is out.

title: Fix error-prone errors
when switching to chapters-screen, vertically center the currently playing chapter
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body: a feature request: when swiping to the chapters screen of the currently playing podcast, it would be awesome if the currently playing chapter (which is already visually distinct from the others, that's good) would be centered on the screen. In podcasts with many chapters, it is often necessary to scroll for a while to find the currently playing chapter. Having it auto-scroll so that the currently playing chapter is in the center of the screen would directly allow navigation to adjacent chapters (next, prev and so forth).

title: How do I recover a Corrupted Database?
body:
I somehow lost all of my subscription information. The app behaves as if I've never subscribed or listened to anything. The directory structure still has info for all of my podcasts, though, and a file called "CorruptedDatabaseBackup", which was modified on the day that I first saw this problem. Is there anything I can do to rebuild my subscription/queue info, without wiping the directory and starting from scratch?

**App version:**
Version 1.6.6-RC1 (Beta Tester), released July 22, 2018.
Downloaded and installed from the Google Play Store

**Android version**:
Android Version 9.0 (codename Pie)
Verizon pushed this over-the-air software update on September 5, 2018
No custom ROM

**Device model**:
Google Pixel (1st generation)

**Expected behaviour**:
I have around 20 different podcasts in my feed. I generally have about 10 files downloaded and ready for play in my queue. Recently, I have had a backlog of about 500 un-listened episodes in my Subscriptions, as I have been about 2 months behind for a bit.

**Current behaviour**:
The app behaves as if I have no Podcast subscriptions, no items in my Queue, no Playback History, In addition, my "Total time of podcasts played" is listed as "0.0 hours", even though I have definitely listened to hundreds of hours via this app. It basically looks like I have never used the app before, though my settings seem to be in tact, because it knows I listen as 1.1x speed.

I don't know what I did to cause this. I reboot my phone regularly. I have >1GB of free space. I have not rooted or unlocked my phone, nor installed any strange/custom ROMs. I am an AntennaPod Beta tester, and let the app update whenever a new version is released, though there was not a new release coinciding with this issue.

But the actual install directory on my phone does show that my subscription information has not been completely erased, though my database may have been corrupted. My current directory structure looks like the following. Note the file named "CorruptedDatabaseBackup:
```
\Pixel\Internal shared storage\Android\data\de.danoeh.antennapod
    cache\ (empty)
    files\
        cache\
            Contains a list of 49 podcasts, many of which no longer produce new episodes
        export\
            antennapod-feeds.html
            antennapod-feeds.opml
        images\
            Contains files for 2 podcasts
        import\ (empty)
        media\
            Contains 85 directories, one for each podcast, though many are ones I unsubscribed from long ago.
            Within those 85 dirs are a total of 22 episodes in MP3 format
        "NOMEDIA File" (.nomedia, empty file)
        CorruptedDatabaseBackup.db (19.6MB, Modified 10/2/2018 10:49 AM)
        crash-report.log (1.35KB, modified 9/7/2018 6:23 PM)
```


**First occurred**: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago
I first noticed this on October 2, 2018. I use the app frequently, so this issue must have first occurred no earlier than September 30, 2018.

**Steps to reproduce**:
No steps are required. Any time I open the app, even after a reboot, it looks like I have no subscriptions, like I have never used the app before.

**Environment**: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?]
I just use this Google Pixel phone, though I often connect to Bluetooth devices (car, Google Home speaker, Anker Bluetooth Speaker) or use standard headphones.
I don't use Prestissimo.
I listen as 1.1x playback speed.
I don't have Auto Download enabled.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
There is a "crash-report" file available, but it is from September 7, 2018. I have used the app extensively after that date. It was the beginning of October when this problem first occurred. But here is the contents anyway:
```
crash-report:
[ Environment ]
Android version: 9
OS version: 3.18.100-ga3ced9894032
AntennaPod version: 1.6.6-RC1
Model: Pixel
Device: sailfish
Product: sailfish

[ StackTrace ]
java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occurred while executing doInBackground()
	at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:354)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.finishCompletion(FutureTask.java:383)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:252)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:271)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1167)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:641)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:764)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to read from field 'de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.playback.PlaybackServiceMediaPlayer de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.playback.PlaybackService.mediaPlayer' on a null object reference
	at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.PlayerWidgetJobService.onHandleWork(PlayerWidgetJobService.java:5683)
	at android.support.v4.app.JobIntentService$CommandProcessor.doInBackground(JobIntentService.java:391)
	at android.support.v4.app.JobIntentService$CommandProcessor.doInBackground(JobIntentService.java:382)
	at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:333)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	... 3 more
```

title: resized icon in settings to correct size
body: The eye for the preference "User Interface" was too small.

title: Added icons in settings to keep style consistent
body: ![screenshot_20181004-100711](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12869538/46460830-7629d700-c7bd-11e8-9d13-4bc1e948e086.jpg)

title: [BUG] Incoming phone call removes persistent notification
body:
App version: 1.6.5
Android 7.0

Current behavior:
When a podcast is playing and a call comes in, audio stops and the AntennaPod notification disappears. After the call playback has to be resumed from the app itself

Expected behavior:
Playback control should persist during a phone call

Current settings:
Persistent playback controls: ON
Headphones disconnect: ON
Headphones reconnect: OFF
Bluetooth reconnect: OFF
Pause for interruptions: ON
Resume after call: OFF
Battery optimization also has been turned off

I have a bluetooth earpiece and I tried this with and without it connected and the behavior is the same.

title: [meta] playback issues in native vs. sonic player
body:
since there are different bugs that prevent reliable playback and there are multiple players to choose from, here's a meta-issue to track them: 
- if i use _native player_, i'm affected by #2783 and maybe #1573. (no seeking, position resets)
- if i use _sonic player,_ i'm affected by #2368 (incomplete playback) and #2729 (permacrash).

title: Migrate rxjava to version 2
body:
I also changed background processing from new threads to the IO thread pool.
Creating new threads is costly and the background work we do is exactly what the thread pool is meant for.

title: Allow mediaPlayer to be null
body:
Closes #2819

I do not own a Chromecast, so I can not test this one

title: Feature request: Queue oldest unplayed episodes
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
All I would like is the ability to queue up my oldest unplayed episodes from the aggregate of all my subscriptions.. I can achieve this in PocketCasts, but want to move away from it because its sync no longer works now that I've degoogled my device as much as I could. Just the ability to hit a button and populate my queue with the oldest unplayed episodes from all my shows, in chronological order.

I'd consider giving it a crack myself if I knew anything at all about Android development, I assume it's a pretty easy implementation, unless there's some issue with optimising the behaviour.

title: Do not crash if mediaPlayer is null
body: Hopefully fixes #2820

title: Implemented number picker preference
body:
Closes #2818

Settings `inputType` does not seem to work. Android still presents the text keyboard. Therefore, this PR creates a new preference that can be used to enter numbers only.

    <EditTextPreference
                android:defaultValue="4"
                android:inputType="number"
                android:digits="0123456789"
                android:key="prefParallelDownloads"
                android:title="@string/pref_parallel_downloads_title"
                app:useStockLayout="true"/>

title: Release the next version please?
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from F-Droid)

While it's a nice ideal to release a major version with a massive set of nice changes and upgrades, the delay in the release might chase people away from this otherwise awesome app. There are a few annoying bugs that I've been dying to get fixes for. It's been five months and I almost thought development had stalled. When I check here, I realize things are quite active. Please release a bug fix version at the least.

Thanks.

title: Map Queue's Time Left to current playback speed
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
Feature request that came in via Google Group.
The Top Bar in the Queue should show the time left not with 1x speed, but the speed that is currently set.

title: [Feature Request] Filter Feeds for Episodes that are Favorites
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi, You can already filter a feed for quite a few properties but the one that I used to use regularly in BeyondPod is missing in AntennaPod.

Sometimes I want to listen to my favourite episodes from only one feed. But I can't filter for episodes I have added to favourites on a particular feeds page.

I know I can search for episodes from that feed in the favourites section. This is fine option when searching for just one episode with a specific guest or topic, but when looking for favourite episodes generally from a feed and using a search, results are mixed up with results from other feeds and are out of order.

I would be quicker and easier to filter a feed for episodes added to favourites. Then there would be no erroneous results from other feeds, and the results would be in correct chronological order.

Would you consider adding this please?

Thanks for your help.

title: Some podcasts have bugs during fastforward
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Try playing the pods from "Pod on the hill", linked below. Pardon the politics. Try pressing skip forward within the episode (I've definitely noticed it during ep 76, I'm pretty sure ep 75 and ep 74 too, but I've only just started following it so it's probably all over the place).

When you do so, you will notice that the timer increases, but the episode returns to the beginning.

nb. I'm playing with 1.40x speed, and Sonic media player.

Pod On The Hill - Victorian Labor Podcast: http://feeds.soundcloud.com/users/soundcloud:users:288847076/sounds.rss

title: Pausing then resuming on mobile network seems to lose buffer
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (9b20aeae) from F-Droid

**Android version**: 7.1.2, LineageOS 14.1-20180906-NIGHTLY-i9300

**Device model**: Samsung GT-I9300

**Expected behaviour**: Pausing then resuming when streaming over the mobile network should be instant. The existing buffer should be used. 

**Current behaviour**: Pausing then resuming seems to lose the buffer and it can take quite a while to build up the buffer to resume. 

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Stream a podcast over your mobile network
1. Hit pause
1. Hit play

title: No Playpack possible in Android Auto
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 7.0 Samsung / Google Launcher

**Device model**: Samsung Galaxy S6 128GB 

**Expected behaviour**:
Start to play a podcast with the play button in Android Auto.
**Current behaviour**:
It is only possible to start a Podcast if you go directly before you start android auto, press the play button. After disconnecting android auto the curently played podcast info is away. You have to find the last Podcast again. After 2 voice calls it wont start again.
**First occured**: few months ago

**Steps to reproduce**:
Go to AntennaPod press play
Connect to Android Auto
Press Play on Android Auto. The Podcast started. (This is the way to go)

Turn of car leave phone connected.
Start car again after a minute or so.
Android Auto starts again and wontt start.
The play back will not start.

This happen also after to calls or if you go to work and drive after back. 

Disconnect usb and the currently played podcast is gone away.
You have to select it again.

Sometimes it even dont start from bluetooth before pressing play in antenna pod. 

**Environment**: 
Android Auto / Ford Sync 3 (Europe) 
Bei Unterbrechungen pausieren
Nach Anfuf fortsetzen

title: Unable to fetch some feeds and/or download some episodes (Expected :status header not present)
body:
**App version:** 1.6.2.3

**Android version**: 8.0.0

**Device model**: Samsung S8+

**Expected behaviour**: Refresh feeds and download episodes

**Current behaviour**: Some feeds that I've tried to subscribe to just fails with an error message.

**First occured**: Don't know.

**Steps to reproduce**:

First example:
1) I add this feed: https://feeds.mozilla-podcasts.org/irl
2) I get the episodes
3) I try to download an episode (latest one) and only get a failure in the `Downloads > Log` that say: `IO Error: Expected ':status' header not present`

Second example:
1) I try to add this feed: https://linuxpodden.podigee.io/feed/ogg
2) I get an error popup with the message `An error occurred: IO Error (Expected ':status' header not present)`

**Environment**: Dark Theme, Chromecast support, Bose Bluetooth headphones.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
```
Not available at the moment
```

title: Fix typo
body:
It is probably not the PR of the year. 
I noticed a small typo in the code, feel free to close it if you think it's not worth it. 

Thanks for this great app, I'm a long time user and I love it.

title: Numerical field & pad for Parallel Downloads dialog (currently accepting but ignoring non-numeric input)
body:
Trying the beta version released it struck me that the Parallel Downloads setting (Network section) can have any type of (textual) input. Any textual input will be ignored and the existing numerical value will be kept. Also, the user gets presented a text keyboard, rather than posing a numerical pad, creating (little) extra effort to set a number.

Would be great if we could just have a numerical field and a number pad presented to the user instead.

If I understand correctly, this was required at the time the feature was introduced (#672) as the best option required API 11 which apparently wasn't available, but in the meantime we're at least at minimal API 14 (#2526). Think we could now have a numeric field, then?

---
**App version:** 1.6.6-RC1 (Google Play alpha channel)
**OS version**: Fairphone OS 18.02.0 (Android 6.0.1)
**Devide model**: Fairphone 2

title: Enqueue jobs with a unique job id per class
body:
Could not reproduce this on the emulator, so I had to rely on documentation.
Resolves #2815 

As Job IDs must be unique per uid (https://commonsware.com/blog/2017/06/07/jobscheduler-job-ids-libraries.html), use IDs that no one else will use...

title: Notification controls do not persist
body:
**App version:** 1.6.6-RC1 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 9

**Device model**: Pixel

**Expected behaviour**: After pausing playback for any reason, the AntennaPod notification should persist until I dismiss it or turn off/restart the phone.

**Current behaviour**: The AntennaPod notification containing playback controls does not persist for long after pausing, either by hand, by disconnecting headphone jack or Bluetooth, or by phone call. Therefore, playback typically does not resume when I reconnect the headphone jack or Bluetooth, or after I finish a phone call. 

**First occured**: Since last update (I think).

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Play a podcast in the app.
1. Pause playback for any reason.
1. After a few minutes with the app not in focus, the notification goes away.

**Environment**: Problem occurs when playing through headphone jack and Bluetooth. Changing the media player does not appear to have an affect. Uninstalling and reinstalling the app doesn't appear to help.

title: Audio ducks for interruptions instead of pausing
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
**App version:** 1.6.6-RC1 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 9

**Device model**: Pixel

**Expected behaviour**: Audio should pause when interrupted by another source, like Waze. "Pause for Interruptions" setting is enabled.

**Current behaviour**: Audio ducks for interruptions. This is very inconvenient and distracting while driving because the audio instructions from the navigation app are read relatively slowly compared to the dialog of a given podcast, which is difficult to keep listening to during the duck. The user has to manually rewind in order to hear what was missed during the interruption.

**First occured**: Since last update (I think).

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Play a podcast in the app.
1. Begin navigation with Waze.
1. Podcast audio will duck for Waze interruptions instead of pausing.

**Environment**: Problem occurs when playing through headphone jack and Bluetooth. Changing the media player does not appear to have an affect. Uninstalling and reinstalling the app doesn't appear to help.

title: Notification is always expanded, disabling the option does not work.
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 commit `9b20aeae` (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 7.1.2 [Lineage OS]

**Device model**: Aquaris U Plus

**Expected behaviour**: When option "Expand notification" is disabled, the notification should not be expanded. 

**Current behaviour**: Regardless of "Expand notification" option value, notification is always expanded. If I collapse the notification and roll the upper(system) drawer up and down again, the notification is expanded again.

**First occured**: Since I am using the app.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Go to settings, disable option "Expand notification"
1. Start to play some podcast
1. Roll down the upper drawer. The notification is expanded(it should not be).
1. Collapse the notification
1. Roll up the upper drawer.
1. Roll down the upper drawer. The notification is expanded again(it should not be).

**Screenshots**:

Settings:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1208989/44628358-b6887080-a946-11e8-8f18-eda7b0ed6ca2.png)

Upper drawer:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1208989/44628359-c3a55f80-a946-11e8-8b53-4b30bf2b1273.png)

title: [Feature request] Support for syncing Tiny Tiny RSS (TT-RSS)
body:
Hello,

it would be great if you could add support for Tiny Tiny RSS (TT-RSS)

title: [Feature] Add new option to Share Dialog to share episode information
body:
**Expected behaviour**:
When listening to a podcast that i want to save to a personal reference database service like evernote or google keep, to be able to share the contents of the episode information (from page 2 of the podcast episode  viewer) - usually has links, time positions and other information that you would want to keep.

title: REQUEST:  automatically put episode at start of queue (on a per podcast basis)
body:
I hope I can explain this correctly
I have about 10 podcasts and two of them are topical (i.e. news related) but the other 8 are episodic.
I'd like an option to always enqueue the topical ones at the start so I can listen ASAP but have the episodic ones at the end (because I don't care if it takes me 3 weeks to get to them.)

Right now I just let all new episodes append to the end of the queue and manually move the ones I want to listen to next to the start.  If would help if there was an option to say 'place new episodes at start' in the specific podcast settings.

Thanks for reading.

title: Implemented keep 5 latest episodes
body:
This implements feature request #2077 . It adds a new cleanup option `Keep 5 latest`

![screenshot from 2018-08-23 21-10-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/223655/44546691-0124a580-a719-11e8-9380-519c87858114.png)

This option has two primary effects:

1. The cleanup algorithm will keep the 5 latest episodes for each feed. If the cache is small, or the number of feeds is high, the cache can get full and never be reduced.
2. The download algorithm will only consider the 5 latest episodes in each feed for download. It will not fetch more, even if there is space for it.

I hope the tests are pretty clear about other less significant implementation details. I'll be running it on my phone the next few days to get a feel for its real world behavior.

There are a few comments in the test files regarding tests I am unsure would be suitable behavior atm. Will take care of them once I've done some real world use. Feedback is also appreciated.

## Should probably be added
- [x] Download items in the queue
- [x] Don't download items which match relevant feed filters

## Could perhaps be done
- [ ] Dont' reserve 5 items in each feed from the feed, instead just clean the requested number of items in reverse smart shuffle order.
- [ ] Allow items which have been played to be cleaned if necessary, even if it falls within the 5 latest.

title: Request: Offer Beta APKs that don't overwrite our current installation
body:
Currently, you guys are testing 1.6.6 and I would love to help test that, but I have a very large list of podcasts loaded in the client and I don't want to risk messing that up with a beta installation from the Play Store that requires an uninstallation to go back to the stable version. Can you offer an "AntennaPod Beta" APK that is separate from our current installation so we can test it without worry or risk of losing our podcast data? I think you'd get a lot more testing done that way from people who share my apprehension. 

You're probably winding down your beta testing period right now, so just something to consider for the future.

title: Reduce splash duration
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body: Closes #2793

title: Reduce splash duration
body:
# Problem The splash screen is displayed quite long, even if the database access is done in background as of #2781. This issue analyzes the problem and suggests solutions. The long splash screen is mainly influenced by three method calls (removing those makes the splash screen much shorter): - `loadData();` in `MainActivity`'s `onResume` - `loadMediaInfo();` in `ExternalPlayerFragment`'s `onActivityCreated` - `loadItems(true);` in `QueueFragment`'s `onResume` All three methods use rxjava to query the database and afterwards do heavy UI changes (like displaying the queue's list). The interesting observation here is that adding a `Thread.sleep` call to the background work of these methods makes the splash screen **shorter**. While sleeping, you can see a progress bar in the app's view. When removing the sleep call, you can **not** see the progress bar. The UI is instantly updated as soon as the splash screen goes away. This leaves me with the conclusion that the background work of the rxjava calls is so short that the result is directly posted to the main thread. The result is already posted while the splash screen is still dismissing, what makes the UI thread stop displaying animations. ## Solution 1 Adding `.delay(1, TimeUnit.SECONDS)` to the rxjava call allows the splash to go away before the result of the background thread is delivered to the main thread. This has the disadvantage that, while the app loads significantly faster, loading the queue itself is delayed. Changing the delay down to 100ms introduces some kind of a race condition: sometimes the splash screen is long and sometimes not. ## Solution 2 Posting the call to `loadData` on a new handler makes the system start loading data **after** the splash screen is dismissed: `new Handler().post(this::loadData);`. This does noticably decrease the splash time and displaying the queue itself does not feel slower. # Benchmarks I used the average of two app starts and pressed my stopwatch as soon as the screen changed from blue (splash) to white (queue). The queue contained only two items. The effect gets stronger when there are more items present.
Direct call2.898s
Delay rxjava1.990s
Post handler1.897s
By the way, the release version with #2794 (posting a handler) only needs 0.98s until the splash screen is dismissed. # Suggestion I suggest to use `new Handler().post(this::loadData);` because it does not slow down loading the queue items. I do not advise calling the method directly because the longer splash screen might lead to ANRs on slower devices. Reducing the splash duration by 30% also makes the app feel a lot more responsive. I think that this is worth the kind of ugly looking code. I suggest to link to this issue in a comment to explain that code usage to developers.

title: Feedback on improved settings/preferences
body:
**App version:** 1.6.6-RC1 (Google Play alpha channel)

@ByteHamster: Thank you so much for the improved settings/preferences! Looks a whole better with the #2634 updates :)

Doing the translations (and now after having updated to RC1 on my device myself), I would like to make the following suggestions:
- 'buttons' section title: doesn't cover just any button in the app, but only specific ones. To make it more descriptive, I would call the section 'Play, Forward, Rewind'
- 'video behavior': in Transifex you said the options are Stop (current behavior), Play Picture-In-Picture, and Continue playing audio only. In my instance I don't see the PIP, however. Is that dependant on another setting, or could it be a bug? (PIP introduced in #2506)
- 'video behavior': not very descriptive title, I'd suggest to title this setting 'Upon exiting video'
- 'Mobile updates' is there to limit data usage, so I wouldn't necessary put it under 'automation' but rather under 'details'
- 'Mobile updates': this only concerns refreshing of feeds, right? Or also the downloading of episodes? In either case, I think it would be good to make explicit in the settings. (I know this was already there, but now seems a good time to improve)
- 'Set subscription counter': this setting could also determine the order of the feeds in the menu (dependent on other setting). We should probably make that explicit in the setting description. (idem: present before but a good time to change)
- 'Select theme' - True black: I know this theme is really black, but I would propose 'Black (AMOLED ready)'. 'Black' already indicates its colour, it indicates already it's darker than 'dark', and 'true' doesn't mean a lot. To support the search function, including the word Amoled would be good I guess.
- 'Exoplayer': written as such in the settings, but in the 'About' section it's with a capitalised 'P': ExoPlayer. [Educated guess](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/media/exoplayer): this should be corrected?

Happy to create a PR to edit strings after hearing your thoughts.

title: Is there a guide on how to use this app?  It is very confusing.
body:
I've tried using this app several times over the years and it has the most confusing interface of any podcast player I've tried.  After finding a podcast and adding it to my subscriptions I have no idea if it's actually going to start automatically downloading episodes offline.  I end up clicking around to mark all unplayed and then downloading them.  I don't understand why all of the subscriptions would be listed along the left side instead of just defaulting to an interface such as the subscription list.

If there is a process to do these things it isn't intuitive.  It seems made to subscribe to rss feeds, download, and play audio files... but there is no workflow.

It would be nice to see a button or longpress action to play all of one subscription in order and another button to play all subscriptions.

If I subscribe to something begin auto-downloading the first X episodes.

There's a queue list, episodes list, downloads list, and playback history.. Why do I need all of this?  None of them have a button to just start playing the list.  A queue lock and unlock button?  What does that even mean?

Just trying to give some constructive criticism.

title: Interface stops with or without playback stopping
body:
Since a recent update to AntennaPod 1.6.5 (on a Xiaomi redmi note 4 device), when the Sonic Media Player is used, the currently running podcasts usually plays fully, but after 10 minutes or so, the app's interface stops showing progress and swtiches to paused state. Then, when the Play button is pressed, it starts playing from the place where the progress bar stopped, as a second channel, while the original playback continues (so you hear two parallel recordings). Closing the app stops both playing channels.

When the Sonic Media Player option is off (so the native Android player is used), the interface behaves the same, only then, when the interface stops after some minutes, the playback stops too, and one has to press "Play" again to restart the playing.

When I hear "AntennaPod" I think of a radio player/podcast app. I think other people get either that impression or the impression that it is only a radio app because of the word "antenna" being first in the name. Yes, the word "pod" is there but its not

title: Update mountpoint of data folder after Android update
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 8.0 (stock, patch-level April 1, 2018)

**Device model**: Motorola Moto Z Play

**Expected behaviour**: After updating from Android 7.1.1 to 8.0, I should be able to continue using antennapod seamlessly

**Current behaviour**: One and the same SD-card is apparently mounted under a different mountpoint in 8.0 vs 7.1.1 - this causes Antennapod to lose its downloaded files. The database is still there but afaict points to places in the filesystem where there is nothing (i.e. /old/mountpoint/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/media/ whereas all the downloaded files now reside at /new/mountpoint/andsoforth). Re-downloading everything is annoying but not the main problem. The main problem are episodes that are no longer available (i.e. can't be downloaded any more) because they have been depublished (German/Austrian public broadcasting companies and their laws ahoy!).

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Have a large database with lots of downloaded files on external SD-card under Android 7.1.1
1. Update to Android 8.0
1. launch antennapod


IMO it should be possible to tell the database "yo, the mountpoint has changed, please change your path-references accordingly!". But it isn't.

title: Disable subscriptions without removing
body:
It would be great if one could disable a subscription without removing it. This is a feature request.

A disabled subscription should differ from a normal subscription in the following ways:

* It is displayed differently in the subscription list (e.g. grayed, or in a separate section below the normal subscriptions)
* Its RSS/Atom feed is not updated
* It can be enabled again

In all other aspects, a disabled subscription should behave identically to normal subscriptions, that it:

* Already downloaded episodes are kept and can still be played.
* Non-downloaded episodes are still shown, are downloadable, and then playable.
* Disabled subscriptions are still part of an OPML export.

Rationales:

* For some podcasts one would like to listen to a few episodes, but doesn't want them to regularily fill up the "New Episodes" section.
* Adding new podcasts is a lot more work than deleting them. So when in doubt, one would rather disable than remove a subscription.
  * This is especially true for the German podcast world, where the podcast directories aren't nearly as complete as one would like them to, so adding new podcasts happens mostly by URL or website link, which is cumbersome.
* Sometimes RSS/Atom feeds are broken, or were only one-off feeds in the first place, while the media files are still downloadable from some CDN.

title: Feature Request: Auto rewind on "Pause for Interruptions"
body:
I have the "Pause for Interruptions" setting enabled.

When a short audio interruption occurs, such as a new message chime, it works OK.

When a long audio interruption occurs, such as directions from google maps, it would be nice if the podcast was rewound before resuming. Resuming in the middle of a word in the middle of a sentence after a 15 second interruption makes a conversation hard to follow.

It would be even better if it could rewind to, say 15 seconds before a series of interruptions. This happens when many directions come in quick succession. Maybe if the interruptions are longer than the play time between them, rewind to before the initial interruption.

title: Database file grows dispropotionally large (due to FeedImages table)
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 7.1.1

**Device model**: Motorola Moto E4

**Current behaviour**: 
Checking the exported database `AnteannaPodBackup.db`, I noticed `FeedImages` table seems to be excessively large. In my case, while there are `4041` rows in `FeedItems` table, there are `2321321` rows in `FeedImages`, most of which are not referenced by anything. It looks as if some logic in AntennaPod fails to cleanup the rows in `FeedImages` or just adding to it repeatedly.

The database file is of size 42Mb. It is reduced to 8Mb if I purge all the un-referenced rows and compacted it.

SQLs used for checking
```sql
SELECT COUNT(1)
  FROM FeedItems
;
--> 4041

SELECT COUNT(1)
  FROM FeedImages
;
--> 232132

-- # referenced by FeedItems 
SELECT COUNT(1)
  FROM FeedImages JOIN FeedItems
    ON FeedImages.id = FeedItems.image
;
--> 2094

-- # referenced by Feeds
SELECT COUNT(1)
  FROM FeedImages JOIN Feeds
    ON FeedImages.id = Feeds.image
;
--> 34

-- Example of how the same logical image is repeated in the table
SELECT COUNT(1)
  FROM FeedImages
 WHERE FeedImages.title = "The Other Real Worldimage"
;
--> 85
--   A row in FeedItems table references to the latest (largest id)
--   row in FeedImages. The remaining 84 rows are orphaned.

```

**Steps to reproduce**:

The DB excessive growth seems to stem from normal usage.

Importing might have exacerbated the problem, however: the database file from my custom build (that I used in the last month or so, based on 1.6.5) grew to 86Mb, with 400K rows in FeedImages. I imported/exported quite a few times since using the custom build, so I suspect import/export might have made the problem worse.

title: How to get to an updated logo/icon?
body:
Given the many proposals in different issues (#1281; #1521; #2124; #2620), I think it's safe to assume many of us developers and active users would agree that AntennaPod can use an updated logo. But how to get there?

From the [Open Source Design blog](https://opensourcedesign.net/open-source/communities/collaboration/tools/design/2017/03/27/osd-needs-better-collaboration-tools.html) (reading recommendation!):

> Design is about understanding, facilitation and collaboration between all the relevant stakeholders. This is why I consider collaboration tools to be so important to design.  However, open source design is at such an embryonic stage that even something as fundamental as a dedicated area for discussion and idea exchange to bootstrap the movement does not exist. This is why I have tried to identify our immediate needs, so that a more suitable tool than GitHub Issues or StackExchange can be found.

The conclusion: such super-tool doesn't exist yet. Meaning: we'll have to stick to current tools. Meaning: we'll have to use GitHub and possibly other tools to get us a new logo.

As we haven't gotten anywhere so far (despite good will), maybe we'll have to get consensus on a proper **process** that will land us a nice updated logo, rather than everybody throwing in their own design. (I'm guilty on that one)
_What (re)designs do we want/need? If we need a colour palette, how do we decide upon one? How do we get to a new logo design? Is there going to be a voting procedure and if so: how?_

Here's a proposal, adapted from https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/1281#issuecomment-150530437:
1. prepare an 'assignment' based on previous designs and comments
2. find one or a couple of open source designers that are willing to help
3. ask them to prepare one to four drafts, in a process with user feedback from our communities (GitHub, Google Group)
4. have a vote via an in- or through-app vote

Steps 1, 2, and 4 could each be supported by their own ticket to limit the mess.

title: Feature Request: display indicator while waiting for streamed content to load
body: When streaming a podcast, after pushing the play button it would be helpful if there were some sort of indication (for example a spinning circle over the top of the podcast icon) to inform the user that the content is loading. Sometimes after pushing play, I have to wait several seconds before the content begins to play.

title: PlaybackService notification setup improvements
body:
Calling `setupNotification` in onCreate has a race condition. If `started` is not set to true from `onStartCommand` while `setupNotification` runs, the function just returns. This keeps the service running with the placeholder notification.

This change moves the initial `setupNotification` call to `onStartCommand`.

title: [Feature request] Using double/triple headset button press to fast forward/rewind
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from F-Droid)

**Android version**: 8.0
**Device model**: Sony Xperia XZ2 Compact 

As far as I can tell, there's no way to assign multiple headset button presses for fast forwarding or rewinding. Most music players allow to double press the headset button to skip to next song and triple press to skip to the previous one, so I assume it's a system-level setting that treats multiple presses as "media next/media preview" actions. It would be nice to see AntennaPod use do that too instead of just play/pause with a single tap. As far as I know, the only podcast player right now that supports both fast forward AND rewind is Castbox (proprietary).

title: Executing core unit tests on CircleCI
Update GpodnetSyncService
body:
Looks like the new method added in #2667 works in practice but it contradicts the documentation of `onHandleWork`:

> Called **serially** for each work dispatched to and processed by the service. This method is called on a background thread, so you can do long blocking operations here. Upon returning, that work will be considered complete and either the next pending work dispatched here or the overall service destroyed now that it has nothing else to do.

title: [#2359 #428] display cover art for media in the widget
body:
Hey guys,
This is a pretty simple update to the widget to add cover art for the currently playing media. I think it works well at all sizes. I especially like the two-wide size, where one block contains cover art and the other contains the play/pause button. I updated the widget preview and losslessly compressed it with trimage.

title: "Episodes" view should show podcast name
body:
When using the "Episodes" view you currently see the Title, Size/runtime, and date.
It would be helpful to additionally show the name of the podcast that this episode is from. 
(Especially helpful when you're running through the New list looking for specific podcasts to enqueue episodes from.)

This is especially helpful when you have podcasts which do not use the same icon for every episode. (Personally I have about a 60/40 mix of podcasts which always use the same icon and podcasts which change the icon every episode.)

title: Does not play when app is minimised
body:
AntennaPod 1.6.5 on FairPhone 2
With Android 6.0.1 - FairPhone Open (with Google Play Services installed)

I expect podcasts to play in the background while I can do other things on my phone.

As soon as I minimise the app, the podcast stops. I tried several podcasts, same problem with all of them. I also tried to start playing a podcast from the widget on the home screen, but this only takes me into the app where the same problem occurs again

The problem occurred since I downloaded the app today (22nd of may 2018)

I got the impression that it should be possible to play audio while the app is minimised. Do I need to change some settings to allow this?

title: avoid unused context parameter
body: While working on the changes for https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/pull/2697 I was reading over the `DownloadRequester.java` code and noticed the `context` parameter is unused in several places. This PR simply removes the unnecessary parameter, which cleans up the code a bit. I was able to unwrap some lines and still stay under the 100 char limit

title: Autodownload by episode size

title: Fix core tests: default coverage, consistent convention, etc.
body:
The main issue to be fixed in this PR: 
- Currently, when running tests or `core` module, e.g., `gradlew :core:connectedPlayDebugAndroidTest`, it does not cover all the tests: those in `feed` directory are not run.

The PR also covers:
- move the few other tests in `core/` to follow standard convention that test files and classes under test are in the same java package.
    - Before the PR, tests under `feed/` follow the standard convention, while the remaining other tests are put under `test/` sub-directory.

It does not cover:
- some tests are really unit tests that do not require a device (i.e., not need to be under `androidTest`), e.g., those in `util/` directory.

title: Automatic feeds update skips intermittently (probably device / OS specific)
body:
Note: I suspect the issue is really a bug of the specific device, but I am reporting to it here, in case other people face similar problems.

**App version:** 1.6.5, Google Play

**Android version**: 7.1.1

**Device model**: Motorola Moto E4

**Expected behaviour**:
When automatic feeds update is scheduled to happen, and network is available, it should happen.

**Current behaviour**:
Intermittently, feeds update does not happen. There is no error visible to end users.
From logging, it seems that Android intermittently incorrectly reports that network is blocked, even though it is connected.

Frequency of feeds failing to update: ~30%, on a few different wifi networks.


**Environment**: 
- Restricting background mobile data connection does not matter:
I've restricted AntennaPod from using mobile data connection in background using system cellular data usage settings. However, I've also tried not restricting background mobile data connection. The result is the same.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 

It seems that on my particular device, when `FeedUpdateReceiver.onReceive()` is called upon feeds update, intermittently `NetworkUtils.networkAvailable()` incorrectly returns false. AntennaPod then silently does nothing.

More specifically, Android incorrectly reports that the network is blocked upon `FeedUpdateReceiver.onReceive()` intermittently. 

In my custom build, I modified `FeedUpdateReceiver.onReceive()` to make an additional `NetworkUtils.networkAvailable()` call after 1-5 seconds delay, somehow then it correctly reports network is available.

Example traces (from a custom build to log `NetworkUtils.networkAvailable()` details)
```
5/9/18 6:30:26 AM PDT  D/FeedUpdateReceiver  Received intent
# In NetworkUtils.networkAvailable(), I add logs to print out networks details returned by
# ConnectivityManager.getActiveNetworkInfo()
5/9/18 6:30:26 AM PDT  D/NetworkUtils  networkAvailable() - active network - connected: false
  , info: [type: WIFI[], state: DISCONNECTED/BLOCKED, reason: (unspecified), extra: (none), failover: false, available: true, roaming: false, metered: false]
```

title: Ampersands in URLs Seem to Break OPML Import
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (Google Play)

**Android version**: 8.1.0 Stock

**Device model**: Google Pixel 2

**Expected behaviour**: Importing a seemingly validly-formatted OPML file should not display errors.

**Current behaviour**: Importing an OPML file where any entry has an & in the URL will show an error about the element _before_ it not terminated. 

**First occured**: Version 1.6.5/Today

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Generate an OPML file where there are multiple podcast files before a podcast which has an & in the URL. I used this site, https://opml-gen.ovh/ to generate and this link: http://www.audioentropy.com/lmtyah/?category=Earth-C&format=rss (note the &format=RSS) caused the issue.
2. Import OPML file in the app.
3. Observe the error, which states that the line before it did not terminate.
4. Remove the line for that specific podcast with the ampersand.
5. The import runs fine.

**Environment**: Changed no settings until after getting the import working.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: Got nothin' here, unless you wanna point me towards a way to get that easily.

title: FR: Allows Feeds Update be invoked by external automation apps
body:
Currently (v1.6.5), AntennaPod supports automatic feeds update by interval or time of day. 

I'd like to see AntennaPod allows feeds updated invoked by external automation apps (Tasker, Llama, Automate, etc.) that can support more complex workflow. 

Example workflows:
1. 7am everyday: turn of wifi, then update AntennaPod feeds

2. 5pm weekdays: turn of wifi, then update AntennaPod feeds 
(Note: what I really want is to refresh and downloaded a specific news podcast for the day, but simply updating all feeds can serve as an approximation).

title: FR: Episode Cleanup (for automatic download) - support 12 hours after finishing
body:
Currently (v1.6.5), episode cleanup (to reclaim spaces for automatic download) supports options 1, 3, etc. days after finishing (among others).

It'd be great to have an option of 12 hours after finishing. 

The use case: 
1. I schedule my feeds to be refreshed daily 8am in the morning, I'd like AntennaPod cleanup played episodes (of the day before) so that it automatically downloads new episodes after the feed refresh.
2. I also want to keep the played episodes around for a short while (sometimes I go back to a played episode to re-listen specific segments, typically within a few hours). 

The existing Episodes Cleanup options are not suitable:
- "1 day after finishing" is too long: the majority of the played episodes were played the evening of the day before, say, 5-7pm. With "1 day after finishing" option they are not eligible for cleanup for the feed refresh 8am the next morning.

- "After finishing" is too soon: The episodes get cleaned up whenever auto-download kicks in. In other words they might get cleaned up even soon after an episode is played, if auto-download happens to kick in.

Thus a half a day (12 hours) option is proposed here.

title: use OR logic in feed episode filters
body:

**Device model**: not applicable

**Expected behaviour**: use OR logic in feed episode filters

**Current behaviour**: uses AND logic in feed episode filters

**First occured**: not applicable

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. go to a podcast feed
2. Click on the 3 line thingy
3. click on a filter such as unplayed and hit Confirm.  Shows all unplayed Episodes.
4. Now, go back to the 3 line thingy and add another filter.  Say, paused.
5. Shows only unplayed AND paused.  I would expect it to show unplayed OR paused.

This sort of filter should capture my stuff about to be downloaded, ones that are paused, unplayed, queued, downloaded, etc.  If I use filters it shouldn't whittle the filter down to eventually nothing.  Otherwise, just make them radio buttons to only pick one filter because no one is going to use this screen to apply so many criteria as AND's.

title: Database suddenly empty
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from F-Droid)

**Android version**: 7.1.2 (LineageOS with microG from April 25, 2018)

**Device model**: Fairphone 2

**Expected behaviour**: The database does not become suddenly empty.

**Current behaviour**: It became empty.

**First occured**: 2 days ago

**Steps to reproduce**:

I cannot (and do not want) to reproduce it. Here is the setting:
- I have almost all my podcast episodes in the queue (about 170)
- two new episodes came in the New tab (https://www.relay.fm/rocket/172 and http://www.hellointernet.fm/podcast/101)
- I added them to the queue (long press on each)
- I switched to the queue, went all the way to the bottom, put them at the top (long press on each), then back to the top and I put them right after the currently playing episode
- realizing it would be better to always put new episodes at the top, I went to preferences and changed that preference
- going back to the podcast list, nothing was longer there: 0 episode, 0 subscribed podcast, empty queue. The only thing remaining was the currently playing episode (I could listen to it although it was not in the queue nor in the list of episodes)
- I tried quitting AntennaPod and starting it again, no change
- I tried rebooting the phone, the only change was that there no longer was a currently playing episode, so the database was basically completely empty
- there was no crash log

I suspect the fact that one new episode had emojis as title (http://www.hellointernet.fm/podcast/101) could be the cause of the problem. However, after resubscribing to all my podcasts, I was able to download it and listen to it.

Feature Request: Select / prioritize audio output
body:
A device can have several possible audio output options (Jack, headset, speaker, Bluetooth, etc).

Currently, when Bluetooth connects, my media is automatically routed through Bluetooth, even if I have my headphones plugged in.

Would it be possible for antenna pod to prefer certain outputs over others. Or to select the output from settings?

I.e. when using the phone app, I can select headset, Bluetooth, wired headphones. I'd like to be able to do the same here so that my audio is only routed to blue tooth when I actively select it.

title: Allow for a priority queue
body: It would be nice if instead if a queue you could set things up as a priority queue. That way I could make rules like "The current playing podcast should be at the top" or "New Risky Business episodes should go straight to the top of the queue".

title: Feature Request: User Definable Queues
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5 (from F-Droid)

**Expected behavior**: Instead of having a single monolithic queue where all downloaded episodes are added, a user would be able to define a custom queue such as: "News," "Entertainment," "Computers," etc. The user would then be able to optionally assign a subscribed podcast from the info screen to the appropriate user defined queue. If no defined queue has been set then, the podcast would default to the primary monolithic queue which may or may not include all items from the user defined queues.

**Current behavior**: All downloaded podcasts are added to a single monolithic queue.

title: Fix Bluetooth Forward Skip Button for Android 8
body:
It appears that Oreo has changed the behavior for Bluetooth KeyEvents.
Starting with Android 8.0, KeyEvent.getSource() returns 0 (unknown
source).

This change explicitly sets when a key press is sent from a
notification, or lockscreen event. Otherwise we use the
customer-defined skip behavior.

Fixes #2428

**Current behaviour**: Notification that podcasts are being downloaded/processed persists after download is complete. Cannot swipe away. Have to force close app to clear the notification.

**First occured**: Version 1.6.4.5 about a week ago. I didn't have the app installed prior to this so i don't know if this has always been an issue.

title: Ignore invalid position updates
body: Closes #2642

title: Add warning to "Mark all played"
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
In the sidebar, I often use "Mark all seen" to remove the "new" message of episodes I am currently not interested in. Directly below that option is "Mark all played", which is dangerous in my opinion. Marking all played makes you lose track of the most important task a podcast manager is used for: Knowing what episodes you have already listened to.

I suggest adding a warning dialog when pressing that menu item, just as it appears when deleting a feed.

title: Progress bar flashes
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5

**Android version**: 8.1 OmniROM

**Device model**: OnePlus 3T

**Steps to reproduce**:

- Seek episode to 50%
- Pause
- Fully kill app (Android settings)
- Open app
- Progress bar on the bottom is at 50% (that's okay)
- Press play in bottom bar
- Progress bar jumps to 0% or 100%
- Wait a second
- Progress bar jumps back to 50%

**Suggestion:** Only refresh progress bar if values are valid (I remember that sometimes it tries to show `-1`)

title: Split feed info and settings
body: Before / After / After: Should be merged together with #2637 to prevent a duplicated settings icon on the feed item list page. Closes #1147

title: Import opml file unsuccessfully
body:
**App version:** 1.6.5

**Android version**: Android 8.0 (MIUI 9 by chinese XiaoMi)
**Device model**: Xiaomi 6

**Expected behaviour**:

**Current behaviour**: I can't import opml file.I choose an opml file and import but it doesn't work.

**First occured**: Version 1.x / about 6 months ago

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Copy OPML file to any place on SD card
2. Open Add Podcast - OPML Import - From local filesystem - Choose the file - Press OK

**Environment**: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?]

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
```
[if available]
```
The Uploading attachments is my opml file.

[podcasts_opml.zip](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/files/1905613/podcasts_opml.zip)

title: Don't pause directly after starting
body:
When registering the receiver, it immediately receives
a headset unplugged event (broadcast is sticky) and pauses
playback again in some cases. We are only interested in status
changes, so we can just return.

Fixes #2635

title: About activity cleanup
body:
- create((Observable.OnSubscribe<String>) was deprecated, so replaced with fromCallable(())
- Navigating through the Links would latch the depth greater than 1, and so you couldn't leave the About page (replaced depth with webView.canGoBack())
- Code clean-up:
  - Removed unnecessary version check
  - Fixed spelling
  - Removed unnecessary import

title: Changed batch edit icon and name
body: Closes #1146 This allows to separate feed details and settings screen because we don't have a gear icon anymore. Additionally, I think that it is much easier to know what this option does. When starting with AntennaPod, I thought this would be a filter instead of batch actions.

title: Added feature graphic
body:
![feature-graphic](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5811634/38676070-31ee3366-3e5a-11e8-8f5c-93abba3760cf.png)

The old PlayStore graphic looks boring (just the icon). Here's a new one ;)

![screenshot_google_play_store_20180411-164013](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5811634/38623928-29b60c04-3da7-11e8-90e4-3a5eaa14948d.png) ![38623928-29b60c04-3da7-11e8-90e4-3a5eaa14948daa](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5811634/38687157-481aa248-3e76-11e8-894e-63608e47fe21.png)

I have redrawn the icon in SVG, hoping that no one will notice the difference :D

title: Play button in queue not working reliably
body:
_**Investigations can be found on the bottom.**_

**App version:** 1.6.4.5 (cfaccef2)

**Android version**: 8.1

**Device model**: OnePlus 3T

**Steps to reproduce**:

- Start last episode in queue and play to end
  - Player on the bottom goes away
- Kill AntennaPod from Android Settings
- Press play button of queue item **(first click)**
  - "Currently playing" notification appears, item shown in player on the bottom
  - Audio does not start (paused)
- Press play button of queue item **(second click)**
  - Player on the bottom flickers to playing and back to paused
  - Audio does not start (paused)
- Press play button of queue item **(third click)**
  - Audio finally starts playing

**Environment**: Sonic

# Investigations

    D/LclPlaybackSvcMPlayer: playMediaObject(...)
    D/headsetDisconnected: Headset plug event. State is 0
    D/headsetDisconnected: Headset was unplugged during playback.

Headset disconnect is received directly after starting to play. Pause event is added to executor. Media is played and immediately paused afterwards.

> ACTION_HEADSET_PLUG Intent is broadcast using the sendStickyBroadcast method in Context.
> Sticky Intents are held by the system after being broadcast. That Intent will be caught whenever a new BroadcastReceiver is registered to receive it. It is triggered immediately after registration containing the last updated value. In the case of the headset, this is useful to be able to determine that the headset is already plugged in when you first register your receiver.

title: Preferences rework

title: Playback Speed Setting in Quick-Settings Panel of Podcast is not related to configured Speeds in App-Settings
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
App version: 1.6.5 (from Google Play) Commit: c79b003
Android version: 7.1.1

Device model: Lenovo Moto Z

Expected behaviour:
The speed setting in the quick settings of the podcast should behave the same as in the playback screen

Current behaviour:
The speed setting in the quick settings panel of the podcast is completely unrelated to the configured global settings. It is limited to 2.50x and is changed by 0.1x, though the app settings are set to some specific steps, including 3.00x. When the quick settings panel is invoked, the speed setting is reduced to
2.50x if the current setting is greater than 2.50x.

title: Settings screen rework
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
There are a lot of settings in a single list - it's hard to find them.

My suggestion would be to use multiple screens. Basically leaving the categories as they are but creating multiple screens.

- User interface
  - Theme
  - Sidebar
- Playback
  - Media player
  - Resume after call
- Network
  - Parallel downloads
- Import/Export
  - OPML
  - Database

Maybe it is even possible to add a search function.

title: Actually return instance in getInstance
body:
This probably fixes all those "db deleted" issues and mysterious NPEs

Previously, the synchronized keyword on open() and close() was useless
because it was synchronizing on different objects in each thread.

Might fix various bugs like:
#1945 #2270 #2463 #2571

title: Fix "no shownotes" message when contentEncoded is empty but not null
body: On some feeds (such as http://www.hellointernet.fm/podcast?format=rss), the <content:encoded> tag is empty but present, which makes AntennaPod ignore the <description> tag.

title: [feature] Bring full material design
Listening to AntennaPod on speaker when a bluetooth earpiece is paired isn't a current option
body:
I have a bluetooth earpiece for hands free talking. It is inadequate and not designed for music or podcasts (and illegal in some states). To listen w/ AntennaPod via the speaker, I have to unpair my earpiece. Then when a call comes in I have to re-pair the earpiece. It would make sense if AntennaPod had a simple option to route audio through bluetooth or the speaker while leaving the bluetooth earpiece paired... similar to when you are on a call and you have these options. 
Thank you for the development!

title: Volume & speed settings per feed
body: Be able to set the volume&speed difference for a feed so you can get them to be similar ( some people talk much faster/slower and some postcast are much louder then others. I saw other suggestions to solve the volume but maybe this is easier to implement).

title: Relative volume
body: Be able to set the volume of the app relative to other apps.

title: Feature Request: Verify database after import / data integrity button
body:
Having fixed #2562, I'm now in the position where trying to play podcast episodes stands the chance of irrevocably crashing the app if I don't clear the database. As I have 90 odd episodes in my queue I'd rather not do this!

I wanted to put forward a couple of suggestions and see what the better idea may be.

One idea is that after a database import, AntennaPod should run through all episodes marked as 'downloaded', and conditionally test and mark whether the file is on disk or not.

The other option is a button in the settings menu to run this process and check the integrity of the database in terms of whether the files marked as downloaded are actually on disk.

I would like to attempt this soon, but wanted to get feedback first to see if there are any suggestions or ongoing ideas as to how this should be addressed.

title: Android Auto: after reconnecting the phone to the car, playback can't be resumed.
body:
**App version:**
Checked in two versions:
 * 1.6.4.5 (from Play store)
 * 1.6.4.1-165-gc13acc62 (built from git)

**Android version**: 8.1.0

**Device model**: Nexus 5X

**Expected behaviour**:

After I reconnect the phone to Android Auto, AntennaPod shows the last item that was being played. Pressing "play" should resume playback.

**Current behaviour**:

After I reconnect the phone to Android Auto, AntennaPod shows the last item that was being played. However, pressing "play" does nothing.


**First occured**: ~2 months ago

**Steps to reproduce**:

Note: this is reproducible both with DHU and with an actual car. See [1] for DHU installation requirements.

1. Connect the phone to Android Auto.
2. Start playing back a podcast (for example, the first item from the Queue).
3. Without pausing the playback, disconnect Android Auto (pull the USB cable, or Alt-F4 the DHU).
4. Reconnect the phone to Android Auto.

At this point the home screen shows the last podcast.

5. Press the "Play" button. Note, that nothing happens.

Note, that choosing an item from the list works correctly.

[1] https://developer.android.com/training/auto/testing/index.html

**Environment**: vanilla settings, cleanly installed AntennaPod. Reproducible both in DHU and an actual car.

title: Feature: open episode on fyyd.de
body:
[Fyyd](https://fyyd.de) is a podcast directory and episode recommendation platform. You can add episodes to a personal feed which can then be subscribed to by others. Currently sharing an episode starting from AntennaPod is quite painful, you would have to search for the episode in your webbrowser manually (or maybe use the [bookmarklet](https://fyyd.de/bookmarklet), but that has it's own problems on mobile browsers).

A menu item to open the visible episode on Fyyd would enable recommending episodes with a few taps.

If I read the [bookmarklet page](https://fyyd.de/bookmarklet) correctly, you can have Fyyd search for an episode by the episodes website URL:

    'https://fyyd.de/search-url/'+base64(episode_website_url)+'/0'

Sharing with one button press is possible, but for that AntennaPod would need settings for the Fyyd username and feed slug.

**Con:** more interface clutter, not sure how many users would be helped by it.

title: Do not charge manual downloads for episode memory
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5

**Android version**: 7.0

**Expected behaviour**: Given that I have manually downloaded podcast episodes, that should not influence whether number of automatically downloaded episodes is exceeded or not.

**Current behaviour**: Since I have manually downloaded several episodes, I receive no more automatic downloads since the number of episodes to store is exceeded.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Set a certain number of episodes to keep and enable automatic downloads.
1. *manually* download more than these episodes.

**Environment**: Auto download enabled. Auto deletion enabled. Finite number of episodes to keep.

title: Only write queue order to database on drag release for podcast queue.
body:
This prevents large numbers of db writes in quick succession. This is a particular problem for large queue lengths. Fixes #2562 and potentially fixes #2573

Feedback and suggestions for improvement welcome.

title: When connected to a VPN on Wi-Fi, do not ask to Confirm Mobile Download
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 from F-Droid

**Android version**: 8.1 (CopperheadOS)

**Device model**: Nexus 6P

**Expected behaviour**:
When connected to a VPN on Wi-Fi, download episodes without further confirmation, just as with any Wi-Fi connection.

**Current behaviour**:
When connected to a VPN on Wi-Fi, AntennaPod asks to Confirm Mobile Download.

When confirmed, download still takes place via VPN/Wi-Fi. (At least as far as I can tell. I tested by switching off mobile data).

I tested with the OpenConnect and AnyConnect VPN apps.

**First occured**: I don't remember, but this seems to be around for a while now, at least half a year I guess.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Connect to Wi-Fi
1. Connect to VPN (I used OpenConnect and AnyConnect)
1. Download podcast episode

title: Feature Request: Show progress in notification
body:
Thanks for writing this app! It's quickly become my favorite podcast player :)

However, there is one feature I quite liked in other players: Showing the progress of the currently playing episode in the notification, either as a progress bar or as a "time played/percentage played" label.
Do you think it's possible to implement something like this?

title: Add Manifest file(s) to support Github dependency graph?
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body: Just a suggestion. :)

title: Feature request for headset users: 2xPause => Resume with 15 sec rewind
body: I would like to suggest a possible improvement: an option to rewind the MP3 a bit by pressing Pause and then replaying it again (meaning 2x "Pause"). Huge advantage: when listening with a headset, you can rewind it by pressing the pause button twice. In case of a short inattention, this is often enough.
