title: Can't download episodes with colon in title
body:
**App version:** 1.6.45 (from F-Droid)

**Android version**: 6.0.1

**Device model**: Moto G (3rd Generation)

**Expected behaviour**: all non alphanumeric characters in filenames of downloaded files are escaped somehow

**Current behaviour**: AntennaPod is configured to store downloads on external SD card which uses FAT32 format. Episodes with characters not permitted on this filesystem fail to download with EACCESS error.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Configure AntennaPod to store episodes on external SD card using FAT filesystem
1. Subscribe to Stuff You Should Know podcast
1. Attempt to download a "Stuff You Should Know Selects: foo bar" episode

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/309468/36911167-9c8cb7dc-1e3a-11e8-83c1-522a7c21e248.png)

title: FR: add "Mark as seen" to context menu in Episodes > New tab
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5

In Episodes > New tab, one can remove an episode from the tab by swiping left.

Proposal: expose the feature in the context menu (the one when long-pressing the episode) as well.

Rationales:
1. The feature via swiping left is somewhat hidden.
2. Swiping left is not quite reliable: AntennaPod often confuses the swiping between mark as seen and going to All tab

Exposing it to the context menu would solve the above issues.

Thanks.

title: FR: Provide share Link in episode playback screen even when there is no episode link.
body:
This is a follow up to #2142 . 

In episode playback screen, if the episode does not have link (in the feed), the current behavior is that Share Link menu item will not be shown.

Proposal: still provide Share Link menu item, In the actual sharing, it supplies the podcast website as a substitute for the episode link: 
```
<podcast name>: <episode name>
<podcast website>
```

The idea is that, in lieu of a link to the episode, the share will provide a link to the podcast along with the episode name. The information will still help users to access the episode. 

Thanks.

title: Intermittent Bug: playback cannot be stopped without restarting the device
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 , Google Play

**Android version**: 7.1

**Device model**: Moto E4

**Current behaviour**:
Occasionally, while playing an episode, it cannot be stopped. I tried the following:
- pressing stop button has no effect
- close AntennaPod has no effect
- play another episode: the new episode would play, but the one I tried to stop would still be playing. 

It is as if the playback (the one cannot be stopped) are running independent of AntennaPod. 

The only way to fix the issue is to restart the device.

**Frequency**: It happened intermittently - more than once a month but probably less than once a week, with daily playback about 2 hours 

**First occurred**: I noticed in 1.6.4.5 as described above. It might have occurred in earlier 1.6.4.x releases but I am not sure.  I definitely could say I did not encounter the error in using 1.6.2.3 (and prior) with an older Samsung device (Android 4.1.2)


**Environment**: For Playback, the default (Sonic Media Player) is set. I have not tried unsetting it.

title: automatic download (podcast episodes): does not download the latest episodes when refreshing the feed
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5  , Google Play

**Android version**: 7.1

**Device model**: Moto E4

**Current behaviour**:
With automatic download enabled, when I refresh the feed (Episodes screen > refresh button), AntennaPod:
1. refresh the feed (and add new episodes to the screen), and **concurrently**, 
2. download latest podcasts (per automatic download setting) available **prior to** the feed refresh.

Net Result: the latest episodes are not downloaded. Instead the ones available before the refresh are loaded instead.

For example, 
- if the feed currently has episodes: `podcast123, podcast456, podcast789, ......`
- after clicking the refresh button, 
    - new episodes `podcastABC, podcastDEF` are added, but
    - the slightly older episodes, `podcast123, podcast456` are downloaded instead.

**Expected behaviour**:
Using the above example, I'd like to see `podcastABC, podcastDEF` are downloaded instead. 

Thoughts?

title: Feeds and queue suddenly lost
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 F-Droid

**Android version**: 7.0

**Device model**: Samsung A5

**Current behaviour**: I've been using AntennaPod almost daily, for some years. I updated to 1.6.4.5 a few weeks ago. I had about 30 feeds with about 300 episodes downloaded and in my queue. Today I opened the app to find no feeds and nothing in my queue. All of the downloaded episodes are still on my phone but not visible in AntennaPod (I can use a music player to play them for example) and all of my settings/options are still there. The only thing I can think it might be, is within the last week I changed the storage location to be my SD card, so episodes were spread between internal and external storage. Is there any way to recover from this rather than having to re-download everything? If I re-add a feed and download an episode that is already downloaded, it downloads the file again despite it already being on the phone in the expected location.

**First occured**: Version 1.6.4.5

title: Auto update hangs when data store is on SD card.
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 Google Play

**Android version**: 7.0

**Device model**: Moto G5+. But this happened on another phone also with Android 6. 

**Expected behaviour**: Auto update and download by set interval, currently 1 hour. 

**Current behaviour**: Starting updating and the updates hangs with a "Downloading podcast data" in the notification. It hangs until I kill AntennaPod. This doesn't happen all the time but most often all the time. 

**First occured**: A few months back. Not sure which version. 

**Steps to reproduce**: Set to update every hour with auto download and wait until an update hangs. The current update has hung for 6 hours. It would be good to be able to kill the hung update process from the notification. Currently I have to go to the app in Settings to kill it. It will not die by itself. 

**Environment**: Auto update/download every hour and data store on SD card.

title: Continues playing after phone call, but should not because of headphone removal
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 (from Google Play)
**Android version**: 6.0.1
**Device model**: DTEK50

**Expected behaviour**: By default, AntennaPod stops playing if you remove the headphones. It also stops playing during a phone call and continues after the phone call ended. Both is expected behaviour. However, if you combine both, things go bad.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. User connects headphones
2. User starts listening to a podcast with AntennaPod
3. User receives an incoming call, AntennaPod stops playing as expected, phone rings
4. User removes headphones while the phone is still ringing (because the headphones don't have a hands-free microphone included and user wants to use the phone itself to talk) and then accepts the call
5. Bla
6. Phone call ends
7. Now, AntennaPod continues playing the podcast *on the phone speakers*, but it should not because the headphones had been removed

title: Removed large icon from notification
body:
Closes #2541.

We do not need the same icon twice.
As the icon is displayed white-on-white, it is not visible anyways.
This also gives more space to the notification text

title: Fixed crash if media file exists but can not be read
body:
This crash can be reproduced when exporting the database and importing it into
the debug version. Native crash.

title: Duplicate translations
body:
Hi,
I want to help translating AntennaPod in Italian but I'm facing a problem: There are two different italian translations going on on transifex and I find it to be confusing.
Right now there is Italian (it) and Italian (it_IT). I don't really know what should differentiate them because they're the exact same language. I already translated some Italian (it) strings before realizing this.
I think the two translations should be merged in some way.

title: Allow to copy episode title
body: I just found myself trying to select the episode title of a podcast in the Mediaplayer activity twice in the last few days. Should be quite easy to make it directly selectable without cluttering menus

title: Adaptive icon
body:
This is an attempt to implement the Adaptive Icons introduced in Android 8 (https://developer.android.com/guide/practices/ui_guidelines/icon_design_adaptive.html).

I did my best to isolate the antenna and the waves from the icon using Gimp.

title: Amazon App Store has 2014 version
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
The AntennaPod version on the Amazon App store is 3+ years old. (information below).

Please update, so that the devices with Amazon App Store can use a recent AntennaPod Version.
Devices would include:
  - Fire OS, Amazon devices
  - Other Google-playstore-less devices which download/install amazon store apk from amazon

-- Amazon App Store - AntennaPod -- 
Author: Daniel Oeh
Latest Developer Update: December 9, 2014
Developer info:
 - feedback@antennapod.com
 - https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod

title: Drag episode order bug
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 7.1.2 [(OpenKirins Ressurection Remix for Huawei P9)](https://forum.xda-developers.com/p9/development/rom-t3606185)

**Device model**: Huawei P9

**Expected behaviour**: After hitting the padlock button, dragging episodes should rearrange them; leaving episodes where they were left on touchup.

**Current behaviour**: Whilst dragging episodes appears to work, after changing activity and switching back to play queue the episodes are in an entirely different order. To get the desired order I find myself having to switch between activities to dismissed the cached data and see the true positions of episodes. Sometimes, however this doesn't do the trick and I have to close and reopen the app. It appears to somehow be losing where I'm dropping episodes somehow; this makes setting an order for my queue very frustrating, especially as I currently have 56 episodes queued!

**First occured**: Version 1.6.4.5 / Some time this week

**Steps to reproduce**:

I'm not sure, as I can't recall what triggered this.

**Environment**: Pretty much standard, I sync to gpodder.net, but that's about it.

I have some experience with Android Dev, so I'm happy to look at diagnosing the problem better, however before doing so, is there any way of exporting the current state of my app (playback position of episodes, current queue, etc.), as losing this would be really inconvenient!

Note that the same symptoms are outlined in #2573

title: Keyboard does not disappear
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 8.0.0

**Device model**: One Plus 5

**Expected behaviour**: After clicking on the search button in the actionbar, the keyboard should stay as long as one is typing in the search textbox.

**Current behaviour**:
The keyboard stays when you click on another button e.g refresh. One can't see the text that is typed.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Tap on the search button in the actionbar.
2. Click on another button for example refresh or the sandwich and than another tab.
3. The keyboard does not disappear automatically.

This is not a severe bug, but neither expected behavior.

title: App force-closes/crashes directly after deleting feed (Beta version)
body:
**App version:** 1.x (from Google Play/F-Droid/Custom build)
, 1.6.4.5, installed from *Beta* channel via Google Play

**Android version**: 5.x [Please mention if you are using a custom rom!]
5.1.1

**Device model**:
Samsung Galaxy J3

**Expected behaviour**:
AntennaPod to open normally

**Current behaviour**:
AntennaPod crashes directly upon opening.
I get to see the loading screen (black screen with logo in the center) for about half a second, then an empty list with the text "Episodes" (in French) on top and the three tabs "New", "All" and "Favorites" (again, translating from French but I suppose that's the English terms used), then the app crashes.
I've recorded this, please have a look at https://youtu.be/zHlHOKPa3oc

**First occured**: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago
This happened today. I have been using the Beta version for 2 days without particular problems (namely to get around #2463), today I decided to delete a feed (I listened to the most episode yesterday, no other episode of that feed had been downloaded), and after deleting the feed the following crash behavior started.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Run beta version of the app
1. restore list of feeds from OPML created by a previous version (most current non-Beta version)
1. Delete one of the feeds

**Environment**: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?]
Not using Prestissimo. Using Beta version, dark theme, files downloaded to external SD, Auto Download turned on (max 25 episodes), speed settings 1.0x, 1.5x, 2.0x, 2.5x, 3.0x, 4.0x. No other settings changed from default settings.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
Not available.
I did use Android's Report issue and sent the logs, so the persons having access to the Google Play account should probably have a report from this afternoon (around noon today, Amsterdam time, if I remember correctly)

title: Layout improvements
body: This fixes that awful flickering when returning back to the queue: ![ezgif-4-8d51e687f6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5811634/36127179-5038e64e-105c-11e8-821e-25501d2f0e8d.gif) Feed header background color: Closes #2565

title: Fix for #2555 - handle null SSID in WiFi list
body: Simple fix for issue #2555  when sorting the list of WiFi connections, handle the case that the SSID may be null.

title: CompletedDownloadsFragment doesn't update List view after episode is deleted
body:
**App version:** 1.x (from Google Play/F-Droid/Custom build)
1.6.4.4 - play store

**Android version**: 5.x [Please mention if you are using a custom rom!]
7.0 original from Motorola

**Device model**:
G5 plus

**Expected behaviour**:
After an episode is deleted in CompletedDownloadsFragment the ListView should get updated to not show the episode anymore.

**Current behaviour**:
Deleted episode stays in the completed download list.

**First occured**: Version 1.x / about x days/weeks ago

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. This
1. Than that
1. Then

**Environment**: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?]

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
```
[if available]
```

title: Android Auto track-skip button behaves like fast-forward
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.5 (beta from Google Play)

**Android version**: 7.0, December 1, 2017 patch level

**Device model**: LG G5 (LGLS992)

**Expected behaviour**: Tapping the track-skip (right arrow + vertical bar) button in Android Auto should cause AntennaPod to skip to the next item in the queue

**Current behaviour**: Tapping the track-skip (right arrow + vertical bar) button in Android Auto causes AntennaPod to jump ahead a few seconds.  I cannot tell how far it jumps ahead, but it seems to be a similar jump to what the app does upon tapping the fast-forward (right arrow + right arrow) button.  

**First occured**: First noticed this behavior when the Android Auto button layout was changed to have a track-skip and a fast-forward button.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Connect to Android Auto
1. Tap the Music (headphones) button
1. Tap AntennaPod
1. Begin (or resume) playback of an episode.  As long as [#2492](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/2492) is not preventing the track-skip and other controls to be displayed, tap the track-skip button.  Instead of skipping to the next episode in the queue, AntennaPod jumps ahead a few seconds in the currently playing episode.  

**Environment**: Connected via USB to Android Auto on a 2017 Honda Ridgeline RTL-E

title: Hotfix for servers not accepting the Range header
body:
Because of #2339, the file always exists when starting a download.
There is still an issue with the server parsing "Range: bytes=0-"
incorrectly, but this commit should make the error appear less often.

Related to #2539

title: Synchronize opening and closing of the database
Delete episodes from device when long pressing
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
When long pressing episodes from the queue, episode or the podcast list one should have the option to delete said ep from the device.

You should be able to delete an episode from anywhere the episode is displayed, having to go to the download section specifically is cumbersome.

In the player it could be added under the dots or as its own item with a trashcan icon.

title: Improved wording (Closes #2545)
Prefer StringBuilder over StringBuffer
body: The latter has unnecessary synchronization.  Found via error-prone.

title: Import/export to/from SD only, or wrong string?
body:
I'm very happy we'll see the import/export function! But when translating in Transifext I read a string saying 'successful export to SD'. Does this mean we can only export to SD (my phone has internal memory only), or is this wrong in the source string?

https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/e6498393a691367c031c5a09ff53d086a497d530/core/src/main/res/values/strings.xml#L670

title: Remove < v14 layouts and replace them with the -v14 overlay
body:
Now that we require SDK of 14, we can remove compat layouts
for older platforms than v14.

title: Make some static fields final
body:
Adding final prohibits modification and allows initialization of
primitive and String fields at compile time instead of runtime in
clinit:

https://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-tips.html#UseFinal

Found via error-prone.

title: Make some inner classes static
body:
This avoids an implicit this field and can help GC.  Found via
error-prone.

title: Feature request: allow episode to be played while downloading is in progress
body:
Hello,

It would be very nice if Antennapod would allow an episode to begin playing before it has finished downloading. The UI implications of this are pretty obvious and the only problem I can imagine is how to handle the situation where the playing catches up with the downloading - presumably pausing the playback would be good enough, though auto-resume once enough additional content had been downloaded would be even better.

Thanks!

title: set minSdkVersion to 14
body:
According to https://developer.android.com/about/dashboards/index.html
API levels of 14 and lower are only on less than 0.5% of the devices.
IMHO it is time to move on, and allow for some compat code cleanup.

Example cleanup included, but there is a lot to remove (extra resources,
various conditionals in the code)

title: Set video aspect on initial creation
body:
Previously on first start of a video the aspect ratio
was not correct (annoying on a 18:9 phone as
it doesn't match the usual 16:9 aspect ratio). So extract
the code into a setupVideoAspectRatio() helper
and call it from surfaceCreated as well.

title: Update jsoup to 1.11.2
body:
jsoup 1.11.1 features a 30% lower DOM memory footprint, streaming
network HTML parsing, faster HTML generation, and a bunch of other
improvements and bug fixes.

See https://jsoup.org/news/release-1.11.1 and
https://jsoup.org/news/release-1.11.2 (with the followup bugfixes)
for details.

title: Cleanup order/remove unused includes
body:
This is the result of Android Studio's include cleanup
Macro. This removes some no longer used includes, simplifying
the code a bit. The rest is grouping and resorting alphabetically.

title: Return START_STICKY from onStartCommand()

The _FLAG_ variant is the input enum, replace it
with the value-equivalent properly typed enum.

title: Allow sending podcast files to Samsung Gear / or store podcasts in music folder as workaround
body:
Hello together! I really like AntennaPod, but what I really miss is to be able to send Podcasts to my Samsung Gear Sport watch, maybe directly out of AntennaPod (Send/Sync feature) - then I could listen to podcasts while running without my phone.

As a workaround solution, the Samsung Gear app could be used to send the files. Unfortunately the Gear App does not allow sending any file on the phone, but only specfic content like music. 

See https://forums.androidcentral.com/samsung-gear-s2/713215-anyway-sync-podcasts.html how you can work around this when using Pocket Casts by setting the storage location to the music folder. Maybe AnntennaPod could provide such a feature too? Either by allowing to enter a real custom location, or by making the music folder available as an option.

I have seen that several issues already adress the storage location already, like #2239 or #2236, but not for this specific use case, thus I wanted share my request.

title: Playback starts at beginning of track if seeking past half-way
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.2 (from Google Play) **Android version**: 8.0.0 **Device model**: OnePlus 3 **Expected behaviour**: Seeking to any time in the track plays the track from that time **Current behaviour**: Seeking to a time in the first half works fine (i.e. a time before half the length), but seeking to any time in the second half starts playback from the beginning of the track. The progress bar continues as if the seeking was correct. E.g., a 1:20:00 duration track, I seek to 00:45:00, the track will play from the beginning, but the duration indicated will carry on counting from 00:45:00. If you seek to a little before half way and play through the halfway point, there's no issue. **First occured**: I think this happened when I upgraded android, not entirely sure. It sounds like point 4 in #2487 but I think the version I have has the #2468 fix. **Steps to reproduce**: 1. Subscribe to [this feed](http://feeds.soundcloud.com/users/soundcloud:users:137742111/sounds.rss): 2. Download any track, play. 3. Seek to different locations, try near the beginning, near the middle and near the end. **Environment**: This happens with any headphones or playing through phone speaker. It also happens if I turn off bluetooth headphones in the second half of an episode (I guess that causes a re-seek) but not if I switch audio sources on the OS level, through the notifications drawer. This happens with sonic player turned on or off. Here's the metadata on one of the tracks (I notice it's fixed bitrate). 
Metadata:
    Software        : GarageBand 10.1.6
    comment         :  00000000 00000210 000007C7 000000000C56FAA9 00000000 06B71DE2 00000000 00000000 0
0000000 00000000 00000000 00000000                                                                     
  Duration: 01:18:14.54, start: 0.025057, bitrate: 197 kb/s
    Stream #0:0: Audio: mp3, 44100 Hz, mono, s16p, 197 kb/s
    Metadata:
      encoder         : LAME3.99r

title: Adjust text color in widget

title: Able to have multiple files playing at once, unable to stop background playback
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.1 (F-Droid)
**Android version**: 7.1.2 LineageOS 14.1 (20171218)
**Device model**: Samsung Galaxy S4
**Expected behaviour**: Pausing and playing a file will cause playback to either pause or start playing.
**Current behaviour**: Sometimes a file does not stop playing, or attempting to stop playback is unresponsive. At this point, it is possible to have a file playing in the background (not able to stop) and a file playing in the foreground (able to stop).
**First occured**: I've noticed this behavior for some time across multiple versions, but finally found a way to reproduce it, thus the bug report now.
**Steps to reproduce**:

The following is a video demonstrating the bug and how to reproduce it.

[ScreenRecord-2018-01-01-19-07-10.m4v.zip](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/files/1596559/ScreenRecord-2018-01-01-19-07-10.m4v.zip)

Steps:
1. Play a file
2. Open the view showing details about the current file playback.
3. Let the file end playing, or fast forward to the end of the file to reproduce quicker
4. Goto 1 until the current file has a duration of 0:00.

You will note that the attached video starts to show odd behavior around 1:33. At that point, a loaded podcast is reporting a maximum duration of 0:00. When this happens, the playback cannot be stopped unless the application is force stopped. While in this state the pause button does not work. However, if a different file is selected for playback there are then two files playing.

**Environment**: No devices are attached during this, such as bluetooth headset or headphones. The application is configured to Auto Delete when playback completes.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
As mentioned in https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/2356 the F-Droid build does not contain logs. I did capture logs during the demo, but they are expected to not contain any AntennaPod logs.

title: An Option to Archive Podcasts
body:
It would be nice to have an option to Archive Podcasts.

Archiving a podcast would mean there won't be any more updates and the podcast would be moved to a different section than the Subscriptions. This way, a dead podcast or a podcast that is uninteresting at the moment would be both stopped and the user will not lose the read status, the place where a certain episode was stopped, the list of favorites, and so on.

title: Please cache podcast logos/images
body:
I've been using AntennaPod for a long time now, always updating to the latest version. And I've always had this annoying problem: AP does not consistently remember the images of the podcasts I subscribe to. Neither in the sidebar, the subscriptions list, or now in the new statistics page (which I love, btw!). There are always some podcasts that show the image at once, and many where it's just a gray box. Often the gray box fills with the image after a (long) while, but not always. This annoys me especially when I'm showing my subscriptions to friends and I want to reccomend AP to them. It gives a bad first impression, much worse than the actuall experience really is.

I hope this can be fixed. It seems to me that it should be quite easy to just cache the images (for a longer time).

Thank you so much for all the hard work on this amazing app, the one I use more than any other app every day! :)

AP version: 1.6.4.1
Android version: 5.0
Phone: Samsung Galaxy Note 3

title: Downloaded files are named from podcast Title rather than filename
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.1

**Android version**: 7.0

**Device model**: Samsung Galaxy S8

**Expected behaviour**:  Downloaded files should be given the same name as the the file on the source podcast feed, or at least there should be an option in the feed settings to enable preserving the file name.  

Podcast creators usually design the naming of episode files to be unique, indicate the specific feed and the date, in a properly sortable scheme.  Podcast titles are generally more informative about the contents but are not ideal for archiving/sorting.

**Current behaviour**: The episode "Title" field is used as the filename for downloaded files.  

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Open and episode of a subscribed podcast.
2. Press the "Download" button to download the episode. 
3. With a file manager program, navigate to the file storage location of the downloaded file.
4. The filename of the .MP3 file will not match the filename in the "<enclosure url=" tag in the .rss feed document (or whatever is used to define the podcast feed), but will match the "Title" field, instead.

**Expected behavior**: When listening to podcasts in car, information such as podcast title, and progress be displayed on my vehicles display (as is done with any other player).

**Current behavior**: Title, progress...etc. All fields are blank. The pause/play button does work, but no information is displayed.

**First occurred**: Worked when I first started using the App months ago. But quit soon after. I thought it was an issue with my personal setup, but all other apps (spotify, etc.) display track/progress/artist perfectly fine.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Connect phone to car via Bluetooth.
2. Play podcast.
3. Notice no information displayed.

**Environment**: Bluetooth to Toyota vehicle using entune system.

title: Support for picture-in-picture mode
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/picture-in-picture.html

Allow to play video podcasts in a floating window (picture-in-picture)

title: Allow content intents
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
AntennaPod currently only allows `action.VIEW` intents if they contain the data `file://`. File manager and Gallery applications often send a `content://` intent. The `MediaMetadataRetriever` function used in `ExternalMedia` theoretically supports `content://` intents, so all we need to do is to pass the Context to `ExternalMedia`.

It would be nice if I could open any file with AntennaPod, because I like the playback speed option.

title: Auto delete not working, podcast files never deleted
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.1

**Android version**: 7.1.1 (LineageOS 14.1)

**Device model**: HTC One m7

**Expected behaviour**: After an episode is removed from the queue, it should be deleted.

**Current behaviour**: I started receiving warnings from the Google app updater, saying I didn't have enough space left on my device to install updates. Using the Android storage analyzer, it found that apps were consuming most of my storage, and that AntennaPod was consuming 10GB by itself. I wasn't sure why AntennaPod would be consuming so much, since I hadn't downloaded that many podcasts, and I have "auto-delete" enabled, so I thought downloaded  podcasts that I've listened to or removed from my queue unlistened, would be auto-deleted.

However, this doesn't seem to be the case. I used the app SSHelper to ssh into my phone, and cd'ed to `/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/media`, where AntennaPod says it keeps all its data. And sure enough, in the folders for the podcasts whose episodes I've either listened to or have removed from my queue, there are a ton of files, some dating back months.

Until this bug is fixed, as a workaround, can I delete this entire directory, or will that destroy Antennapod? There seems to be a folder for every podcast I've ever listened to, even ones that I unsubscribed  from and removed from Antennapod. Why is it not deleting those folders?

title: feature request: archive / unsubscribe feeds without removing them
body:
there are lots of podcast productions, that are discontinued. 
AntennaPod should be able to work with them without updating their feeds anymore.
this would be beneficial, if you have lots of those discontinued feeds. 

this may be implemented by _archiving_ a feed. it should be accessible as a normal feed would be. you should be able to download and listen episodes and track them (#1960).

i would prefer having it integrated in the normal UI instead of an archive section.

title: So many problems since Andriod 8 update on Nexus 5X
body:
I have the Nexus 5X running Android 8.0 and antennaPod 1.6.4.1 . Did a factory reset and only have a couple other non factory apps installed. First let me say I tried all the podcast players out there and this was by far the best. I really loved this program until recent and wish I hadn't updated to android 8. Today it just got so bad I couldn't take it anymore thats why I'm opening a bug report. So many problems I don't know where to start.

1  Randomly just starts playing when plugging into the charger 
    Randomly starts playing if I let call go unanswered while plugged in to charger
    Randomly starts playing after using the camera and then turning screen off and putting in pocket.

2  Sometimes starts up playing multiple pod casts at the same time including the last podcast I listened 
  to thats marked as played and shows download only.  Update - Today when it began to play on its own 
  I discovered that it was playing the same episode over top of itself.  The episode began simultaneously 
  playing from where I left off and also from the very beginning. How can that even happen? 

3  Today it just started playing when I turned the display off and I couldn't shut it off. None of the 
  playback control buttons would respond and it continued to play even after I closed all programs. I had 
  to open up android settings, all apps, and manually stop antenna pod to get it to shut down.

4  Sometimes when restarting an paused episode the playback will start completely over at the very  
  beginning instead of where I left off.

5  This problem has me even more confused because I'm not sure whats to blame. The same podcasts I 
  been getting from  Itunes using the same unchanged home network take much longer to download. A 
  podcast that use to take 2 min now takes 30 minutes. Very frustrating.

title: Share podcast / episod with itpc:// protocol prefix
body:
I often share an episode or entire feed friends over WhatsApp etc.

It would be good if when the recipient clicked the link I sent them it opened in their podcast app if they have one.

## The problem

Currently what is sent is (depending on the podcast in question) usually some web page link to a page of varying quality and usefulness, often resulting in the recipient failing to listen to what I send because it's all too much of a pain, or using the embedded webpage player even though they are using a phone that has a podcast listener installed.

## Suggestion

The Share Link button could normalize the feed url to start with `itpc://` before sharing.

It would be good to choose the prefix with the broadest support, I'm not sure what apps support which.

----

Useful info: https://codex.wordpress.org/Podcasting

This is basically the inverse of issue #333

title: Ability to view entire summary for episodes from show page in Add Podcasts
body:
Something that may prove to be a nice include would be to have the ability to view the entire summary of an episode of a podcast from the podcast's page when looking inside the Add Podcast screen. This functionality already exists for podcasts you are subscribed to.

For example, in the AntennaPod app, go to Add Podcast > Search iTunes, search for Intercepted. After clicking the podcast, you can see the episodes but selecting an episode currently does nothing. So you can only see the first two or three sentences of the description.

It would prove useful to be able to see the entire summary when tapped to be able to get a better idea of what a podcast's episodes are like without having to subscribe first.

When I press the button, the playback starts, plays a few milliseconds, and then stops.
After manually starting an episode, clicking the button stops the playback for a few milliseconds and then resumes.

Seems like there was a change in some API, which now reports button down and up as two separate events.

title: Parse RSS pubDate fields containing "Sept"
body: According to [RFC 2822](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2822.txt) the correct abbreviation is `Sep`. But [some](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=521548) [generators](https://github.com/sparkle-project/Sparkle/issues/217) incorrectly use `Sept` instead. That causes the feed to be displayed out of order, and when logging is enabled, logcat shows `DateUtils: Could not parse date string`. The same feed works in Podcast Addict.

title: Android O
body: Hi, I try to make a PR for support Android O and this sucks Why do you have a 'core' module with same flavors ? In our company we merged the modules (and if you want you can separate it with packages) and the result was a easier build script and faster build times. If you like a merge of modules, I can make a PR and add support Android O too. Please let me know ! PS: I just ask to save my time, because a lot of open source projects are not very open to new ideas.

title: Reload FeedMedia from DB to ensure correct playback position - fixes #2382
body:
Changed the implementation of the 'Parcelable' to sync with what is written to the DB.
It could happen that if Android OS deserializes a FeedMedia, that a  playback position is set to the LocalPSMP which is quite old. As described in #2382 this is easily reproducable in Andoid O probably because of the aggressive Background Task management.

title: Using AlarmManager.set() to set the alarm and update feeds may be delayed
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
Hi,

I found API [AlarmManager.set()](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/AlarmManager.html#set(int,%20long,%20android.app.PendingIntent)) is used in [UserPreferences.java](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/e884e989c781a2527b737ff30f0fcadd23e791f5/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/preferences/UserPreferences.java) to schedule the alarm to update the feeds automatically at some time.
For your information, from API 19, the alarm scheduled by this API may not be triggered at the exact time you set. It may be delayed due to the system scheduling. So, the update may be delayed.
To have on time alarm scheduling, you may use setExact or setWindow instead.

Thx.

title: Feature Request: Only keep most recent N in queue
body: I'm currently subscribed to the PBS Newshour. But I know that I can't keep up with their content during school. It would be nice if I could tell it "just keep the last dozen" or " everything in the last 3 days" in queue.

title: Feature request: set as next in playlist for favorite podcasts
body:
Feature request:
It would be great, if it could be set for individual podcasts, that new episodes are always placed directly at the next position in the playlist. So I could here the new episode of my favorite podcast automatically as soon as it has been published.

Also a possibility to "play next" in addition to "move to start/end" (in the episode context menu) would be great to do the described before manually.

title: Feature request for snooze timer: snooze after x episodes
body:
Feature request:
I use the snooze function very often. What I lack would be an option "episodes"next to seconds, minutes and hours. It would be great, if e. g. after 3 episodes it would be switched off.

title: Podcast insertion order into Queue is broken (In my opinion)
body:
**App version:** 1.6.4.0 , Commit 7b496d5a (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 6.0.1

**Device model**: Nexus 5

**Expected behaviour**:
When selecting several episodes in succession (so that they download in parallel), for example from a feed just added, they should be added to the queue by the order which they were selected for download, or by the chronological order.  
This is especially irritating when you download a multi-part podcast, and expect to hear the chapters in the order which you have selected them.

**Current behaviour**:
They episodes are added by the order in which they have finished downloading.

**First occured**: As far as I remember into the past

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Add a new feed, or choose one with more than one unloaded episodes
1. select episodes for download in quick succession in a specific order, preferrably selecting the longest episodes first, and the shortest last.
1. Go to the "Downloads" screen / "Running" tab and watch the order in which the episodes complete downloading. hopefully they will download out of order due to their length difference.
1. Go to the "Queue" screen and note the order the episodes were added, and you will notice that they are sorted by the download finish order, not by the download start order.

title: Starts playing unexpectedly
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
**App version:** 1.6.2.3 from Google Play

**Android version**: 8.0.0

**Device model**: Pixel

**Expected behaviour**:
AntennaPod only plays when I ask it to :-)

**Current behaviour**:
AntennaPod will start playing some episode I've listened *and finished* recently. Usually one I've finished listening to. The only way to prevent this is to delete played episodes. Events that seem to trigger this include connecting to a car via Bluetooth Audio, and certain Play Store updates (I don't know if the Antenna Pod pod itself or some services, like the Web View or Google Services).

Because of this bug AntennaPod has started playing in inappropriate situations, such as in the middle of the night and while my phone was charging on my office desk.

This seems to be related to issue #2425, as the episode plays in the same hidden mode that requires killing the app.

**First occured**: 4-8 weeks ago

**Environment**: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?]

Headphones Reconnect and Bluetooth Reconnect options are disabled. So is Keep Skipped Episodes.

This happened many times both with Bluetooth Audio and without headphones. I don't discard that it could happen with headphones, I just never experienced it, because the I don't normally do the things that have triggered this problem while the headphones are connected.

**App version:** 1.6.2.3 (F-Droid version)

**Android version**: 7.1.1

*(I don't think the rest of the questions is important.)*

Hi,

first of all thanks for Antennapod. I use it daily on my commute and am very happy with it. I recently got the idea of enqueueing my "short notice news feeds" in front of my "long term feeds". I found the feed priority sorting method in the [Wiki](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/wiki/Sorting-criteria#advanced), but I couldn't find anything regarding feed priorities or priority sorting in the App. Where and how do I set feed priorities and sort the queue accordingly?

Thanks in advance for the answer and thanks again for the App.

title: Disable track skip functionality
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Is there any way to disable the functionality where holding down the volume button skips and marks done an entire track?

This is a really frustrating feature. Several times, I've gone to raise or lower the volume, only for AntennaPod to skip the entire track, mark it played, and delete the downloaded file. It's really subtle and difficult to avoid, because doing a single volume press doesn't usually cause this, but accidentally holding the volume it down for even one whole second does cause it.

I can't see any option under the settings to change this. Is this a feature in AntennaPod or is it built-in to Android?

title: "Hardware Forward Skip Time" button skips N seconds into next episode instead of N seconds ahead
body:
Hello,

I believe I am seeing a bug that first occurred after I upgraded my Google Pixel phone to Android 8.0.0.

I have the "Forward Button Skips: When pressing a hardware forward button skip to the next episode instead of fast-forwarding" option Off.

I have the "Fast Forward Skip Time: Customize the number of seconds to jump forward when the fast forward button is clicked" option set to 30 seconds.

Before upgrading to Android 8.0.0, while listening to a podcast, if I clicked the forward skip button on my car, or in the TeckNet Bluetooth adapter in my spouse's car, AntennaPod would skip forward 30 seconds in the current podcast. If the current podcast had less than 30 seconds remaining, it would skip to the start of the next item in my queue. That was the correct and expected behavior.

After upgrading to Android 8.0.0, while listening to a podcast, if I click one of the hardware forward skip buttons listed above, AntennaPod marks the current item as played, skips to the next item in my queue, and then starts playing that item 30 seconds in, effectively skipping the first 30 seconds of that episode.

I have toggled the "Forward Button Skips" option on and off, and can verify that it is currently off, but this issue occurs. I highly suspect that Android 8.0.0 changed something to cause this to occur.

---

**App version:** 1.6.3.0

**Android version**: 8.0.0

**Device model**: Google Pixel (Hardware Version: PVT)

**Expected behaviour**: When configured properly, Forward Skip Button advances 30 seconds into current podcast.

**Current behaviour**: Forward Skip Button ends current episode, marks it as played, then starts next episode in queue 30 seconds in.

**First occurred**: After upgrading phone to Oreo.

**Steps to reproduce**:
Described earlier.

**Environment**:
No Restissimo. I configured the Forward Skip Button behavior. Bluetooth is connected to either a car or to a bluetooth-to-FM transmitter. Phone has Oreo through Verizon. I have a backlog of several hundred episodes in my Episodes list, if that matters.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
```
not available
```

title: Allow option to do "Automatic Download" from end of Episodes list
body:
Hello,

I would like to submit a feature request that modified the behavior of the "Automatic Download" setting.  Currently, if Automatic Download is enabled, AntennaPod downloads a set number of episodes starting from the top of the "Episodes" list, which means it downloads the most recent files.

I prefer to listen to episodes in order, so I would like the option to tell AntennaPod that when automatically downloading files, it should select from the oldest episodes first, which would mean downloading from the bottom/end of the Episodes queue/list.

In the UI, this could be implemented as selection from a list that reads:
Download from Episodes starting with
 - Oldest
 - Newest

And you could make Newest the default so that the current behavior remains the default.

---

**App version:** 1.6.3.0

**Android version**: 8.0.0

**Device model**: Google Pixel (Hardware Version: PVT)

**Expected behaviour**: Allow user to determine if Auto Download is from top or bottom of list

**Current behaviour**: Auto Download is fixed to top of list

**First occurred**: Not sure. I have noticed this behavior since I started using this app a few years ago.

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Under Settings, enable Automatic Download
2. Optionally allow it to download even if you are not plugged in, if you are not plugged in.
3. Either allow app to download over the air, or connect to WiFi.
4. Ensure that the number of episodes currently downloaded is less than your "Episode Cache" setting so that at least one file will automatically download.
4. Refresh your app list.
5. Watch it download some number of files from the top of the Episodes list.

**Environment**: [Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?]
No Restissimo. Bluetooth doesn't matter. Phone has Oreo through Verizon. I have a backlog of several hundred episodes in my Episodes list to get through.

**Stacktrace/Logcat**: 
```
not available
```

title: Add auto download on mobile connection option
body:
As I got "unlimited" data on my mobile I switched off wifi and found AntennaPod no longer did auto updates. I therefore downloaded the source, got android-studio and added the option to auto download even when you are not on wifi, even though I haven't done any android development before.

I've run with my changes for a few months without any problems and though it may be helpful for others.

I now see there is issue #2005 where this change is suggested already.

title: Playback starts randomly
body:
Ever since the Android 8 update I've had podcasts suddenly start playing for no reason.

On one occasion it started in the middle of the night. On another I went back to the room where I left my phone and found it merrily playing away. I think it might have been on charge on both occasions, but not just put on.

Twice it's happened while I've been reading a book in the Kindle app. My sleeping wife was not amused!

Strangely, it seems to start at the beginning of a podcast, not where I last left off. The resume on headphones/Bluetooth feature still gets that right.

title: Audio mixing problems with other apps when using bluetooth headset with a2dp-profile
body:
**App version:** 1.6.3.0 (from Google Play) Commit: b1bb29ddc

**Android version**: 7.1.1

**Device model**: Lenovo Moto Z

**Expected behaviour**:
Navigation notifications should pause playback, play and unpause afterwards when using bluetooth headsets.

**Current behaviour**:
When using a Jaybird Freedom headset (a2dp-profile) listening to podcasts with AntennaPod and using Google Maps or e.g. Komoot as navigation app does not work as expected. Whem there is a navigation
announcement the playback pauses, then there is silence for some time and then the playback unpauses.
BikeCitizionGuide works like expected. I don't know if this is a issue with AntennaPod, Android or the way
the navigation apps work.

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Connect the Jaybird Freedom Headset
2. Play podcast
4. Start navigating with Google Maps.
5. Navigation announcements remain silent.

**Environment**: 
- Jaybird Freedom Headset
- various playback speeds (1.75 up to 3.0)
- Sonic Media Player (doesn't matter)
- Headset disconnection/reconnection enabled
- Bluetooth reconnection enabled
- pause on interruption
- restart after call

title: Don't add completed downloads automatically and always into playlist
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hello, 

this app is great. I'm using it for many podcasts. I'm downloading many podcasts episodes in the night automatically. But I don't want to see them all automatically and always in my playlist. 

My idea is to integrate two options:
1. You can globally  activate or deactivate the queuing of completed downloads into the playlist. 
2. You can choose for each podcast if you want AntennaPod to add the downloads automatically into the playlist. 

Best regards 
Tim

title: Allow setting order (or priority) of podcast to download
body:
Currently it seems when you use auto download and have free space AntennaPod will download the latest podcast episode from all subscribed podcasts.

I propose to have a mechanism in which you can specify a podcast to look for un-listened episodes for in order to download before looking for the latest episode from all podcasts.

Eg. Say you listen to a number of podcasts, A, B, C
A uploads a new episode at 13.00
B uploads a new episode at 15.00
and C at 20.00

I propose we can somehow make it so that if a has an episode that has not been listened to yet, it gets priority over all other podcasts. (This would mean in order to not download all past episodes the user would need to mark them as listened to)

The way I could see this working is either:
- Each podcast has a priority value, higher values get checked first when auto-downloading a new episode, equal priority podcasts can just use the current deciding factor (latest episode?)
- In the auto-download settings there is a list of all subscribed podcasts, users can re-order the list and when auto downloading a new episode the subscribed podcasts are searched in the order in which they appear in the list

title: Support Android Autobackup for Apps
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
When my phone broke recently I lost all my Antennapod subscriptions, play lists, downloaded MP3s, etc. despite having backup to my Google Drive turned on. This shouldn't have happened. All Antennapod data should have been backed up to Google drive and restored automatically onto my new phone.

Note that there should be no extra UI to implement this. The UI is all at the Android system settings level. 

see https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/autobackup.html for technical details. This may be as simple as adding this to the manifest:

```
<application ...
    android:allowBackup="true">
</app>
```

Storage is limited to 25 MB so you probably can't use it for the MP3s, but that should be more than enough space for all the metadata. 

This is related to but not the same as #377 which requests the Option to export/import database #377. That is a manual export that could be used to move data to a phone with a different account.

title: A few minor commits in master but not in develop
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I accidentally found there were a few (minor) commits present in master, but not in develop/

Specifically, it was 3 commits by Tom Tom on Jun 22, 2016 on master:
https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/commits/master
```
  Fixed rule 'The diamond operator ("<>") should be used'.  
  Fixed rule 'Utility classes should not have public constructors' 
  Fixed rule 'public static fields should be marked as final'.
```

There was no real harm per se. However, when I accidentally rebased my local develop from AntennaPod/master, and then corrected it by rebasing with AntennaPod/develop, I encountered a few merge conflicts that were due to the aforementioned commits in master.  It just took a while to resolve these issues.

title: Cannot subcribe to specific podcast when storage is on FAT32 external SD card: open failed: EINVAL
body:
I have six podcasts already subscribed without problems. When attempting to subscribe to [The Guardian's Brexit Means...](https://www.theguardian.com/politics/series/brexit-means/podcast.xml), I got a message in Antennapod's download log saying "IO Error: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument)". The message did not specify which file name it complained about.

The only bug looking vaguely relevant I found was #268, but that's supposed to be solved, and the podcast's name doesn't contain a colon. However, it does contain an apostrophe, which may or may not be legal in FAT32.

Sure enough, if I change Antennapod's storage to internal I can subscribe to the podcast.

**App version:** 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid)

**Android version**: 6.0.1 ([Fairphone Open 17.07.6](https://code.fairphone.com/contentx/2017-07-27_fairphone-open-17.07_release.html), not rooted, without Google services)

**Device model**: [Fairphone 2](https://www.fairphone.com/en/)

**Expected behaviour**: The podcast should be subscribed, no matter the storage back-end Antennapod uses.

**Current behaviour**: If storage is a FAT32 external SD card, the podcast is not subscribed, and a message saying "IO Error: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument)" appears in the download log.

**First occured**: Version 1.6.2.3 was already installed the first time I tried, on August 5, 2017.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1. Go to Settings -> Choose Data Folder.
1. Select your external SD card, formatted with FAT32 (e.g. `/storage/1234-ABCD/`).
1. Go to Subscriptions -> Add Podcast.
1. Enter `https://www.theguardian.com/politics/series/brexit-means/podcast.xml` in "Add Podcast by URL"
4.1. Alternatively, click "Search FYYD", enter `guardian brexit` and click the first result.
1. Click "Subscribe".

**Environment**: Auto Download is enabled on WiFi. When Antennapod is configured to use the external FAT32 SD card, the download fails. When Antennapod is configured to use internal storage, it succeeds.

**Stacktrace/Logcat** (with timestamps and UID:s stripped to save you from scrolling to the right):
```
08-07 21:07:49.758 32371 15358 W System.err: java.io.IOException: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument)
W System.err:    at java.io.File.createNewFile(File.java:939)
W System.err:    at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.download.HttpDownloader.download(HttpDownloader.java:186)
W System.err:    at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.download.Downloader.call(Downloader.java:43)
W System.err:    at de.danoeh.antennapod.core.service.download.Downloader.call(Downloader.java:14)
W System.err:    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237)
W System.err:    at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:423)
W System.err:    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:237)
W System.err:    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1113)
W System.err:    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:588)
W System.err:    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:818)
W System.err: Caused by: android.system.ErrnoException: open failed: EINVAL (Invalid argument)
W System.err:    at libcore.io.Posix.open(Native Method)
W System.err:    at libcore.io.BlockGuardOs.open(BlockGuardOs.java:186)
W System.err:    at java.io.File.createNewFile(File.java:932)
W System.err:    ... 9 more
```

title: FR: Sleep Timer: Please treat play/pause toggle as shake.
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
---
During the ducked audio volume that is signaling impending timer time-out, override "pause" with sleep timer reset.
---

**App version**: 1.6.2.3 F-Droid

**Desired behaviour**: Waive off sleep-timer with single action.

**Current behaviour**: Sleep-timer timeout requires either patiently waiting out onSleepTimerAlmostExpired or pressing play/pause 3 times.

**Steps to reproduce**:

1) Be awake as timer time out is approaching;
onSleepTimerAlmostExpired
Audio volume drops significantly signaling an impending pause...

(This continues for several seconds, which would give me time to grab the phone and shake.
But I'm not planning to shake, I'm planning to push the super convenient bluetooth play/pause toggle button on my headphones or automotive FM<->bluetooth dongly thing. Or maybe the phone is in the little dashboard GPSesqe mount, and I want to press the on-screen >/" toggle. )

2) Impatiently fail to wait for playback to pause, and press play/pause toggle too soon.
Playback is stopped...

3) Oops, Too soon; press the toggle button again...
Audio returns at full volume, everything is perf...
onSleepTimerExpired is finally reached and Playback is stopped.

4) Press play/pause a third time. Finally resuming full volume play with timer reset.   


**Environment**: Auto-enabled sleep timer, bluetooth thingy or screen easier to reach than shaking phone.

title: Allow Audio Playback from Android Audio
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
AntennaPod is my go-to app for listening in the car.  Unfortunately it doesn't integrate well with Android's automobile technology.  

Instructions for supporting discovery and playback from Android Auto are found [Here](https://developer.android.com/training/auto/audio/index.html).  

#### Requirements

1.  Some labels in the Manifest file
2. A conditional in alarm management to only trigger if not in Car mode

#### Harder Stuff
3. Implement the Queue as a [MediaBrowserService](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/service/media/MediaBrowserService.html)
4. Enable playback through a [MediaSession](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/session/MediaSession.html)
5. [Allow voice commands to control playback](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xc2HZSwPcwM)

title: Pubdate respecting smart shuffle
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Copied from Google Groups:

Hi, 
 
I love AntennaPod and gave it five stars on the Android App Store. 
 
One feature that I often wish for is a kind of smart shuffle. I listen to (lets say) five podcasts, and some of them are episodic, so its nice to listen to them in order. Since different podcasts began on different dates, and have a different frequency (e.g. weekly, bi-weekly, etc.), when I add multiple podcasts to my queue and then sort the queue by date, I get something like this: 
 
    Radiolab 1 
    Radiolab 2 
    Radiolab 3 
        : 
        : 
    Radiolab N 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 1 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 2 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 3 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 4 
    Radiolab N+1 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 5 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 6 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 7 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 8 
    Radiolab N+2 
        : 
        : 
    Fresh Air 1 
    Radiolab N+2 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 1 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 2 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 3 
    Fresh Air 2 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 4 
    Radiolab N+1 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 5 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 6 
    Fresh Air 3 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 7 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 8 
    Radiolab N+2 
        : 
        : 
This is correctly sorted according to date, but it can result in clumping of podcast episodes; something thats not as pleasant to listen to. A smart shuffle would pick episodes in date order from each subscribed podcast, round-robin fashion. This would result in a queue that looked more like the following: 
 
    Fresh Air 1 
    Radiolab 1 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 1 
    Fresh Air 2 
    Radiolab 2 
    Thrilling Adventure Hour 2 
        : 
        : 
  
Even though Radiolab episode #1 aired (lets say) years before Fresh Air episode #1, the important thing is that Radiolab episodes are queued in order and Fresh Air episodes are queued in order. Of course, clumping would still occur at the very end of your queue unless you happened to have the same number of episodes from each different podcast. Thats OK, I think, because I usually just add all new episodes from each subscribed podcast to my queue. By the time Ive burned through a significant percentage of my queue, there are usually new episodes, and I can re-sort to interleave the new episodes.  So, though there may be 'clumps' at the end of the queue, I never actually come close to reaching the end of the queue.
 
I find myself manually arranging my queue this way, and its very time-consuming and labor-intensive (even more so on a phone). Perhaps this could be an alternate Sort By choice, like Date, Ascending (interleaved).

title: Feature request: bookmarks by shaking the device
body:
Hi,
I really love AntennaPod and I use it also for listening to conferences, lessons and other speeches while I'm walking, running or driving. 
It would be great if someone can add a simple feature: add a bookmark by shaking the device.

If I'm driving listening a conference, I could want to remember a particular part of the speech but I can't look at the phone or write a note with the minutes:seconds that I am listening to. So a feature could be to shake the phone and AntennaPod "writes" a bookmark with the name of the audio file, the minute and the second. 
It would be much more useful if AntennaPod bookmark the current time minus a custom time set by the user.
E.g. I set the "timer" 30 seconds before the current position. If I'm listening to 14m 52s, when I shake the phone the bookmark should be created on 14m 22s. If I set the timer to 45 seconds, the bookmark goes to 14' 07" and so on.

title: Feature Request: Alternate Podcasts in Queue
body: When I sort my queue, I want to listen to a variety of different podcasts. It would be great to have a button to alternate podcasts in the queue: given a sorting criterion, the queue should be sorted by putting the first episode of each podcast in the queue sorted along that criterion, then the second episode of each podcast etc.

title: Feature request: Display cover art in widget
body:
I'm surprised this isn't already implemented since it's common in any podcast/music player I've used.

Either the current widget with the cover art to the left, or adding another option for a bigger widget with a big cover would be nice, it helps quickly identify what you're listening to, since currently the widget only displays episode title and time, not even the podcast name.

body:
The app lacks an easy way to suscribe to a podcast the first time. For people that do not know what a podcast is, an easier on-boarding process is a must.

Please provide a screen with short instructions  Suscribe to your first podcast, search for it here and a big search box that allow the user to search for a podcast at once when the App starts for the first time.

In the meantime, better instructions about this process, in multiple languages, are needed in the website. We have tried to explain to subscribers of [Querre Cuentos](http://bit.ly/querreapple) how to use your App (we love it), but it is not easy for them.

title: Stream/Delete and Download/Play buttons should not share the same real estate in UI
body:
Because I listen to most podcasts at home with wifi, I use the "Stream" button often. However, occasionally I like to listen to podcasts where there is no network access, and in this case I download episodes in advance. When a podcast has been downloaded, the "Stream" button is replaced with the "Delete" button, and the "Download" button is replaced by the "Play" button. However, muscle memory often takes over and I hit "Delete" when I mean to hit "Stream" (really "Play"), because this is the button I'm used to using.

I find the organisation of the buttons non-intuitive. Perhaps the "Play"/"Stream" buttons could share the same real estate, and the "Delete"/"Download" buttons could share the same real estate. This seems more intuitive, and I expect would lead to less accidental episode deletions.

**App version:** 1.6.2.3 commit e7c6953

**Android version**: 7.1.2 LineageOS 14.1

**Devide model**: Nexus 5

**Expected behaviour**: Not accidentally deleting episodes due to muscle memory and placement of the "Stream" and "Delete" buttons.

**Current behaviour**: Accidental episode deletions.

title: Feed that contains both video and mp3 selects video
body:
# Problem
Specifically this feed has the issue: http://tv.ida.dk/audiopodcast/channel/16944635

I have been debug'ing to find the root of this issue.
It happens while parsing the feed. First it goes through the de.danoeh.antennapod.core.syndication.namespace.NSRSS20 parser which sets the media to a FeedMedia object with the correct download url. Later during the parsing it goes through de.danoeh.antennapod.core.syndication.namespace.NSMedia which in line 95 sets the media to a FeedMedia object with the video url (from the media:content element in the feed).
When it is done parsing it is left with the wrong download url.

This happens because the "isDefault" attribute of the "content" element is "true".

# Possible solution
1. Would it be a solution to not add the FeedMedia object from NSMedia if the "type" attribute of the "content" element were video?
2. Alternatively it could be solved by making it configureable which source from the feed should be used for the download.

I could spent some time working on a fix.
Which solution would be preferred? Solution number 1 would gives the best user experience since the feed will just work. I am just not sure if it will break something else.

title: Allow ignoring episode image for lists
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
# Problem description

Podcasts may use different artwork for each episode. Antennapod displays those images in episode list and playlist on the left side, next to the podcast title (and duration etc), which is the obvious choice.

The problem arises once a user has subscribed to multiple feeds, each using different images per episode. It is very hard to distinct the different podcast feeds in episode list and playlist, because there is no visual indication to which feed an episode belongs to.

# Solution proposal

-  Introduce another settings toggle to allow fallback to feed artwork instead of episode artwork
- If the settings toggle is checked, display the feed artwork instead of episode artwork in all lists

---

**App version:** 1.6.2.3 from Google Play Store

**Android version**: Android 7.0

title: Tweak about view and version
Split up two different uses of the string "New" into two different strings
label: [Label(name="good first issue")]
body:
The string **new_label** (https://www.transifex.com/antennapod/antennapod/translate/#da/$/6971314?q=new) is being used twice, in plural form and in singular form.

It seems like the problem is in \app\src\main\java\de\danoeh\antennapod\fragment\EpisodesFragment.java:

                case POS_ALL_EPISODES:
                    return resources.getString(R.string.all_episodes_short_label);
                case POS_NEW_EPISODES:
                    return resources.getString(R.string.new_label);
                case POS_FAV_EPISODES:
                    return resources.getString(R.string.favorite_episodes_label);

This should be

                case POS_ALL_EPISODES:
                    return resources.getString(R.string.all_episodes_short_label);
                case POS_NEW_EPISODES:
                    return resources.getString(R.string.new_episodes_label);
                case POS_FAV_EPISODES:
                    return resources.getString(R.string.favorite_episodes_label);

and then **new_episodes_label** should be created as a new translatable string, for the plural case, in \core\src\main\res\values\strings.xml:

    <string name="episodes_label">Episodes</string>
    <string name="new_episodes_label">New</string>
    <string name="all_episodes_short_label">All</string>
    <string name="favorite_episodes_label">Favorites</string>
    <string name="new_label">New</string>

**new_label** will then be the badge/label on specific episodes, i.e. the singular case.

I don't have experience with pull requests and all that, so maybe someone with that experience can make the change?

**Edit**: Corrected label_new to new_label; sorry for the confusion.

title: add after currently playing episode
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi!
When enabling "move new episodes to the beginning of the playlist", I think, there are 2
misbehaviours:

1. When adding an older episode manually to the playlist, it is also added to the beginning.
I think, only newly released episodes found by the feed updates should be added to the beginning.
Manually added episodes should be queued at the end.

2. To ensure, that continuous playing works all the time, the episode should not be added always
to the top of the playlist. It should be queued after the current playing episode. When an episode from
within of the playlist ends, the following episode should be the one on top of the playlist, not the
directly following. Maybe the playing episode should always move to the top of the playlist when
playing.

What do you think?

title: Sort order broken BBC Newshour
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
---

**App version:** 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid)

**Android version**: 7.0

**Devide model**: Samsung S7 edge

**Expected behaviour**:

Subscribe to BBC Newshour on the BBC's own RSS feed. There are two episodes a day, available sometime after 14:00 UTC and 23:00 UTC.  Set sort order to "New -> Old". If feed sync is done only once in the day, AFTER both of the day's episodes, feed is displayed as expected:
Day3 Ep2
Day3 Ep1
Day2 Ep2
Day2 Ep1
Day1 Ep2
Day1 Ep1

However...

**Current behaviour**:
If feed sync is done BETWEEN the two episodes and again after the second episode, you end up with this:
Day4 Ep1
Day4 Ep2   <- wrongly sorted below the earlier episode
Day3 Ep2
Day3 Ep1
Day2 Ep2
Day2 Ep1
Day1 Ep2
Day1 Ep1

**Stacktrace/Logcat**:  none

title: Number of episodes shown in drawer may not match number of items in Episodes view
body:
**App version:** 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid)
**Android version**: 6.0.1 [CyanogenMod]
**Devide model**: Samsung S4
**Expected behaviour**: Value of the number of episodes listed in the drawer:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5264535/26030168/948c5c08-3818-11e7-9c77-fd791bdcb0a6.png)

matches the number of episodes listed in the Episodes area.

**Current behaviour**: The number may not match. For example, currently it says that 105 are available, but there are only 10 episodes listed for download.

**Steps to reproduce**: This may be a difference in how podcasts which have been marked as not to be kept updated are handled. I have several podcasts marked as not to keep updated:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5264535/26030181/fb7a0276-3818-11e7-9efe-09012481222d.png)

and as a result none of the episodes for that podcast are listed in the Episodes area (which is expected). However, I think that the number of episodes in the podcast are being counted for the number reported in the drawer. As the episodes are not being listed, I would expect that they would not be counted as well.

title: Episode count is wrong
body:
**App version:** 1.6.2.3

**Android version**: 7.1.1 -- Lineage OS (latest)

**Devide model**: Moto E 2015 Surnia

**Expected behaviour**: The number next to "Episodes" in the side bar should match the number of new episodes in the scroll area.

**Current behaviour**: The number next to "Episodes" is always one more than the number that are visible. When no episodes are available, it still shows "1".

**Steps to reproduce**:
I just upgraded from CyanogenMod to Lineage by reflashing the device (not an inplace upgrade). After installing AntennaPod, I restored its files from a backup with adb and set the permissions/SELinux context. Everything works fine other than this episode count is wrong. Is there any way to get AntennaPod to reset this count?

Or does this number indicate something else is wrong? When I store the podcast files on an external SD card. When I first started AntennaPod after restoring its files, it started to download new episodes before it had permission to write to the SD card. I deleted those episodes (in the app) and then downloaded them again after granting permission. I don't know if this could somehow be related -- maybe it thinks there is an episode in internal storage still?

title: Feature Request: Jump to next chapter
body:
When there is a new chapter coming up ( maybe next 3 mins ) the fast forward button could just jump to that chapter.

I think that this is a better idea than doing a "forward backwards dance" to get to the beginning of the next segment without unlocking my phone. Honestly this is kind of a skip ads feature, but I'm skipping them anyway in this situation.

title: UX: List of podcasts should be a page, not a menu so the back button works

0. Open menu
1. click on a particular podcast such as Podcastle in the list of podcasts. menu closes 
2. Download an episode, or whatever. 
3. Click Back button 

Actual: I'm back at the home screen and the app is closed
Expected: I'm returned to the list of podcasts.

title: Trust path error prevents downloads from streamer1.afa.net
body:
**App version:** 1.6.2.3 F-Droid

**Android version**: 4.4.4 CyanogenMod

**Device model**: Samsung Galaxy S4

**Expected behaviour**: Podcasts should download.  They worked yesterday and have for years.

**Current behaviour**: Downloads fail with this error:
```
IO Error: java.security.cert.CertPathValidatorException: Trust anchor for certification path not found
```
**First occured**: Today, same version.  Haven't changed anything on my phone.

I found [this issue](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/2264), but unlike that issue, I can't find any SSL/TLS/HTTPS certificate trust path errors on SSL Labs: https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=streamer1.afa.net

I see that their cert expires in 9 days, but that shouldn't cause this.

Note: I am able to download these podcasts with Firefox on Android without any problems.  e.g. this URL works fine in Firefox but not in AntennaPod: https://streamer1.afa.net/tracking/streamer1.afa.net/afr-aod/sandyrios/sr_20170508.mp3

Thanks for your help.
