title: Changes to media player protocol
body:
This PR changes some aspects of how the PlaybackService works and the way it communicates with the media players.

Main changes are:
- Playable types should now implement `onPlaybackStart()`, `onPlaybackPause()` and `onPlaybackCompleted()`, and before each call the current position should be properly updated (or more or less accurate), so that features such as played duration can work (only matters for `FeedMedia` type).
- Flattr and gpodder play action instructions were moved inside `FeedMedia`, to be executed when playback pauses or completes.
- As such, an item is flattr'd only when playback pauses/ends, as opposed to the previous behavior where it would be as soon as it reached the threshold (and we were checking every time we updated the position).
- This also introduces a distinction on the play actions we send to gpodder, as now we don't send the duration as the position when we skipped (unless smart mark as played applied).
- PSMPCallback changed considerably: now it has onPlaybackStart, onPlaybackPause, onPlaybackEnded, getNextInQueue, onPostPlayback.
- PSMP now must implement `skip()` and `stopPlayback()`, while `endPlayback()` becomes an internal method. `stopPlayback()` (and `endPlayback()`) return a `Future`, just for the sake of tracking the method's execution when switching media players (we want to be done with the old one and its callbacks before starting the new one), as it's often run on a separate thread.
- The transition between episodes is now done almost exclusively by the media players, opening the way for future support of chromecast queues (that's why a callback method to fetch the next episode in the queue was introduced).
- changes to RemotePSMP.
- created default PSMPCallback for the tests.

I had tested it mostly before the free/play flavors split, but hopefully still works without a problem after being rebased.

title: Fix gradle free builds
body:
Replaces #1996, follows #1982 to resolve #1959.
Here is a new solution that fix the flavor and build variants build under gradle and seems to integrate better with android studio.
To make a free build `-DfreeBuildHackDoFreeBuild=true` must be passed to gradle, ex:`./gradlew clean assembleFreeRelease -DfreeBuildHackDoFreeBuild=true`

@mvdan and @mfietz : are you ok with this solution?

This solution is better that #1996 cause the build variants are correctly linked on Android Studio.

For the record:
- Using different build files was not possible due to: [GRADLE-2624](https://issues.gradle.org/browse/GRADLE-2624)
- build variants fix from: http://stackoverflow.com/a/29661804

title: Flavors code optimization
body:
I was concerned that, as it was, future code changes would get more confusing.

I essentially separated the code that was common to both flavors (almost all of it) from the code specific to each particular one.

As stated in #1959 and https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=78997 gradle try to resolve all flavors dependencies before going on, this patch makes gradle skip Google Plays Services dependencies when building "Free" targets and when listing tasks.

title: Fix statistics
body:
Formerly, the played duration was reset when the episode was added to the playback history, i.e. when it completed. Not really sure why that was the case, "so that it behaves correctly" is not really useful. Could have something to do with flattring, but I don't see why it would matter.

We also restore the played duration for episodes where the played duration was already reset. Of course, we have no way of knowing how often the episode was already reset. If the user played the episodes multiple times, most of the information is already lost.

Resolves #1961

title: Make AntennaPod free again
body:
Creates two flavors for both the app and core module. The play flavor is essentially the current state, while the free flavor is missing the cast companion and the cast play services library.

I chose to comment out the corresponding lines of code in the free flavor. I think the easiest way to keep both flavors synced is to work on the files in the play flavor, copy-n-paste the new state to free and comment out code that requires one of the proprietary libraries. With the commented out code, one can get a quick summary of the necessary changes without having to go through the git history.

From this point on, we would mainly use `./gradlew assemblePlayRelease`; F-Droid would execute `./gradlew assembleFreeRelease`

Resolves #1959

title: fixes CastManager.addMediaRouterButton NPE
body:
This fixes #1974.

I have no clue as what could have caused this problem.

If on one hand this PR prevents NPE to be thrown for this reason, it also prevents us from ever finding its cause as users will be more unlikely to report it in the future (who can tell if the cast button didn't show one particular time? more likely we assume it's some temporary connectivity issue).

label: [Label(name="bug")]

My statistics are pretty low numbers so I checked a few feeds. Now I notice that a podcast which I played yesterday for about ten minutes has "0,0" as played hour time (while according to my search engine 10 minutes = 0,16 hours). Also another podcast which I played for a couple of hours only has 0,7 hours as a statistic.

I'll keep an eye on it to see if I can find a pattern.

---

**App version:** 1.6.0.7 (Google Play alpha channel)
**Android version**: FPOS 1.3.6 // 5.1
**Devide model**: FP2

title: Statistics: keep deleted feeds
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Currently, when feeds get deleted they also get removed from the statistics section. There may be several reasons to still keep that statistic:
- the publisher changes the url without any forward mechanism/update in a directory (to get the right number one might want to add up two feeds)
- one deletes an old feed but still wants to keep that statistic (for whatever reason)

So imho it would be nice if the statistics for deleted feeds would be maintained, or at least removal of statistics is decoupled from removal of the feed (until statistics get reset (#1869)).

title: Provide free version for f-droid builts
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="project issue")]
body:
Hi!
Please provide a version, which does not depend on non-free components like google-play services or flattr. Otherwise f-droid cannot build recent  versions. Maybe cou could add a f-droid branch.

title: AntennaPod disables Media Buttons for CyanogenMod's MusicPlayer
body:
**App version:** 1.6.0.7 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 6.0.1 [CyanogenMod 13.0]

**Devide model**: OnePlus One - bacon

**Expected behaviour**:
When using my Headphones pressing the Play/Pause Button should pause/resume playback in the CyanogeMods default [Music App](https://github.com/CyanogenMod/android_packages_apps_Eleven)

**Current behaviour**:
As soon as I install AntennaPod the Media Buttons do not work in the MusicPlayer. 

**Steps to reproduce**:

I think the problem lies in this part of the AndroidManifest.xml file:

https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/core/src/main/AndroidManifest.xml#L31

```
android:exported="true">
```

As soon as I start AntennaPod this line gets added to `data/system/users/0/settings_secure.xml`

```
<setting id="7454" name="media_button_receiver" value="de.danoeh.antennapod/de.danoeh.antennapod.core.receiver.MediaButtonReceiver" package="android" />
```

And this disables the Media Buttons for the Music App. Removing this line and restarting my Phone enables the Media Buttons for the Music App until I start AntennePod again.

title: Accept any media content type except for text/*
body:
The whole content type thing in podcast is a mess!

I have problems with podcasts using:

> Content-Type: application/force-download

Why is needed to filter any content type, if its for HTML errors, then let's ban only HTML and plain text MIME types.

title: Atom image
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
With atom feeds AntennaPod currently loads the image from the logo element. However the atom RFC states [logo should be a 2:1](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287#section-4.2.8) image and [icon a 1:1.](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4287#section-4.2.5)

I think the easiest thing to do would be try to load the image from icon first and then fall back to logo when in the atom NS. Somewhere in [this file](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/syndication/namespace/atom/NSAtom.java).

However it might be better to allow multiple images in a [feed](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/feed/Feed.java). Then the two images in [feeditemlist_header](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/app/src/main/res/layout/feeditemlist_header.xml)/[ItemlistFragment](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/app/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/fragment/ItemlistFragment.java) could be different and not just a blurry stretched version of the same image.

title: Fix for restoring scroll position in detail view #1947
body:
The scroll position on detail view is now being restored when you are switching back to it. 

On orientation change it doesn't restore on the exact position at the moment. 
But i think that could work with a scroll position relative to the webview height.

title: Scroll position in detail and chapters view not persisted
body:
**App version:** 1.5.2 from F-Droid

**Android version**: 6.0.1, Cyanogenmod

**Device model**: Wileyfox Swift

**Expected behaviour**: When returning to AntennaPod, the detail view and the chapters list should be at the same scroll position as it was when I switched away to another app.

**Current behaviour**: Detail view and chapters list scroll back to the top when returning to AntennaPod

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Open details view (2nd/middle view) of a podcast
2. Scroll down
3. Click on a link; the browser opens
4. Go back to AntennaPod
5. Scroll position is the beginning of details

Same for the chapters (3rd/righ view) of a podcast:
1. Open chapter list of a podcast
2. Scroll down
3. Switch to another app
4. Switch back to AntennaPod
5. List is scrolled to beginning

Also happens when rotating screen:
1. Open chapter list of a podcast
2. Rotate phone from vertical to horizontal
3. List is scrolled to beginning

---

Related to #1409 and #551.

body:
**App version:** 1.6.0.7 (from Google Play)

**Android version**: 6.0.1 [CM13.0 - nightly]

**Devide model**: OnePlus One

**Expected behaviour**: When one clicks "Flattr this" or an episode is auto-flattred, a success notification should be displayed when the operation was successful. 

**Current behaviour**: When one clicks "Flattr this" or an episode is auto-flattr'ed, a notification with the following content pops open:

```
AntennaPod flattr failed
Not flattr'ed: <Episode Name>
HTTP 500: Internal Server Error
```

When I check on my flattr page the flattr has been successful, though, despite the warning AntennaPod displayed.

I don't know whether this is an AntennPod or [flattr4j](https://github.com/shred/flattr4j) issue.

**Current behaviour**: antennapod doesn't update when I turn on the wifi network; I have to update feeds manually.

Is there a way to have automatic update as soon as a network connection is available? Or have I misunderstood this feature?

The commit accepts this content type for media. Don't think there are any other mime types anyone would use.

This should probably go into 1.6

body:
Instead of returning something useful (`audio/*`, `video/*`), the ted talk servers return content type `application/octet-stream`.
The commit accepts this content type for media. Don't think there are any other [mime types](https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#model) anyone would use.

body:

**Android version**: CyanogenMod 13

**Devide model**: T999L

**Expected behaviour**: audio clip is downloaded

**Current behaviour**: download is refused

**First occured**: noticed about 3-5 days ago

title: add an option to archive media file when playback completes
body:
Hi. I developped a feature that I miss on Antennapod and I'd like it to be integrated. The feature is about adding an option to move the media file to an "archive" folder instead of deleting it when the playback completes. The file will still be marked as deleted on Antennapod but then the user can safely move/delete the files from the "archive" directory. If you are willing to add such feature here are the key points of the proposed implementation: - Change the user preferences "auto delete" check box into a "played action" list (none, delete, archive). - Replace the "prefAutoDelete" shared preference by a "prefPlayedAction" shared preference (1.7.0.0 migration). - Change the feed preference "auto delete" list to a "played action" list (global, none, delete, archive), no database migration needed as the old values will still be valid.
It reuse the database Feeds "auto_delete_action" field as the played action value, there is no renaming/migration :-/ as there's no easy way to rename or drop a column in SQlite. Adding a new "played_action" column will make the "auto_delete_action" one obsolete and imho keeping an unused field with values should be avoided.

title: Possible causes of Hang-Bugs Found
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Dear AntennaPod Developers,
I am implementing a hang-bug detection tool and I am analyzing AntennaPod with it (master version downloaded yesterday). I tested the app with a Nexus 4 (Android 5.1) and Huawei P8 Lite (Android 4.4). I found that the main thread of Antennapod calls:

1) android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount and
2) android.app.SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commit

frequently when subscribing and opening podcasts. In particular, the above APIs are called as consequence of the two following calls:

```
1) de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.MainActivity.saveLastNavFragment -> android.app.SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commit

2) de.danoeh.antennapod.core.storage.DBReader.getQueueIDList -> android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount
```

In my experiments, the execution of those functions on the main thread may be the main cause of the eye-detectable delays (i.e., hang-bug) experienced with AntennaPod.

As the developers guide of Android suggests, moving work off the main thread leads to higher responsiveness of the app. It is actually possible to move those two operations off the main thread using background threads. Therefore, do you think that the smoothness of the app would improve by executing those functions off the main thread?

Thanks for any information,
I hope I can help improve AntennaPod.

title: avoid stopping playback after skipping (and changing media type)
body:
Issue is: While playing an episode (locally), on the `MediaPlayerActivity`, and skipping to the next one, the new episode would pause some milliseconds after it started (at least when the media types change). Expected behavior would be, since the previous episode was playing, for the new one to keep playing.

This behavior, in part, was not present before the chromecast implementation, so a quick solution is to make the local PSMP behave exactly as before (so, on start playback, we're only asking to update the media session).

However, when switching from video to audio, this would also occur even before chromecast was implemented, being caused by the video surface being released and calling the media player to reset it. The method to reset the video surface is certainly not meant to be invoked while the current media is of audio type, so a quick fix is to check if the media type is indeed video before resetting the surface and reinitializing the media player.

Final note: gradle was giving me such a hard time today (possibly because I tried upgrading the plugin, which seems to work ok, but then reverted) and so all my tests were not following the changes in the code I was doing, to the point of debugging and the logs not matching and the break points being inside if blocks that tested false. Really driving me nuts...

title: Performance Issue of AsyncTask.execute
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Developers of AntennaPod,

Hi, I have found that `AsyncTask.execute` has been used in many places, like 3 times in `GpodnetAuthenticationActivity`, one time in `AudioplayerActivity`, etc.
However, this API slows down if multiple tasks are being executed on devices with system version higher than 3.0 because AsyncTasks started by this API are executed serially on a single background thread for systems newer than 3.0. (This is found in the [API guide](http://developer.android.com/intl/zh-cn/reference/android/os/AsyncTask.html#execute%28Params...%29))
It will help to improve the performance by changing `execute` to `executeOnExecutor` to enable real multi-thread execution.

Thanks a lot.

title: Nav Drawer subscriptions counter: display subscriptions (not episodes)
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Actually when I first saw the number in the Nav Drawer implemented (in the build for the ChromeCast test) I was like 'huh, I don't have that many subscriptions!?' In other words: I didn't read FR #1850 (by @Matth7878) properly and only now (sorry for being late) realised that to me the number should display the amount of subscriptions, rather than total amount of episodes.
- When the counter is set to '# of new episodes' both numbers (episodes & subscriptions) are exactly the same (and thus one of them is useless).
- Seems weird:
  - Queue: # of episodes in the queue
  - Episodes: # of (new) episodes
  - Subscriptions: # of subscriptions, no, wait, what, total # of episodes?
  - [Feed title]: # of [whatever set type of] episodes in that feed

Proposal:
- Episodes: total (sum) # of [whatever chosen in the settings: new/unplayed/combined] episodes [this is currently displayed after subscriptions]
- Subscriptions: # of subscriptions
- for both: don't display if counter setting=none (only number displayed = queue)

body:
Dear developers of AntennaPod,

I am a student majoring in Computer Science. We are trying to collect existing bug reports and fixes of bugs caused by specific devices to help detect and fix similar bugs of other active applications.

We have detected that in your app, method setSupportActionBar of android support library v7 is used in many activities. However, we have observed that invoking this method on some Samsung devices running 4.2 system will crash your app.

We have found discussions in in the bug tracking system of Android: [here](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=78377). as well as a stack overflow question: [appcompat-v7 v21.0.0 causing crash on Samsung devices with Android v4.2.2](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26657348/appcompat-v7-v21-0-0-causing-crash-on-samsung-devices-with-android-v4-2-2)

A suggested fix for it is to add `-keep class !android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.**,** {*;}` to the proguard rules. I have seen the opposite rule to keep all the classes in android.support.v7 in your proguard file.

Thank you vey much. Hope this information is useful for you.

title: Chromecast issue 340 initial PR
body:
Related to #340 

Chromecast support will only be triggered once the user enables it in the settings.
The way it works is that, despite being disabled, all the chromecast support components are activated, but out of reach from the user. And if the user disables chromecast support, it also disconnects (if PlaybackService is started and was connected to a chromecast).

If it's disabled, the only thing that is supposed to affect the normal use of the app is in the `AudioplayerActivity`, where I'm setting the position seekbar to indeterminate whenever it's seeking or buffering (or perparing?). This does not affect the position it shows, just its background.
I understand that, visually, there are certainly better ways to show the user it's doing some sort of loading, but I couldn't come up with an obviously better one given the current layout, and this one was extremely simple to implement.

title: Fix initial gpodder sync
body:
For one, the sync was using the item identifier (UUID) to look for episodes which might not be the episode's download url.
Then, we can only sync the episode state when the feeds have been downloaded, parsed and persisted. before, chances were high that the feeds are still downloaded while we tried to find the not yet persisted episodes in the database and set their state according to gpodder.

Resolves #1872

title: Episode: Reload description on swipe
body:
Always calls onFragmentLoaded() because updateAppearance() does not reload the description.

Resolves #1876

title: Swipe gestures in episode details - description not updated
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
If you tap on an episode, you get a details view including (I assume) a WebView that displays the description. Swiping left/right switches to the next/previous episode, so it changes title, icon, feed title, duration,...

**The description gets reloaded (progress indicator visible) but it does not change to the description of the new episode you just switched to.**

This happens in the playlist as well as in the episodes list of a single feed.

title: Fix item tags
body:
Resolves #1831

The problem: The apply actions dialog relied on the feed items tags being loaded

Solution: Load tags, use LongLists with ids less often
QueueEvent is mainly used by the queue fragment, FavoritesEvent by the favorites fragment. All other fragments get notified that feed items(' tags)  changed.

Icon option: https://design.google.com/icons/#ic_delete_forever

title: Remove 'visit website' and 'share' from the queue context menu
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
@charlesay suggested in https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/1262#issuecomment-148548683 there is a risk the context menu in the queue gets overloaded if new functions get added.

I'd say, it's a bit overcrowded already. All context menu entries are about doing something with the episode in relation to the queue, except for the last two: 'Visit website' and 'Share'.

I think these can be deleted to keep the UI simple.
- They're accessible also from the episode view and currently playing screen (two taps away)
- Optionally, as some sort of replacement, these options could be made accessible via the mini-player: long-press the mini-player could bring up a context menu with the entries '(un)mark as favourite', 'share' and 'visit website'.

title: pin code to modify settings and feeds
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I have a phone that is used to play music and podcasts on our family stereo, and the phone is locked down so that only select applications can be run, so that my children can't install apps or access any content they wish.

I would like to use AntennaPod on this phone, and to have it configured to allow access to a preselected set of feeds.  As it currently is, my (younger) children can browse and subscribe to any feed they want, which I would prefer was not the case.

A solution to this problem would involve making it possible to set a pin code that needed to be entered in order to modify settings or feeds.  If such a feature were added to AntennaPod, I would very much appreciate it!

title: Having the PlaybackService handle the MediaSession
body:
It just seems to make total sense, as the service already handles notifications it should also handle updates and callbacks from the media session.
Also, there was some redundancy with all the callbacks for general media keys, media session media keys and widget key, so they now all use the same receiver and media key presses get parsed by the same algorithm.

About the `updateMediaSessionMetadata()` method, which was only called when either the lockscreen preference was changed or the media changed, I added a callback from the media player to the service to (asynchronously) trigger it whenever the media changed, and moved the preference change listener to the service and have it run synchronously. If you believe that it's better to have it always running on a separate thread, I can implement it in the same fashion as the notification updater.

title: Optimizations in PodDBAdapter.java
body:
In the ['PodDBAdapter.java'](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/b6ac166c4f88e139b294827bd5129ad28c040506/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/storage/PodDBAdapter.java), I see we have listed all the table field names as constants grouped together. It is very hard to understand the DB structure in this way. Wouldn't it be great if we group these so that by reading the code itself, I can imagine the database?

To implement this, we could create a static final class which we call `PodDBContracts.java`. In this file, corresponding to each table, we can create a static inner class which will have that table's field as constant strings. It would make the code more readable and maintainable. 

Please let me know if this is a welcome contribution right now. I would be happy to send a PR!

Thanks,
Harshita

title: Replace 'add' tile with action bar button + empty state in Subscriptions view
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Personally, **I think the 'Add podcast' tile is a waste of screen space when you have a lot of subscriptions** that don't fit on 'above the fold' (screen without scrolling). As such, I would prefer it at the bottom. However: it's not really easy to access if you have a lot of subscriptions (as you have to scroll down a lot).

**Proposal**:
- do implement an 'add podcast' button in the action bar (as proposed earlier by @TomHennen, and [used](https://lh5.ggpht.com/sLp72XsaKvoGkUB8AUx8DaDyUixB6wAl6QWEidaYyuWhMH4dFx_osY0VxBSKFQjmJA=h600) by Pocket Casts)
- additionally implement an '[empty state screen](https://www.google.com/design/spec/patterns/empty-states.html#empty-states-displaying-empty-states)' welcoming users & inviting them to add a podcast
- optionally remove the 'add podcast' tile (no opinion about this)

Another way to do it is to add a FAB (like DoggCatcher [does](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/_Vu2xWEG2wbQVn19by09R9dBmLs_tJYZj6vBc6n755Cp3Jv8m0uqK5SDXc1JfbMgMsDP=h600)), but then you'd need to discuss colour and (more importantly) make sure somehow that if there's three feeds on the last row, the last column is visible as well.

It was discussed elsewhere (initial PR, plus #1838), but would like to open this issue to come to a conclusion.

Menu item 'counter' currently is a sub-setting of 'adjust menu'. With the introduction of the Subscriptions setting, this is no longer correct (as it also adjusts the order of the subscriptions view, not just in the menu)

Proposal: move it to the menu, change the description (expand to include the subscriptions view)

(Initially reported in #1838; related: #1853)

title: Please allow automatic cleanup of old episodes without enabling automatic download
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**App version:** 1.5.2.0 (from f-droid)

**Android version**: 4.2.2

**Devide model**: Samsung cell phone

**Expected behaviour**: I would like to be able to set a maximum number of episodes (or even better a maximum space on disk) and have antennapod automatically delete old files that I've already listened to (starting by the oldest), when the maximum number/size threshold is reached, WITHOUT having to enable also the "Automatic Download" feature.

**Current behaviour**: I've tried to tweak the settings to achieve the goal described above, but currently it seems that the automatic "Episode cleanup" feature is only enabled when the "Automatic Download" feature is enabled too, am I right? (if I'm wrong, please explain how can I reach my goal).

Now, I'm not interested at all in the "Automatic Download" feature (in fact, given my current feed subscriptions, it's an anti-feature, because it would download LOTS of unuseful files); unfortunately this also turns off the automatic Episode Cleanup feature, so that there is no way to have antennapod delete old files automatically, and to avoid my disk space filling up I have to remove the episode files manually from the feed folders every once in a while. Being able to enable automatic cleanup without automatic download would be way more convenient.

title: gpodder sync failure
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
_edit: 04-Apr-2016_
@keunes proposed to start a new issue thread in #1795. So this is what I did.

---

**App version:**
1.5.2.0 (Google Play)

**Android version**
6.0.1 | Cyanogenmod 13

**Devide model**
Samsung Galaxy S4 | GT-I9505

**General information**
Syncing of podcasts feeds and the current (play/pause) state of one or more episode(s) when pressing the update button in episodes and inside the tab "all".

All devices devices, the cell phone mentioned above, and a tablet (Sony Xperia Z4 tablet same AP version from GooglePlay and Stock Rom Android 6.0 (not sure about the version, can't check right know) are registered in gpodder as cell phone. The devices have also the same subscriptions (small icons of a cell phone on the right of each row for each podcast feed listed in the gpodder website).

**Expected behaviour**
**1)** After starting to stream an episode on the smart phone I pressed play/pause. The expectation is, that AntennaPod is starting the synchronization to gpodder.

**2)** After that I expected to make an update of all feeds (as described above) on the tablet to get the latest feeds updates and the updates from gpodder regarding the play/pause on the same episode.

**3)** If I'm marking an episodes manually as played, or if I'm using the gear wheels symbol inside of a podcast feed, I expected that this state of listened/played episodes will be synced to all devices as well

**Current behaviour**
Syncing to gpodder is very unstable at all. Sometimes the update is working for new subscriptions. If any new subscription has been added with the podlove plugin on a website, this is mostly working as well.  Any edit (e.g. delete of an podcast feed on a Android device) it's not syncing with gpodder. So the change is not present on the website of gpodder or any device.

**to 1)** After starting to stream an episode on e.g. the smart phone (e.g. pressing play/pause), in the status line appears very often the following failure message.

**German (original message)**
1st row | gpodder.net Synchronisierungsfehler
2nd row | Ein Fehler ist beim Synchronisieren aufgetreten: jav..
-> There is nothing else to read

**English (translated message)**
1st row | gpodder.net Synchronization failure
2nd row | A failure occurred during syncing: jav..
-> There is nothing else to read

**to 2)** Same behaviour for the second point as described here in section **to 1)**. 

**to 3)** It's not working at all

**First occured**
I don't know. It never worked at all.

**Steps to reproduce**
See above

**Environment**
Tests within wireless LAN connection. Bluetooth off

---

Did the gpodder integration ever worked?
Is there a possibility to see more of the failure instead this short message?

For that reason I also asked for the pod.care support #1776.

title: Issues with subscriptions view in 1.6 alpha
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
It's cool to have the Subscriptions view, but there's a few issues that came along with #1826 into the latest alpha:
- <strike>numbers are really hard to read with tiles with dark backgrounds (see red circled numbers)</strike> _Solved with #1842_
  - proposal: make number color follow theme (almost-black-type-of-gray for the dark theme, white(?) for the light theme)
- <strike>feeds without image don't consistantly show a title (see green ovals)</strike> _Solved with #1842_
  - can do some logging if it's needed to figure out what's going on
- <strike>numbers change in a seemingly random fashion (see blue circles)</strike> _Solved with #1845_
  - I have selected "number of new and unplayed episodes" in my settings; can't quickly decipher what the random (wrong) number comes from (new, in queue, etc)
  - again: can do some logging if needed
- Nav Drawer item/title 'Subscriptions' remains bold if moving from subscriptions to feed view (expected: make the relevant's feed title bold in the Nav Drawer) (see red ovals)
- menu item 'counter' currently is a sub-setting of 'adjust menu'. With the introduction of the Subscriptions setting, this is no longer correct
  - proposal: move it to the menu, change the description (expand to include the subscriptions view)
- there is no left padding/margin within the tile titles (for 'add podcast' and tiles without image), which makes it a tiny bit hard to read (and just looks bad)
  - proposal: make the left margin/padding the same as the bottom (which I assume is there because of the line height)

Then, to reiterate remarks made earlier (in https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/pull/1826#issuecomment-202167130 and https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/pull/1826#issuecomment-202273543):
- the 'Add podcast' tile should be the last item of the list in the subscriptions view
- since it is possible to add subscriptions via the Subscriptions view, which is displayed in the nav drawer by default, 'add podcast' in nav drawer should not be disabled by default
- <strike>'show subscriptions' should be part of the dialog to set the menu items (which can be called via the menu settings screen and long-press on the menu items), rather than having its own item in the menu settings view [hope it's clear what I mean]</strike> _Solved with #1846_

title: OPML Import: Fix URI containing absolute path
body:
When Ghost Commander is used to open an OPML file _From local filesystem_, we would expect to receive a URI like `file:///storage/emulated/0/FILE.opml`, but we receive `/storage/emulated/0/FILE.opml`

Resolves #1502

title: AP should ignore content type when downloading media
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**App version:** 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play beta channel)
**Android version**: 6.0.1/CM13
**Devide model**: Galaxy S3 T999L

**Expected behaviour**: video plays

**Current behaviour**: only audio plays

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Download an episode from this poorly managed feed: http://www.sciencefriday.com/feed/podcast/podcast-video/
2. Try to play the mp4 video clip -- only audio comes out

When viewed in the filesystem, the actual file has .mp3 extension. I'm guessing this is because the feed advertises media as audio/mpeg content type. The actual filename in the xml is .mp4
In any case, the type of media should probably be determined by some other means..

title: Sort queue by feed title
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Sorting the queue "Alphabetically" is not always that useful. Episodes from a single feed are in this way not always grouped together, depending on the episode naming convention.

Feature request:

Add sorting the queue by feed title + episode publication date, ascending and descending.

```
f1.getMedia().getFeedTitle()+f1.getPubDate().getTime()    // QueueSorter.java
```

Add menu item title "Feed" to menu Queue --> Sort.

Menu item "Alphabetically" in menu Queue --> Sort could be renamed to "Episode".
Alphabetically is a method of sorting. It does not indicate what is being sorted.

title: Adapt 'apply actions' filter & view
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I would propose a small set of changes to the 'apply actions' view. Currently, there are two distinct **filtering mechanisms**: one for the feed view, one for the 'apply actions'. They each have their own set of labels and function slightly differently. - let the filter applied in the episode view not affect the 'apply actions' screen - merge their strings (see table below): - add the 'paused' state filter in the 'apply actions' screen - let both filters have the same options order - remove 'all' and 'none' options from the 'apply actions' filter (these are already available via the 'select' button (next to the filter in the action bar) **And further**: - make it easier to see which episodes one has selected by a button that hides unselected items (so you don't have to scroll through the list to see which ones are selected) - button can be eg https://design.google.com/icons/#ic_visibility and [it's off state](https://design.google.com/icons/#ic_visibility) - once an episode is deselected it gets removed from the view (with a tiny delay so that the user can see the episode in fact is deselected) - for visual ease, align the 'select none/all' button in the action bar and the individual checkboxes - make the 'intermediate checkbox' deselect all rather than select all (more logical since the button has a minus sign)

| array (feed view) | seperate (apply actions) | value the same? | | --- | --- | --- | | hide_unplayed_episodes_label | unplayed_label | y | | hide_paused_episodes_label | n/a | n/a | | hide_played_episodes_label | played_label | y | | hide_queued_episodes_label | queued_label | y | | hide_not_queued_episodes_label | not_queued_label | y | | hide_downloaded_episodes_label | downloaded_label | y | | hide_not_downloaded_episodes_label | not_downloaded_label | y |

title: Merge add_feed_label & add_new_feed_label
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Both have the same value and seem interchangeable. Latter is only used [here](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/c2a1644d07ab52b9e32a2599000e6751ce07fcc7/app/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/activity/OnlineFeedViewActivity.java#L152) for an action bar title.

The latter could be replaced by the former, no?

title: Update strings.xml
body:
- proxy_host_invalid_error: add verb & article to improve clarity
- proxy_host_empty_error: replace 'must not' by 'can not'
- removed set of strings that aren't used (anymore)
- for feed setting "Auto remove episode": Improve clarity of setting name (feed_auto_download_global -> "Global default") and delete explanatory info ("override global default" in auto_delete_label). Removes unnecessary screen clutter, removes double & in most cases false info (if setting is 'global' it doesn't "override default")
- share_item_url_label & share_item_url_with_position_label: add 'file' to clarify what URL is shared (media file, not episode webpage)
- prevent position_default_label ('00:00:00') and 'app_name' (the same in all languages so far) from being translated

title: Update CONTRIBUTORS

Instead of having a single feeditem id, we now have a list of feeditem ids and a position.
When the user swipes left or right, the position is adapted accordingly and the UI is updated.

Works in all episodes, new episodes, favorites, queue, feed view...

As of now, it does not take into account that items that are represented in this list might be removed while in the episode view. Easiest solution would probably be to just finish the fragment when the next (or current) item is not found.

title: code cleanup (perhaps to an extreme level)
body:
I was too annoyed by all the warnings in Android Studio that the ocd in me kicked in and I decided to do a basic code cleanup. None of the changes should affect the code functionality, except for maybe some obvious simplifications. Below I try to enumerate all types of changes made.

Of course, if you think in some aspect I might have gone too far, I'll be happy to revert some of the changes.

There are also some obvious typos that were corrected.

Also, please take a special look into the manifest and let me know whether the change was appropriate.

code cleanup:
- lambda expressions, method references,
- multi catches,
- remove unnecessary keywords (public keyword on interface method signatures, static on interfaces or enums, final on private method signatures),
- == false expressions,
- diamond type (<>) expressions,
- replace StringBuffer with StringBuilder for local variables used by a single thread,
- replace Arrays.asList with Collections.singletonList whenever applicable,
- inline variable returns (whenever the variable name's meaning is not important to understand the code),
- replace some chains of if/else if/... with switch/case,
- break append(a + b) into append(a).append(b) for StringBuilder objects,
- unused import statements,
- reduce log TAGs to 23 characters,
- MaterialDialog callback deprecated,
- ActionBarActivity for AppCompatActivity,

title: Added statistics function
Introduce 'Swipe to refresh' (pull to refresh)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Quite a few proposals have been done to make AP more Material Design-like. Since the developers have little time available, not much attention goes to 'facelifts'. One aspect of MD that would greatly enhance functionality, however, is 'swipe to refresh' (commonly known as 'pull to refresh', as is present in many other apps; see [Google's Design guideline](https://www.google.com/design/spec/patterns/swipe-to-refresh.html#swipe-to-refresh-swipe-to-refresh)).

(This functionality was proposed earlier, cf https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/711#issuecomment-89810272, but it deserves a separate issue.)

title: Speed button doesn't respond immediately after Sonic (de)activation
body:
Sorry for the perhaps confusing title.

**App version:** 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play)
**Android version**: 5.1
**Devide model**: FP2

**Expected behaviour** (switching on): Immediately after switching on Sonic via settings or via dialog (that pops up when pressing speed button), enable the speed button (grey -> white) & have it work (immediately respond to user inpot to change speed)

**Current behaviour/to reproduce** (switching on): Have Sonic switched off, Prestissimo disabled. Starting point is the playback screen, enabling sonic via the dialog: 
- setting sonic when playing an episode, tap speed button when still playing AND setting sonic when episode paused, tap speed button
  - the speed button will register the user's action but not display speed, only executes after (pause &) play (correct in the sense actual playback speed and number displayed are aligned); the button remain gray until moving away from the playback screen
- setting sonic when playing an episode, pause the episode, tap speed button
  - the speed button will function (change displayed speed, use correct speed starting playback), the button remain gray until moving away from the playback screen
- setting sonic when not having played sth (fresh start of the app), start playback
  - the speed button turns white & works

**Expected behaviour** (switching off): As soon as sonic is diabled in the menu, the playback speed should be set to 1.00x, button sould be disabled (grey, display dialog) and sonic should be disabled.

**Current behaviour/to reproduce** (switching off): button &  sonic keep working (can change speed; button white & displaying speed) until playback is paused. If paused in other speed than 1.00x, that speed will remains displayed (greyed out, but still might be confusing) and that value is the starting point in the situations described above.

**First occured**: dunno

label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
**App version:** 1.5.0.9 (from Google Play)
**Commit:** a97788a

**Android version**: 4.4.2

**Device model**: Samsung S5 mini  (SM-G800F)
## Position in audio does not change when dragging slider and slider disappears when paused

**Expected behaviour:** When I drag the slider on the lock screen controls the audio will jump to the position I release it at.

**Current behaviour:** Slider moves but the audio continues to play and the playback position in the audio track does not change.

**First occured**: Current version after switching from a Samsung S3 mini to the S5 mini
**Steps to reproduce**: 
1. Start playing a podcast then let the screen lock
2. Press **power** button to view lock screen
   ![2016-03-18 12 59 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/864159/13877730/faa6a8ac-ed0c-11e5-87e2-1cb2d0315a74.jpg)
3. Drag the slider, notice that the playback position in the audio track does not change, even though you can move the position of the slider.
   ![2016-03-18 13 00 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/864159/13877754/29f90500-ed0d-11e5-994e-32411a6d364e.jpg)
4. Press **power** button to turn screen off.
5. Press **power** button to turn screen on, notice that the slider has now jumped to the **real** position of playback in the audio track.
## Slider disappears when paused

**Expected behaviour:** Lock screen slider always stays visible or at least reappears when play is re-started.

**Current behaviour:** Lock screen slider disappears when the audio is paused. It does not reappear when play is restarted. It does reappear when the display is turned off and then back on.

**First occured**: Current version after switching from a Samsung S3 mini to the S5 mini
**Steps to reproduce**: 
1. Press **power** button to view lock screen
2. Touch the pause button, notice the slider disappears.
   ![2016-03-18 13 00 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/864159/13877911/149396fc-ed0e-11e5-9407-5f6e8ff4ce73.jpg)
3. Touch the play button, notice that the slider does not reappear.
   ![2016-03-18 13 00 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/864159/13877933/3b1db5a0-ed0e-11e5-9678-10b9ea0149e3.jpg)
4. Press **power** button to turn screen off.
5. Press **power** button to turn screen on, notice that the slider has now reappeared.
   ![2016-03-18 13 01 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/864159/13877954/593221b6-ed0e-11e5-88b9-060181a18106.jpg)

**Environment**:  I am not sure if I was using Prestissimo. It was installed but the **Use built-in sonic media player . . .** was checked in the settings.  I uninstalled Prestissimo, restarted and retested, results were the same.

title: Auto Delete deletes episode-in-progress after sd card unmount/remount
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
**App version:** 1.5.1.4 from play store. Haven't yet received an alpha/beta from joining the G+ groups

**Android version**: 6.0.1  (Stock AT&T)

**Devide model**: Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge

**Expected behaviour**: Episode in progress remains stored on the card and ideally continues to play from current play offset.

**Current behaviour**: Episode is deleted

**First occured**: Last Week, but that's when I first got this device and installed AP

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Configure AP with "Auto Delete" enabled
2. Configure AP to store podcasts on the SD card
3. Add at least one episode to the queue
4. Play an episode from the queue, leaving it paused somewhere in the middle
5. Unmount/remount the SD card
6. Hit Play on the episode - it will be deleted and the next queued one will play if "Continuous Playback" is enabled.

This issue is extremely annoying on the Galaxy S7 Edge. It currently has an issue where the SD card auto-unmounts quite often. There's debate as to whether it's a hardware or software issue. Since it always successfully re-mounts, I'm leaning toward some sort of power-saving software issue in Marshmallow. I also wonder if there's something in a recent Android API that AP can call to more completely "lock" the file and prevent the SD card from being auto-unmounted by the OS.
I'm guessing that Antennapod's open file handle gets invalidated so that resuming playback then fails (throws an exception?). It then proceeds as if it had completed playback of the episode and deletes it.

In this situation, where playback fails but the current position is nowhere near the end, I would not expect it to delete the episode. Ideally, AP could re-open the file in this situation and continue as if there had not been an error. I don't know if it will be easy (perhaps a specific exception type/error code) to tell that this is what happened.

For now, I've re-set AP to store casts on the internal storage to avoid the re-download or manual delete hassles. Not a solution for everyone.

title: Setting to choose maximum stored episode per subscription
label: [Label(name="duplicate"), Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I changed from an other podcast app to AntennaPod and I missed one feature.
I can setup the maximum number of downloads unter the general settings.
But it would be a great feature, if I could setup the maximum number of stored episodes for each subscription separately.

I think this option could placed in the context menu of each subscription.
And if the maximum is reached, the oldest, not played episode will be deleted.

Episodes I've started, but not finished shouldn't count. 

Example for unplayed episodes:
I will have 2 Episodes for Podcast X.
I download Episode 001 and after a week 002. One week later Episode 003 is released. AntennaPod should remove Episode 001 and than download 003.

Example for played episodes:
I will have 2 Episodes for Podcast X.
I download Episode 001 and after a week 002. I started (but not finished) Episode 001. One week later Episode 003 is released and should downloaded (becourse Episode 001 is not counting). An other week later Episode 004 is released and AntennaPod should delete Episode 002 and than download 004.

title: Mark as played gesture doesn't remove episode from queue at once
body:
**App version:** 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play?) (Yes, joined beta channel)

LG Nexus 5X

When in queue list, sliding an episode to the side should mark it as played, and remove it from queue.

title: Updating to newer android or switching sdcard will break AntennaPod data location
body:
AntennaPod version: 1.5.1.4

I updated my phone from Android 4.4.4 to Android 6.0.1 and i got an unable to access sdcard error.
Then after i copied my media files to a new sdcard i got the same error.

**When is this a problem:**
- After upgrading android
- After changing sdcard
- After restoring to not default location

**After some troubleshooting i found and solved the problem manually:**
original location:  android 4.4.4  /storage/sdcard1/Download/AntennaPod
restore location:  android 6.0.1  /storage/1234-ABCD/Download/AntennaPod (sdcard error)
working location:  android 6.0.1 /storage/1234-ABCD/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files
new location:       android 6.0.1 /storage/4321-DCBA/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files

**Two files need to be updated:**
/data/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/databases/Antennapod.db
/data/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/shared_prefs/de.danoeh.antennapod_preferences.xml

**>> Antennapod.db**
update "main"."feedimages" set file_url = replace (file_url, '/storage/sdcard1/Download/AntennaPod', '/storage/4321-DCBA/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files');
update "main"."feedmedia" set file_url = replace (file_url, '/storage/sdcard1/Download/AntennaPod', '/storage/4321-DCBA/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files');
update "main"."feeds" set file_url = replace (file_url, '/storage/sdcard1/Download/AntennaPod', '/storage/4321-DCBA/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files');

**>> de.danoeh.antennapod_preferences.xml**
  <string name="prefDataFolder">/storage/4321-DCBA/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files</string>
  <string name="ExternalMedia.PrefSourceUrl">/storage/4321-DCBA/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/media/somefile.mp3</string>

**Prefered fix:**
Scan mmc/sdcard for 'cache;export;import;media' and update location accordingly.
On failure allow user to enter folder manually

title: After forcing stop AntennaPod service, AntennaPod fails to open.
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
**App version:** 1.5.0.8 and later (now 1.5.1.0), F-Droid build

**Android version**: 5.1 - Using CyanogenMod 12.1

**Device model**: Samsung S4 Mini

**Expected behaviour**:
Works as expected without crashes

**Current behaviour**:
Crashes either on open, or sometimes after reinstall works for a short while. After initial crash however it never works again (unless reinstalled).

**First occurred**: 2- 3 weeks ago. In a bit to save some RAM, I force closed services for a number of apps, stupidly ignoring the warnings Cyanogen gave me that this might cause apps to fail. 
Following this Antennapod crashed every time I tried to open it.

**Steps to reproduce**:
1. Go into android task manager and force stop the Antennapod service (in Cyanogen this means going to running apps, clicking into antennapod, forcing stop service, ignoring the warning).
2. Try to open Antennapod. App fails ('the app has stopped' or similar message). Sometimes after reinstalling Antennapod it works again for a short while but afterwards fails to start.
- \- 

Hi,

I've posted about this in the Cyanogen forums as well and it seems like the only fix might be factory reset. I don't really understand why this is happening even when I use various forms of uninstall, reboot, reinstall, clear data for the app, but none of this seems to fix the problem I have caused!

I'm not at all sure this is a problem with AntennaPod, but I'm including this bug report here for your information. 

Thanks,
Nick

title: Address error-prone warnings
Play/pause button unresponsive after unlocking phone
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
While I am listening to a podcast, I unlock my phone to pause it. I cannot play the podcast again since the button becomes unresponsive. Details below.

**App version:** 1.5.0.9 from Google Play Store

**Android version:** 6.0.1

**Devide model:** Nexus 5

**Expected behaviour:** Press play button. Podcast plays. Play button icon changes to pause button icon.

**Current behaviour:** Press play button. Button is unresponsive. The podcast doesn't play. Play button icon remains.

**First occured:** about a week ago

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open a podcast and be on the main podcast screen with the audio controls and podcast picture/description. Make sure the podcast is playing.
2. Press power button to lock phone.
3. Unlock phone. You should be back on the main podcast screen.
4. Press pause button. The podcast will pause.
5. Press play button. The button will be unresponsive.

This can also be recreated with the podcast not initially playing, in which case the pause button will be unresponsive.

If you press the back button and then click on the bottom tab to get back to the main podcast screen, the play/pause button will once again be responsive.

Milestone... depends... If we want to push beta now, we probably want to wait for 1.6

Robotium: Could only break testing, after all.

title: crop / limit podcast list lengths + visual difference for non-live items
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I don't see anywhere an option - manually or auto - to limit the accumulated podcast list lengths in AntennaPod. Some feeds, whose online XML lists are only a dozen entries long or so, have many hundred old items in AntennaPod meanwhile. No manual cleanup command or automatic  algorithm (setting) seems to exist for cropping.? 

Thus podcast list handling & update is getting slower and slower. Its somewhat manageable with display filters, but that does not really satisfy regarding the data pile up problem and regarding navigation. To crop, it seems to require a complete feed deletion + re-subscription, but then the stored newer items get lost.

There is also no visual difference for items which are not anymore "live" according last feed XML download - and which mostly do fail upon download attempt. So its always a lottery to try on an older item - and then possibly receipt the download error.

Suggestions (in case I'm not missing a "secret" option):
- A manual option to shrink a list to "live" feed items + N  (according to last XML feed download)(default N=20); but possibly always keeping even the very old items which still have downloaded media files (and/or are queued/favored)
- Show a visual difference between "live" items and only internally archived very old items. (according to last XML download) 

That would do 99% for me. 

Fancy / optional:
- auto algorithm (and setting - globally or per feed) for auto-limiting the feed list length to live items +N  

---

**App version:** 1.5.0.9 (current)
**Current behaviour**: podcast list lengths ever growing; list handling getting slow
**Expected behaviour**: manual and optionally automatic option to shrink the list length to "live" items +N

title: Remove unused resources and shrink images
body:
# I removed unused resources like the Roboto font (we only use Roboto Light) and some icons. This should save more than 100kb.

Then, I threw them into ImageOptim (all options, slowest speed). The images are only optimized (this should remove lint warnings!), the quality is the same. This should save another ~ 140 kb.

title: Reordering episodes in queue causes mis-ordering, crashes
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When dragging episodes up or down in the queue, I often get crashes.  If there is no crash, the queue frequently ends up out of order.  Sometimes merely dragging an episode up or down one slot causes a crash.

I have found at least one reproduction case.  Suppose you start with episodes A, B, C, and D in order:
-A
-B
-C
-D

Tap on A and start to drag down, so you should end up with
B
A
C
D

When A's row gets to where you would expect it to swap with B, the app does one of two things: crashes immediately (I haven't figured out why this happens yet), or the remaining episodes all slide down another row (D pushing into a previously nonexistent row):

-
-A
-B
-C
-D

If you continue to hold and drag A down, when it gets to B's new row, the app crashes.  This reproduces for me 100%.

I also am experiencing some bugginess moving an episode up, but haven't found a watertight repro case yet.  Usually it manifests itself by moving the episode an extra space or two.  Sometimes the app crashes.

I noticed this in the last few days.  I don't remember the exact first time, but I would guess no earlier than a week ago.

AntennaPod version: I signed up for the beta some time ago, but am not sure if I'm actually getting beta builds.  My App info says I have version 1.5.1.3

Android 5.1.1, Nexus 4

title: Fix RecyclerView reorder crash
body: Hopefully resolves some phones crashing when an item in the queue is dragged.

title: Be able to downgrade database
body:
Application: Manual installation of older versions, F-Droid

I believe we can pretty much ignore any "add column" or "create index".

The code is only able to downgrade to 1030005. That was when the meaning of new, played and unplayed changed fundamentally.

Resolves #1736.

title: Episode view: Show podcast title
body:
![item1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/13607697/ad8675f6-e551-11e5-995e-86995fba65b6.png)
![item2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/13607698/ada3d9e8-e551-11e5-968a-2ec7519331c5.png)

Resolves #1727
Also fixes an issue where the loading indicator is shown after an orientation change.

title: Prevent parsing errors
body:
Make as little assumptions as possible about the current parsing `state` (current item, feed etc.)

(I'd rather have too many checks than having to dig deep into the code to find out if a variable can be null at that particular moment)

Resolves #1686

(Yes, I forgot to create a new branch. Luckily, the branch was already merged and the new branch would be based on this anyway)

title: Proxy support
body:
Resolves #447

![proxy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/13540268/b8d48654-e255-11e5-9a6b-423776cd60bc.png)

**Testing:**
Install [Orbot](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.torproject.android&hl=de)
Host: 127.0.0.1 / localhost
Port: 8118

**Testing authorization:**
I installed Polipo on a RasPi for that. My config is this:

```
logSyslog = false
logFile = /dev/null
proxyAddress = "::0" 
authCredentials = <username>:<password>
allowedClients = 127.0.0.1, <local-ip-range>
diskCacheRoot = ""
```

**No Socks 4 or 5?**
The problem is described in https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/2315
If someone actually asks for SOCKS support, we could have a look at jsocks

This PR also contains a minor fix for cut off icons in the Downloads Log.

body:
Resolves #775

![s](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/13526149/5511cdba-e206-11e5-98d7-762642bcda2e.png)

title: Give each pubdate thread its own parser
body:
Resolves #1726 (Hopefully)

If different threads inconveniently call `DateUtils.parse(String)` at the same time, they might interfere with another using the same parser. Now, each caller gets its own parser.

(1.5.1, because this could only really harm performance, but I really doubt that)

title: Audioplayer v1.0.14 & Audio controls dialog fix
body:
I know, branch name is a bit misleading...

Newest audio player should fix fallback to android's native player and catch all decoder thread exceptions (and fail gracefully).

When your locale is not us, the audio controls dialog saved the the playback speed from the slider in a wrong format. This leads to errors like this

```
E/PlaybackSvcMediaPlayer: java.lang.NumberFormatException: Invalid float: "1,70"
```

If the episode has an episode specific thumbnail though, its difficult to tell which podcast its from. Currently I copy the URL and paste it in another app, rather than go through the episodes list and find the match.

**Requested change**: In the episode view, display the podcast name in a smaller text size below or above the episode title. I think the size and style of the date and length would work well.

title: Play/pause button can stop working
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
**App version:** 1.5.0.9 from F-Droid

**Android version**: 4.4.4

**Current behaviour**: Play/pause button can stop working after the screen has turned off (after the screen is turned back on of course). 

**First occured**: Version 1.5 (worked on 1.4)

**Steps to reproduce**:
With the current episode in focus:
1. Play something
2. Turn off the screen
3. Turn on the screen
4. Pause (this works)
5. **Play/resume doesn't work**

AND
1. Stop/pause playback
2. Turn off the screen
3. Turn on the screen
4. Press play (this works)
5. **Pause doesn't work**

As a workaround, if you press back you get the currently playing episode at the bottom and the play/pause button there works.
If you focus a different app before turning the screen off, turn the screen on and then focus AntennaPod again it works fine. So the problem occurs only when the app has focus (on the current episode).

**Environment**: Do you still use Prestissimo? No, and I have tried Sonic on and off.

title: flattr4j jarfile not available anymore (from wiki instructions on how to Set up the Android SDK)
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
When setting my development environment following the [wiki instructions](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/wiki/Building-AntennaPod) I noticed that the link to `flattr4j` which points to http://www.shredzone.org/attachments/download/250/flattr4j-core-2.7.jar is now broken, as you get redirected to https://shredzone.org/index.html

There doesn't seem to be a place where to download the "compiled" jar file.

Also, the following is mentioned on the Github page of the project at https://github.com/shred/flattr4j :

> **Important Note**
> 
> Flattr is currently changing its API. Because of that, some of the flattr4j calls are failing or not delivering the expected results. It is unclear to me what a future API may look like, and to what extend flattr4j is going to support it. For the time being, **I recommend not to use flattr4j in new projects.**

So to create PR #1722 I didn't include this jarfile. The app runs fine, but as I have not been using Flattr since ~2013, I can't test the Flattr-specific bits.

Question: Is the Flattr integration from AntennaPod still working, or is it affected by the API changes mentioned above?

In any case, the wiki should probably be changed. The reason I didn't do it myself directly, is that I don't know what it should be changed to:
- either, if the code is broken, remove this .jar dependency (and thus also probably remove all Flattr code from the app?)
- or, if the code is still working, try to find another place where the jarfile can be downloaded from. (I suppose we don't want to ask new contributors to compile that jarfile, I for one have no clue what needs to be done for that, and am not interested in a `git clone` of that project's source code.

title: Option to Fast-forward instead of Skip
body:
This PR addresses issue #1560, and builds upon PR #1424.
Now instead of only allowing Blutooth hardware buttons to fast-forward instead of skipping (which used to be the original behavior), other users can choose to fast-forward. For example (but likely not limited to this use case) CyanogenMod users that long-press the Volume Up button can now again fast-forward 30 seconds. (long-pressing Volume Down still rewinds 30 seconds).

The change was made by broadening and renaming the option that was introduced for "hardware" button presses. By default, the behavior is to Skip (so that it is consistent with the current behavior), but any user that wants to Fast Forward can set this option to False.

This should be testable also for non-CyanogenMod users, either by using a Bluetooth handset that sends the KEYCODE_MEDIA_NEXT, or by triggering the KEYCODE_MEDIA_NEXT from the application itself.

I have removed the translations for the old preference `pref_hardwareForwardButtonSkips_title` and `pref_hardwareForwardButtonSkips_sum`, so that the new text gets translated again.

This is my first PR for AntennaPod, I hope I did everything well, don't hesitate to let me know if I need to change things. Thanks for looking into this.

title: Allow user to disable toast notifications
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
Great app. Thanks first.
I usually start a refresh when in wifi and do something else (like checking email). While refresh is in progress, it constantly displays toast. If possible remove toast or allow user to disable them.

title:
Remove
's from description
Reduce number of pre-selected playback speeds
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
> if I long-press the speed control, I get a big long list of speed options, and tapping an option on that list disables or enables each, whereas my intuition is that I would go there to choose my current speed, either in order to make up for that the main control can't go backwards (https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/pull/1561#issuecomment-189011034, @kousu)
> 
> > Press this little icon: http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/icon/sliders/
> > Still an issue? ^^ [@mfietz]

I must admit that even I had forgotten about the possibility to change the speed from the audio settings button, and that I was a bit annoyed that (I thought) I had to cycle through all the options to go down one step, when I actually used the feature in real life for the first time last week.

My proposal: move the selection of preferred speeds to the settings screen. Like the OP, intuitively I would expect a lonpress to draw up a list with radio buttons to set the current speed, with some option to reach/have a slider.

title: fix the volume conversion upon user interaction
body:
There was an inconsistency with the user set volumes, as the one experienced by the user when moving the seekbar isn't the same as the one later returned by UserPreferences.

This fixes that, and also moves the conversion formula into a new method on core.util.Converter

Also, I took the freedom to slightly alter the formula, since as it was it was giving the same output for 99 as for 100.

Besides, the volume bars progress were always initialized to 100, so I created methods on UserPreferences to read the saved values (different than returning a float between 0 and 1) and called them when initializing the seekbars.

title: Downloader: Disable gzip for media files
body:
Resolves #1627
(Actually, probably not. If gzip is the problem, we should rather see a skip in the local audio, but not duplicate content. Well, it is an improvement, I guess...)

title: Duck and raise audio volume back
body: Resolves #996

title: Use media:thumbnail and media:description if nothing else provided
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently, when adding a YouTube RSS feed, AntennaPod only displays titles, since regular description and itunes:image tags for items aren't provided in YouTube's [feeds](https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=UCjL9fu714QdyrkleaHX5-sw).

Proposal: if there's no `description` and `itunes:image` tags for an item, check if `media:thumbnail` and `media:description` are available.

title: Downloader: Check content type for media
body:
Resolves #1503

Could probably add some lengthy explanation, but the user probably only wants that HTML is not mistaken for an episode.

body: Resolves #1466 (hopefully)

body:
Make sure that DB helpers, preferences and so on are initialized on each of the various entry points, especially BroadcastReceivers.

Resolves #1695

All tests passed.

title: Video player: Delay controls hide on interaction
body:
When rewind, play/pause or ff is pressed, the controls hiding is delayed.
Lowered the general delay for hiding from 5s to 2,5s. (In comparison, in VLC the default value is only 1s)
The position now also updates (e.g. when seeking) when playback is paused.

I noticed that often the current position is not updated because tryLock is false (race condition) and the position is not actually read.
So I added a timeout of 50ms. Really not sure if this is a good idea. 50ms should not be noticeable, but we are running on the main thread here...

Resolves #1687

title: Prevent video controls from disappearing while using them
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I suggest a change to the on-screen video controls. It would be nice if the controls do not disappear while using them. 

Currently, if I am playing a video podcast and hit the 30sec FF button (on the screen) several times, the controls will eventually disappear, no matter how frequently I am hitting the FF button. I can be rapidly hitting that button, and all of a sudden they on-screen controls disappear. Obviously they come right back after touching the screen again, but it may be nice to prevent them from going away.

It is good to have the on-screen controls disappear eventually, however, I suggest to keep the controls on-screen for a minimum number of seconds after touching a playback control button. Maybe 5 seconds. Then the controls should disappear after that.

Hopefully I am clear in my description.

label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
On my Fairphone 2 (Android 5.1) I have enabled 'Hide sensitive notification content'. Skype & WhatsApp notifications are understandably hidden, but other AP's content (not the notification player, but e.g. download notifications) is blocked as well.

I guess AP need to declare it's notification data 'Public', from how FOSS navigation app OsmAnd resolved the issue: https://github.com/osmandapp/Osmand/issues/2241

Also, the user could comment directly from AntenaPod.

title: Moving to new phone with newer version produced error in fetching feeds
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
Hi!

I do not have apps from the play store set to automatically update, so when I switched to a new phone Antennapod was an older version (1.3.4.1). On the new phone the newest version of Antennapod was installed  (1.4.2.2). 

I backup the application data for Antennapod using Helium then restored it on the new phone. When I tried to fetch the feeds they all produced an **Unknown Error**.

I then tried upgrading the old phone to the newest version (1.4.2.2) of Antennapod and started Antennapod fresh and fetched feeds. This worked. I then backup Antennapod  on the old phone and restored on the new phone. I started Antennapod fresh and tried to fetch feeds. I got an **Unknown Error** for each feed it tried to fetch.

I then tried uninstalling Antennapod on the new phone. Then reinstalling Antennapod and  restoring the data with Helium.  I got an **Unknown Error** for each feed it tried to fetch.

I am not sure how to proceed other than I would need to start fresh and export  then import via OPML or via gpodder.net.

This means I will lose all my downloaded episodes and their status. Correct?

Any other ideas on moving Antennapod to a new phone?

Thanks again for all your hard work on Antennapod!
Frederick  

---

App version: (from Google Play) 1st time 1.3.4.1 ==> 1.4.2.2  2nd and 3rd time 1.4.2.2 ==> 1.4.2.2

Android version: 4.1.2 ==> 4.4.2

Device model: Samsung S3 mini ==> Samsung S5 mini

Expected behaviour: Moving the data should allow feeds to be fetched

Current behaviour: Fetching feeds on the new device produces and **Unknown Error** for all feeds it attempts to fetch

First occured: Version  1.4.2.2 / yesterday

Steps to reproduce:

Move Antennapod data from one Android phone to another using Helium.

Stacktrace/Logcat: [if available]
[aLogcat.txt](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/files/129777/aLogcat.txt)

title: updated translations
Set default episode cache size to 25
body:
Sets the default episode cache size for new users to 10. Assuming that you have at least once a day access to a fast network and that 10 episodes is something like 3 hours of listening, 10 should be a reasonable default value.
To not make old users angry, the current default value of 20 (which is not actually any of the options) is bumped up to 25 if the user has not changed the default.

Resolves #1654

title: Mobile Data: Do not show retrieving filesize spinner when download is not allowed
body: Resolves #1655

title: Prevent gpodder sync duplicates
body:
Resolves #1658

gpodder escapes colons (`:`) which seems to be pretty unnecessary. See [1] and [2]
## 

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2053132/is-a-colon-safe-for-friendly-url-use/2053640#2053640
[2] https://www.w3.org/TR/html4/types.html#type-name

title: fix the audio ducking feature (issue 996)
body:
This should fix issue #996. At least it did for my particular problem, and since I couldn't reproduce the problems initially reported, I'm not entirely sure whether it will work for them as well.

Changes made were simply to introduce a layer on PlaybackServiceMediaPlayer on the volume settings in order to automatically reduce the set volume whenever it should be ducked.

Future methods to read the volume levels (in order to update the seekbars) should use the member variables mVolumeLeft/Right, as long as it's the expected behavior to keep ducking effects away from the user's control (other than ducking becoming possibly an optional feature in preferences).
