title: Default episode cache size should be one of the options
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Currently, the default cache number is 20. But that's not one of the options (anymore). No real problem of course, but a bit weird.

title: FR: Export & import favorites
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
Migrating from one phone to another, it's pretty damn easy to use OPML export & -import to move stuff over. Yet it would be great if also 'favourites' could be exported (given the fact that syncing with gpodder.net doesn't work properly in all cases), so that these episodes (and their feeds, as they can't be orphaned) could be imported to a new instance.

Currently, if gpodder.net is not enabled/functioning, ppl may loose their favourites (and not be able to re-add them, in they're old episodes which may no longer appear in updated feeds).

title: OPML Import: Select all/none toggle
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently, when importing an OPML file, 'deselect all' is hidden behind a menu button, and both 'select all' and 'deselect all' are still visible when it makes no sense to apply them.

Proposal: when none or a few (up to all but one) are selected) display 'select all', otherwise (in case everything is selected) display 'deselect all'.

This unclutters the UI, and (at least to me when migrating to a new phone) the only most logical thing to do is to select a few feeds manually, or everything via the button.

The rare case when 'deselect all' is wanted, is (I guess) when a person changes their mind:
A) first thought 'I want all' then thought 'I want just a few', or
B) first thinking 'I want feeds A-G' then thinking 'I want feeds Q-Z' (e.g. in case selecting many feeds manually and wanting to switch to another set.
In these cases users will likely figure out to press 'select all' and then 'deselect all'.

title: Audio controls dialog scrollable
body: Resolves #1650

title: Can't see all audio controls
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When using the phone on small screen in landscape, the audio controls can't be scrolled i.e. it's only possible to set the playback speed and left channel audio volume.

Version 1.5.0rc5 Android 4.4 Custom ROM

title: updated changelog
added new translations
updated translations
Remove deprecation warnings by using ContextCompat.getColor().
Episodes Skipping & Deleting
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body: This has been happening sporadically over the last couple weeks and might coincide with an upgrade from Kit Kat to Lollipop. The issue is that I'll be listening to a podcast and suddenly I'm listening to the next episode in the queue. I thought that maybe I was inadvertently triggering this so I enabled "keep podcasts when skipping" but the episodes that skip disappear from my queue and need redownloaded to complete listening. Had this happen 3 times in 5 minutes on a drive tonight. I don't think this is happening while I have headphones in, just when connected to Bluetooth (hard to say though, I listen with Bluetooth 75% of the time).

title: Pause for interruptions
body:
I have enabled Pause for interruptions. This works fine for notification sounds. However, it doesn't work for other media sounds (e.g when Nike+ running is giving me an update on speed/pace)

App version: 1.4.2.2 (from Google Play)
Android version: 6.0.1 [stock]
Device model: Nexus 5x
Environment: Bluetooth headphones with Prestissimo

title: Duplicate items in podcast feed appear over time
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
I've observed that sometimes multiple instances of items in podcast feeds appear over time. Following is an example:

![screenshot_2016-02-03-19-31-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5264535/12802761/1e7a2dac-cab3-11e5-9348-b4d3e70925c6.png)

The [podcast feed](http://cms.marketplace.org/podcasts/collections/153961/itunes) itself only defines one instance of each item. Initially when the podcast was added only one instance of each item was observed. Some time later after listening to all item, however, I went back and saw that there were multiple entires for each item. Some items have no duplicates, some appear 3x and some 4x times.

This is observed on AntennaPod 1.4.2.2 running on Android 4.4.2 from Cyanogenmod.

title: Add "always play episode at top of queue" option
body:
Close #1565 
- add new preference (by default it keep previous behaviour) 
- tyni changes in PlayBackService

title: Apply Actions: Get Add to Queue back
body: I'm not a smart man...

title: No external storage / Choose Data Folder redo
body:
Well, this branch started off by giving the "No storage available" activity a butter where the user could set the data folder so she would be able to use the app again.
Then I realized that we only need the very restricted choose dialog on Lollipop, <= 4.4 and > 5.1x are fine with the old way.
For Marshmallow, we also have to check read and write permissions. This PR does that.
(Without the permissions, we cannot do anything on Marshmallow. So we check for this really early and don't allow the user to do anything without giving us the permission first.)

The Directory Choose Dialog now also has a fancy icon for "Create new folder" (showing text really bugged me).

Oh, I'd skip the refactor commit... ^^ (both icon commits are only adding graphics and doing plumbing)

Resolves #975

title: Breaks when updating android versions
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
This has happened to me recently when upgrading my galaxy s4 (i9505) from stock 4.3 to cyangen 12, then more recently to cyangen 13.

Basically after the update antennapod loads and says 'external storage not mounted' I can't do anything in antennapod.

I managed to fix it both times by flushing the app data, which meant I had to manually subscribe again to every pod cast and download them all again.

From what I've seen online it seems to be where the previous path to the data (which I keep on an external sd card so my internal card doesn't get bloated) is invalid. 

Would it be possible to add an option when the expected storage path isn't found to redefine it?

title: don't show space warning if we can autodelete stuff.
updated translations
Upgrade AntennaPod-AudioPlayer to v1.0.11
body:
Made some optimizations...
(Luckily we are still in alpha, so we have enough time to check that I did not fuck up ^^)

title: AntennaPod won't write to external sd card
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
I have an Xperia M4 Aqua running Android 5.0 and AntennaPod 1.4.2.2. I chose sdcard1 as the data folder (full path: /storage/sdcard1/Android/data/de/danoeh.antennapod/files). I then tried to download a podcast episode, but the message "Failed to access external storage" pops up.

Also, if the path stated above is selected, OPML Import doesn't work, either. Internal storage must be selected for it to import subscriptions successfully.

title: Improve If-Modified-Since/ETag
body:
Instead of persisting the unix epoch time in the `Feeds` table's `last_update` property, we now persist the `Last-Modified` or `ETag` string returned from the server (SQLite doesn't care that the column type is integer).
This is to prevent issues where we would save a timestamp to the database even though the file has changed on the server (could be a caching or a simple race condition).

The other change is that refreshing the feed from its view now enforces the feed to be refreshed regardless of said column value.

title: Set 'filterInclude' properly
body: wasn't setting boolean properly when loading data, resulted in filter switching to 'include'

title: AntennaPod fails to recognize downloaded podcasts after unmounting and remounting
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
I recently attempted to move my podcasts manually to my SD Card due to space concerns. However, as other posters- have mentioned, AntennaPod does not recognize files that are moved manually. It is for this reason that I deleted my stored podcast data and reinstalled AntennaPod. However, now with the podcast directory on the external storage, every time I mount and unmount the SD card, AntennaPod no longer recognizes the downloaded podcasts (doesn't allow playback and starts to redownload the previously downloaded podcasts) -- similar to how it doesn't recognize podcasts that are placed in the media directory manually. 

Any assistance relating to this matter would be very much appreciated. 

Thank you!

EDIT: Additional Information

Android version: 5.0.2 (CyanogenMod 12-20150308 Nightly Build)

Device model: Samsung Galaxy Note 3 (SM-N9005)

Expected behavior: Expected AntennaPod to playback downloaded podcasts after unmounting and remounting SD card,  

Current behaviour: The play icon appears next to the downloaded podcasts, but once I choose to play the files, AntennaPod begins to redownload them

AntennaPod Version 1.4.2.2

Steps to reproduce:
1. Choose external storage for data folder.
2. Download any particular podcast episode.
3. Close AntennaPod, unmount the SD Card and remount. 
4. Open AntennaPod and attempt to play the previously downloaded podcast -- a recommencement of the download should occur.

I tested playback speeds 1 and 1.4, .oga and .mp3 files, switching the screen off via the power button and waiting for auto-screen-off and leaving a number in the sleep timer field vs. deleting the number (in which case it says "Ente" BTW).

title: add 'episode filtering' & other updates
body: Functionality introduced per  #1612. Should probably wait with merging until 1.5 is out on Google Play.

title: Custom media location
body: Currently, the only customization option for download location is the ability to choose the storage device AntennaPod uses. There should be some way, perhaps a field in the settings menu, to set a custom directory as the location for completed podcasts, i.e. sdcard1/Podcast.

title: Resuming incomplete downloads sometimes results in duplicated content
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Sometimes when downloading a file the download cannot complete for one reason or another. When the download is re-attempted / resumed, it eventually can succeed. The interesting bit is that when the file is finally played, it sometimes has a section of audio repeated around where the download failed and was restarted. That is, the audio plays, then at some point the last few seconds repeat. However, the issue is not the playback, as once the file is downloaded the repeating bit can always be reproduced.

It is also possible that when the download is continued from being interrupted the resulting audio file may contain a section which is invalid and sounds like static when played for a brief moment around the section where the re-download occurred.

This can be observed on AntennaPod 1.4.2.2 from F-Droid.

title: Only reset episode to new if feed item did not link to a file before
body:
Resolves #1616 (Hopefully)

"if item.getAutoDownload() is false, the file has been downloaded before" is only correct for files downloaded recently.
Actually, checking `getAutoDownload()` should not really be necessary. Items with a former wrong URL (that 404'd) should still be new (if the user did not tamper with them).

title: Added 'Keep Updated' option for Feeds
body:
Added a 'Global Refresh' option for feeds.  Defaults to true.

If you disable global refresh for a feed then if you refresh the feed list from the queue, from the episodes list or from a scheduled update then that feed will _not_ be refreshed.  Further, any new episodes for the feed will _not_ show up in 'New Episodes' though they will continue to show up under the Feed's episode view.

![global_refresh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5216560/12565558/f8dfb9fe-c382-11e5-861f-743ea690beab.png)

resolves #1182 and resolves #286

title: When subscribing via iTunes search I get on gpodder.net podcast named "Unnamed Podcast"
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
I have searched on iTunes for the podcast "Blue Ocean World". I subscribed to it (and I don't need to emphasize, right?, that I am very grateful that AntennaPod allows me to search subscriptions on iTunes). When downloading the subscription correctly propagated to my gpodder.net account as well, and it has correct name and issues in the AntennaPod. However, when I look on the subscription on gpodder.net, I see it named as "Unnamed Podcast". That is not good.

It's true RSS stream turns out to be http://www.hellohoratio.com/podcast.xml (and if subscribe to it on gpodder.net via this URL then it gets name, issues, correctly).

Is there something wrong with propagating metadata obtained from iTunes?

title: Episode autodownload filter
body:
Goes part way to implementing what was proposed in #531.

Not sure if it makes sense to do everything requested in #531. With this PR the filtered episodes won't be autodownloaded, but they'll still show up for people to see (maybe they'll decide they want to download something after all).

If there is demand we could consider expanding the scope of this feature.

title: RFE: Multiple playlists /queues
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
I would love to be able to make multiple playlists. For example one for news and another one for documentaries. 

An example of usage would be the history podcasts by Dan Carlin. They're long and should be heard in the correct order. I would make a playlist of one period of history (as Dan does in his naming structure of podcasts). Then I could listen to topical podcasts of news and current affairs for a while, and when I have more time I can listen to another one is a series of history podcasts.

Maybe a solution could be an ability to add tags to podcasts, manually and automatically, and then create, sort and play queues based on tags?

Related topic: sorting the order of podcasts is not very 'discoverable'...

title: Eliminate confusion from UI elements that change playback speed
body:
Resolves #1603 

Changes in `canSetPlaybackSpeed()` go beyond the linked issue. Necessary because we often change the media player "on the fly". The current mp might not have playback speed capabilities, but we can switch to an implementation that does.

title: OPML export saves in folder that gets removed on uninstall
body:
When you do an OPML export, it gets saved in the antennapod folder, which gets deleted if you uninstall it. This is rather unfortunate, as keeping the data even though you're uninstalling the app is rather the point of the OPML export.
Could this be changed so it either saves it in someplace which doesn't get deleted, or doesn't delete that specific file when uninstalling?
As a secondary concern, doing two exports results in only one file. Does it get overwritten? I suggest saving it with timestamps in the name or just numbering them.
Thirdly, maybe you should by default leave some settings and subscription data behind when uninstalling? You make it far too easy to lose all settings and subscriptions.

Sincerely,
A quite grumpy settingless and subscriptionless user

Nexus 5 | AP v.1.5.0.2 | Android 6.0.1

title: Playback speed option confusion
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I don't use different playback speeds so I have all but 1.00x disabled in the settings. Despite that, it still appears in the lower left corner, which isn't too bad but unnecessary. It however also still appears as a slider in the audio controls, where i can set it to anything still, though it gets ignored upon exit.
I understand where this all comes from, but I feel like between the settings and the UI controls there is some excess of options.
I can't think of a perfect solution, so I hope you will.

title: Audio Player: Themed background colour
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The grey background colour in the playback view (on which podcast name, image and episode title are displayed) is the same for both the light and dark theme and fits neither as it doesn't appear anywhere else. 
Could that change to something more thematically consistent?

title: Changing playback speed unpauses playback
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When in the playback view, changing the playback speed unpauses playback.
Reproduction steps:
1. Staat playback
2. Pause it in playback view
3. Tap playback speed, a few times
-> playback unpauses, play button doesn't change

There are a few other oddities I noticed related to this. By my knowledge I only had 1x playback selected before the last few updates. After, I could change between 0.5 up to 2.0. I went into the menu, afterwards only between 1.0 and 2.0. Curious, I went to look at the specific setting and found a range of 1.1 to 2.0 enabled, all these ranges in steps of 0.1. Going back to the playback view it no longer went to 1.0, keeping to the range in the setting. I suppose something in the update did something strange, or that one time when I enabled sonic for a second. It's so strange a collection of bugs I doubt it'll be easily reproduceable.

V. 1.5.0.2
Nexus 5
Android 6.0.1
Not using Sonic

title: Problem with seeking in a particular podcast.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Android version: 5.0.2
Device model: MEDION X5004

Expected behaviour:
Seeking in any podcast episode should just work.

Current behaviour:
With one particular podcast, I have this problem that seeking beyond a certain position does not work correctly. The Podcast is [Linux Voice, Season 3 Episode 22](https://www.linuxvoice.com/podcast-season-3-episode-22/). When the podcast starts, I seek to a position beyond 35 minutes (e.g. `00:36:54`). Then one of the following two things happen:
- Either the podcast stops as if it was hitting the end of the mp3-file. The next episode starts playing automatically.
- Or, and this is quite strange, the (visual) seeking succeeds, the new display time is `00:36:54` and continues to increase in every second (`00:36:55`, `00:36:56`, ...), but the audio track is wrong. The audio that is played is from the start of the podcast episode (`00:00:01`, `00:00:02`, ...).

First occured: Version 1.4.2.2 / occurred sometime around 2015-12-23

Steps to reproduce:
1. Subscribe to Linux Voice Podcast via iTunes.
2. Download Season 3 Episode 22
3. Start playing the episode.
4. Seek to position `00:35:00` or beyond.
5. Repeat step 4 several times, until you see the above behavior.

Environment (Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?):
I have changed some setting, but can't remember what. I do not use any headphones or other devices with the phone. I do not have Prestissimo or any other related app (to my knowledge) installed.

title: Episode size is displayed as 'MB', but actually is in Mebibytes('MiB')
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
The title says it already.
I have a podcast episode, which has a size of 109444697 bytes. This is 109 MB or 104 MiB in the IEC standard (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mebibyte).
In the list overview of episodes, AntennaPod displays `104 MB`, but it should rather be `104 MiB` or `109 MB`.

title: Fix Iconify web icon
Widget: Update playback position every second
body:
Problem: FeedMedia's internal position is only updated every 5 seconds [1]. The widget would get updated about every 1.5s, but would read this often obsolete value. Now, we get the position directly from the playback service (and update every second).

Resolves #1278
## 

[1] https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/f3758e33c28eae203bd6cfd0fee8cf3fb9c6b2d5/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/service/playback/PlaybackServiceTaskManager.java#L38

title: More (consequent) use of issue labels
label: [Label(name="project issue")]
body:
Currently, almost half (95 of the 201) issues don't have labels. Also, sometimes labels aren't updated according to new comments from the OP. Lastly, I think we need a new label called 'Under discussion' (for larger issues like updated logo, auto download oldest episode first, etc).

I don't want to pretend to know what's good/useful for the developers, but I can imagine the project would benefit of more (consequent) use of issue labels. Especially after @mfietz' great work on the 'early spring clean-up' :)

I'd like to volunteer to take on the job of applying issue labels. I know that'd (unfortunately) mean I'd also be able to merge PR's and do other technical stuff, but wouldn't wan to and you'd have to trust me not to do so.

title: Introduce "Top queue item" setting for continuous playback
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
> while I am at it I would like having the player start playing from the top of the queue when new episodes are added. Of course after the current episode is played. [@cdysthe in https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/1414#issuecomment-159448272]

Wholeheartedly agree. Currently, the 'add to top of the queue' option doesn't make much sense: Imagine a line (queue) to enter a concert, where VIPs may enter at the front of the line (add episodes to top of the queue). Then what's the point of having ppl added in front of the line (top of the queue) if you let ppl enter (episodes play) who are half-way in the line (just because they happen to be behind the person that last entered). The logic of a line (queue) I think is: first in line, first entrance (rather than first next person in line after the one that just entered).

Then why still add episodes to the top if playback starts somewhere in the middle? The aim (in my world) of 'add to top' is to make the queue have the most recent episodes first. However currently playback will always end up somewhere in the middle of the queue, and I won't always listen to the most recent episodes first.

Currently I always manually drag & drop the currently playing episode to the top, which is really cumbersome.

Curious to see @mfietz' & @TomHennen's viewpoints. If not standard behaviour, I'd advocate for a setting to enable this (new setting under 'Queue').

body: App version: 1.4.2.2 What: '404' error when auto downloading this episode is repeated many times per second. I believe the failure is this link, but I used a google search to find it. It isn't extracted from the antennapod logs so it might not be the right failing url. http://s3.amazonaws.com/reasontv-video/reasontv_audio_253053.mp3 ``` NoSuchKeyThe specified key does not exist.reasontv_audio_253053.mp3BB16B4A6E75AFED6DdkCgsUevXOxkVF0nLCo7z8GhMb+9s3Z8aZSyxGUllt69YgOcmp5ecb8IzXurqPzxkZ0Jf2UXF0= ``` Another ?possibly useful? link https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/why-jean-paul-sartre-should/id322850582?i=359364678&mt=2 Cases: Killing and restarting the app - problem occurs again. Removing this episode from ? the queue ? (memory fuzzy) - problem ceased. Clicking the 'download' button on the feed - One 404 failure - working fine Clicking the retry button in the log - One 404 failure - working fine Repro: Add episode to the queue Mark as unplayed Set AutoDownload 'Refresh' the podcast (boom) The app is responsive enough to cancel AutoDownload - this stops the loop.

title: FR: Play next in feed if playback initiated from feed overview (+ reversed feed)
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I sometimes like to listen to a bunch episodes from one show, just to catch up with the feed after holidays. Currently, this is possible by manually sorting the queue, but I find it quite a hassle to do so. Quite some other users seem to want to be able to play the episodes just from one feed, because they're listening to an audio play, lectures, or alike.

Therefore I'd like to propose:
- to make AP **play the next episode in the feed list when the currently playing episode is finished, when playback is initiated from the feed list** rather than from the queue
- to **introduce a new feed-setting to reverse the order in the feed screen** so that the newest episode of the feed would be shown at the bottom of the list (and new episodes would be added to the bottom). If enabled, I can then listen to that episode in sequential order by tapping on the highest listed (and thus the oldest) episode, after which AP will continue playback down the list (to more recent episodes).
## 

**Feed screen as dedicated queue, change of perspective (?)**
I have the feeling often we as (wannabe-)developers\* see the feed screen as a way to manage episodes of that particular feed, and a way to reach information and settings of that feed. Given the large amount of talk about multiple playlists and stuff, however, I believe many people could easily or already see/perceive the feed overview as a special playlst or dedicated queue for one show, and I think we should adapt our perspective accordingly. When doing so, the proposed makes more sense than current behaviour, regardless the use case. Rather than jumping from one queue to the other (dedicated to general) without any feedback to the user, AP sticks to the queue from which the user initiated playback.

 \* I consider myself to be one of the wannabe-developers

title: Unavailable episodes (no media file) in "New" list
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Here's a frequent offender: http://www.kqed.org/.pod/forum
They add new entries without media content, then add the content to the entry several hours (days?) later.

In AP, these new "episodes" show up with a "mark as played" check mark instead of download icon. There seems to be no way of adding these episodes to the queue (so I can remember to download them later, when they become available)
If marked as read/played, these don't reappear as new when actual content is added later (even if the updated feed now includes content)

A similar (but slightly different) offender: http://www.sciencefriday.com/feed/podcast/podcast-video/
Adds links to the media file, but the media file is not available (HTTP/404) for some days.

Possible solutions:
1) implement a "download queue" -- use standard download rules, but don't start the download until the media file is available. If media file unavailable, don't remove from download queue.
This is probably the best solution, though most effort to implement...
2) allow adding episodes without media to the queue -- let user download manually later
3) when media file becomes available, episode should be re-added to the "New" episode list

title: Indicate that episode cache is full

```

SELECT FeedItems.id, FeedItems.title, FeedItems.pubDate, FeedItems.read, FeedItems.link, FeedItems.payment_link, FeedItems.media, FeedItems.feed, FeedItems.has_simple_chapters, FeedItems.item_identifier, FeedItems.flattr_status, FeedItems.image, FeedItems.auto_download
FROM FeedItems INNER JOIN Feeds ON FeedItems.feed=Feeds.id 
WHERE FeedItems.item_identifier='<IDENTIFIER>' AND ...
```

IDENTIFIER (URL) includes `'`, thus breaking the query.

title: AudioPlayer v1.0.7
body:
If Sonic fails (e.g. sample rate cannot be read), fall back to native mediaplayer.
If Sonic failed, we only reconsider using Sonic again when the playback service is restarted. Because we constantly reset audio players (and thereby forgetting we were in an error state), this seemed to be the easiest solution.

On Marshmallow, native pitch and playback speed work now. (Tested on N4 with Marshmallow)

Also includes downmixing (stereo to mono), which users will be able to enable in another PR.
# Testing

Clone https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod-AudioPlayer/

See https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod-AudioPlayer/#local-testing

Call `error()` in `SonicAudioPlayer.initStream()`

All tests passed on 4.4.4 virtual device.

title: When connected to WiFi that doesn't provide internet connection, download files hang playback
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Antennapod should verify that the data downloaded is the media data.
If connected to a hotel or airport Wifi that require further login, the downloaded file is small, around 1-20 kb.  It is probably the network login screen, but antennapod assumes that it media file and trys to play it.  Which generally hangs the program and it is killed.

A connection with blocking, may also have similar problems, where the blocking message is received instead of the media data.

I suggest two corrective actions:
1. Verify that the internet connection is available, before attempting to download the episode.
2. Check that the received data is actually a valid media file after it is received. If not, don't let it be played.  

Workaround: Look for media files that are too small and delete them from the cache manually.

I also have problems where antennapod hangs when an audio podcast ends, followed by a video.
Again, checking the data, before attempting to play it should allow using the correct codec.  The check should be done on the next podcast in background while playing the first podcast or when it approaches the end.

title: OPML import from local filesystem doesn't work
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I re-installed antennapod and tried to import some feeds from a local OPML file but it didn't work.

In the "OPML import" screen, I click on "From local filesystem", I get the "Complete action using..." popup dialog, I choose my usual file manager (Ghost Commander), navigate to the file, click on the file and nothing happens, I'm back in the "OPML import" screen again.

I'm sure the OPML file is OK, importing podcasts from the very same file used to work in previous versions of antennapod (unfortunately I can't recall the exact version when it worked).

Another small bug: if I repeat the import process, I always have to choose the external filemanager, even if I select "Always" in the "Complete action using..." popup dialog; so it seems antennapod is not keeping track of the choice.

(BTW Importing from gpodder.net works)

title: Reverse filtering (of episodes)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Actually I had started to write the following:

> I checked in transifex if it wasnt some translation mistake, but it seems it's not. In 1.4.2.0 it seems filtering of 'downloaded' and 'not downloaded' episodes are reversed. I.e.: when filtering for downloaded episodes

Until I realised that actually it does work as expected, technically at least. From a user perspective, filtering is a bit counter-intuitive (to me, and). _Rather than 'Hide episodes [that fulfill selected criteria]' I expect(ed) 'Only show [episodes that fulfil selected criteria]._

I know I'm stupid not to read the dialog title, but I think it does show current practice may not be so intuitive. Looking at other apps I have installed, positive filtering does seem standard practice.

Now, I understand this is yet another issue where 'users may get confused if we change things', but I wanted to share this 'insight' and I'm curious to what the developers think of positive filtering in this case (especially in the imaginary circumstances the filtering was new and unknown yet to users).

title: CursorWindowAllocationException: getFeedMedia(id)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
In short, the problem is that we create cursors to retrieve additional information (image, chapter etc.) while the first cursor is still open. We end up with multiple still open (but ultimately closed) cursors.

```

    at android.database.CursorWindow.<init>(CursorWindow.java:104)
    at android.database.AbstractWindowedCursor.clearOrCreateWindow(AbstractWindowedCursor.java:221)
    at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.fillWindow(SQLiteCursor.java:154)
    at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount(SQLiteCursor.java:148)
    at android.support.design.R.getFeedImages(R.java:36874)
    at android.support.design.R.extractItemlistFromCursor(R.java:26208)
    at android.support.design.R.getFeedItem(R.java:30594)

```

title: Update interval setting input feedback
body:
There currently is no way to find out current interval/time settings.
If I set an interval value for updating before, I would expect that specific radio button to be on. (i.e. I set the interval to 12 hours, go again through interval/time introduction and re-open interval setting screen, i expect that one to be 'on')
Also, the interval setting screen closes almost immediately after selecting an interval. The only feedback to the user is the highlighted button, but that's probably (at least in my case) below the user's finger and invisible. Maybe the whole row should be highlighted, or the window should close with a bit of a delay.

title: Proposal: Default update interval of 24 hrs
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Current situation: update interval isn't set (ie every feed needs manual updating)
Proposal: update interval is set to 24 hours

Novice users aren't necessarily going through all settings. Personally I did expect auto-update to be on by default. Other news-ish apps (like email, of our public broadcaster) also do auto-update, at least on opening the app, so I'd say it's not that strange of behaviour (in today's fast-moving world).
Considering 'mobile updates' are disabled by default, there is no negative consequences for the user in terms of costs or data usage (we can assume in virtually all cases wifi is means absence of negative outcomes for users such as unexpected costs/speed deprivation).

title: Unclarity of Episode Cleanup
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
**Two questions about wording:**
What does this function do exactly: Remove = 'remove from queue' or 'delete media file'?

What does 'if space is needed' imply: episode cleanup will be performed only when episode cache is full (as in number of items in the queue = or > cache setting) [rather than continuously checking if an episode/file should be removed]?

**And one about the relation to auto-delete:**
These settings seem somewhat overlapping, no? Shouldn't they be merged? I find the settings a bit confusing.

**Remark about the location**
Why is this placed under the Network section? I would expect it close (just below) 'Auto Delete', or if not there at least some other place than Network - it doesn't really have anything _directly_ to do with network/(wifi/mobile) data use?.

title: loading completed downloads takes unreasonably long
body: Sometimes loading the completed downloads screen takes unreasonably long (over 1 minute). Other screens such as the page for a podcast also sometimes takes very long, but this might be due to loading content from the internet. The completed downloads screen on the other hand should only need local data and should take at most 1 second to load.

title: Replaced checkboxes with switches in preference screen
body:
According to [material design specs](https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/selection-controls.html#selection-controls-radio-button)

```
If you have a single option, avoid using a checkbox and use an on/off switch instead.
```

Each selection item in the preference screen have one checkbox to toggle an option on/off, which in this case would make more sense to use a Switch control instead of a checkbox.

title: Refreshing feeds seems to take a long time, apparently
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
I just upgraded from 1.4.0.12 to 1.4.1.4 (f-droid repository) and antennapod now seems to take a very long time when refreshing feeds: instead of 5-6 seconds per feed, often almost 20-30 seconds: indeed often my screen goes off for power saving (30 seconds) and the refresh icon is still running in circles.

Anyway, as soon as I turn on the screen, the feed is always updated.

So I tried this:
- press "update feed"
- wait 5-6 seconds (the average time it usually took for refresh in previous versions) and turn off the screen (press power button)
- wait 1 second and turn on the screen

And the feed is almost always refreshed!

So it seems the refresh process is running at the usual speed, but it's not properly displayed on the screen, it takes some triggering event (screen power off-on) to have the display status updated.

I also tried deleting and re-adding feeds, but this doesn't affect the problem.

title: Lower memory usage
body:
Doesn't really fix #1464, but should have positive impact on memory. (At least it doesn't hurt)

 http://stackoverflow.com/a/31062339/5369600
Basically, `wrap_content` is bad for images, because Glide would still has to load the full image. We should only use `match_parent` and fixed dp size.

title: Tea and Jeopardy advent episodes lock out control
body:
If one of the Advent 2015 episodes of Tea and Jeopardy is played either by manually playing it or by being the next episode during continuous playback then when it has finished antennapod will not allow me  to play another episode(of any podcast) either via manual selection or via continuous playback.  Nor can I repeat the episode in question.  
Similarly if I have continuous playback off and the episode before and Advent Tea & Jeopardy finishes then the Advent episode is shown as the current episode but I cannot play it or any other episode.  
The background colour of play buttons changes when I press them indicating that the press has been detected but nothing else changes.
Deleting the problem episode, marking it as played and removing it from the queue make no difference.  The only reliable mechanism I have found for regaining control is to unsubscribe from the podcast and then rebooting the phone.

http://teaandjeopardy.geekplanetonline.com/?feed=podcast

title: Fix refresh indicator and (queue) dragging while downloading
body:
Resolves #1462 
Fixes feed refresh indicator in queue, episodes and feed overview.

Another optimization: When downloading, I chose to refresh the whole list because the change animation for a single list item looked pretty stupid. Just found out I can disable it... Now only items that are actually downloaded are refreshed.
I encountered an issue on my smartphone where dragging while downloading dropped the item at the current position (when the download progresses are updated). This change seems to fix it.

title: Refreshing Feed(s): Indicator keeps rotating
body:
The last AntennaPod update (1.4.1.4) seems to have affected the refresh process on my phone (HTC one M8, KitKat v.4.4.4).  When I press the refresh arrow, the arrow icon continues to "circle" and only stops when the phone goes into sleep mode (after which the new episodes are loaded). It used to be a fast process and I never had any problems before this update.

I love this app - any help resolving this issue would be much appreciated.

title: Playback resumed after call -> headphone disconnect -> call end
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When I have a podcast playing and I get a phone call, the podcast pauses as it should. Before picking up the phone I disconnect the headphones as I prefer just using the phone for phone calls. After the call ends, playback resumes over the phone speakers instead of waiting for me to also plug the headphones back in. In my opinion this is not desirable behaviour.
I feel it would be better if headphone disconnect playback pause and phone call playback pause mechanisms were entirely independent, and reconnects/call ends of one didn't restart the playback paused by the other mechanism.

I'm using AntennaPod 1.4.1.4 on a Nexus 5 running android 6.0. The AP settings that seem relevant are as follows:
Headphones Disconnect - ON
Headphones Reconnect - ON
Pause for Interruptions - ON
Resume after Call - ON

Reproduction steps
- Set settings as above
- Start playback over wired headphones, turn off screen
- Get called
- Disconnect headphones
- Answer call
- End call
  -> result: playback starts over speakers

title: Handle redirects with relative URL correctly 2.0
Handle redirects with relative URL correctly
body:
For testing:
Relative redirect: http://test.mfietz.de/redirect/path (sends "Location: /redirect/foo")
Path-relative redirect: http://test.mfietz.de/redirect/rel-path (sends "Location: foo")

Both should redirect to http://test.mfietz.de/redirect/foo

Resolves #1445

title: Feed URL redirect is not parsed properly
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Relative HTTP 301 redirect is used here:
http://www.sciencefriday.com/audio/scifriaudio.xml
You can see it with curl:

```
< HTTP/1.1 301 Moved Permanently
< Location: /feed/podcast/podcast-episode
```

This should make the feed URL get rewritten to `http://www.sciencefriday.com/feed/podcast-episode`. Instead, it becomes just `/feed/podcast/podcast-episode` -- which is not a valid URL and feed errors out from then on

P.S. version: 1.4.1.3 commit 397a6fd

Usually I want to select a recent Podcast from the bottom of the queue and, thus, I have to scroll down again and again which is annoying.

title: Difficult queue reordering
body:
Hi,
this is on a Moto G running Cyanogenmod 12.1 (Android 5.1.1) and Antennapod 1.4.0.12 from F-Droid.

It seems it has become very difficult to reorder episodes in the queue, especially when moving the episode causes the view to scroll.

One example which almost always seems to mess up the queue:
- Grab the first episode by the points on the left
- Move it down until the view begins to scroll
  Here already the first issue comes up: It is very difficult to control by what amount the view scrolls - just a little more makes the list scroll very fast almost immediately.
- When now trying to scroll less fast I almost always get one or more of the following symptoms:
  -- Other episodes being moved as well
  -- Two episodes (other than the moved one) perpetually interchanging positions
  This makes it very difficult to move only one episode more than a few positions without messing up the queue.

I have noticed that there seems to be a related bug #1409 with similar issues which however was closed for the version (1.4.0.12) I am experiencing the issues here.

I have made a small video so you can see what I mean. (Finger position indicated by the dot)

http://www.file-upload.net/download-11090432/antennapod.mp4.html

In the video, the queue first contains episode 69..80 of the "Mythen" Podcast (yellow icon), ordered, with other episodes behind. I try to pull the uppermost episode downwards three times and you can see how the whole queue gets messed up.

Thanks for the good work for the app which I use everyday & hope that helps,
Stefan

title: More smark options
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Usually podcasts last way longer than songs, 60 and 90 minutes are quite common. And many of them have 'garbage' (ads, uncut overlapping times from other contiguous chapters or programs), that you would like to skip especially at the end of the episode, all while considering current episode as fully played.

I guess that this is why a 'smart mark as played' optional time is offered; you can currently choose between No and 15/30/45/60 seconds.

I would like to request to expand this to allow to select for several minutes. For example, my typical podcast has usually around 5 minutes of overlapping content at the end I have to skip to go to next episode. I would bet that 5 minutes for something 60/90/120 minutes long is way more frequent than 60 seconds, the longest I can choose. Adding 5 and 10 minutes to the current available options would more or less make it for many people with minimal developer effort.

Alternatively, I would rather prefer to let me choose the amount in seconds I want, instead of being only offered a closed set of predefined values. This way developers would not need to guess which options to offer, simply let the user enter what they feel it fits him. That would be slightly more complicated to code, but not much; perhaps only some code to prevent absurdly high or negative values to be accepted would be in order for safety.

title: Problems in episode replay just after playing
body:
I ran into some problems when trying to replay an episode that I just finished playing.

As soon as the episode finishes playing, its entry in the episode list becomes "grayed out", and there's no way to play it again: the "play" icon is actually stuck in the "pause" state, and the time navigation bar is unresponsive.
Please note that the "Auto delete" setting is off (and I can see the downloaded file is still in the media folder).

If I close antennapod, open it again and try to play the episode (which is still grayed out):
- sometimes the app still behaves as described above
- sometimes the app crashes when I click on the episode ("Unfortunately antennapod has stopped").
- sometimes I can replay the episode by long pressing on it and selecting "Reset playback position", but then there is no way to control playback (pause, seek, stop), and playback goes on even if I close or kill the application!

I'm using version 1.4.0.12 from the f-droid repository, on android 4.2.2

title: Also handle rewind/previous media buttons
body:
Makes #1413 right.

Basically, I thought those onPlay() etc methods would somehow get called by Android. Turns out, basically anytime onMediaButtonEvent() is called and there is a default implementation in MediaSession (non-support) that calls the appropriate method for a keycode.
Because we don't want the default and looking at the keycodes ourselves is no big fuzz, we can do all of this manually.

Really hope that settles it...

More information: https://github.com/android/platform_frameworks_base/blob/master/media/java/android/media/session/MediaSession.java#L728

title: Error (Unknown error) and freezing using Sonic media player
body:
I'm struggling to get variable speed playback working in Antennapod.  I started with 1.3.4.1 and Prestissimo, but I couldn't get playback to work consistently (would crash either at the beginning or end of just about everything I tried to listen to).  I uninstalled Prestissimo, joined the beta program, and downloaded 1.4.0.10, and tried using "Sonic media player" instead, and experienced similar symptoms.  I tried Prestissimo with 1.4.0.10, and the same problems happened.

Here are the symptoms:
- Many episodes just won't start playing.  I press "play", and the play icon changes to a pause icon, but no playback occurs. The time index does not increase.  I can't get playback again until I force-stop Antennapod and restart it.  I haven't figured out if this is podcast- or episode-specific yet; it seems to happen randomly.
- Transition between one episode and the next (continuous playback) causes playback to stop.  The error dialog "Error (Unknown error)" pops up, and again I have to force-stop antennapod.

All problems go away if I disable "Sonic media player" in the settings (and don't have Prestissimo installed) before I first attempt to start playback.  It doesn't seem to matter what the speed setting is; the mere fact of having Sonic enabled causes this behavior.

I'm on CM11 on an xt907.  Is there a way for me to provide any additional useful debugging info for this?  Would love to help get varispeed playback working reliably...

title: Understanding translation
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
So I suspect the following files are related to translation of AP, but could someone confirm, correct and/or expand if needed?
- [AntennaPod/.tx/config](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/.tx/config)  The transifex project configuration. Indicates which translation files (eg trans.fr or trans.sv_SE) need to be placed in which folder in the codebase
- [AntennaPod/core/src/main/res/](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/tree/develop/core/src/main/res)  The folder in the codebase where all translation files are stored. Each language has its own folder, eg values-fr or values-sv-rSE, with in that folder a strings.xml file.
- [AntennaPod/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/util/LangUtils.java](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/core/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/core/util/LangUtils.java)  creates an array in the app with language codes and their written-out names.

And finally, another question:
If I'd change the Transifex configuration file and do a pull request to add another language that's been translated on Transifex (and let's say the PR gets accepted), would that mean that automatically with the next import from Transifex (by the main developers), the right folders in AntennaPod/core/src/main/res/ would be created?

title: Introducing a language threshold
body:
Following the discussion in #1369 and earlier thoughts, I would like to propose a translation threshold for including languages in the app. If a language has less than that threshold translated (the 'English' resource, not considering the description or changelog), then we shouldn't provide it in the app. This would create a cleaner interface in the app itself. But it also relates to the question of claiming which languages you support in Google play, maybe later on the website as well: if you have just 50% translated, than it wouldn't be fair to claim that language is supported. Though a bit arbitrarily, I would suggest a threshold of 75%. This would cut off the following languages: - Hebrew (Israel) 74% [he_IL] - Russian (Russia) 74% [ru_RU] - Polish (Poland) 68% [pl_PL] - Danish 68% [da] - Portuguese (Brazil) 62% [pt_BR] - Greek 59% [el]
NOTE: Greek is currently not imported from Transifex either - Hindi (India) 52% [hi_IN] - Italian 49% [it]
NOTE: Italian (Italy) // 85% // Nov 01, 04:03p.m. // [it_IT] _is_ available, so `it_IT` can be used for `it` - Romanian (Romania) 44% [ro_RO] - Azerbaijani 38% [az] - Spanish (Spain) 35% [es_ES]
NOTE: Spanish // 100% // Nov 03, 05:03p.m. // [es] _is_ available, so `es`can be used for `es_ES` - and other languages with less than 35% of the strings translated I put the languages that _will_ be available on the wiki: [Supported languages](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/wiki/Supported-languages) I would be willing to spend some time activating people to update the languages that are just below the threshold.

title: Norwegian (Bokml) not imported from Transifex
body:
Comparing the list of [languages translated](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/wiki/Supported-languages) to [this Transifex import list](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/.tx/config) (if that indeed is what it is), it seems that Norwegian Bokml (Norway) // 99% // Nov 01, 04:03p.m. // [nb_NO] is fully translated but not imported from Transifex.

`Bokml ([bukml], literally "book tongue") is an official written standard for the Norwegian language, alongside Nynorsk. Bokml is the preferred written standard of Norwegian for 85% to 90%[2] of the population in Norway.` ([Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bokm%C3%A5l))

Given the above, I assume [nb_NO] strings could also be used to cover [no].

title: Update feed URL when redirected
body:
Frankly, inceptor is not the only solution, but the easiest.

Another would be the HttpDownloader, but it gets far more complicated. We would have to check prior requests, if one of those was redirected. Then, the DownloadRequest source (download url) would have to be non-final. Next, we would have to check any code that used the DownloadRequest if it assumes the source field to be final and so on (e.g. when removing the requests from the current downloads).

I think it is easier to update the field when we encounter a redirect. I don't think there is any other reason for a feed URL to change, so we actually don't need to update a saved feed's URL when refreshing the same.

title: Implement voting system
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body:
It makes it easier for AP supporters/backers to promote their favourite feature, for developers to check which features are most popular, and for userbase in general to engage with AP.
- Registration is really simple
- Maintaining seems doable, meaning there's not much project maintainers need to do except for closing implemented features. Unfortunately, the system doesn't rely on GitHub data and new feature 'requests' created on the platform don't lead to features created on FeatHub, and vice versa. However, the community (including me) can make sure cross-linking happens between feature requests on GitHub and FeatHub.

A list of the most-voted features can be [embedded](http://feathub.com/feathub/feathub/+1) in the AP website and/or the project page here on GitHub.

(I found this as I was originally searching something to implement [this voting-system](https://widget.uservoice.com/omnibox/ZvXzkjQWXCAPzzA85v84cg?mode=support&locale=en&forum_id=137101&contact_us=true&mixpanel_channel=site2_sidebar&embed_type=inline) in an easy way).

title: Convert line endings from CRLF to LF.

- Please make sure to configure your [Git config](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Configuration#Formatting-and-Whitespace) to automatically convert
  line endings for your operating system. The repository should however
  only contain files with Unix line endings `LF`. Otherwise a full file
  diff will constantly appear in the working directory.
- This commit introduces **no code changes**.

title: User survey
label: [Label(name="project issue")]
body:
To improve the website (https://github.com/AntennaPod/antennapod.github.io/issues/4), prepare for a 'Warm welcome' (#1329) and prepare for a new logo (#1281), it would be nice to start a user survey to gather some input from the users of AntennaPod.

This survey could cover the following **topics**:
- Feature usage frequency
- Most-liked currently implemented features (Ranking)
- Most-wished not-yet-implmemented features (Ranking + user input)
- Can we get in touch again for one follow-up survey? (e.g. for logo-vote)
- User-profile: country, age category, amount/situation of use, visual/hearing/other handicap that might limit usage
- Feedback/comments (Open text field)

For **data collection** we could rely on a Google form or a [Qualtrics](http://www.qualtrics.com/), [SurveyGizmo](https://www.surveygizmo.com/survey-software-features/question-types/) or [Opina](http://opinahq.com/) survey, or try to self-deploy a survey using [LimeSurvey](https://www.limesurvey.org/en/)

title: Podcast episodes repeat last few minutes
body:
For the Last 2 months or so, most of my podcasts will repeat approx the last 5 mins of the episode. So let's say a podcast is reported by AP to be 40 mins, the podcast might only be 38 mins long but will have the last 2 mins repeated.

I suspect this may be related to either pausing or skipping forward in episodes as shorter episodes do not do this. I usually skip adverts, and longer episodes i may not listen to in one go. However, I have also had intermittent problems with skipping lately as well, where skipping forward will sometimes take me back to where I started skipping from (eg I skip at the start of an advert, it tkaes me forward to half way so I skip again and I end up at where I started skipping).

My current device is HTC M8 running 5.0.1. I am on the beta program and have the latest version.

body:
I have been a regular subscriber to the "The City Church with Judah Smith", but lately when I download episodes, the audio run time is 3 or 4 times the actual length of audio for the episode and I am also having playback issues. For example, my wife has an iPhone has downloaded the last two episodes, and here is a comparison of the episode length from iTunes and AntennaPod:

Friend of Jesus - Part Three (iTunes Run Time: 45:05, AntennaPod Run Time: 2:06:35)
Friend of Jesus - Part Two (iTunes Run Time: 40:17, AntennaPod Run Time: 1:51:03)

When I let an episode play uninterrupted, it will play until the exact time listed in iTunes and then it will end and the episode will be removed from the queue even though it has not reached the end of the listed run time.  If I pause an episode and then resume play, the audio will not begin from the spot where I paused it and will jump back to near the beginning.

It seems as though something is getting corrupted with the run times because the audio quality is fine but I'm not sure why the issues are happening.

Here are some further details:
My Device:  Samsung Galaxy S5, Android Version 5.1.1
Podcast URL:  http://thecity.org/feeds/audio

Any help would be appreciated.

title: Missing option: Disable play-button on lock-screen
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body: It's not possible to disable the play-button on the lock-screen while a stream is playing. It would be great if there was an option in the settings for this.

title: Recycler view for Episodes Fragment
body:
This swaps our use of DSLV for recycler view in the Episodes Fragment.

We _SHOULD NOT_ merge this in for 1.4. Instead this will be targeted for the next version where we can build on in for RecyclerView in the Queue.

I've integrated the use of SnackBar as demonstrated by @mfietz. Ideally we'd do something more like this: https://github.com/hudomju/android-swipe-to-dismiss-undo, but we'd need it to be compatible with api 10.

title: Update translations 2015 11 03
Prefer iTunes image over everything else
body:
Problem: RSS feeds often have both an image tag and itunes:image tag. In my experience, the "normal" image tag often points nowhere or not to the image we want. The itunes tag is usually right.

Thus, we should prefer the itunes:image tag to the other tags and only use those as a fallback when the itunes tag is not present.

This is a partial solution to #1332, which might not even be a real problem after all.

title: Marshmallow: Lockscreen snaps when cover art is a gif

This does not happen all the time and i don't know how i got there. Even the pin entry dialog was doubled.

title: Feature request: Audio balance
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Feature request for an audio balance setting for the relative volume of the left and right channels.

Use case: Allowing people with reduced hearing on one ear to adjust the volume to get proper stereo effect.

UI: Most design use a slider or knob that defaults in the center as neutral and full left meaning only that channel.

title: Knowledge base
label: [Label(name="project issue")]
body:
I've been pregnant with this idea for a while. Recently @keunes reminded me of it: I think it would make a lot of sense to have some kind of knowledge base with tutorials, workarounds (known issues) and other general information.
This knowledge base could be started in the wiki. Once we got some information in it, we can integrate it into the app, either at the bottom of the settings (near about) or in the drawer.

For the tutorials, we might even have those in the app itself, through something like https://github.com/amlcurran/ShowcaseView
(My ideas go from having just screenshots explaining the steps to guiding the user visually through the app)

Long ago I was using Prestissimo but there was often an error stopping playback when ending an episode and switching to next in queue. Due to that I stopped using prestissimo.

I have been using sonic media player as default since it has been implemented and got no problem with it.
I think it would be nice to promote it as default and set it to on with x1 / x1.25 / x1.5 speed. Variable speed is a nice addition and I'm sure a lot of people do not know this feature. (And never go in parameters)

Also updated some links to use AntennaPod rather than danieloeh in them, plus updated description to be a bit more in line with Google Play Short description.

title: Google Store description: Tagline + player
body:
Re-added accidentally removed Play Store tagline for mobile devices (the "Short description").
Added word 'player' in first sentence; most apps call themselves podcasting player. Hopefully improves Google Play Store listing a bit.

title: Feed Remover: Don't let the user cancel the ProgressDialog
body:
Resolves #1304

Also considered using an IntentService or another background class.
Problem: At least two activities and one fragment react to the completed deletion in similar, but different ways. An IntentService could just send ProgressEvents, but the MainActivity would need some mechanism to find out what ("FeedRemover") actually completed.
This might not be the cleanest solution, but it should prevent the exception. One could also argue that changing only as little as possible to fix the issue is good ^^

title: Starting Bluetooth playback on reconnect doesn't always work correctly
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The best example is when your device is paired with a car stereo.  AntennaPod will start playback as soon as the device connects to the car.  However, the car stereo may not have the Bluetooth source selected. As a result AntennaPod podcasts will be playing through episodes, but the user will have no idea this is happening. As far as they're concerned they just started their car and are driving somewhere listening to the radio/cd/nothing.

One thought for how to resolve this so that it works properly for people with Bluetooth headsets is to have a setting that determines if AntennaPod will start playback on bluetooth reconnect.  It has also been suggested that AntennaPod should vibrate some when it starts playback due to a Bluetooth reconnect.

This behavior changed in AntennaPod 1.4 alpha, so I think we should try to resolve it before we release 1.4.

title: Fix datetime parsing StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
body:
Fixes #1301 

I figured, parsing is not that critical, so whenever the VM feels like throwing an exception, we should basically just ignore it.
Catching `StringIndexOutOfBoundsException` should actually be enough, but better safe than sorry. The app should not crash because some publication date might be displayed incorrectly.

title: Download retry loop when out of storage space
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
My device went into a continuous loop of attempting to download a new episode and failing with the message "Insufficient Space". This also caused the Antennapod download notification to rapidly expand and collapse. I was able to get it to stop by going into the settings and disabling auto-download.

[Download log screenshot](https://goo.gl/photos/nBCeJ7WbHLmNzJ7s9)

Solid Explorer is displaying memory usage as:
Root: 97% (28.8 MB free)
Internal Memory: 84% (1.97 GB free)

This is on the 2013 Nexus 5.

The feed url is: http://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/The-Defrag-Show/feed/mp3
I also saved a sample of the feed here: https://gist.github.com/dander/2330a550147b835fbebc

The latest episode appears to be ~33 MB, however I think there may be a problem with the feed itself. Even after cleaning up some space, I am unable to download that episode, and the file shows up as 1B in the Queue. However, the download failure loop has stopped.

title: NPE: ItemFragment Loader.loadInBackground
body:
Fixes #1290 

Mostly replaced the Loader with an Observable.

Also changed the order of some of the functions (I like to have the methods in order of the lifecycle), replaced some anonymous classes with lambdas.

EventDistributor and EventBus are register and unregistered in onResume and onPause.

title: Feature request: Option to rewind a bit when resuming playback
body: AntennaPod currently resumes playing from the position where it was paused, but it would be nice to have an option to rewind a predetermined amount of time when resuming playback. The best solution would be to make the amount of time to rewind a function of the amount of time occurred between pause and resume, up to a certain limit, like 30 seconds or so. For example, it would rewind 10 seconds if we paused for 20 seconds or rewind 20 seconds if we paused for 40. If we paused for a minute or more, it would rewind 30 seconds.

title: Buttons on bluetooth devices skip track instead of fast forwarding
body:
Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011
Android Version: 5.1
Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87
AntennaPod version: 1.4.0.2

I use my phone with two different Bluetooth audio devices. These devices both include one "forward" and one "back" button. In the past, these buttons mapped to the in-track Rewind and Fast Forward functions, which would step back/forward some number of seconds. I liked that.

It looks like this functionality changed. It seems now that the "back" hardware button on my Bluetooth devices does nothing within AntennaPod, while the "forward" button now skips to the next podcast file instead of fast forwarding in the current track.

Unfortunately, I am unable to say with confidence if this change came about because of a recent update to AntennaPod, or with the recent upgrade my phone experienced from Android KitKat to Lollipop. Please feel free to swat this down if you're confident that no such changes were made on the AntennaPod side, or if this working as intended.

Thanks for your consideration.

title: Android home screen widget requires first opening main app
body:
Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011
Android Version: 5.1
Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87
AntennaPod version: 1.4.0.2

The home screen widget is a 1-high-by-4-wide widget that lists the podcast's title, includes a track progress time indicator in the form of "current hh:mm:ss / total hh:mm:ss" and a play/pause button.

If the AntennaPod app has not recently been opened, is not listed in the recent apps list, or was at some point exited by the Android OS to clear up RAM, the widget does not fully work. In this situation, you see the most recent track's title and the play button, but no progress/total time. Upon hitting the play button, I do see it's on/off-touch actions as the background highlights, but it does not start playing. 

At this point, I see two options:

Option 1: First open the app (using its main icon or clicking elsewhere on widget) and then hit the play button. Now it's registered, and so when you go back to the widget, you now see the current/total time and the widget's play button will function.

Option 2: First open the app (using its main icon or clicking elsewhere on widget), but then do **not** actually hit the play button. Go back to the widget. If you do this, the play button will now function, but the area of the widget which _should_ show the current/total time is still blank. Once this happens, I can't figure out how to get the current/total time to show on the app again. Play/pause it as much as you want, either from the widget or within the app, it looks like the current/total time will not return to the app until the app is cleared from memory (by Android or by you manually) and you execute the steps listed above in Option 1.

I know this is really corner case stuff. You have no obligation to address my issues, I'm just happy to provide you information.

title: Android home screen widget updates progress bar every 5 seconds
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011
Android Version: 5.1
Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87
AntennaPod version: 1.4.0.2

The home screen widget is a 1-high-by-4-wide widget that lists the podcast's title, includes a track progress time indicator in the form of "current hh:mm:ss / total hh:mm:ss" and a play/pause button.

I noticed that they current playback time does not update every second, but instead only ever 5 seconds. So if you stare at it while it's playing, instead of seeing 00:02:43... 00:02:44... 00:02.45..., etc, over the course of 20 seconds, you will only see 00:02:43... 00:02:48... 00:02:53... 00:02:58.. 00:03:03.

This may be intentional to reduce battery/resource consumption, or may be a limitation of Android's widget refresh rate, but I figured it was worth mentioning.

title: Updated description
body:
As @TomHennen suggested in https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/1152#issuecomment-138323471, I've been working on re-writing the app description.

**Below is my proposal. If you feel like adapting it, it's easiest to go over to [this TitanPad](https://titanpad.com/9y3ic3NMWv).** Please do fill in your GitHub username if you make changes; it makes any discussion easier. Please also provide some explanation if you changed things in the chat facility there.

I'll only do a PR to change https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/develop/description/en.txt if some consensus has been reached on the change (hence the TitanPad).
# Proposed description

With AntennaPod you get instant access to millions of free and paid podcasts, from independent podcasters to large publishing houses such as the BBC, NPR and CNN. Add, import and export their feeds hassle-free using the iTunes podcast database, OPML files or simple RSS URLs. Save effort, battery power and mobile data usage with powerful automation controls for downloading episodes (specify times, intervals and WiFi networks) and deleting episodes (based your favourites and delay settings).

But most importantly: Download, stream or queue episodes and enjoy them the way you like with adjustable playback speeds, chapter support and a sleep timer. And show your podlove to the content creators with our Flattr integration.

Made by podcast-enthousiast, AntennaPod is free in all senses of the words: open source, no costs, no ads.

All features:
- Easily add and import feeds via the iTunes and gPodder.net directories, OPML files and RSS or Atom links
- Manage playback from anywhere: homescreen widget, system notification and earplug and bluetooth controls
- Enjoy listening your way with adjustable playback speed, chapter support (MP3, VorbisComment and Podlove) and an advanced sleep timer (shake to reset, lower volume and slow down playback)
- Take control over automated downloading: choose feeds, exclude mobile networks, select specific WiFi networks, require the phone to be charging and set times or intervals
- Manage storage by setting the amount of cached episodes, smart deletion (based on your favourites and play status) and selecting your preferred location
- Share episodes and feeds through advanced social media and email options, the gPodder.net services and via OPML export
- Support content creators with Flattr integration including automatic flattring
- Keep track of the best of the best by marking episodes as favourites
- Find back that one episode through the playback history or by searching (titles and shownotes)
- Access password-protected feeds and episodes
- Take advantage of paged feeds (www.podlove.org/paged-feeds)
- Back-up your subscriptions with the gPodder.net integration and OPML export

title: More extensive Cleanup settings
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
# Current (as per #1241)

![cleanup_settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5216560/10257690/df66355e-6926-11e5-9ff2-75c2ad425fc3.png)
# Enhencement

A bit more flexibility in these settings could be nice:

**Remove episodes:**
- After: [radio buttons]
  - completing playback [default]
  - pausing(/skipping) or completing playback
- With a delay of: [dropdown]
  - 0 days (immediately)
  - 1 day [default]
  - 3 days 
  - 5 days
  - 7 days
- But exclude: [checkboxes]
  - favourites [default: Y]
  - episodes in the queue [default: Y]

The advantage of adding 'remove after pausing' is that if you loose interest of an episode and tap 'next' halfway through, these episodes can be automatically deleted after a while and won't take up memory space indefinitely.

**What if you just pause and want to listen to an episode later again?**
Because many people just pause an episode with the intention to listen to it again later, this option should not be the default. In practice, this setting I imagine will almost always be applied in combination with a delay of a couple of days; when the episode has not been restarted after those days, there's probably a lack of interest (this would be my use case, with a setting of 5 days).

**inspiration**
Use-case of @charlesay in #1262.

title: Playback Broken
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
I recently flashed my phone to the factory image and now Playback on Antenna Pod is borked. This may be related to issue #1223.

Longer podcasts take a few seconds (~2-5 sec) to begin playback, then stop playing after ~3 minutes; if you press play after it stops 3 minutes into playback, it plays again for ~3 minutes -- repeat.

Sometimes podcasts will not play at all. this happens especially when I try to play another podcast after pressing play on another one before it has started playing (during that 2-5 second buffer timeframe).

---

**Symptoms:**
- Playback only works on occasion.
- Playback only continues for ~3 to 3:20 minutes.

**Tested With Episodes**
- Roosterteeth Podcast: 343
- Planet Money: 657, 656

**Specs:**
- Android 4.4.4
- Moto G Generation 1
- AntennaPod Version 1.3.1, Commit 2f55256 (From fDroid)

title: Playback position regularly moves back to pre-last position after pause
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Often, but I can't tell in which cases exactly, the playback position of an item regularly moves back to pre-last position after pause. What I mean with that is:
- I play an item and pause it (playback time A). (some stuff happens in between) then play again and pause again (playback time B)
- when resuming the play again, the progress bar and currently playing position show correct data (playback time B) for half a second or so, but then changes to playback time A.

What I don't know:
- if it happens only when I pause it via the lock screen, or when playback gets paused when I unplug my earbuds, or when I manually pause it in the playing bar at the bottom or the system notification
- if it happens with certain 'some stuff happens in between' (i.e. play another item, refresh feeds, shutdown phone, check email, etc)
- if it also happens if I only paused once (playback time A being 0, basically) [I think it does sometimes, but I'm not sure]

This issue has been present for quite a while (throughout some different versions). Don't know why I only reported it now. I have not enabled prestissimo. The issue plays up I think for different feeds.

I found it rather cumbersome to note down every single pause and the consequence in daily use (playback gets paused rather often) and thus I didn't do it. Any feedback on if it's really necessary to do so (to provide more detailed info) or on other means of getting more detailed info is appreciated.

AP v. 1.3.4.1 on Android 4.2.2

PS. My quick-fix is to pay attention to the position when I hit play, so that I can manually scroll to that position again.

title: Info not updated after reset playback position

Info **is** updated after screen turns off (inactivity), after scrolling the item off-screen or changing screens (go to feed view, for example).
Expected behaviour to give immediate feedback that the playback position was reset.

title: Rewind after pause feature
body:
This pull request resolves #620 feature request.

The playback is rewinded X seconds after the pause and resume. The rewind duration depends on time that elapsed between the pause and resume. User is not able to customize the rewind duration right now.

I have chosen following constants (can be easily changed):
- podcast rewinds:
  - 0 seconds - if pause < 3 minutes
  - 2 seconds - if pause > 3 minutes
  - 5 seconds - if pause > 1 hour
  - 10 seconds - if pause > 1 day

I have chosen these constants based on my gut feelings and observation of the other apps such as Audible.

title: PROTOCOL_ERROR
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Recently I tried to listen to the System Mastery podcast. The feed's here:

http://feeds.feedburner.com/SystemmasteryPodcasts?format=xml

It's hosted on Wordpress. The feed loads fine but I get a PROTOCOL_ERROR in AntennaPod. I get the same error in Pocketcasts. The audio files download just fine with desktop clients, curl, etc. The System Mastery folks are at a loss as they didn't change anything, but were getting reports from their users things didn't work properly.

I went looking around and found this issue:

https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/1897

so it's possible that there is some change in Android 5.x that in combination with a server change (HTTP 2 support on part of Wordpress?) triggers this problem.

I recently learned another podcast, Heavy Cardboard, also hosted on Wordpress, is experiencing very similar issues with Pocket Casts. According to them Pocket Casts is working on a fix but I figured I'd inform you too.

http://feeds.feedburner.com/HeavyCardboardPodcast?format=xml

title: Updated playback tests to make them more reliable
body:
1. Added a idle sync at some key points to make sure all the actions were actually done.
2. Instead of using a stand-alone PlaybackController we're using the external controller since the stand-alone controller wasn't always notified when media was initially loaded (I suspect media was started in more than loadMediaInfo when playback first starts).  This _should_ be more realistic in the long run.
3. Resolved one or two conditional tests that were actually testing the wrong thing

The relatively long string changed only a little, however, and I would prefer to update my previous translation rather than thinking of a new one. Would it be possible to recover this string somehow?

title: Can't mark an in progress item as 'Played'

Phone: Motorola Moto X 2011
Android Version: 5.1
Kernel version: 3.4.42-g756aa87

I have my phone synced to my car's Bluetooth, and am able to play audio. When I turn off the car, playback pauses, as expected. But when I then hit "play" on the phone, the progress bar does not activate, and the "play" button does not change to "pause". I need to then open up Android's task manager, kill AntennaPod, then open it again, at which point I see a popup stating that the AntennaPod app had crashed. I click OK, open AntennaPod again, and now playback starts working again.

In fact, the same scenario plays out when I go from playing on my phone's speaker, to starting playback over Bluetooth.

title: Make Text Readable On Download Notification

title: Cleanup algorithm updates
body:
Here I am on my vacation submitting updates...

fixes #1234 and fixes #1060 

Preferences now has an 'Episode Cleanup' option that allows the user to specify how they want their episodes removed or deleted. The default is "if it isn't in the queue or favorites then it is eligible to be deleted if stuff needs to be downloaded".  However the user may override this and choose some other other setting.  They may choose "never' or any of 0, 1, 3, 5, and 7 days after the episode has completed playback.

I'm open to any suggestions on how/if things should be reworded.

I'm also willing to entertain some sort of indicator on an episode (perhaps in Completed Downloads) that shows it is eligible for deletion.  I have _no_ idea what that indicator should look like though.

I also went through and fixed the PreferencesTest which wasn't checking the results of waitForCondition().

![device-2015-10-02-165820](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5216560/10257690/df66355e-6926-11e5-9ff2-75c2ad425fc3.png)

title: Use built in APIs in Android 6.0 for variable speed playback
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body: API 23 added the PlaybackParams class that allows for (among other things) setting playback pitch and speed. These params can be attached to a MediaPlayer object. Because of this, Prestissimo should be considered deprecated as of Android 6.0. Use the native API instead.

title: Feature request: auto-remove played episodes after a delay
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Sometimes I want to re-listen to an episode after I've finished it. Sometimes because I did not understand or did not pay attention to some detail, or because I want to investigate further on something that was said, or even because I want to play the episode (or a portion of it) to a friend.

For such reasons, I do not want to auto-remove episodes as soon as they are finished. Instead, I'd prefer to have an option to auto-remove finished episodes after 1 day, or 2 days, or 7 days, 

Currently, I have to either manually delete the episodes, which is a pain; or to re-download an episode (which can be impossible if I'm not on a good Wi-Fi).
