title: Adapt variable speed preference dialog for sonic
body:
![pref](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/10122980/0d1c0c9e-652b-11e5-915a-f7afe1a35258.png)

(Yep, on older devices, the content part is scrollable!)
- Fixed issue in Sonic player where switching would cause an unknown error (calling pause when in prepared state was considered an error)
- Variable Speed dialog: Thought it would be a good idea to mention sonic and allow the user to enable it instead of installing prestissimo.
- Now full dialog needed stacked buttons...
- Disable respective button when play store is not available or the android version is too low
- When switching to sonic, the media extractor doesn't give us the correct position after seeking. So, whenever the media player position doesn't seem to make sense, we have a look at the current playable

(I know, it's rather odd that enabling sonic is the negative action and closing the dialog is the neutral one. But that is the order that makes most sense to me when displayed in the dialog)

Fixes #1230

body: AutoCloseable isn't available on all APIs

title: Prestissimo has to be installed for Playback Speeds preference
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
On last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) there is a new experimental built-in option to use sonic media player as replacement for prestissimo but you still need to have prestissimo installed.

If you do not install it you can't set play speed option (It asks to download prestissimo) and you can't change speed in player view which do not have speed switch button.

title: Bug in sleep timer when shake to reset is not set
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) implemented shake to reset (and vibrate) in sleep timer.
When shake to reset is not set antennapod dial down sound but do not stop playing.

Beside you end up stuck with a low sound level. The only way to get back normal sound level is to set sleep timer with shake to reset and let it stop playing audio.

title: Episode should not be deleted when preference to "not remove items from queue when skipping" is on
body:
On last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) skipping episode delete episode which force you to download it again.
I think when you're skipping an episode and set preference to not remove episodes from queue it shouldn't delete episode.

title: Podcast Episode List hangs On Force Close
body:
I just build AntennaPod on my device using the latest Develop branch (an hour old), and found a situation in which the app hangs.
1. Add a podcast

3. Open Android recent app list, and swipe away AntennaPod
4. Open the app, and it should try to open the podcast episode list you were just in, but instead it will hang.

Note: this doesn't happen with the Play Store release of this app. I am also using Android M P3 on Nexus 5.

Edit: Just downloaded the new PlayStore release and am experiencing the same issue.

title: Antennapod feature request - "Cog Gears" + Filters + Sort for Downloaded Episodes.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Antennapod feature request - "Cog Gears" multiselection for Downloaded Episodes.

---

Hello Antennapodders,

Good work and many thanks! 

Here is a feature request for a workflow:
- Please enable the enhanced "cog gears and filter" multiselect interface, as it exists for the Podcast Episode listing, for the "Completed Downloads" group. (This button appears in the top row of icons)

My particular circumstance (Antennapod 1.3.4.1 dark theme- Samsung S4 mini running AICP custom ROM):

I've downloaded LOTS of episedes while I have a good wifi connection. They all enqueue, which is good, but for so many it's hard to sort them properly. So I actually cleared the queue of 145 episodes and now its quite difficult to rebuild it.

When I go to the Downloads section via the side bar, I find myself on the blank Running slide-tab. Since any particular user is only actually running the downloads for a short period, it might be better to have "Completed" as the initial display.

On the completed slide-tab, I've got the rubbish bin icons on the right to delete individual episodes, but I can't multiselect, filter, group or sort the downloaded episodes. 

If this Completed Downloads interface had the enhanced filtering and multi-select,  we'd be able to 1) rebuild the queue much more efficiently, 2) bulk delete accidentally downloaded, 3) use sort and filter to review the entire collection.
## 

This appears to have a similar background to #1209" Add filter and sort options to the "All episodes" view #1209 "

Apologies if this has been requested or phrased in a different thread. I just signed onto Github with Antennapod as the catalyst (hooray!)....and while I think I saw something similar in the issues archive, for the life of me I cannot find the thread!

title: FR: replace share menu by dialog
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
As first proposed by @mfietz in #905 (Share website url comes out as share url), I would like to execute the share menu by a dialog. Also, this would be an opportunity to unify sharing across the 'currently playing' screen (which uses a second menu) and the 'feed overview' screen (where there are two options in the top-right menu).

I think this will make sharing easier, especially from the currently playing screen as it takes some proper attention to discern the different menu options. Also, this should lead to fewer steps needed to share*.

**From Currently playing/Episode screen**
![share_episode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11229646/10025494/7ae8d106-6154-11e5-9192-ae3c6ad5b8cc.jpg)
Options:
. Episode webpage VS File URL
. Episode title (Y/N)
. Timestamp (Y/N) [grayed out if episode hasn't been started to play/isn't playing]

**From Feed overview screen**
![share_podcast](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11229646/10025493/7ae7d738-6154-11e5-87f9-5c4d26a1565a.jpg)
Options:
. Podcast webpage VS RSS URL
. Feed title (Y/N)
. Author (Y/N)

(*)  This requires last picked options to be remembered.
Current: 1 tap menu icon, 2 tap share, 3 tap wanted option in second menu
After proposed changes (see #1170 for proposal to include share icon in currently playing screen): 1 tap share icon, 2 tap 'share' in dialog

PS. I didn't want to continue in issue #905, as it was originally about sth else.

title: Update playback notification
body:
Updated the notification bar to show the skip episode action (was necessary to improve lock screen controls on 5.0+).

The number of options displayed depends on if you have continuous playback and/or persistent notifications enabled.

Swapped the feed title with the episode title since 1) it made more sense this way and 2) there's more room for the episode title given the smaller font.

Got rid of the time that was displayed.

Also updated how skipping episodes works. Now, by default, when you skip and episode it isn't removed from the queue.  If you still want that behavior there's a setting that will do it for you.

Unfortunately I'm not sure we can get the expanded notification on the lock screen.

title: Favorites
body:
Users now have the ability to tag an item as a 'favorite' and see all those items in a list under 'Episodes'.  In the future if something is marked as favorite it will have other effects.

Should probably take a second look at #538 now.

Address some of #851.

title: Alternative to Prestissimo [4.1+] and other annoyances
body:
Audio players were moved to an external library.

While testing the new sonic audio player, I got annoyed with test failures not actually caused by the changes, so I replaced some of the AsyncTasks with RxJava. At last, I managed to run all (new) sonic tests successfully. Using the new player in the app has been no issue, so far (Honestly, can't remember a single issue...)

Still, tests fail once in a while (e.g. in teardown(), saying that the database pool has already been closed). I tend to have a quick look and if it is one of the usual suspects, I just ignore it...
Another source of errors is the custom UndoBar thingy, which will hopefully be replaced by Snackbar soon.

Also fixed the about link handling, which was already part of the retracted #1208

title: Allow only alphanumeric and a few other characters in media filenames
body:
Resolves #1203

Instead of replacing a few special characters that we know are not allowed in filenames, only allow that few characters (alphanumeric, spaces and so on) that are unproblematic.

Also considered applying this the generation of the directory name, but I fear this could break backward compatibility. Current feeds with special characters in their title (that might create issues on some devices or file systems) could end up with a second directory for their media files.
While this would probably not be a problem I didn't want to risk fixing one issue and creating another.

All tests completed successfully.

title: Add option to override automatic download setting
body:
Currently automatic download is global setting.

It would be good to have ability to override that for individual podcasts. (ie. "Force automatic download" or "disable automatic download" in the podcast settings)

title: Add filter and sort options to the "All episodes" view
body:
It would be nice to have option to filter episodes in the "All episodes" view.

For example only show downloaded episodes for easier manual deletion. Currently this type of filtering is only possible in the postcast view but not in "All episodes"

title: Prestissimo replacement and normalizers [4.1+]
body:
This PR introduces two new experimental features:
(1) A replacement for prestissimo, the sonic media player. Might use a little more CPU, but CPU measuring tools hardly showed any difference.  When playing, I could not hear any difference to the prestissimo plugin.
(2) Normalizers. Adapted several different normalizers. Can be changed while playing.

![prefs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/9913196/e1d6b0a2-5cab-11e5-9684-19b57c80b9e2.png)

Licenses were added to about, also fixed issues when clicking an url and when pressing the back button:

![about](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/9913218/fe30af28-5cab-11e5-8876-0af2d0882b31.png)

Resolves #856

title: dial playback speed down to 1.0 during sleep timer
body:
This idea results from reading through the sleep timer improvements implemented with #1072 :-) Those could IMHO be supported by a function to dynamically reduce the playback speed (if [Prestissimo](https://github.com/TheRealFalcon/Prestissimo) is installed) from whatever the user has set to 1.0. It could work by simply distributing the `Playback Speeds` steps along the `Sleep Timer`'s time axis with the 1st "downstep" happening immediately.

Example: Speeds 1.0, 1.25, 1.5 and 1.75 are set upBefore starting the timer, playback is at 1.5x. Setting the sleep timer to 20min, the first 10min play at 1.25 (immediate downstep) and the last 10 at 1.0. If 1.75x was used before and 30min are then timed, 10min each would play at 1.5, 1.25 and 1.0.

title: Lockscreen background, media session and playback state
body:
![lockscreen](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/9860746/4ea2d2ee-5b2e-11e5-801c-c6cf8c11c1c0.png)
(Cover of http://www.npr.org/sections/money/)

The next button doesn't actually mean there is another episode in the queue, it might end the playback altogether.

APod is now able to set the lockscreen background. It is a preference: There are probably a lot of people that prefer their own background image to the episode image on the lockscreen.
Maybe "lockscreen background" is a bit misleading: Basically, any other app/service that is "listening" (that receives MediaSession information) can read that image and show it. If enabled, watch apps will also be able to show the cover. "Cover art"? Not sure it this is any better, might only be more confusing.
Because of Glide, the meta data is updated in a background thread. Not sure if executing on the executor service is the best idea or if this should just run in its own thread... I guess we'll see if this leads to unwanted behavior

Receiving media button events from external apps also seems to work now.

Resolve #762

title: version 1.3.4.0
Do not acquire wakelock when Prestissimo backed mediaplayer is created
body:
Code changes inspired by https://github.com/android/platform_frameworks_base/blob/master/media/java/android/media/MediaPlayer.java

What was happening here?
When a ServiceBackedMediaPlayer was created on startup but the current episode is paused (we played an episode and restarted the app; external player is at the bottom, but paused), the media player already acquired a wakelock without needing it. This would only get justified when the user actually started playing.
So, now the wakelock is only acquired if it was held when the method was called.

Resolves #1110

title: Freeing up space in the nav drawer
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body:
As to not take over the main discussion in #836 about a special feeds-screen, I'll continue the discussion here about my proposal to move down the 'add podcast' entry in the navigation drawer to below the list of individual feeds, plus the proposal to unpin settings, both in order to free up space higher up in the menu. My reply to the comments by @Cathryne:

> Do I understand correctly, that these suggestions would make the "distance-to-option" dependent on the number of subscribed podcasts?

Yes

> If yes, why punish listeners with many subscriptions in this way?

Well, I guess that's one way to look at it ^^ Instead of focussing on a negative attitude of developers/the programme ('punishing the listeners'), I would like to look at the likelyhood of an option being used. I don't know about you, but personally, and I would think many users with me, tap on a feed in the drawer far more often than they tap on 'Add podcast'. If this is indeed is the case for most users, then to me it only makes sense to put the 'add podcast' entry below the feed list in the drawer. The less often a function gets used, the higher its' "distance-to-option" can be (and vice versa). Plus, the larger the list of 

> It's IMHO fine to have a few items pinned (configurable & rather at the top, than at the bottom, but hey!).

Sure, it's absolutely fine to have a few items pinned. But, again, following the reasoning above, the "distance-to-option" relative to how often a function is used, would make it only logical to not have the settings pinned. Indeed this is in line with (current) [Material Design guide](http://www.google.be/design/spec/patterns/navigation-drawer.html#navigation-drawer-content).
And pinning items at the top I feel really goes against all UI/UX conventions :P

> In order to clean up space the vertical space of each item & podcast title should be reduced. The necessity to shrink the covers in the drawer to about half their current size would IMHO be balanced out by aa separate subscription view with large cover images (not sure I'd use it, because I really like the drawer list).

Although I see that the vertical height of the menu items, the feeds could be reduced, I absolutely wouldn't shrink the feed images any further; on [my phone](https://fairphone.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/201064718-What-are-the-technical-specifications-of-the-Fairphone-1-)'s 4.3 inch screen, I'm already _just able_ to see the images properly (as in: being able to see what's on an image, with [No Agenda](http://feed.nashownotes.com/rss.xml) being the worst).
As you say, people would still use the nav drawer to navigate between feeds quickly, and most of us would only use the subscriptions view only for a more 'immersive' view (plus reaching archived feeds that may be added in future as per #1182). As the subscription view is 'extra' (at least it seems to be for the both of us), for me shrinking images doesn't balance out as you say.

title: AntennaPod keeps starting by itself
body: I use an app called Battery Doctor to conserve power, and frequent it shows AntennaPod in the list of currently running apps even when I'm not using it or haven't used it lately.  I have automatic downloads turned off and I can't figure out why it keeps starting up by itself.  Is there another setting that I'm missing?  Thanks.   (Android Kitkat 4.4.2)

Also works with dark theme nicely.

title: What happened to the lovely streamer ?
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
Hi

I can t be sure when this stream crasher is introduced but I am unable to stream with APod anymore. Every attempt to stream from hundreds of subscriptons crashes for no good. I can download them but cant stream them. I was able to stream somewhat steadily in the past but not so easily nowadays. Bear in mind that I have not upgraded my Android since then, so same Android but crashing Apod. This has started showing signs of crashloving in last couple months if I am guessing right.

title: Refactor database access
body:
Mostly removing the need to pass a context on every database access.
Most of the changes are pretty boring (and where refactored automatically), the interesting parts are probably `PodDBAdapter` and `PlaybackTest`
Also added some null checks (when tests crashed) and replaced one or two asyntasks (Seems like the threads were not stopped immediately, so Android throw IllegalStateExceptions when the database was deleted in a tearDown but those threads still tried to access data; no problems once replaced by RxAndroid)

title: Glide memory management
body:
Well, I watched https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8Hddx1eOZo
The only place where we really can free up some memory is Glide
So I looked into it and found https://github.com/bumptech/glide/blob/master/samples/flickr/src/main/java/com/bumptech/glide/samples/flickr/FlickrSearchActivity.java

Actually, I don't think I ever ran into memory problems on my phone, but this seems like a good idea to do

title: Fix cropped dialog buttons
body:
![cropped](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/9770152/c395e8ec-572e-11e5-9863-56362537472d.png)

Left: Button is cropped. On smaller displays, one of the buttons might not be shown at all.
Right: Stacked buttons according to https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/dialogs.html

The dialog will also have this material look on older devices.

I was going to use the library for some of the preference dialogs for material design, anyway.
There are one major and one minor newer versions of the library, but they already target v23.

An alternative would be to insert manual wrapping into the button labels ("Set_\n_Interval")
Downside: All of the strings would probably have to be revised. In some cases (German...), it might be pretty hard to find a good wrapping that works on all the different display sizes and resolutions

title: Move 'Episode Cache' from network to other settings section
body: Proposal: As the title says, move 'Episode Cache' from 'network' to 'other' settings section. I see the option more as a way to limit used disk space, rather than limiting used mobile data.

title: Effect of not setting update interval/time of day
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: What happens if the user doesn't set an interval or time of day to update feeds? (What's the default refresh rate?)

title: 3abce4c breaks my build
body:
It seems that adding retrolambda in 3abce4c is breaking my build.
Parent commit fd2633e42f is working fine.

when set my HEAD to 3abce4c, and tried to sync gradle in AndroidStudio, I get:

Error:Execution failed for task ':core:compileReleaseJavaWithJavac'.

> When running gradle with java 5, 6 or 7, you must set the path to jdk8, either with property retrolambda.jdk or environment variable JAVA8_HOME

What do I need to change in my build environment to get this to work again? Do I need to install the Java8 SDK?

title: Merge remote-tracking branch 'AntennaPod/develop'
Completed Downloads page occasionally indicates "0 B" as download size
body:
Go to the menu, select "Downloads".  Then swipe to the "Completed" tab.  The size of the downloaded podcast is shown next to the lower right corner of the podcast icon.  Usually this is a plausible value.  For example: "21 MB".  Occasionally it displays "0 B".  The download will still play, so this is not a failed download.  

This happens on AntennaPod 1.3.3.0.  It occurs on both phones I use for podcasts:
-  Moto G (XT1031) with Android 4.4.4. 
-  Kyocera Hydro Vibe (C6725) with Android 4.4.2

Some podcasts seem more likely to have this problem.  But it does not happen consistently.  "On The Media", "This American Life", and "Planet Money" seem to have  it occur most frequently.

This is a really minor issue.  The strange download size is just a little confusing as it might indicate a problem with the download.

title: Feed and item images are not updated
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
As in #536 I was instructed to create a new issue if the images of my feeds still didn't fetch, here I am :P

The feeds of which AP doesn't fetch images, even on wifi:
- BBC Radio Click (http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/worldservice/digitalp/rss.xml, which gets auto-directed to http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p002w6r2/episodes/downloads.rss, which does have an image, but the forward may be the problem)
- Channel Fourteen .ogg Feed (https://feeds.feedburner.com/thirdworldlinuxogg)  -> doesn't have an feed image defined in the xml indeed, but there is a media file attached to each item with an image (but that's like not the way it should be done, so we'll just ignore this one)
- BBC Friday Night Comedy (http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/radio4/fricomedy/rss.xml which again gets directed to http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p02pc9pj/episodes/downloads.rss, which does have an image)

I've added the BBC feeds a while ago, I think via the gpodder directory, and then the feeds got changed and now they don't have images...

title: Undo when swiping an item out of 'New Episodes' doesn't work
body: This is because we're marking the item as not read anymore, but we really need to mark it as new.

title: Fix new episodes
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body:
Simplified autodownloading and hopefully fixes (finally) our autodownloading of old episodes.

fixes #1009.

title: disable predexing to get CircleCI doing a full build
body:
Previously CircleCi was just doing ./gradlew test which doesn't actually try to build everything.

This will now run assembleDebug for us to give a better idea of if something works.

We still can't run tests (our tests fail on non-x86 hardware and CircleCi doesn't support x86 hardware) and we still can't assembleRelease (signing).

title: High mobile data usage during playback
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
Even when I've pre-downloaded all the podcasts in my queue and disabled mobile data updates, AntennaPod still seems to be using plenty of data during my commutes as I listen.  I have auto-downloading completely disabled and I manually queue and download each podcast while on WiFi.
Just in the last 12 hours since I installed a network monitor, AntennaPod has downloaded 39.05MB on mobile data (63.14MB on WiFi, which would account for one downloaded podcast).  During the same timeframe, Prestissimo has used 114.68MB on mobile and 19.55MB on WiFi, which could be another matter, though this is the only app I have that uses Prestissimo.
I've already reached my monthly bandwidth cap in the last ten days.

<string name="pref_auto_delete_title">Supression automatique</string>
```

should be

```
<string name="pref_auto_delete_title">Suppression automatique</string>
```

title: Occasionally unexpectedly skips entire episode(s)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I'm afraid this is going to be a hard to reproduce bug as it only does this to me maybe one in fifty times, but it's sufficiently annoying and it happens regularly enough to seem worth reporting.

I haven't spotted specific patterns that trigger it but I think it only happens when I'm using my bluetooth headphones, and when I use the play button on them to resume playback. What I expect to happen is that the podcast episode I'm half-way through starts, what actually happens is the episode gets marked as played and deleted (I don't have it configured to keep files otherwise I run out of space). Sometimes it'll also delete the next couple of episodes I have queued as well.

This is infuriating if I'm out as I can't re-download the ~150mb file even over 3g as it's just not reliable enough so I don't get to listen to what I had queued until I'm home again. It's also minorly annoying because I have to find my place in the episode again when I've re-downloaded it.

Love the app, and it keeps getting better with every update.

version info:
- Google Nexus 4
- CyanogenMod 12-20150322-NIGHTLY-mako / Android 5.0.2 (shh don't tell anyone I don't like updates, people keep breaking things)
- f-droid
- antennapod 1.3.1 (2f55256)

Usually listening to NoAgenda (in the morning!) http://feed.nashownotes.com/rss.xml but that could be coincidence as that's most of my listening material.

Sorry I haven't been able to pin this down further.

title: Google Play: Update descriptions
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I have AntennaPod on my Fairphone 1 (Android 4.2.2). There seems to be something weird with the changelog related to language. Data shown in the 'What's new' section on Google Play varries in different situations.
- In the Google Play store on my phone:
  - if phone settings Language = Dutch -> data for version 1.2
  - if phone settings Language = English -> data for version 1.3.2
- On Google Play online (web):
  - if not logged in (interface language = Dutch) -> data for version 1.3.2
  - if logged in (preferred language for Google products = Dutch) -> data for version 1.2
  - if logged in (preferred language for Google products = Dutch) -> data for version 1.3.2

I'm wondering: is this an issue with (bug in) Google Play, or a matter of [updating the 'What's new'](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/189724) on Google for different languages?

title: Fix loading in destroyed feed view activity
body:
DefaultOnlineFeedViewActivity was the only implementation of the abstract OnlineFeedViewActivity, so I mashed them together into one class.
AsyncTasks and Threads were replaced by RxAndroid.
The really important part is canceling the subscription when the activity is destroyed... (Yeah, probably could have done this with threads and tasks, but they seem to be a rather bad choice on Android)

All tests passed on my computer.
Resolves #1149

title: Split feed info and settings (improve cluttered interface)
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently, the feed info and settings are combined in one screen in the feed overview. Maybe it's an idea to make the whole 'cover area' (image, background, title & producer) clickable, leading to a screen with the info (author, language, URL, description, button to open podcast website); and replace the 'i' icon with cogwheels, leading to a screen where settings specifict to that feed can be applied (include in auto-download, auto delete episodes, authentication).

Visually it would be nice if the 'cover area' would be kept, the buttons in the top right removed, the global menu replaced with a 'back' arrow, the additional info/settings would replace the episodes overview. [list of proposed screens and changes in comment below]

- The cogwheels are now grey, as if the option is not available, and should be white (like the buttons on both its sides)
- Button label is currently 'apply actions', which is rather broad, and could maybe be better 'Bulk manage episodes'

title: FR: Bulk Remove from queue
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I accidentally bulk added all episodes of one feed to the queue via the 'Apply actions' screen. Now I'm stuck with 145 episodes - that I already have listened to - in my queue. Would be nice to also be able to undo this via the bulk edit, rather than via individual edits from the queue screen.

This would mean yet another option in the bottom bar, and so I would propose to change the menu to some kind of 'pull up' (rather than 'drop down') menu at the bottom where the preferred action can be selected, plus an 'apply action' button on the right side of it.
This would also give more space to the descriptions of the different functions (the Dutch ones take more space than the English ones).

(I guess another option would be to add 'Bulk manage episodes' from the contextual menu in the Queue screen, but to me that wouldn't be as logical.)

title: Mark as seen?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
There is a string "Mark all as seen" in Transifex (key: mark_all_seen_label)
- Where does it appear? (will this be a new function in 1.3?)
- What does the function do? (really just remove the 'new' mark?)

I am not aware of an option to manually mark items as 'seen' (i.e. removing the 'new' status, applying 'unplayed' status); but only to mark items as 'played'.

title: Resume playback when bluetooth device is reconnected
body:
Also changed the changelog, mostly as a reminder to tell users why we need a new permission.
Side note: On Android 6, this has protection level normal - We won't have to ask the user for this permission.

Tested on a really, really cheap bluetooth speaker...

Fixes #1130

title: Localize option label
body: Fixes #1139

title: Merge version 1.3.2 rc4 in to branch
version 1.3.2.4
Translation: string missing
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: I'm working on Dutch translation, and there doesn't seem to be a string on Transifex for the titles "Option x" on the OPML import screen.

title: Not possible to disable counter in menu (nav drawer)
body: As discovered through #1105, selecting 'none' under the "Set subscription counter" doesn't hide the counters in the menu (navigation drawer).

title: reorder intialization
body:
Re-ordered initialization so 'instance' is populated as soon as possible.

fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#1136

title: Trouble playing back Radio Berkman .ogg episodes
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Hi,

I'm subscribed to Radio Berkman:

http://feeds.feedburner.com/radioberkman

When I resume playing an episode after closing AntennaPod, it resumes playing at a point different than the point it was paused.  If I seek within an episode using the slider, it displays one time for a fraction of a second, then displays another time as it starts playing back.  If I seek using the Forwards and Backwards buttons, it doesn't seek by 30 seconds.  Sometimes seeking using the Backwards button will cause it to seek forwards.

When I open the episodes using Totem on my computer, the duration doesn't match the duration shown by AntennaPod.

Matt

title: Won't resume playback on Bluetooth headset after pause
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: If playback is through a Bluetooth headset, playback will pause if the headset is shutoff, but it won't resume once the headset is reconnected.

title: Can't remove subscriptions with dead RSS feeds
body:
I synced with my gpodder.net account, which included several subscriptions that no longer have active RSS feeds.  It seems that since AntennaPod has never successfully downloaded the feed, it doesn't appear in the subscription list, so I can't remove the dead subscription.  I have unsubscribed via gpodder.net, but AntennaPod doesn't seem to be syncing the _removal_ of a subscription.  As a result, every time I refresh my podcasts, I get errors for four RSS feeds that I don't have listed in my subscriptions.
Also, is there a way to get to the download history / error log from inside the app?

title: update interval doesn't appear to work on version 1.3.1
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I'm using the F-Droid build of 1.3.1, but since updating to it, I don't seem to be able to set the interval (or time of day) to check for new episodes. Settings->Update Interval or Time of Day->Set Interval and then it doesn't matter what I choose it doesn't seem to take. Opening it always shows none of the intervals marked and no matter which I choose (and it does close after I select one so it's tough to tell if it selected it) I don't get any automatic updates to available podcasts. I have Mobile Updates and Automatic Download turned off, but I'm on WiFi a lot.

I didn't see this listed already, but maybe I missed it or it's already being fixed or it's specific to the F-Droid build.

Thanks.

title: Can now download things while on mobile.
body:
The glide url loader now uses its own OkHttpClient.
The result is that we can now search for podcasts and download them while on mobile
even if the user doesn't allow mobile downloads (NOTE that we don't do anything
they haven't asked us to do while on mobile).

I'm not sure if this is the _right_ solution, we don't load _any_ images while on the mobile network this way.  It is better than the current situation where we can't really download anything while on mobile data unless the user has mobile download enabled.

fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#1101

title: Deadlock in DownloadService
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I managed to get in to the following deadlock state after merging in #1109 and loading the develop branch on my device (not to say that is related to #1109, just to give context).

As I recall I had asked the device to refresh some feeds, while playing a podcast.  (Nexus 6, Android 5.1.1).

Something worth noting is that we have multiple copies of the downloadCompletionThread running (DownloadService.java:181) when I would expect there to be on one (queue Highlander reference).

I haven't really been able to put my finger on what's wrong just yet.

Any ideas @mfietz?

```
"Thread-22185" prio=5 tid=32 Waiting
  | group="main" sCount=1 dsCount=0 obj=0x12cff500 self=0x9c45e400
  | sysTid=5262 nice=0 cgrp=default sched=0/0 handle=0x9c4e2d80
  | state=S schedstat=( 111248074 16361042 62 ) utm=9 stm=2 core=0 HZ=100
  | stack=0xa0cb4000-0xa0cb6000 stackSize=1036KB
  | held mutexes=
  at java.lang.Object.wait!(Native method)
  - waiting on <0x1031822a> (a java.lang.Object)
  at java.lang.Thread.parkFor(Thread.java:1220)
  - locked <0x1031822a> (a java.lang.Object)
  at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Unsafe.java:299)
  at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:157)
  at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2016)
  at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingDeque.takeFirst(LinkedBlockingDeque.java:460)
  at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingDeque.take(LinkedBlockingDeque.java:649)

title: Battery: Persistent CPU wakelocks when inactive
body:
Hello,
Today I did not use my Phone and the battery went from 80% to 10% in a few hours.
A look in Wakelock Detector told me that my Phone was active all the time. AntennaPod (more exactly: com.aocate.media.ServiceBackedMediaPlayer) prevented the CPU from sleeping for 93% of the up time (since 1d and a few hours)!
During this period I was in flight mode, did not listen to any episode and nothing was paused, either. So AntennaPod should have been (almost) completely inactive.

After I forced AntennaPod to exit the battery stayed at 10% for 3 hours :)

I use CyanogenMod 12.1 and AntennaPod 1.3.1.

body:
FeedMediaSizeService gone, file size will be fetched on demand

Replaces #1100 and #993, hopefully fixes #990 this time

label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
From the play store:

> Downloads already played episodes For the past week, seeing already played episodes in my queue. (Says so when I press on the episode) e.g. NPR Hourly News from 06-05-2015 and 06-15-2015 Have to delete the file and ep from queue every time.

I'm not sure why this would be happening. I've subscribed to that feed so we'll see if I see the same behavior. Sharing this link back to the play store to get more feedback.

Device reported as:  L-01F (g2)

title: Read feed counter setting correctly
body:
preferences.xml and UserPreferences used different strings m(
Rest is refactoring

Fixes #1106

title: Set Subscription Counter doesn't work
label: [Label(name="bug")]

title: Translation question: what does the drawer counter do
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
As there are quite a few strings that haven't been translated to Dutch I am working on that in Transifex. I have the app open in front of me so that I can check for the right context.

In order to determine the the proper translation of 'Set subscription counter' (pref_nav_drawer_feed_counter_title) and the other counter items, I was wonder what the function (Setting the subscription counter) actually does:
A) determine the displayed number in the drawer
B) determine the numbers for the counter (the "set subscription order" setting 'sort by counter') and thus the order of the feeds if 'sort by counter' is selected
C) both

I would expect it's C) both, but from the english strings I would read differently, as the description of the "Set subscription counter" currently is: "Change the _information displayed_ by the subscription counter"

title: not every action has a timestamp
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body: fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#1102

title: Custom SSL Socket Factory for Android 4.1.x - 4.4x
body:
Fixes #1086

Honestly, I'm not entirely sure why this actually works, but I tested this both on a (virtual) 4.1.1 and a 4.4.4 device.
_OkHttp_ should take care of setting the socket's enabled protocols (see ConnectionSpec). I'm not familiar with OkHttp and not motivated enough to find out what exactly doesn't work here... A fix is a fix ^^

Also upgraded OkHttp to the latest version and increased the sleep time of the feed media service to 5s to be even more server friendly.

Side note: This was caused on 4.x devices by servers only allowing TLS 1.1 and 1.2, but not 1.0
I don't think this is very common. I'd rather have an insecure podcast download than nothing to play...

title: Time total in queue should show summed time remaining, not total time
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: The time displayed at the top of the queue is the summed time of the total length of all podcasts in the queue. This seems a less useful number than the summed time of all the time left in each podcast, at least for indicating how much time listening to the queued podcasts will add up to.

title: Audio-normalisation (& volume correction)
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Taking the feature request by @Threore in the issue on enhancements for AP v 1.3:

"I do a lot of my podcast listening while riding to university on a bicycle, which means wind and traffic often make it hard to hear the podcasts. The obvious solution is to turn the volume up, but **some podcasts are so much louder than others that going from one to the other becomes jarring. Some setting or automatic feature that normalises all the audio would be great**."

Same for me; sometimes I'll just pull out my headphones on the bike when I can't hear what they're talking about on a new episode from the queue (no, I don't have buttons on my earplugs to skip episode or adjust volume :) )

I would like to add the option to set audio levels to the softer, middle or louder podcasts (I know this boils down to an additional volume setting front-end, but back-end it would be determining the volume edit between finishing normalisation and saving the file). Reason: normalisation may not be enough to pump up the volume high enough to suit biking (although maybe I'm wrong here).

title: Update strings
body:
updated strings and version code for release.

I don't think I'm going to go with the last two digits as 99 for this release since I'm not sure we'll actually release this version, but if we do I don't want to have to rebuild it.

title: License & Contributers
body:
1. Formatted license file (line breaks ftw!)
2. Python script that generates CONTRIBUTERS file. copy file to "contributers.py" (see .gitignore), add transifex credentials, execute and pipe (>) into target file
3. new, generated contributers file (manually removed obvious duplicates)

Side note: Translators may include people that joined the corresponding language team, but never actually translated anything.

title: Show URL for failed downloads in logs
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi,

I have several podcasts and sometimes they do not get downloaded properly. But the error line on the Downloads/Log view can neither be expanded nor provides enough information to actually understand what's happening.

I propose a new feature -- say when pressing or long pressing on a line -- that would show a full URL (so I can copy/paste it in the browser and try it out myself) and show the full error to understand what's going on and if the podcast is even worth following.

See attached screenshot, for example:
- "Unsupported Feed type: Invalid type" tells me nothing
- The URISyntaxException does not tell me what's wrong with the URI because I cannot see it.

![Log file](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4567693/9243872/e3f56c6a-4195-11e5-8154-cce38b693d94.png)

title: License
body:
With the growth of the project, the [current](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/b332942f161f598d2c3247bdd073765a8ad51662/LICENSE) license is probably no longer sufficient as it leaves much unclear and not explicit. For example, it asks for the copyright notice to be included, but doesn't say anything about whether forked code should disclose source code or not (relevant [comment](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/997#issuecomment-128245418))

It's probably a good idea for the community or maintainers to discuss/decide on a more appropriate and comprehensive license. A good summary of popular licenses is available [here](https://tldrlegal.com/). Some of the more popular licenses are listed [here](https://tldrlegal.com/verified) (scroll down). An alternative listing of popular licenses is available [here](http://choosealicense.com/licenses/).

title: Using the "skip backwards" button quite often jumps all the way back to the start of the episode.
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body: I don't think this is an intentional feature?  I've seen it happen a number of times (Alpha version), possibly just when trying to skip back more than one jump in quick succession.

title: Encode non-ascii query strings for the iTunes search
body:
iTunes search now works fine with non-ascii query strings.

Also checked the gpodder search, all queries I tried already worked fine.

Fixes #1075

title: Adding sensor rotation per Issue #965
label: [Label(name="needs work")]
body: Tested this yesterday, and it worked fine on my Android (Lollipop). Is a very minimal solution of #965. If preferred I can add a portrait-specific view so that the video player isn't stretched in a weird aspect ratio in portrait orientation.

title: Option to auto download oldest episodes first
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Auto download always downloads newest episodes first. So, if the episode cache size is smaller than the number of unplayed items, older episodes are never downloaded.
Another problem is that if there are multiple new episodes from the same feed, the newer episodes end up at the top of the queue, while the other way around would make more sense.
Of course I can manually reorder the queue, but it would be nice if the order of new episodes was retained automatically.

title: Sleep Timer: Shake to reset, lower volume, vibrate, remember preferences
body:
# Sleep Timer Dialog

![timer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/9154520/936d074e-3e93-11e5-965d-3232652fee59.png)

The dialog will now remember the last settings.

I know, the layouts look redundant, but I found no other way to make the dialog look this way, e.g. if you remove the outer LinearLayout, the dialog will become very narrow.
# When timer is about to expire...

10s before the timer is about to expire, users can choose to get a short 0.5s vibration, we need a new permission here. Not sure if this may have any implications on devices with no vibrator, maybe the Play Store will tell them APod is not compatible...
In any case, the audio's volume will be lower significantly. Lowering it to 10% may look much: I tried to find a balance between still being able to hear and detecting the actual volume change [1]. 10% turned out to be the best solution for me.
Shake to reset will only work in this 10 second timeframe. I took the threshold from someone else's code - maybe we have to lower it in another commit, not sure how good people are at giving their phones/tablets a good shake (acceleration!) while lying down...
If a shake is detected, the timer will be reset to 15 mins [2], the volume will be reset to 100% as a kind of audible shake detection confirmation.
# References

Resolves #247
Improvement over #466
I'm also considering closing #228. Fading out sounds nice, but is (as already said) not noticeable enough.
## 

[1] Not really sure what is up with the volume setting. I don't think it is linear... when I lowered the volume to 50% or so, the volume change would not be noticeable immediately
[2] Well, I could almost bet on a FR to make this configurable. Not sure if it is worth the effort... Getting an other EditText in the dialog without messing up the layout could be harder that it looks

title: Episode view is lost on manual download and download error
body:
I have a new podcast with many old episodes (i never heard before). 
One episode seems interesting after start reading its description so i click the "download" button. This starts downloading but throws me into the feed view (unwanted behaviour 1 as i was reading the description). 
Even the scroll position is lost, so i have to scroll down again to this old episode. 
While further reading the description my WiFi failed and so the download stops. But again i was thrown into the feed view (unwanted behaviour 2).

Thanks for all your work with this software. I use them every day on my way from and to work. Cycling would be so boring without :-)

This following NullPointerException showed up from the play alpha channel.

What's interesting is that it came from within a 'Log.d()' line that should have been removed by ProGuard. I suspect it just removed the call to Log.d(), but that the computation that occurs in the call still occurs.

Is it ok to pass the .load() function of Glide a null pointer?  If so, awesome. If not we'll need to fix a couple of other places.

title: removed extra quote
body: @LatinSuD reported an extra " in this string on Transifex.

title: Only autodownload queued and new items
body:
After some thought and use of autodownload as it stands now, auto-downloading all unplayed episodes is just not the expected behavior for anyone.  If we autodownload all unplayed episodes then if you subscribe to a new feed all of the episodes from that feed are candidates to be autodownloaded, and they may trump other 'new' episodes from other feeds.

So, this change makes it so that only queued and new items are autodownloaded. If you want to download something else you can still click the 'Download' button and it will still be downloaded and enqueued.

As a result, I think AntennaPod/AntennaPod#1060 will probably wind up focusing on the cleanup algorithm, favorites, etc...

This also fixes a small bug that occurs when upgrading the database to set the autodownload flag to false.

refs AntennaPod/AntennaPod#1009

title: Queue centric AutoDownload and Cleanup Algorithms
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
There's been some confusion recently about when things get auto downloaded and when they get cleaned up.

Part of this is from actual bugs and part of it is because the functionality is just plain confusing.  The problem is that changing the behavior may break some users' workflows.  Some might say that those users' workflows should be broken, but it's probably wiser to find a solution that can make everyone happy.

To do that I'd like to propose a new workflow that will likely become the default, but give users the choice to retain the old one.
## AutoDownload and Queuing

AutoDownload will download and add to the queue all items which are 'New' and have auto-download enabled (e.g. it will still support disabling downloads for individual feeds).  

It currently downloads any unread items.

An item is new if it hasn't been acted on in some way.  All new items show up in 'New Episodes' currently.  This essentially makes New Episodes the list of items that will be downloaded the next time auto download is activated.

While we think we have #1009 under control with the auto-download flag, this change would certainly have helped with it too.
## Cleanup

Cleanup will consider any item that isn't currently in the queue as eligible for deletion.  Currently an item has to be fully played and not in the queue for it to be deleted.  Items won't get deleted immediately, but the next time AntennaPod needs space it will remove items that aren't queued.  This will resolve the problem of having new items but them not being downloaded because you simply removed an item you didn't care about from the queue.  Currently to make room for an item you have to mark the item as read and remove it from the queue, or go to 'Downloads' and remove it there.  Which is more complicated than needs to be.

This change to cleanup should resolve #939, #699.
## Enhancements

Some users like to keep episodes after they've already listened to them. We could add (either now or as a future enhancement) a 'Favorites' capability (something that's been requested a number of other times). Items that are 'favorited' won't be deleted by the cleanup algorithm.  (#538, wouldn't quite be as full featured as #851, but that would be more complicated to handle from a 'don't delete this' standpoint and take more time to implement)

We might want to update what makes an item appear new. With this system an item added to the queue will never be new. A user might want to be able to see what new things have been downloaded and added the queue.  Not sure what would be a good way to indicate that.

Finally, we might want to add some ability to remove stale items from the queue. User can ask to bulk remove everything older than 7 days or something to that effect.
## Transition

I think the user should be allowed to choose between this and the 'classic' algorithm, but I would like this to be the default in the future since I think it makes far more sense.  So there's a question of how to transition without having people that would prefer classic lose all their episodes.  I'd propose the following (though I'm not sure it's the best idea).

For new installs, we just default to this new algorithm.  But, if the user is upgrading, on the first launch of the app we ask the user if they want to switch to the queue centric model that allows for easier management of automatic downloads and easier cleanup of old episodes.  If they prefer they can stick with classic which downloads more things and requires more interaction to clean up old episodes.
## Implementation

We'd create a new EpisodeCleanupAlgorithm and a new AutomaticDownloadAlgorithm. Choosing the new mode would use those algorithms instead of APCleanupAlgorithm and APDownloadAlgorithm.
## Thoughts

Any thoughts or opinions?  Any other related issues I missed?

title: Queue duration summary includes non-downloaded episodes in count
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It's possible to have non-downloaded items in the queue. The summary at the top of the queue includes the duration of podcasts that haven't been downloaded yet.

Is this a good idea?  Should we only include downloaded podcasts?  Should we have an indicator that they're not all downloaded?

As I recall the desired use case was someone who is about to go on a trip and wants to make sure they have enough for the road.

~~2. It would be great if you could configure each podcast feed individually to NOT be displayed in the "New episodes" view. It turns out supporting 'flattring this app' is too complicated.

While we appreciate everyone that wants to support development, finding a way to properly and equitably manage the funds would take significant time away from actually working on AntennaPod.

We still support flattring feeds.

The best way people can support AntennaPod is by joining the alpha test and reporting bugs before the app goes to production.

title: Glide
body:
# Replace Glide

Picasso has been replaced by Glide. While the images are loaded, most ImageView show a grey placeholder and the name of the feed.
When a feed is downloaded/refreshed, we no longer load the feed's or its episodes images.
# Update Manager

I needed a mechanism to delete the already downloaded feed or episode images on upgrade. In the future, we can use this class whenever APod has to do upgrade maintenance.

In my tests, deleting a huge image cache could take quite a while (20-50s). So deleting is done in its own thread. In my tests, this had no impact on the running app.
# Preference: Image Cache

There is now a user preference where one can set the limit for cached images. Default: 100 MiB (Else, Glide's default would be 250 MiB)
(FYI, 1 MiB or Mebibyte = 1.048.576 bytes, 1 MB or megabyte = 1.000.000 bytes...)

![pref](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/9012995/71aabae2-37b9-11e5-8b02-3372ef28bf90.png)
# Datetime parser fixes

When I loaded APod with nearly 100 podcasts, I noticed that some feeds' pubdates could not be parsed. Some of the dates looked correct, but hat multiple consecutive spaces. Another feed used the [_ANSI C's asctime() format_](http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html) which is UTC bases and does not include timezone information.

title: Autodownload doesn't refresh feeds automatically (Alpha)
body:
On previous installed version I had auto download enabled in settings (disabled for three feeds), no WiFi filtering. 

After installing the alfa I at first didn't change any settings, two days later I hadn't received any new podcasts (at this time I didn't check if any new episodes where available, but given the release schedule of my subscriptions there should have been some) so I went into the settings and checked to see if automatic download was still enabled, it was, I also set a download time (2 am). Today, two days later, I still hadn't gotten any new episodes so I went into each podcast feed (from the sidebar) and refreshed the feeds. It found 12 new episodes and the automatic download started.

title: Retro-actively disable auto download for older episodes
body:
Problem: Per default, auto downloading was enabled for all episodes when it was introduced. Now, some users complain that (older) episodes are downloaded twice (or again).

Solution: We disable auto downloading for all episodes that are marked as played, have a position > 0 (partially played) or are currently downloaded (all actions, that would disable auto downloading now).
We exclude episodes that are currently in the queue.

Possible new issues: There might be users that performed an action that automatically disabled auto downloading (like downloading or playing) and manually re-activated auto downloading. These users will lose their manual change.

Fixes #1009

Also changed: The DB version now reflects the app's code version. This will make it a lot easier to see when database migrations were performed.

Why I did not use variables in the SQL you ask? My reasoning: I know the tables and columns names for that particular version upgrade. When someone changes these constants in the future, this person will break the migration. IMHO it makes sense to not use variables here.

title: Add Norwegian Language Support
body: A user on Transifex requested Norwegian (no) support.  Add support in the codebase for that language.

title: share titles with the URL. fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#905
Fix Time of Day Refresh
body:
Fixes a couple of problems with Time of Day automatic refreshing:
- It was getting refreshed too many times. It was using .before() to determine if it should add a day, but it also needs to use .equals(), otherwise the alarm can trigger multiple times.
- It was using refreshExpiredFeeds() which was broken since it assumed getUpdateInterval() was the only game in town (it isn't since it doesn't handle time of day updates).   getExpiredFeeds() was also using the wrong units for getUpdateInterval() (it returns hours, but getExpiredFeeds() assumed it was millis) so it was just pretty much always refreshing all the feeds anyways.

I also fixed a test that was broken with some prior changes to Add Podcast.

title: Removing episode probably should also disable auto-download on that episode
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Removing an episode is sometimes not very permanent.  For example, explicitly removing an episode that is in the queue, and then hitting refresh on the queue will immediately download the episode again.

My gut feeling is that an explicit request to remove an episode should be permanent until an explicit request to reverse that state, which I believe is achieved by automatically marking as no auto download.

Version 1.2.1 build 58.

It only does this once for each time you open a feed view.

Replication steps:
1. Go to a podcast feed view
2. Scroll down
3. Start downloading an episode
Result: feed view seems to reload, and snap back to the top
Optional extra steps:
4. Scroll down again
5. Download other episode
Result: now feed view doesn't snap back to top anymore

Alternates for step 3: "alt-tabbing" out of antennapod and back in, marking episode as unplayed

   Every fragment must have an empty constructor, so it can be instantiated

   constructors will not be called when the fragment is re-instantiated;

title: Fix1026
body:
Being far more conservative when we check for sizes of items.

@mfietz could you review? I'm open to other ways to solve this problem.

title: FeedMediaSizeService is overactive
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Currently it tries to download the size for every item, even if we already have the size.

There are a couple of reasons:
- getFeedMediaUnknownSizeCursor() should check if KEY_SIZE <= 0, but it checks > Integer.MIN_VALUE, which is everything
- Some servers always return 0 for this query, so we'll just always ask how big they are:
  (example showing some logging that has been added)

```
07-19 21:59:31.030: D/FeedMediaSizeService(21038): Getting size currently 0 for https://my.slate.com/subscriptions/media/3c83...........mp3
07-19 21:59:31.466: D/FeedMediaSizeService(21038): Size now: 0
```
- It should probably only check on sizes if isDownloadAllowed(), not just if networkAvailable().

title: Feature request: an option to change playback speed
body:
An option to change playback speed to a lower (when listening to foreign language or otherwise difficult podcasts) or higher (easy listening) setting would be very appreciated.

This could probably be integrated in the interface by adding a button on the right of the playback controls in the player view, which would trigger a pop-up menu with available speeds, Youtube-style, or a separate pop-up with a slider.

However, a brief search reveals that the Android API by default does not include a functionality to change playback speed. See [this Android issue](https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=1961) and also [this SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5149050/changing-the-speed-of-music-playback-in-android). So this FR will probably have to sit here for quite a while, unless someone decides to re-implement variable playback rate, or Google suddenly releases an update.

I might have been mistaken though, as I am poorly familiar with the details of Android development, so someone should look into whether this is actually impossible with the current API.

title: Feature request: Option to set seconds to skip/rewind
body:
When I miss a word or two it often annoys me that I have to rewind by 30 seconds and listen again to what I've just heard. In other apps I figured that 15 second would the best fit for me (and when I feel like I missed more than a word I can rewind twice.)

Can you please add an option to adjust the delta time to skip?

title: Make itunes search more prominent and fix squashed griview
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body:
iTunes is really the easiest way to find podcasts that we have. So it should be listed above adding by URL or by GPodder.

I had thought of integrating the iTunes search bar directly but that would have been a bigger change without much more benefit.

The GridView on large devices (Nexus 6 for example) was showing
iTunes and gpodder results in two columns, which was cutting off
valuable information. I simply double the default size of the grid
columns on the theory that on a tablet someone may still want multiple
columns and that 400dp was wide enough to show the needed detail.

Hi

The current search results page is in thumbnails views which is fine but most of the time the titles and names etc are cutoff which makes it hard to see what the podcast is about. Sometimes the icons for the podcasts are generic which makes it harder to recognize what is going on.

This might not be an issue with searches with couple results but when the search results return tens of results it makes it a tedious job to go into the details one by one to see what  the podcast is about.

thanks

title: overide "downloading on battery" for manual updates
body:
I would suggest a change: 
On manual feed update AND episodes are ready to download AND on battery AND "Download when not charging" prefs is NOT set
Antennapod should ask the user:

```
New episode could be downloaded, but you are on battery. 
[download], [download always], [no]
```

I tend to forget the reason why the download is not performed, so a manual update should override the prefs or inform me about this situation.

title: Hangup after video episodes
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
Hi!
There are problems when a video episode ends. The episode ends and gets deleted (if configured). But the next episode in the playlist is not being played after that. Pressing play for the next episode has no effect. Only killing and restarting the app helps. Playing the playlist should be continuous, no matter if video or audio. It seems there are some problems returning from the video player, as it pauses only when a video episode ends.

title: Add git commit ID and version top the "About" screen
body:
This change adds the information provided by "git describe" to the "About" screen.
This info includes the SHA1 of the commit on which this release is based, as well the the number of commits since the last release and the last release number.

Please note that AntennaPod release labels have been applies to the 'master' branch, therefore releasing snapshots from the 'develop' branch will not yield useful info other than the commit ID,
It is still useful in the sense that it provides the number of commits since the last label on the develop branch, and even if there are no more labels, the number of commit will increment for newer builds.

title: Setting updates for a specific time of day didn't work on newer devices.
body:
Alarm was not being issued on devices running 5.1 (and perhaps older).

setRepeating is setInexactRepeating on API 19+, that means we can go as long as interval*2 before updates.

Switched to use 'set()' instead to get behavior that matches what users expect.  Otherwise we could go as long as 2 days between updates.

Even if I subscribe via the iTunes search there isnt descriptions for thes podcasts. They are Al Jazeera and Bloomberg.

title: Fix button moving and icon being cut
body:
# Before

# After

title: Drawer: Feed context menu, counter and order
body:
# New "new" state

Problem: Before, we flagged an episode as _new_ when several conditions where satisfied (not downloaded, not in the queue, not marked as played...). When a user wants an episode to not be flagged (e.g. to reset the feed counter showing the number of new episodes) she had to mark the feed as played.
Another problem showed when subscribing to a new podcast. We decided we only want to most recent episode to appear as new. To achieve that, we ourselves had to mark all other episodes as played. Users cannot distinguish if they actually played the episode or not.

Solution: New is now its own (database) state. Basically, "new" means unplayed "and some more". We no longer have to mark episodes as played on subscribing, they simply become unplayed. On the downside, we now have no mark new episodes as unplayed when they are added to the queue, downloaded, played and so on (on the other side, retrieving new episodes from the DB is a lot easier).
# Drawer feed preferences

Users can now customize the feed order and counter.

![hui](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/8507677/d2a84ad0-224c-11e5-84a0-5e62e0b92319.png)

Resolves #983
# Drawer feed context menu

Users can now mark all episodes as seen (all new episodes become unplayed) or as played (all new or unplayed...).

![0](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/8507661/5f26acfa-224c-11e5-8a31-714541c77bb3.png)

Resolves #922
# Refactorings

I was fed up with all the stupid callbacks. So I took the upgrade DB code and moved it. Also renamed some occurences of read to played.

Also deleted the APSPDownloadAlgorithm and APSPCleanupAlgorithm classes. They are never used and belong to another project...

title: Get filesize from server
body:
Obvious, visual change: When claimed media size is zero bytes, we no longer show "0 B", but nothing. I believe this is superior to showing "Unknown size" and alike, the user would not know why this is or what she can do to fix it.

For episodes, where the file size is unknown or suspiciously low (some feed seem to give the runtime in minutes...), we ask the server for the correct file size in a background service. This service is started when the app does the same (an old run may have been interrupted), but also when one or several feeds are refreshed.

This will fail if the server does not support the HEAD request method. As I have yet to encounter a server that does not, I was not able to find a workaround for this probably quite rare case.

Fixes #990

I would love to have a button which will create an entry with the playback time and the name of the podcast-episode which was played. This would give me the possibility to hear the minutes around the "bookmarks" again after I arrived at home.

title: Option to sort feeds alphabetically
body:
As discussed in #441 

The feeds were changed from alphabetical to number of unplayed episodes. Is it possible to make it an option?

The two ways I use antennapod are affected by this:
1. Listening to podcasts on demand: me or a friend have a specific feed that we want to listen to, so we want to pull up the feed, see if there are any new episodes or old episodes that we haven't listened to.
2. Queuing up a small percentage of subscribed podcasts.  

I know some other people personally who are the same way.  Detail from my previous post:

I have a limited amount of time available to listen to podcasts compared to the amount of subjects and podcasts I'm interested in. Most of my feeds have a large amount of unplayed new episodes, but that tag is still useful to me:
1. Subscribe to a large list of podcasts of various subjects (from educational to comedy to career-specific)
2. Select a small amount of feeds to auto-download 
3. Add specific episodes to the queue (or for direct streaming) via description
4. Let queue auto-download when on wifi

Step 3 is of course what is affected by this:
- "New Episodes" tab
  - mixes all the topics together
  - low-frequency feeds can get lost amongst higher-frequency feeds.
- Static alphabetical view of podcast feeds
  - allows quick access by subject or feed
  - tagging may work as well as I saw in another thread, but one feed may be lighthearted or heavy on the same subject, where selecting individual feeds is still useful to me
  - Unplayed tag still useful (in case marking all as read sorts it alphabetically)
    - old unplayed podcasts are useful if I've exhausted my queue for that subject

I'm open to suggestions in a better process for the same use case with the update.

As the setting depends on your use case (which doesn't usually change), it should not be on the main UI, but rather somewhere in the settings, where I personally don't think it would be considered clutter.

body:
Hello,

I previously opened #796 requesting the addition of an uplayed count in the Nav bar which was added.

However there were some strange UX choices added which I'd like to see if they can be changed.

Prior to this feature being added, the podcast list in the navbar was sorted alphabetically, these was optimal as you always knew where a particular podcast was in the list.

Once the unplayed count was added to the navbar it appears to have changed the sort order of the podcasts.  This looks to be sorted now as 1) most unlistened, then 2) alphabetically.   This gives a terrible user experience as you have to pay a lot more attention to the list as there is guarantee a podcast will be listed where you expect it.

Can this be changed back to just doing it alphabetically while keeping the unplayed count?

title: build 60 for alpha testing
Let user change data folder if current one is not available
label: [Label(name="needs work")]
body:
![muh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/8395650/da7f075e-1d7d-11e5-9121-7bf30d13b78c.png)

The button will open the usual choose data folder preference dialog. On older devices, clicking the navigational up will lead to a crash, of course.
Of this is not the first start, the user will experience pictures not being displayed and media files not being found, because the folder they ought to be in is not there. [1]

This only gives the user the opportunity to change the app to a useable state again (or, if this is the first start, choose a directory because our choice of the external folder as a default didn't work)

Resolves #975

[1] Checking the database and bringing it to a consistent state (file not readable/not existent -> downloaded=0; fix local paths) should be done when the _move data folder_ feature is implemented.

title: GpodnetEpisodeAction not sent for all 'PLAY' actions
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
We send the GpodnetEpisodeAction PLAY when items are marked as read. At least we do in some when the user users the menu item to mark something as 'Played'.

However, we don't always send this action when an item is marked as read.  For example: when a user swipes an episode away in 'New Episodes' or when they 'Mark all as played'.  Since this can happen in so many places we might want to centralize these actions.  Either doing so in DBWriter or some other helper class.

Thinking this is low priority.

title: Don't send Gpodder actions for items that don't have media.
body: Fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#964

title: Must send download list when content changes
body:
In #969 we updated DownloadService to return a copy of the list of downloads. That prevented the views from referencing data that wasn't there anymore.

However, I didn't set it to send a copy of that list every time the data changed.  Previously there was 'onDownloadDataAvailable' which would get called when the initial list was created and 'onContentChanged' which would get called whenever anything changed.  Now, there is just 'onContentChanged' and it takes the content itself.

This solves the remaining problems from #968, but it does so at a cost. Now, any time the download list changes we'll create a copy of it. When we're downloading a lot of small items (feeds for example) the list might change rapidly.  That means we'll be creating a lot of these objects, just for them to be garbage collected.

This seems to work fine on my Nexus One emulator, but I'd be curious to know if there's a better way.

title: "No external storage is available" on Cyanogenmod 12 / Lollipop (LG Optimus G)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
The course of events is somewhat complicated, so here is everything in chronological order:

My phone is an LG Optimus G (e975), running Cyanogenmod. This device has no sd card slot, external storage is emulated at `/storage/emulated/0`.
1. It was running Cyanogenmod 11 (Android 4.4 iirc) and AntennaPod 1.1.2. I didn't encounter any of the issues below then.
2. As CM 12 became available I upgraded to that version, upgrading the Google Apps in the process.
3. Soon later I noticed AntennaPod wasn't updating feeds properly, a new episode wasn't shown even after manual refresh, though it was clearly in the feed. Using paged feeds also didn't work, the "v" button was shown, but pressing it yielded no results after loading was done.
4. I noticed AntennaPod's version on F-Droid (1.1.2) was outdated, so I reinstalled 1.2 from Google Play. Starting AntennaPod results in the error: `No external storage is available . Please make sure that external storage is mounted so that the app can work proplerly.`
5. Rebooting, removing cache and data, reinstalling, disabling PrivacyGuard didn't fix it.
6. Best part: Reinstalling 1.1.2 from F-Droid now also yields the No external storage is available message.

Despite all this, it's nice to see the latest progress!

title: Return a copy of the downloads.
body:
This should prevent any IndexOutOfBounds errors.

The Downloads list that's provided via getDownloads shouldn't be pointing to the same instance as the one used by the DownloadService.

fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#968

title: IndexOutOfBoundsException in RunningDownloadsFragment
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I believe this is caused by a race condition.  The item is removed from the list before getItem is called.

We _could_ solve this by just checking the index in getItem before returning, but that could still cause a race condition. Better would be to see if we should be operating on a copy of the list, synchronizing access to it somehow, or using a better method of identifying downloads.

title: DefaultActionButtonCallback tries to create GpodnetEpisodeAction when there's no episode
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
This was reported for 1.2 and 1.3alpha.  It appears to be happening because of [this line](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/2d4705461c00dcb131b848789fa2a8a6021d19da/app/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/adapter/DefaultActionButtonCallback.java#L104).

We get to this line only when the condition on [line 59](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/2d4705461c00dcb131b848789fa2a8a6021d19da/app/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/adapter/DefaultActionButtonCallback.java#L59) is false, which means the episode has no media, but the GpodnetEpisodeAction.Builder is going to try to get the download URL for the 'media', which the item doesn't have (or we wouldn't have gotten here).

I think that we actually don't want to use Gpodder in this case. The user is never actually given a choice in this view to mark an episode with media as played. So this really shouldn't be present.  This mark as 'read' is really only for website only entries.  Which, means that the string used [here](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/blob/e1b494ba0577ce2cb60e6b3120e3534fb1f3211c/app/src/main/java/de/danoeh/antennapod/fragment/ItemFragment.java#L360) is probably wrong too.

```

title: gpoddernet: do not crash on unknown remote actions
body:
**UNTESTED!  I don't have a working build setup.  Please verify before merging.**

According to [1](https://gpoddernet.readthedocs.org/en/latest/api/reference/events.html) and my own episode actions feed, "action":"flattr" is a

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: FLATTR is not a constant
```

exception when fetching the episode actions list.

title: Streaming to dlna/upnp devices (proof of concept available)
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I would welcome a feature to stream podcasts to dlna/upnp media renderers (cf. #280). I have implemented a proof of concept for such afeature using the cling library. (Personally, I don't consume any video podcasts and I didn't not care about them in my current implementation.) It took me a while from the first attempt, so my implementation is based on a somewhat outdated version of AntennaPod. I encourage you to have a look at it: https://github.com/volhol/AntennaPod/tree/streammedia

On the MediaplayerActivity you can find a new Item in the menu called select media renderer. 

![menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11587858/8340733/92a87240-1ac0-11e5-9dad-64fe018aba4a.PNG)

The app tries to find all suitable medai renderers in your local network. Just select one. The app then attemps to play the current media item form the current position on the chosen media renderer.

![select media renderer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11587858/8340740/9c055b14-1ac0-11e5-96f0-ee32210acc74.PNG)

In fact, the app does currently not stream the content to the device itself. Instead it transmits the original URL to the device and asks it to stream the content from there. It may take a while before you can start playback. During this time, you see that the play/pause button changes appearance. Sometimes you may have to press the play button two to three time before the playback starts. Once the media item is played back on the media renderer, you can change the current position as well as the volume like you would in local mode. (Altering the volume works from the MediaplayerActivity only.)  The fast torward/reqind button disapppear since there is no suitable feature for this in dlna/upnp.

I have tested this feature on the four dlna/upnp media renderers I have access to. I found out that each of them behaves a bit differently. Thus, it may not work properly on your devices.

I am of course open to any discussion on if and how this feature could be integrated with an AntennaPod release (standard feature, separate module as prestissimo, ...). I tried to isolate most changes in separate files. Please be aware that the cling library (http://4thline.org/projects/cling/) requires at least API 15.

title: New feature: Add Feed-specific 'Delete After Playback' override option
body:
Let me repeat this again:
DO NOT PULL THIS AS-IS. THIS IS FOR DISCUSSION ONLY.

One of the features I still miss in AntennaPod is the ability to control the Auto Delete option _per feed_.
Some feeds are throwaway - once I hear them, I want them to be automatically delete.
Other feeds are precious and I want to keep the chapters I've downloaded.

This pull request adds a new 'Delete After Playback' spinner to the FeedInfoActivity. It has 3 states:
Default - use the global setting
Yes - delete after playback, regardless of the global settings
No - Do not delete after playback, regardless of the global settings

This is my first Android work, and I have a VERY shallow understanding of Java (I come from C/C++), so this pull request is based on googling stackoverflow and the SDK documentation.

I know for a fact that this code does NOT work yet. I ran it through the emulator and I see that my settings is not saved between invocations. I'm sending this to solicit feedback and to learn `android programming.

I also hope I didn't do anything stupid with git. There were a few commits on the main repository between the time I forked and the time I merged my changes back to create the pull request.
