title: APod does not add the podast if the connection fails.
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi

Maybe it makes sense to not to add a podcast, but the thing is there could be temporary connection issues with the podcast providers. 

Here is a scenario. I have 60 podcasts in an opml file. I import it and some of them fail during import and APod does not add them. They are not listed. Well what if the connection issue is temporary from the server? Sometimes the providers might get hit with lots of request which disables their response?

I think that it will make more sense if APod adds the all the podcasts during import but show some icon or gray it out next to the listing (not in downloads window) to show that it failed during the import. And maybe it will come back during another refresh.

It is a bit confusing this way because hard to keep track of which ones made it back whioch ones are not.

title: Mark all as unplayed, download all unplayed, enqueue all unplayed
body:
In the feed view, you can now:
- Mark all as unplayed
- Download all unplayed
- Enqueue all unplayed

All of these will show a confirmation dialog just as "mark all as played" does.

This PR started with adding the ability to enqueue and download all unplayed episodes. Just downloading/enqueuing all episodes regardless of their play state seemed unreasonable to me.

When a new podcast/feed is added, all but one episodes are marked as played. To download/enqueue all episodes of a newly subscribed podcast, it became necessary to be able to undo this default behavior and mark all episodes as unplayed. 

![new](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/8307056/ced9ab4e-19bc-11e5-8376-ef19df967d32.png)

Resolves #871
Partially resolves #520

title: Question regarding continous playback
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
Hi

If I wanted to implement continuous playback by default - NOT VIA THE QUEUE. User selects the latest podcast and plays it, when done it moves to the next item what would be the easiest way to do this?

We are creating an App with one podcast preloaded and preventing adding further. Adding to the queue does not make sense due to the nature of the audio, where some are 30 seconds and goes to the next item.

Forcing the user to put audio into a queue would have to be repeated each time they used the app.

So, on playing the latest it should move to the next item downwards.

Any ideas?

title: Only call getPSMPInfo if you need both the status and the playable.
body:
Fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#942

PlaybackServiceMediaPlayer.getPSMPInfo() groups PlayerStatus and the currently playing media (Playable) in a synchronized method so that you can get a consistent picture at any one point in time as to what was happening.  Unfortunately, it was getting called in other synchronized methods (of another class) and PlaybackServiceMediaPlayer has other synchronized methods that also get called.  This occasionally results in deadlock.

To fix it, I created a non-synchronized getPlayable() and now call either getPlayerStatus or getPlayable depending on which is needed except for the rare circumstances when they are both needed. When they're both needed we still call getPSMPInfo().  Luckily, the case where we need both aren't the cases that were causing this deadlock, so I think this should solve the problem.

I would appreciate some review of these changes to make sure I didn't miss anything bad.

title: Deadlock in PlaybackService.saveCurrentPosition
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
A user reported a deadlock via Google Play. 

After looking at the dump I think what's happening is this:
saveCurrentPosition is synchronized and calls PlaybackServiceMediaPlayer.getPSMPInfo() which is itself synchronized.  PlaybackServiceMediaPlayer.setPlayerStatus (which is synchronized) calls saveCurrentPosition. Since these things can happen from different threads we wind up with deadlock.

Thread dump:

```
----- pid 29288 at 2015-06-22 14:37:04 -----
Cmd line: de.danoeh.antennapod
ABI: arm
Build type: optimized
Loaded classes: 20278 allocated classes

title: Stop UserPreference caching
body:
Refactoring of the UserPreferences class

SharedPreference values are not cache anymore as the SharedPreferences does caching itself.
Additionally, the default value for the number of parallel downloads was lower from 6 to 4.

Resolves #940

title: Rewind / Fast forward settings aren't remembered after the first launch
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Using Lollipop (5.1.1) on a Nexus 4. I encounter the following issue:
When I change the time settings for rewind and/or forward, the settings aren't saved. 
If I use another app or even go into another part of AntennaPod and go back the buttons are back to the default setting (30s).

title: Occasionally autodownload does not work in v1.2.1
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I had 5 episodes sitting in "New Episodes" that were not downloaded automatically no matter how often i hit the refresh/download button. Autodownload was activated in settings and for all respective podcasts. Downloading **each individual episode manually** one after the other worked.

This problem started for me with the update to version 1.2.1 yesterday using Google Play store.

Samsung S3 Neo (I9301l), Android 4.4.2

title: Feed picture not displayed
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Feed address: 
[http://trip.since1989.org/feed/podcast/](http://trip.since1989.org/feed/podcast/)

AntennaPod:1.2.1

title: set autodownload == false once an item is downloaded
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body:
Once an item has been downloaded once, we never really want to autodownload it again, whether or not it was downloaded this time.

Should resolve the problem in #936 related to episodes being re-downloaded once they've been deleted.

title: Episode necromancy
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
AP keeps resurrecting (downloading and adding to the queue) episodes I have listened to.

The resurrected episodes get added as new ones come out in the same feed. At one point the queue was completely empty, the next day I had the new episodes released that day, plus the previous one for each of those feeds. I have auto refresh on every 4th hour, along with autodowload/queue. 

When long-pressing on the episodes I have the option to mark them as unplayed, so I'm assuming AP remembers I've listened to them, or marked them as played/skipped (difference?) before. Marking then as unplayed gives me the option to play them. All the files exist on the device and I can play them immediately and I don't have the option to stream them.

When I notice this, I have to go into each episode, tap to remove the file, wait for the file to be removed, tap to remove it from the queue, back out, wait a while until the episode disappears from the queue (takes several seconds, if it even works), and hope they don't come back again.
Sorting the queue while doing this can get really interesting as it randomly ressurrects episodes I just removed too.

I have a Samsung S3 GT-I9300 with Cyanogenmod 12.1 and I'm currently in the alpha/beta program.

title: Remove button to Flattr AntennaPod
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="question")]
body:
Now that AntennaPod isn't being maintained by @danieloeh any longer and a team of people are working on it, Daniel, mentioned that he felt we should change who the Flattr money goes to.

After discussing with Daniel and @mfietz we decided that we should remove the ability to flattr the app.  The reason being that since the team is split up, there's no one person who the money should go to.  At the moment we have no expenses (apart from time).  So there really isn't a great way to deal with the revenue Flattr was providing.

We are, of course, very pleased that people like the app enough to donate.  We just don't know how to deal with those funds justly, and as a result felt it would be better to remove the ability to Flattr AntennaPod directly.

This should resolve #507 and #567 as we just won't support accepting money any longer.  If people have a better idea of what to do, please share it here.

title: Fix testPauseForInterruptions
body:
testPauseForInterruptions was failing, looking for the Auto Delete string.

It should have been looking for the pause playback string.

title: build 59, alpha testing
Car view
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Often use this app while driving and have my phone mounted on the dash. Play / pause, forward,  rewind  controls however are small and hard to access use while in this view. 

Propose that while in the episode player view have a slide up gesture added to the bottom control bar so that it makes that control bar take up 50-60% of the screen and finger swipe down to make back to normal.

title: Fixes Queue transition from playing local to streaming
body:
Fixes #928

The PlaybackService was not using the right FeedMedia/Playable to determine if the file was present locally or the next item would be streamed
Also works with continuous playback

title: Fix datetime parsing (seconds absent)
body: Fixes #929

title: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast #3
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
The most recent release of AntennaPod seems to have a bug that has been fixed.  Last December I reported incorrect dates on a podcast in issue #545, this was fixed correctly when the issue was closed.  With the newest release I am seen the exact same failure mode as was reported in that issue.

From that issue:
_It is the podcast for "[Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast](http://feeds.feedburner.com/RichardHerringLSTPodcast)".  Every time I add the feed it thinks every podcast is today.  The next day when I updated the feed it increments the day and shows every podcast as today._

title: Misbehaviour at end of playback when next in Queue is undownloaded
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
If you play a podcast in the Queue and the next item in the Queue is not downloaded, when the playback ends the playback controls view doesn't go away if it was open, instead just showing playback controls that don't do anything and no cover.
Furthermore, the bottom Now Playing/Play-pause bar shows the episode that just finished with the pause button.

How to replicate:
1. Put downloaded podcast in Queue
2. Put not downloaded podcast in Queue right below the previous one
3. Play first podcast
4. Go to playback controls and drag playback timer to end of file
5. Playback controls are blank (problem part 1)
6. Go back to Queue
7. Bottom bar shows just finished podcast (problem part 2)

title: Item Removed / Undo message at end of last podcast in Queue
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
When the podcast at the bottom of the Queue finishes playing, a message appears at the bottom saying "Item Removed           Undo" where pressing the Undo returns the podcast to the Queue. 
This only happens for the bottom Queue item, perhaps because for the others there is always a bar with play button for the next episode at the bottom.
Either this message should be removed entirely, or appear consistently at the end of every podcast, right now it seems like a built-in feature accidentally left on.

How to replicate:
1. Add podcast to Queue
2. Play it
3. Go to playback controls and drag time to end of podcast
4. AP goes back to Queue and shows "Item Removed" message.

title: Fixes Queue not opening, small podcasts images not scaling up and long URL not wrapping
body:
# Queue not opening

I start with the tricky bit: When the main activity is restarted or resumed, we open the last fragment the user opened. Until now, this was read and deleted (set null). When coming back from another activity (audio player), the last fragment would else (when not nulled) be read (this would be the same as the current one) and the current fragment would be loaded again (my emulator shows some sort of short flashing).

Setting the last fragment to null had the following consequence: Coming back from the audio activity, the last fragment would be read and set to null. Opening the other activity and going back would query the last fragment again, this time the preference would be null and the default value Queue would be returned. The app now believes the current fragment to be the queue and not open the queue when trying to do so via drawer. So far, so confusing...

To fix this, the main activity now stores the current fragment in a new string variable, the last fragment is no longer forgotten (nulled). When the last fragment is read, we now check if the last fragment is the current fragment (this can only be the case if the activity is resumed). If they are the same, there is nothing to be done.

Resolved #919 
# Scaling up a small cover

![small_cover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/8271363/adc6042a-1813-11e5-867c-738d73d5896b.png)

Resolves #921
# Long URL getting wrapping

![long_url](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/8271362/ab58e388-1813-11e5-8075-66697e0bf384.png)

Resolves #923

title: Download Report: introduce setting to disable
body:
Give the use the option to disable the download report.
While it is useful to see the failed downloads, if a user is subscribed
to many podcasts, most of the times a few fail, which makes the notifications rather annonying.

title: Parts of some episodes not deleted
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
While exploring the antennapod/files/media folder using ES File Explorer, I noticed some episodes that appeared to be still there which I had listened to and according to AP weren't there anymore.
I checked the release dates of those episodes and the 'last modified' date in the properties of these files, and the last modified date is probably the date of when I listened to it.
The file size displayed in the properties was also really small, and when trying to play the files it only plays for a little while before stopping.

What I think is going on is that when AP deletes a finished episode, it sometimes is interrupted somehow and part of the file remains. AP randomly crashes sometimes, so maybe that's when it gets interrupted? I have no idea how to replicate this but maybe keeping a list of files to be deleted and checking afterwards if they indeed are would work.

Edit: The files and dates, though I'm pretty sure it's nothing specific about these files or dates.
Release date    Podcast/episode                 Last modified date
2  feb      Hello Internet #30                  2015/05/25 16:47:54
4  jun      In Our Time - Prester John          2015/06/05 11:02:27
25 jul 2014 On The Media - War of Words         2015/03/31 13:09:33
22 apr 2015 Planet Money - Can You Patent A Steak   2015/04/22 22:42:48
22 may 2015 Planet Money - This Is The End      2015/05/23 15:23:36

title: Podcast URL in info window partially off screen
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: When you go to a podcast subscription from the navigation drawer, and tap the little 'i' thing you get a page with information about the subscription. Among other things, it has the URL of the feed. This URL if longer than the width of the area for it, won't continue on the next line and instead just disappear off screen.

title: Long press context menu on subscriptions
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: I like the long pressing on Queue, New Episodes, etc. to add/remove those to the nav drawer. I think the same long press should do something for the subscriptions, like giving you a menu to unsubscribe.

title: Podcast icon in playback view really small
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
In previous versions, the podcast icon seemed to always be scaled up to the full width of the phone when in 'playback view' (where you only really see the podcast you're playing and have all the playback controls).
Now, some podcasts have really small icons in the middle, which I suppose means they aren't high-res enough to fill the entire screen. If this was a deliberate choice so be it, but I preferred it the old way so here's hoping it's accidental :)

title: AntennaPod shows up as audio playback app, but behaves strangely when so used
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I'm using ES File Explorer on a Nexus 5 running android 5.1

When I open mp3 files from ESFE, it suggests its own player and antennapod, but if I use antennapod a number of things can happen:
- Sometimes, the music starts playing, but an app crash notification comes up and when ok is pressed the music stops
- Sometimes, when the previously played and paused file is such an external mp3, opening another just opens the previous file
- Sometimes when opening an external mp3 file, it works! But then, when I closeswipe antennapod, the music doesn't stop, with no clear way of how to then stop it

All in all, unless antennapod is somehow made into a half-decent audio-file player, I suggest not having it listed as such.

title: Menu navigation Queue button doesn't always open Queue
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
In the side menu, there are buttons for the Queue, all the individual podcast subscriptions and the settings, among other things. Through some voodoo witchcraft navigation, it is possible to be in the window of a subscription, and when clicking on the Queue button, not going to the Queue instead staying in that subscription. I don't have a consistent way of arriving at this yet, but these are the approximate steps:
1. Start at Queue
2. Go to a subscription's page
???. 
Navigate to some pages that have back arrows in the top left
Also, use the android back button not the app's one
At some point, use the home screen to go to the android home page, and relaunch the app using the app icon
4. Through some combination of the ??? above, you end up at the subscription's page but clicking the Queue button won't take you to the Queue, leaving you stuck at the subscription's page until you go to New Episodes or something like that

title: New episode count for each podcasts remains after downloading
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
The per podcast new episode count shown in the side menu doesn't go down/ disappear after downloading the new episodes, whereas it does for the all new episodes count on the New Episodes button.

Edit: This issue should be labelled as bug, but I can't for the life of me find where to do so.

Edit 2: This not-disappearing-of-counts started in I think version 1.2, and it hasn't fixed the existing miscounts in updating to 1.2.1, but I don't know yet if it still miscounts in 1.2.1.

title: Audio from video streaming ?
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi

I realize AntennaPod is geared towards audio but would not hurt is audio streaming from a video streaming is possible with it. Basicaly it will just  play audio from a video stream if possible. The reason I am bringing it up because it might be cheaper from the batter usage perspective maybe?

title: 1.2.1 moved to production
build 58
Disable embedded images
body: for now...

body:

Specs, Motorola Moto X, Android 4.4.2 Antennapod 1.2 (Google play)

title: Slow loading of views in 1.2
body:
Moto G 4G 
Android 5.1/4.4.4
AntennaPod: 1.2
23 Podcasts on external SD class 10

After the upgrade to AntennaPod 1.2 loading the different Views like "all episodes" take quite long (20 sec). It only happens if you switch between different views. Switching from App to Home Screen doesn't force it to reload. 
I didn't have this problem with 1.x. Loading times were way shorter.

title: Some remarks on the version released on 16.06.2015 (performance issues)
body:
Hi, I'm no contributer to AntennaPod, but simply a single user observing some issues with the newest version of AntennaPod. The update was done automatically within my Wiko Rainbow (Android 4.4.2) at 16.06.

First of all thank you for this marvellous piece of software. I'm that glad to have it as no other podcast-player on Android is that simple, minimalistic, stable and focused.

With the newest update from 16.06.2015 I observe a significant delay in displaying the episodes-lists, the played list, the podcasts themselves, etc.
The feature showing the unlistened episodes on the right side of the podcasts is great, however it looks like all the changes have changed the speed of the application overall.

Showing the playing list with 321 entries needs more than 20 seconds. Potentially a problem with the length of the list as after deletion of the playing list things are fine again.

However adding a podcast-episode to the playing list by using the context menu lasts ~10-15 seconds.

Opening a podcast-overview lasts 2-3 seconds. That's definitely longer than before. Not dramatic, but new.

But the most significant problem I observed first today having no internet connection at all. I have downloaded all the episodes and placed them in the playing list. Opening the playing list lasted approx. 40-50 seconds. Jumping back and opening one of the podcasts directly was not possible, no episodes were displayed. From my perspective AntennaPod seems to unusable if there's no internet connection even the episodes are downloaded. I could not observe this behaviour with the previously installed version.

Perhaps you can use these details for further improvement. With a heavy heart I will have to search for another podcast-player.

Ciao, Georg

title: Store information if file has embedded picture in the database
body:
We now store in the database if a media file has an embedded picture. In principle, this makes any further checking superfluous.

Migration: Already downloaded files are checked and the database is updated accordingly. While the files are processed, we show a progress dialog to the user. (This dialog will be shown in future database migration)

This branch is based on the similar hotfix.

Resolves #898

Considering that we do not have playlist per se, it would be very nice if we could have a second stack for things we might listen later, podcasts that we might want to check out later. thanks

title: Huge memory usage on AntennaPod 1.2
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
On my Nexus 4 and 7 (both running Cyanogenmod 12.1 nightly) I've noticed that downloading of feeds and episodes causes unusual high memory usage. It's increasing with the number of downloads in parallel but the used memory is not assigned to AntennaPod itself but seems to be used by the android system. While "system" is used to use around 300 MB on my Nexus 7 when idle, it's increasing to 750 MB while downloading 3 episodes and to more than 1.1 GB when downloading 10. Sometimes the used system memory stays at 800 MB, even after the downloads are finished and AntennaPod was killed using a task killer.

I could reproduce this behaviour after reinstalling (only imported my previously created OPML file). In Version 1.1.2 the memory usage is perfectly normal so I'm now back on this version.

title: Any ideas for AntennaPod 1.3?
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Now that 1.2 is released it's time to start thinking about 1.3.

There have been some suggestions for major UI improvements. Some visible, some under the covers.  I think it would make sense to think through all the GUI related features and changes we want and try to make them all work well together.

Some thoughts on improvements:
- Material design overhaul
- ~~Use of RecyclerView in place of DSLV~~
- New subscription view (#848, #836)
- ~~Better sharing of episodes (#861)~~
- Display of itunes 'explicit' tags (#724)
- Filtering by itunes 'explicit' tags (#725)
- ~~Support for multiple queues~~
  - I don't think this will happen in 1.3
- ~~Improve visibility of adding podcasts via iTunes~~ - Done
  - This is really the easiest way of adding podcasts
  - Perhaps making it the first option users see and only labeling it 'search'?
- ~~Download all episodes from a feed (#871, #520)~~
- ~~Episode forward/back (#732)~~

I bet there are some other good thoughts on what could be done. 

We should think hard about any changes to how we interact with the app, how these features would change them and how they could all work together.

title: Cache and deletion questions, skip button in player missing
body:
Hi,
I have only recently begun to experiment with AntennaPod, but I like it so far. This is more of a question than a bug report maybe. I'm wondering about the skip button and the auto delete behavior.
I am on the Google play version 1.1.2 and I download episodes manually so far.
I understand that there's a cache where episodes go after I listened to them and the oldest gets deleted from there once it's full. Or do all episodes go there once I download them and they delete no matter whether I ever listened to them? Is there a way to list all episodes that I have currently downloaded? Does the cache only work with auto-downloading?

The auto-delete after playback option is in addition to the cache, isn't it?

https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/111 talks about a skip button in relation to auto-deleting. This is exactly the behavior that I am looking for. However, the skip button is just not there on my phone. Or I cannot spot it :)
The notification area only shows play / pause. What's the easiest way to get to the next episode? 

Kind regards,
Matthias Kauer

![screenshot_2015-06-16-09-33-17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2436121/8174509/eed5c4b2-140f-11e5-88d2-5f27dadbef42.png)

Or, bury it behind the overflow menu, but in this case white screen is often wasted.

label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
This request came from the play store:

> Good except for a disastrous flaw Dear Developer, this app is beautiful and I just love it. Yet, there's just one bug which bugs me night and day: there being no code to manually and automatically pause downloading, half the time the downloads result in errors, on our slow connection speeds of 512 kbps. I'd request you to kindly implement this in an update so that we no longer face this problem that makes one's head boil with anger. Thank You.

I'm not sure how this might work, but it seems like a legitimate request.

When I use the forward button the episode jumps to the beginning. Same is happening when I type on any position of the track (line). A delete and afterwards resubscribe doesn't have any difference. It's not working.

Software: CyanogenMod 12.1
Android: 5.1.1
AndennaPod: 1.1.2

EDIT
Streaming of an episode works. The issue appears only with downloaded episodes.

title: Auto delete option being ignored

body: I have the "Auto Delete" setting unchecked, but after an episode finishes playing AntennaPod will usually still delete it. Oddly, this seems non-deterministic, as sometimes it will keep the download.

title: Update strings 1.2
body: updated a number of strings from Transifex. Going to wait before declaring #843 done to see if there are any updated translations.

title: Fixes "gzip finished without exhausting source" error
body:
Resolves #854

I can only guess what exactly goes wrong here.
My guess is that okhttp either has a bug in its un-gzip and throws an error although the data was read correctly - or the server does not comply with some standard (e.g. there is no content-length field).

Catching the exception and just continuing as if nothing happened seems to work.

Not sure if additional checks would do any good. We could check the content length if it is sent by the server, but a lot of servers seem to get that wrong (sending the content length of the unzipped data)

title: Prestissimo-related crashes
body:
When using prestissimo, AntennaPod crashes from time to time, either when the application is off for a long time, or when jumping to the next podcast (not 100% of the time, though. sometimes I do get to play 2 consecutive podcasts at x1.2, but most of the time it will fail when switching to the next one).

My default speeds are 1x and 1.2x. I usually listen to speech podcasts at 1.2x, and Music at 1x.

After a crash (sometimes the App stops, and sometime it just refuses to play), I need to do the following to get it back to work:
1. go to the Application list ("square" icon/button on Lollipop), and remove the app from the list.
2. Turn off the phone for a few seconds to ensure it's removed from memory.
3. turn on the phone and run the app again.
4. Try playing again. It will play for a brief time (< 1s) and then stop playing. however, it is still responsive and will let me press the prestissimo speed indication and set it back to 1.0
5. Repeat step (1) - (3) 
6. try playing again, this time it will play, but at 1x speed.
7. Wait a few seconds, then press the 1.0 to turn it into 1.2

This has been like this for a very long time, I'm not sure if it ever worked flawlessly.

It should be "Dplacer vers le haut de la liste".
Note that the string "Move to the bottom of the list" is displayed just fine.

Ii wasn't able to find this string in Transifex, is this maybe an Android issue?

Samsung Galaxy S4 mini, running Cyanogenmod 12.1 - Android 5.1.1

title: Crash when downloading episodes manually in a particular order
body:
Running:
AntennaPod 1.1.2 on CyanogenMod CM11 M11 and a Galaxy S4.  AntennaPod is set up so that podcast episodes must be manually downloaded

Issue: 
If I have at least two new podcast episodes in my download list, downloading the 2nd after the first causing the error `unfortunately antennapod has stopped`  and AntennaPod to restart

If I have a number of new episodes, for example 3, available in my queue for downloads. 
1. podcast1_e12
2. podcast2_e05
3. podcast3_e634

I start to download these new episodes first pressing the download icon for `podcast1_e12`.  The download begins, I then click the download icon for `podcast2_e05`.  As soon as I do this AntennaPod crashes/restarts with error `unfortunately antennapod has stopped`.  The crash is always on the 2nd podcast in the list and no others (largest sample to date is 4).

However if I try and download them in any other order than `1`, `2`, `3` the download works fine.

If I do it in any order other than `1`, `2`, `3` and then cancel all downloads I am then able to download in order `1`, `2`, `3` with out a crash.

title: Feature request: tags for podcasts and episodes
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Having a lot of podcasts is difficult to manage in AntennaPod.

Adding tags to podcasts would allow searching podcasts and episodes by tag, and create virtual playlists by tag. A tag assigned to a podcast would assign this tag to all its episodes.

Also it would be nice to add tags to unique episodes. Favourites  feature could be implemented using an episode "favorite" tag.

title: Allow auto downloading of queued but played episodes
body:
Resolves #839

This is only used by the auto download algorithm. Auto download candidates are items in the queue and unplayed items. For the later, the removed criteria is always true.
Episodes in the queue should be auto downloaded regardless if they are played or not.

title: Reenabling auto-download is not effective
body:
An item that has been deactivated and reactivated download won't be auto-downloaded.

How to reproduce this:
- Wait for an item to be downloading (or delete the download to force it).
- Cancel download. The app will disable auto-download for the item.
- Reenable auto-download for the item.
- Delete next downloaded episodes.
- Wait for download (or force it, by disabling and reenabling wifi).

Expected result: The reenabled item should download

Actual result: Following items would be downloaded instead

Version. 1.2 build 54.

title: Clips often fail to play when using BT headset
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Currently playing clips are usually OK, but if the next one comes up -- the app frequently stops playing (and often can't start back up) until the BT headset is disconnected.
When disconnected, next clip can be played and if BT headset is connected while playing, everything is fine.

Notes:
- Does not stop on every clip transition.
- Some clips refuse to start playing via BT headset almost 100% of the time (different podcast/filetype??)
- I usually listen at up to 2.3x speed, but switching down to 1.0 doesn't seem to help much.

Possibly unrelated: sometimes "Prestissimo has stopped" error pops up, then the clip starts playing at 1.0x speed (and speed controls become unavailable until playback is paused)

title: End of clip cut off when playing at >1x speed
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When listening at higher speed than 1x, tail of the clip is being cut off. It's always a small amount of time -- but at a high speed, it's not negligible.

Example clip: http://www.npr.org/2015/05/26/409673364/artist-makes-money-off-other-peoples-instagram-photos
1x cuts off the last word
2.3x cuts off last 2 sentences

Notes:
- I listen to podcasts at up to 2.3x speed

title: updated versionCode for build 54
Fix sharing opml
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
- When adding a feed via sharing the AntennaPod action now says 'Add Podcast' (hopefully this will make it more clear this isn't the activity to import OPML)
- Now supporting opening OPML files from Gmail and the Downloads folder
- Simplified processing of Intents in OpmlImportFromPathActivity
- We don't currently support importing OPML from just sharing a URL. We'll have to add that later. (issue #833)

title: Support importing OPML if the user shares an OPML link
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Currently the OPML import task isn't shown if the user shares an OPML link from a web browser. They will get the 'Add Podcast' option though.

This is something we should definitely support, since otherwise users may be confused.

title: reverting to tryLock for getPosition
body:
Fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#829

We'll have to live with this for a bit to ensure it actually fixes the problem.

title: AntennaPod not proposed anymore to play externally downloaded audio file
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I often download .mp3 or .ogg files of audiobooks (usually 8+h content), and used to read them with AntennaPod aside from using AP for my regular podcast listening (in particular because of the accelerated playback speed).

My previous phone was a Samsung Galaxy S2 running Cyanogenmod, but since this weekend I have a new phone (S Galaxy S4 mini, running Cyanogenmod 12.1 - Android 5.1.1). When I select an audio file, I don't get AntennaPod as a suggested application to open it (only the default Music app, and VLC which I have installed myself).

I don't think this would be due to a recent change in AP (the manifest file still lists the intent-filter `<data android:scheme="file"/>` and `<data android:mimeType="audio/*"/>`, but maybe something changed in Android 5.X that requires an update in the manifest file?

Until we figure this out, I'm putting my "reading" of the biography of Andrew Carnegie on hold, I just cant listen to a 32+ hours audiobook at 1x speed ;)

title: Deadlock during playback in 1.2 alpha
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I ran in to a deadlock issue when testing 1.2 build 53 on my HTC One M7 running 5.0.2.

It started when playback was getting interrupted by navigation. Some of the interruptions worked and then eventually playback just never resumed.  Eventually I hooked it up to adb logcat and was able to see it generate the traces.txt file.

The entire time it was locked it was printing lots of these messages:

```
05-23 16:38:10.624: D/PlayerWidgetService(1653): Service was called while updating. Ignoring update request
```

I think this may be due to [this change](https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod/commit/fd30ec8189a1d9b47adfa31a9fe7dbc2085061f6#diff-28d8471f71a58338c63e08375776702aL537) where the tryLock() was changed to a lock(). 

[Here is a dump of the thread traces](https://gist.github.com/TomHennen/8c946d4ef0c72ae40b02)

title: weird connection errors over wifi
body:
I've installed the latest version 1.1.2 from the PlayStore on both my mobile phone and my tablet and recieve connection errors with some feeds and when trying to connect to gpodder.net over wifi. With gpodder the following error message appears:

java.net.SocketTimeoutException: failed to connect to gpodder.net/2605:2700:0:5::4713:9656 (port 443) after 30000ms

Many feeds are working fine, but for these I get a similar error message:

http://blog.ct.de/ctuplink/ctuplink.rss
https://netzpolitik.org/category/netzpolitik-podcast/feed/
http://stimmen.univie.ac.at/feed/mp3
http://www.jungundnaiv-podcast.de/feed/mp3
http://feeds.feedburner.com/sowiradio?format=xml
http://chaosradio.ccc.de/chaosradio-latest.rss
http://cre.fm/feed/mp3/

The error messages always include IPv6 adresses and read like this

failed to connect to cre.fm/2a01:a380:4408:a001::30 (port 80) after 30000ms

The error does only occur over wifi. When trying to connect to gpodder or downloading feeds via mobile data connections everything is working fine. The issue also had appeared in the last version by the way.

Thanks in advance!

title: Fix ActionBar SearchView
body:
Tested on 2.3 and 4.2.
Both Light and Dark theme work (correct icon, text color etc.)

title: Gpodder synchronization fixes
body:
[Interesting stuff is in the second commit] Changes 'n' Fixes: - Episode actions are sent immediately (not only on feed refresh) - Fixed episode identifier - Local changes overwrite remote changes: If gpodder sends a podcast unsubscribe, but the local changes include subscribing to that podcast, we go with the local information.
Reasoning: Subscriptions are sync immediately after adding/removing, our local data is most likely more recent

title: Nav indicators, context menus and new "new"
body:
All of this is open for discussion, some of the context menus might be too crowded... Now, they basically include any possible action that is not reachable within one click (thing: no button for it)
# New "new"

New no longer means unread/unplayed. It still has to be unread, but additionally
- Not in the queue
- Media not downloaded
- Not paused (partially played)

An item can become read, if it is marked as read, it is completely played or it smart mark as played is activated and the threshold is reached.
# Nav draver indicators

![failed-indicator](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/7572098/290403ca-f81c-11e4-9b78-18e4df4d4b55.png)
- Indicator when a feed refresh failed
- Number of unread episodes per feed
- Feeds are ordered by the number of unplayed episodes
# FeedItem context

![itemlist-context](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/7572140/64ca321c-f81c-11e4-8a9e-9b062e4bc00b.png)
# Context menu for queue, new episodes and all episodes

![queue-all-context](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/7572167/86cedc64-f81c-11e4-821d-278af8306a0a.png)

Resolves #796 
Resolves #589
Resolves #752
Resolves #819

body:
On 2.3 devices the text in the search box for adding a podcast via iTunes was barely visible.

This gives the text the correct color.

body: fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#805

title: Merge 1.1.2 change in to develop
body: 1.1.2 fixed a problem with the gpodder.net certificate handling for 2.3 devices. We should merge that change in to 1.2.  There will likely be a merge conflict when dealing with AndroidManifest.xml and about.html. We should probably just take the version of those files that are in develop.

title: Storage quota on data folder
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="needs info")]
body:
It would be great if a could put a quota in GB on the data folder.
Therefore, if the storage space of all the downloaded episodes reach over this limit, the oldest ones will be deleted.

title: Option to set all episodes older than 'n' to be deleted.
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="needs info")]
body: I would really like to see an option in AntennaPod to be able to set that all episodes older than 'n' days should be deleted. It could either be a sliding scale, or something like "one week", "two weeks", "one month", six months" or "one year". It would of course be even better if you could set this on a per subscribed podcast basis.

title: widget incorrectly displays information when podcast episode ends
body:
There appears to be a small issue with the widget that when the current listening episode ends all the information updates for the next podcast except the time.

What you get:

```
podcast-new title
podcast-old time played / time total
```

In the case of the time played and time total they are the same, eg 30:00 / 30:00

What you should get

```
podcast-new title
podcast-new time played / time total
```

In the case of the time played and time total they are the same, eg 00:00 / 30:00

title: Fixed another minor typo
body:
Also added quotes around the setting string to better parse the message. Otherwise it sounds like:

> "[This app is currently] Downloading over mobile data connection is disabled in the settings"

which seems grammatically incorrect until realizing that the first part is referring to the setting, and not an action currently being undertaken.

title: 'Search' displays in toolbar as word and not icon
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When the search button is displayed in the toolbar it is sometimes displayed as the word 'search' instead of the search icon (the magnifying glass).

This happened on 2.3.7 in the New Episodes view when that view was empty (no new episodes). May occur at other times.

title: Mark as unplayed
body: Would it be possible to get an option to mark episodes of podcasts as new/unlplayed if they get accidentally played.  At the moment the only way to reset the play status appears to be to play the podcast, pause it and manually scrub back to the start (00:00 time)

title: Convert AsyncTasks to IntentService
body:
Hi `AntennaPod` developers, I'm a Ph.D. student and doing research on Android async programming, particularly on AsyncTask and IntentService. AsyncTask can lead to memory leak and losing task result when GUI is recreated during task running (such as orientation change). [This article](http://bon-app-etit.blogspot.com/2013/04/the-dark-side-of-asynctask.html) describes the problems very well. 

We discussed with some Android experts and they agree with this issue, and claim that AsyncTask can be considered only for short tasks (less than 1 second). However, using IntentService (or AsyncTaskLoader) can avoid such problems since their lifecycles are independent from `Activity`/`Fragment`.

In `AntennaPod`, many of the AsyncTasks are declared as non-static inner classes of `Activity`/`Fragment`. So the above issue can occur (especially for relatively long tasks).

I refactored 8 AsyncTasks in `AntennaPod` to IntentService (in separate commits), with the help of a refactoring tool we developed. I also mark some types as `Serializable` in order to put them into Intent. Do you think using IntentService should be better in some of these 8 scenario? Do you want to merge (some) commits in this pr? Thanks.

title: Episodes with a PlaybackCompletionDate should be delete before those without.
body:
Episodes that are not played yet (getPlaybackCompletionDate()==null) should be sorted in as now and not 1.1.1970

When sorted in as "now", these episodes are delete later in auto cleanup mode, than played once.

title: Cancel Auto Downloads
body:
- Creates a new field boolean auto_download field in the DB's FeedItem model (default: true).
- When the user cancels a (manual or automatic) download, this field is set to false.
- Migration: The value for existing FeedItems is read from the Feed's auto_download field.
- Refactoring of the Auto Download algorithm. When IDs are provided, don't read all  items that are queued or unread and filter by ID, pull items with an acceptable ID from the database directly.

Resolves #760

title: Optionally resume playback after call
body:
Defaults to true.

fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#753

Also fixed warning due to TAG being too long for log statements.

Details: I'm running AntennaPod v1.1.1 on CyanogenMod (KitKat).

title: make downloaded media files world-readable
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
otherwise prestissimo has no access to files created by AntennaPod

This issue is comes to light when media is stored on a filesystem that obeys file permissions.  At the moment downloaded files are readable only for AntennaPod UID.

If you point me to the right place in code where completed downloads can be processed, I'll supply push request.

title: Support syncing with TT-RSS
body:
I use [Tiny-Tiny RSS](https://tt-rss.org/redmine/projects/tt-rss/wiki) (a.k.a. TT-RSS) to manage my RSS feeds, including podcasts, but I generally prefer to use it as a backend for applications like [Liferea](http://lzone.de/liferea/) on the desktop, which use TT-RSS's [API](https://tt-rss.org/redmine/projects/tt-rss/wiki/JsonApiReference) to sync feeds.

It'd be great if Antennapod could sync with TT-RSS similarly to the way it works with gpodder.net, with the ability to specify a particular folder/category within the TT-RSS tree as the root for podcasts and have new subscriptions added within Antennapod placed there, read/unread status updated as appropriate, etc.

title: Download Report
body:
A download report is only generated if at least one of the downloads (not including images, only feeds and media files) failed.

Before, this notification would show the refresh icon, ticker "Downloads completed", content title "Downloads completed".

Now: notification shows refresh icon with exclamation mark, ticker "Downloads completed with error(s)", content title "Download report"

title: Automatic download problem
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
I tested (months ago) the WiFi Filter. I activated the filter and added my home and work wifi. 
But I changed my mind and deactivated the filter (home and work remained with an checkmark, but grayed out) . 
Now I found out the automatic downloads does not work on other wifi than both selected.

label: [Label(name="feature request")]

title: Retry failed downloads in the download log
body:
What it looks like:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/7372433/f9a0b740-edc6-11e4-9a05-bcd32157d3d6.png)

What it does:
- Failed feed downloads (refresh) and media downloads have a retry button
- If there is a newer successful entry for a feed or feed media, the user cannot retry (because it is pointless, obviously)
- Successful feed refreshes now create a download log entry when the last refresh failed
- Wow, such layout, much fancy  [woof]

Resolves #541

title: Toggle option to have episodes deleted when swiped off the queue.
body:
Hi,

I would like to see a toggle option to have episodes deleted when swiped off the queue regardless of whether they are listened to or not. If that's not feasible a context menu option to delete the episode in addition to moving it up and remove it from the queue would be helpful.

The way I use AntennaPod keeps me in the queue most of the time. That is where I play from (thank you for including direct playback from the queue) and organize my listening, so it would be great if I could delete episodes from there also.

title: Bring user to ItemListView when subscribing to a podcast
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I've been thinking that we have a bad user experience when you first subscribe to a podcast. Namely, you subscribe and then have to click back like 4 times to get to the main screen. It would be nice if when you subscribe it takes you to the subscribed podcast view (ItemListFragment), and then you don't have to navigate all those back buttons. 

This should make it much easier for people to interact with the podcast they just subscribed to.

On devices with bigger screens it can be annoying to open the notification area for nothing....

This basically means that the events provided to onScroll are null. From onScroll:

```
public boolean onScroll(MotionEvent e1, MotionEvent e2, float distanceX, float distanceY) {

        final int x1 = (int) e1.getX();   // this is line 381
        final int y1 = (int) e1.getY();
        final int x2 = (int) e2.getX();
        final int y2 = (int) e2.getY();
```

I don't think this is DSLV's 'fault', but it should be easy enough to fix.

body:
Hi!
I'd like to mark multiple episodes to apply actions.
For example if I want to mark some episodes as
read.

title: Stopping downloads does not work
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
- Enable autodownload. Refresh so that a number of new episodes is found.
- Open the "Downloads" view. Choose any new episode and click the "x" on the right to stop the download.
- Each time a download of another item has finished, the episode where the download is stopped will be marked to be downloaded again.

title: Nav Drawer Preferences
body:
Includes:
- Drawer longclick dialog
- Drawer preference (all of the lists can be hidden, this is the fallback)
- Restore last fragment (lists and feeds)
- Fragments are referred by their tag (lists) or their (feed) id
- Drawer dialog UI tests
- UI optimizations

title: Don't obfuscate with ProGuard
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="question")]
body:
It can make a mess of the crash reports. Yes, if we keep the mapping we could reproduce them.

But is there any upside to obfuscating? We're an open source application. There's no IP to protect?

I'm considering adding `-dontobfuscate` to proguard.cfg. 

Are there any reasons I shouldn't?

(see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9651703/using-proguard-with-android-without-obfuscation for some potential problems and a solution)

title: Merge v1.1.1 -> develop (v2)
body: Branch was not up to date. Luckily, only small commits.

title: Merge v1.1.1 and develop
Fixed some NullPointerExceptions
body:
These were happening on some handsets when onPrepareOptionsMenu was getting called.

It is sometimes called before the menu is actually loaded, causing us to not find the
MenuItem we're looking for.

This solves the symptom, if not the cause.

After making this change the number of failures reported on Apkudo dropped from 20 devices to just 6.

title: Playback Issues
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I've recently noticed some issues with the playback bar. When trying to move forward or back within the recording, it's almost like there's randomization going on. The current position marker jumps around, sometimes 15 minutes, sometimes more, and always in reverse. It's the same with the forward button in the playback: it always moves backwards in the recording. Has anyone else experienced this?

I've got version 1.1 installed on an HTC One(M8) running Android 5.0.1.

title: AntennaPod fails to resume after a phone call
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
When a phone call is received via a Bluetooth headset and 'Pause for interruptions' is set in the settings, the podcast playback stops correctly, but never resumes when the phone call ends.

When on the other hand, it is interrupted by GPS navigation messages (e.g. Waze), it correctly resumes playing the podcast.

I din't think it is relevant, but 'Headphone' disconnect and 'Headphone reconnect' are also enabled.

title: Should indicate which Feeds failed to refresh
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It would be nice if we prominently indicated which feeds failed to refresh. You can probably get this from the download log but something more in your face would be nice. An indicator on the Podcast itself in the Nav drawer perhaps?

Taken from a play store comment:

> Stopped showing new podcasts Used to be good, but won't show which podcasts it has failed to refresh. Podcast Addict doesn't have this problem so will be using that from now on. Update: The app will not show me which podcasts have failed or succeeded to download. Podcast Addict shows that certain podcasts have new content, this app does not right now.

title: updating build number for 1.1.1 alpha test
Release 1.1.1 needs testing
body:
I recently uploaded a release candidate of 1.1.1 to the Alpha channel for testing (you can also find it here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/7dyg37vi34gqunu/AntennaPod_1.1.1_release.apk?dl=0).

This resolves some issues that were reported by users who missed the All Episodes view and used it instead of the Queue.

All things considered this is a fairly minor change. But some feedback would be welcome before we push it out to production.

Are there any other immediate changes we should include in 1.1.1?  My hope is to get this out quickly to help out folks that are currently broken, but if anything is missing and straightforward we could include it now (or in a 1.1.2).

Changelog:
## Version 1.1.1
- All Episodes and New Episodes are now both present
- Remembers which activity was last active instead of always going to the Queue
- When adding a podcast the most recent episode is considered 'new'

title: Downloaded items not added the queue
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
From Google Play

```
Can't see downloaded episodes Why did you remove the All Podcasts list? Once a podcast is downloaded, it is removed from the New Podcast list, and not added to my queue. Its hard to see what podcasts I have to listen to.
```

So I wouldn't worry much about this, except that they say the that after the episode is downloaded it doesn't show up in the Queue.  My guess is that they don't have auto add enabled. But that's definitely not good behavior. Once #748 is published his overall issue should go away, but the queue, at least for him, isn't working the way it should. We should take a look at this.

title: New and all episodes
body: This helps resolve #741 and #742. A redo of PR #744.

title: now saving the last navigation fragment the user had loaded
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body: For issues #741 and #742. Now restoring the last navigation fragment the user was viewing when AntennaPod was closed. This should give the user a more seamless experience where they don't see fragments they aren't expecting.

title: Add "Delayed Delete" to the "Auto Delete" feature
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
It has happened to me a number of times when my phone crashed while AntennaPod was playing a podcast and when the phone resumes normal operation that episode of the podcast has been deleted.
I think that happens because I have the "Auto Delete" feature enabled and somehow AntennaPod "thinks" that the episode has finished playing and by such it deletes the episode.
Would it be possible to create a "Delayed Delete" feature tied to the "Auto Delete" that would mark the episodes to be deleted but would only delete them 24 hours later?
Thanks in advance.

title: Control order of episodes
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
Sometimes I would like to control the order of episodes displayed. I might want to listen to the podcast from the first. Right now, I have to scroll all the way down to play each episode and this is especially a problem if there are a lot of episodes in the podcast. 

Could there be an option to control the order of podcasts by "Date-Added" or so on?

title: New and all episodes
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body:
Initial PR to have both 'All Episodes' and 'New Episodes'.

We might want to choose a different icon for All Episodes. We currently use the Queue icon (was better than New Episodes).

This helps resolve #741 and #742.  It also resolves some of the issues we were having with swiping to mark items as read when the user was view all the episodes. Currently the user can't swipe to mark things as read in the All Episodes view.

![All and New Episodes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5216560/7172510/1f7a1c64-e3b7-11e4-9a25-441c8f77cd06.png)

title: now saving the last navigation fragment the user had loaded
label: [Label(name="awaiting review")]
body: For issues #741 and #742. Now restoring the last navigation fragment the user was viewing when AntennaPod was closed. This should give the user a more seamless experience where they don't see fragments they aren't expecting.

title: Major missed use case: Managing everything from 'All Episodes'
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I think we missed a major use case of 'All Episodes'

From a recent play store review:

```
All episodes listing removed No clue why it was removed, now I have to look at a list with barely visible episodes. The old listing was far better. Showed episodes and clearly showed what was new. Silly change for the sake of change. Nothing beneficial.
```

The user from #741 also seemed to care quite a bit about 'All Episodes'.

I think some users (not sure how many) weren't actually using the queue. They were just using All Episodes and playing things as they wished.  Our changes disrupted their workflow significantly.  We didn't notice this because we all play everything from the queue and thought of 'All Episodes' as a place to go simply to add things to the Queue.

I'd like to suggest the following changes for a 1.1.1 release (based on the version_1.1 branch):
- Instead of defaulting to the Queue view, we should really just display the last fragment the user was looking at when the app closed
- We should probably decrease or remove the amount of fading that happens to 'read' episodes in the 'New Episodes' list
- We should see if there are any low risk ways to implement some of @heckler01's suggestions from #721 (if there's no easy way it can wait for a more major update)

Thoughts?

title: Issues Reported from Google Groups "Please(!) bring back the "all episodes" list"
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I had a discussion with someone on the Google Group for AntennaPod.  I'm not quite sure why they're experiencing the issues they're seeing. If it's something to do with the device they're using or if this is a usability issue or some combination of the two.  He seems frustrated enough that we should probably consider what is going on and think about how it could be addressed.  I'm following up with the author to find out what device they're using.

Tim:

```
Sad enough that you had to switch from the play list to "all episodes" every time you launch the app for a few months now, the "all episodes" lists is now missing completely. If I want to listen to an episode now, I have to search 3 lists to find it. This makes this great app almost unusable. Additionally, you have to scroll very, very carefully now not to swype one of the episodes out of the list.
Please bring back the "all episodes" list or at least have a switch in the settings to turn it on. I was so glad I found a good podcast app, finally, I don't want to move all my podcasts again.
```

Me:

```
Hi Tim,

The All Episodes list is still around, it's just called 'New Episodes'.  'New Episodes' defaults to showing only those episodes that haven't been added to the queue.  However, you can click the little three dots and clear the option that says to show new episodes only.

I wonder if you're using the app in a way that is somehow different from how most other people are using it.  Most people add episodes to the queue and listen to them from there.  You can configure the app to do this for you automatically if you like.
```

Tim

```
Thanks for your answer. I tried to use the app the way you proposed now and add the episodes I want to listen to to the playlist, but this release seems to be extremely buggy. E.g.
- Some of my podcasts were in the playlist, some are not, I could not figure out what rule is behind this. So I decided to start from scracht und delete the episodes in the playlist to start with an empty one and add the episodes I plan to listen to. A few seconds after I emptied the list, more and more seemingly random episodes appeared in the list again. If I swype episodes away from the playlist, these exact same episode appear again in the list (happened 4 times with one episode) after a few seconds or minutes. The list is constantly filled up with random episodes - and the app seems to start downloading these random episodes after adding them to the list.
- If "swyping away" multiple episodes in a row, the app reproducibly crases
- Some of my podcasts are automatically downloaded, some are not, even though I have "automatic download" enabled for all podcasts (but this problem also existed in previous releases)
- If I download podcasts manually in the "new eposodes" list, they are not marked as downloaded after the download (at least in 90% of the cases) - so I don't know which one I already downloaded
- As already said, swyping is much more sensive than in any other app, which always makes you swype episodes away when scolling. Undoing the operation does not bring back the episode, at least not until changing to another list and then opening the first list again.
- Loading the list sometimes takes minutes - or maybe the process hangs somehow. I never experienced that with the previous releases.

Maybe going back to the last stable release and fixing the bugs beforde publishing the new release would be a good idea. I really appreciate the work you do for a good, free opensource app, but on my part I cannot really use the app in this condition.
```

Me:

```
Hmm. We honestly haven't had those problems (crashes, random downloads, etc...) and have received mostly positive feedback regarding this release.

However, I'm certainly concerned. I'll be sure to relay these concerns to the rest of the team and we'll see what we can do.
```

title: Episode cache preferences has to many entries
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Here is a screenshot from an emulated Moto X running 4.4.4:
![ec](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/7121456/ee603b5c-e214-11e4-97d4-f2754a77379d.png)

When the episode cache dialog opens, the first entry is completely invisible. I find this extremely user unfriendly, I should not have to scroll in such dialogs.

I think we should get rid of at least 2 options. 1 and 2 seem completely unnecessary. Proposal: Unlimited, 5, 10, 25, 50, 100

Another solution could be to have have the option unlimited (and maybe some valies) and a textfield where one can input the desired value. Advantage: Most flexible. Disadvantage: Having to type a value...

title: Version 1.1
body: Merging 1.1 changes in to master.

title: gpodder now properly sets the initial data for feeds
body: Fixes a bug where GPodnetSyncService was setting the wrong date when importing new feeds.  This result in feeds not being displayed since the system thought there was nothing new.

title: update strings for release 1.1
body: closes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#708

title: Episode Forward/Back
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
AntennaPod doesn't currently have a way to easily skip to the next episode.  You can go to a sub-menu and click 'Skip episode' and that will do it, but it's not very accessible.  

I personally want to skip past episodes a lot, but that doesn't necessarily mean I want them removed from the queue.

I think ideally we could add track forward/back buttons that let you navigate in your queue without removing episodes when you do so.  These buttons (or at least forward) should be available on the widgets.  Additionally, it should be possible to configure bluetooth buttons to track forward/back instead of rewind/fast forward.  Does anyone else think such a thing is desirable?

A lower-effort method would be to simply expose 'Skip episode' as a button on the various player widgets.

All opinions are appreciated.

title: PlaybackTests currently failing
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Specifically PlaybackTests. startLocalPlaybackFromQueue and PlaybackTests. startLocalPlayback are failing.

They're failing because they expect the AudioplayerActivity to show up after you click on 'Play' from within 'New Episodes' and 'Queue'.  That isn't happening anymore.  I don't know when this change was introduced, if it was intentional or inadvertent (if I had to guess I'd say it was #693).

I think that, before we make any change, we should figure out what the behavior _should_ be.  Do we want the audio player activity to start when you click on 'play' on an item in the list?  I'm not sure that makes sense.

Any opinions?

title: Make 'Add to queue' the default
body:
If an item isn't in the queue, then 'add' will be the first option you see (instead of 'Download').

fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#615

title: innitial flattr authentication broken
label: [Label(name="invalid")]
body:
When trying to authenticate to get the flattr token, the url
https://flattr.com/oauth/authorize?response_type=code&client_id=&redirect_uri=flattr4j%3A%2F%2Fde.danoeh.antennapod%2Fauthenticate&scope=flattr
is opended,  which only displays
"Bad request (400)
There is an error with the request. Parameters might be malformed or missing."

I gues  flattr changed it's api.

title: Add feed: remember credentials, Basic authentication: try UTF-8 encoding
body:
Actual changes in the second commit.
- When adding a feed, credentials are remembered after selecting a feed.
- When basic authentication fails (with default encoding), UTF-8 encoding is tried.

I have tried this with http://p.j-crew.de
Only tried on 4.4, but I don't see why the small changes should not work on any other version...

Fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#727
Fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#627

title: When discovering xml feed, password is not remembered
body:
I have a site which is fully protected by HTTP Basic Auth. When users try to add the feed in AntennaPod, they are prompted for the password twice, even though both the website and the feed are on the same domain and use the same HTTP Basic Auth realm.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Add the following site to AntennaPod: http://p.j-crew.de
2. Enter the username and password (both are "a", without the quotes)
3. Confirm the RSS feed (there is only one)

Expected result:
The password from step 2 above is remembered and used for the feed and for downloading the MP3 files.

Actual result:
The user is queried again for the password after selecting the feed.

Further information:
The apache logs can be seen live at http://misc.j-crew.de/p-access.log and http://misc.j-crew.de/p-error.log (to see exactly which URLs were queried). There is an identical site except without HTTP Basic Auth at http://q.j-crew.de for comparison (with logs at http://misc.j-crew.de/q-access.log and http://misc.j-crew.de/q-error.log).

title: LoudnessEnhancer for Android 4.4+
body:
Closes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#612

Needs testing. I assumed 6dB would be a good value for the maximum loudness amplification, might be too much.

title: Support for explicit itunes tag filtering
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Feature request.
RSS feeds can include a tag <itunes:explicit>yes</itunes:explicit>.
I would like to be able to filter based upon it ("Exclude explicit podcasts").

This tag can be used on a podcast by podcast basis to indicate foul language.
Example: http://www.npr.org/rss/podcast.php?id=510289

label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Feature request.
RSS feeds can include a tag <itunes:explicit>yes</itunes:explicit>.
I would like ability to be notified of this tag via text or icon in the episode details screen.

This tag can be used on a podcast by podcast basis to indicate foul language.
Example: http://www.npr.org/rss/podcast.php?id=510289

title: Navigation drawer re-design
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Some thoughts about how the navigation drawer could be re-designed. Of course, some ideas might not be completely thought through - Feedback and ideas are appreciated. Basically, I think we should get rid of the Playback history and Downloads in its current form. In order: - New episodes: This is already changed in the current build, no further changes required. Think "Inbox". - Queue/Playlist: No changes. If requested, we could also have several Playlists. Feeds might get linked to a specific Playlist where new episodes would be added.
Episodes would not get added to "the queue", but rather "Add to [default playlist]" and "Add to..." (Opens dialog where user can choose playlist, if there a more than one).
Playlists could get renamed and episodes could be moved from one to the other. - Downloads: Should behave like an "Download folder". Will show any episodes currently downloaded to the device. Will have the ability to play and delete episodes. Sorting criteria could include publication date, file size, progress, "last usage" and more. - Favorites: Would only be displayed if the user actually marked episodes as favorites (yet to be implemented). Actions would basically be the same as Downloads. Being a favorite episode would also be considered when cleaning the cache to download new episodes. - Add podcast: No changes. Maybe some small visual changes.
+++ - Feeds: No changes.
+++ - Settings: no changes.

title: add ability to show feed url
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: I did not found a way to view the exact url of the feed of an podcast. This can be useful to check if i have an old url in case the url has changed for a podcast.

title: Release candidate for 1.1 needs testing
body:
Version 1.1 is about to be released. Some pretty significant changes were made and we'd like to make sure no problems have been introduced.

It would really help if people could test the current release build, either by joining the AntennaPod Alpha Google Plus group (https://plus.google.com/communities/117446128636140585144) or by just downloading the latest release build here: https://www.dropbox.com/s/4c475h3yst0ys38/AntennaPod-develop-current-release.apk?dl=0

Please report any new bugs that you encounter.

As many of you know @danieloeh stopped maintaining the project with 1.0.  I'm trying my best to maintain the project properly.  If you see that I'm doing anything wrong please let me know.  I'd like to thank @mfietz for all the hard works he's put in to fixing bugs and adding new features.  He's probably responsible for 70-80% of the changes you'll see in version 1.1.  Of course, a big thanks to everyone else that's contributed for this release, their changes have provided some great new features and fixes.

Going forward, if anyone would like to contribute, the most valuable thing for me would be if you could build the proposed pull requests and test the functionality introduced in that request. If you encounter any problems or have any suggestions, just add a comment to the PR.  If everything works well, please comment saying that everything works well. That will give me more confidence when merging the requests.

Thanks everyone!

title: Updated market description
Separate fast forward and rewind times
body:
![ff](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/7007616/f7768f40-dc8b-11e4-8773-ed7bcb829c7b.png)

Users set fast forward and rewind time separately. This is set on the audio player activity by long pressing fast forward or rewind. Small numbers above the buttons show the current values.

The former preference setting has been removed.

FF/Rev seems to cause troubles on older devices. The seekbar is not updated properly when seeking while the audio is paused - the position is updated properly.
Until now, seeking was only possible when the audio was actually playing. On newer devices, the seekbar is not updated properly in very rare cases. Most of the time, it works as intended.

title: removed notice that AntennaPod isn't maintained. It is.
Sync episode actions with gpodder, smart mark as played
body:
Closes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#539
Closes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#542
Closes AntennaPod/AntennaPod#694

Episode actions are recorded and synced when user is logged into gpodder.
- Create episode actions when episodes are downloaded, played, deleted and marked as read
- Sync (download and upload) episode actions
- MediaPlayerActivity deletes almost completely played episode on close
- Improved parsing of datetime strings
- Smart mark as played can be disabled or set in the preferences

![Screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6860662/6952930/3abeb508-d8c6-11e4-9eaf-aeb4c69f92c8.png)
## For debugging

You can goto https://gpodder.net/share/ and click the world icon near User page. Recently played doesn't seem to update immediately... Maybe the web server is caching the request

What I usually do:
$ curl -i -u [Username]:[Password] -H "Content-Type: application/json" -H "Accept: application/json" -X GET https://gpodder.net/api/2/episodes/[Username].json?since=[Timestamp]

Timestamp is seconds since 1.1.1970, set it to 0 or get the current time from http://www.epochconverter.com/ (For debugging, I take the current time and set the last three digits to zero).
You should see some nice JSON ;)

You should also see the syncing in logcat

title: Inconsistent preferences: Sometimes showing description, sometimes current value
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
At the moment, the preference view is quite inconsistent. In some cases the current value of an preference is displayed, sometimes only a description what the preference does. So, I'd like to have a discussion about a consistent display. Options: - [Description:] It does this and that
Current value: N [unit].
- Seems rather strange... - Should work with any preference and we can have both a description and show the current value. - Current value is always easy to find - Mixed: Does this and that if value is less/more than N [unit] - Only works with integers - Description could get complex if feature can be disabled (update interval) - Current value might be "hard to find" in the text (of not bold or italic) - Description only - I'd like to see the current value... - Current value only - I don't think this is an option. Sometimes the preference title is rather cryptic...

title: Swipe to mark as read
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
It would be nice if you could swipe an item in the 'All Episodes' list to mark it as read.

Granted, this only makes sense if you're only displaying 'new' items, but I think it might be a common use case.

The problem is that DSLV doesn't support lists that can remove items but that don't want to be dragged around.  I took a stab at this here: https://github.com/TomHennen/AntennaPod/tree/swipe_to_mark_as_read but was thwarted because of the DSLV issue.  I may take another look at this in the future, but I figured I'd at least note it as a feature request.

title: Start playback directly from the queue.
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
Hi,

Sometimes when I click the play button in the queue the episode starts playing, but more often it doesn't and I'm taken to playback and have to click 'play' from there again. What's the mechanism behind this and would it be possible to consistently have episodes play directly from the queue? The queue is what I work from all the time and would like to have a way to not having to leave it unless I want more information about an episode.

title: More questions (and suggestions) about the cache.
label: [Label(name="discussion")]
body:
The way I use AntennaPod (or any podcast player) makes it important how episodes are deleted. My favorite way to limit space taken up by media is to be able to set a time limit on storing episodes: Do not keep any episode longer than 7, 14, 30 or 60 days for example. There's other fancier way of doing this but it would move AntennaPod towards settings bloat. 

The way it's done in AntennaPod is a bit confusing for me. I know that episodes are deleted when played becuase I have set them to, but what if I swipe the episode off the queue while playing because I'm not interested and move to the next episode? When will that episode be deleted? Also, is it possible that AntennaPod "forgets" episodes somehow and never delete them, or will all episodes above the set number be deleted? What happens if I add an episode to the media directory manually. Will AntennaPod ever notice that file and delete it? I am just trying to understand how it works since I seem to end up with more media stored than set for the cache limit (i use 40). Finally, an option to have any episode not in the queue deleted would be helpful.

I would not have to ask any of these questions if AntennaPod had the option to time limit storage like for instance (the bloated) BeyondPod has, so I think I would like to add such an option as a feature request.

label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
It had been implemented using the method outlined here:
http://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/battery-monitoring.html

However, that method isn't working anymore. In the logs we see that the call to intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_STATUS, -1) is returning -1.

It isn't clear why this happened.  We could resolve it by creating two different power connection listeners, ones that just handled connected/disconnected.  I'd be interested in figuring out why this happened however. What changed?

Continuing to look at it.

title: Enhancement: Unsymmetric fast forward/backward
body:
In the menu you can set a fast forward/backward step width between 5 and 60 seconds. This value will be applied on both, forward and backward.

The most frequent use cases for fast forward/backward are (in my opinion/experience):
- you want to skip some less interesting passage and find a point to continue listening
- you want to repeat a passage of about the last minute, maybe you have not listened to concentrated enough and and you must find the exact starting point again

For both use cases an unsymmetric forward/backward step size which allows you to step forward coarse and find the exact point stepping backward fine.

For example Linux Totem Video Player uses this technique with fixed step sizes of +60s / -15s. It is very easy to find a desired point by this means.

My suggestion is to gives the possibility to selcet forward/backward step widths independantly by providing:
- separate inputs for both values - or - 
- an input for fast forward and an extra multiplier for backward ratio: 0.1 / 0.25 / 0.5 / 1 (optional additionally: 2 / 4 / 10)

title: make gpodder service usable for older devices again
label: [Label(name="needs work")]
body:
On older devices, crucial intermediate certificates are missing. In
this fix, we create a custom trustmanager. The algorithm follows the
certificate chain and checks validity and issuer signature. In the last
step, we take the root CA's certificate from the system's keystore and
verify the chain's last certificate thus validating the whole chain.

Fixes AntennaPod/AntennaPod/issues/576

After a recent upgrade, the Refresh icon is no more available in the top bar (in all views). Now one must click the top-right "three dots" icon, and then select refresh, which I find cumbersome.

Please consider bringing back the old refresh icon (at least in the single podcast view), beside the Search icon, or even instead of it.

On OSX Yosemite after doing a clean checkout running:

./gradlew tasks

A problem occurred configuring project ':app'.
> Cannot evaluate module library : Configuration with name 'default' not found.

* Try:
Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
```

Any help or ideas would be appreciated.
