title: Improvement Reqest: Remove entry from play list upon file deletion
label: [Label(name="needs info"), Label(name="question")]
body:
In cases when I delete an episode file from play list, I expect it to be be deleted from play list, too.
- I suppose, nobody wants to deletes a file and keep the entry in the play list.
- It takes an extra manual action to remove it from play list, too

Steps to reproduce:
1. open play list 
2. open one item within play list
3. touch "remove episode" (trash icon)
4. touch androids "back" button to return to play list

After those steps the episode is still in the play list.
My proposal: it should be removed

Thanks for all!

title: "Unknown Error" when resuming streamed podcast and streaming podcast suggestion
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Every time I pause a podcast that is being streamed and try to resume it, I'm treated with an "Unknown Error" prompt.

see pic
http://i.imgur.com/ohDHLC7.png

Also, with podcast streaming in general, I'd love to see an option with streaming where it'll attempt to download the full podcast as I'm listening to it. It really bothers me that I can be streaming a two-hour long podcast on my wifi network and then an hour into the podcast I step out of my wifi network range and the podcast just stops. You'd think that after an hour there would've been enough time for Antennapod to passively download the whole thing. Why not simply just download the whole podcast from the beginning, you ask? I want to start listening immediately. I don't want to wait for the podcast to fully download before listening to it.

title: Going back to top after viewing single episode
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: When going back after viewing a single episode i jump to the top of the list instead of to the previous looked at episode

title: Password protected pods fail to load
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I've subscribed to the ZEIT Premium Podcast (URL: https://premium.zeit.de/itunes/feed) which is only available with a valid user name and password. Everything worked fine on v0.9.9.4, however, now on v1.0 I'm always prompted to reenter my credentials when I want to download a new entry although previously saved. However, reentering the login information does nothing so that the download fails in general. I've already triple-checked by password. Furthermore, I deleted and reinstalled the pod, without any changes. Ideas?

 running on CM11 M9, Android 4.4.4

title: Blackberry Package Maintainer
body:
I just noticed the update to the README that the project will not be receiving any further updates. I also noticed that a version of this app in the blackberry world app market is out of date with the current master and 1.0 tag. 

I'd like to offer to take over the maintenance of the blackberry specific functionality, testing and release management, if it in fact is currently being done by the same team here? If not would it be advisable that I just create a fork to continue on with the project?

title: Integration with iTunes Podcast Search
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Would seem useful to discover and search for podcast feeds in the iTunes podcast directory - 

API for the directory - https://www.apple.com/itunes/affiliates/resources/documentation/itunes-store-web-service-search-api.html

title: Play / Pause Media Button Not Supported
body: On devices such as Blackberry's, the volume up down buttons also have a play/pause functionality. This is tied to some type of android functionality as it works as expected for some apps, ie soundcloud, and beyondpod, but not AntennaPod.

title: OPML Import
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Currently app only allows OPML import from a given directory, would be nice if this opened up a file dialog instead and allowed user to select the OPML file.

title: Download serially instead of in parallel
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I would like to scan down the list of episodes in "All Episodes" view, tap the download icons of all episodes I wish to retrieve, and then have those episodes downloaded one at a time in order (instead of simultaneously).

Often my queue will be empty, and I'll want that first episode to download as soon as possible so I have something to listen to while the rest download.

Is this already possible?

title: Thumbnails zoomed in too far
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I believe this started happening in the 1.0 release.

I listen to a podcast that puts the episode number in the mp3-embedded thumbnail.
AntennaPod used to display the entire image, but now zooms it (to fill the description area?). This crops out part of the episode number.
At first I thought it was doing a fit-to-height zoom. Then I rotated my phone to landscape and it cropped the width the same, but also severely cropped the top and bottom, to the point of being silly.

title: pause should rewind x seconds
label: [Label(name="feature request")]

Used the word 'clear' because it seems more active than 'empty'.
For issue #593

title: Option to disable download notifications
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Each time AntennaPod is downloading podcasts, has downloaded them or failed to download them, it adds a notification.
Users should be able to control what notifications they do or don't want to receive, so there should be an option to disable the download notifications.

title: Add Loudness enhancer for 4.4+
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Kitkat's API has an audio effect called [LoudnessEnhancer](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/audiofx/LoudnessEnhancer.html), which could be used in association with a sound level meter (also in the 4.4 API) to adjust loudness for podcasts that are too quiet. I would like to try to implement this myself and contribute it back to the project, but first I would like to ask if there's interest in such a feature and, if yes, what would be the best approach to add a filter.

The same thing could be done for adding an equalizer with different presets, but equalizers are supported in older versions of the API.

title: Use design time attributes to assist layouting and value preview.
body:
I added [Design Time Attributes](http://tools.android.com/tips/layout-designtime-attributes) which are useful to **render meaningful previews** for the layout files in Android Studio. They also help to optimize layout in general. Further you can **add placeholders** for text and image elements. I use strong **background colors** for text fields and image views to preview their exact dimensions and margins.
None of these changes affects the compiled application code.

Here is an extreme example for _layout/downloadlog_item.xml_:
## Preview without Design Time Attributes

![antennapod-download-before](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/144518/5891052/fc2e8bea-a47e-11e4-9f2f-08688b52c671.png)
## Preview with Design Time Attributes

![antennapod-download-improved](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/144518/5891054/00dc547e-a47f-11e4-87f2-ef340384c2cc.png)

title: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast (2)
body:
This is a similar bug to the one I reported before, #545.

When I add the rss feed link for this podcast [herewearepodcast](http://www.herewearepodcast.com/rss)

I get the same date corruption, all podcasts are listed as today.

Upon inspection the rss file does not use the pubDate tags, but it does use dc:date tags, I have not seen these before.

```
<dc:date>2015-01-04</dc:date>
```

I don't know the legacy or support issues of this tag, but I am capturing the issue here at least for reference.

Thanks for fixing the last problem.

title: Options to sort queue

relates to #166
This add a sub menu to sort queue by alpha, date and duration.

title: Use public shared podcast dir for downloads
label: [Label(name="needs work")]
body:
Fixes #599 

Uses the public podcast dir for enclosure downloads. The exist (user configurable) data dir is still used for feeds and images.

Future enhancements might include adding a second shared preference for changing the location of downloaded podcasts as well, but I think it makes sese to use the system default (where other apps will expect them to go) for the actual media files by default.

title: Sync notification broken on Android 5
body:
On Android 5.0 the sync notification sometimes show up as empty, but other notifications work (the icon is there, but it's white and hard to see):

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/512573/5828591/3b601e68-a0d4-11e4-8ab6-7da7c75c70c7.png)

Other times they work; I haven't noticed a pattern yet. Currently on the latest commit in the develop branch.

title: Check if file already exists (thus preventing redownload)
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
## Check if file already exists

I download podcast from my computer. I want to re-listen to them on my phone so I transfer my podcast media files to the config folder. Problem is that the application does not scan the folder for new files. In the app, it tells me it has not been downloaded yet (eventhough it already exists), so I am forced to redownload my podcasts.

So please, whenever the feed is manually refreshed, force the app to check if a file already exists. That way, it does not insist on downloading an already existing item. I do not know how feeds work but if they have some md5 checksum, it might help in making sure episodes are correctly identified/verified.
## Another possible feature

Please give an option to permanently store certain podcast episodes. Give the individual episode a "Permanently store" checkbox. This will prevent the application from automatically deleting it.

title: All Episodes Context Menu Missing
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I'm not sure if it's a bug, but I noticed the context menu (long press) from 'All episodes' has gone away. The options that were in there are still available elsewhere, just not as easy to get to, was that intentional.

If I recall you used to be able to download, delete, or add an episode to the queue.

title: Too easy to accidentally mark all episodes as read
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I have just done it. For a while I have been fearing the possibility and now it has turned into a reality. Because, in All episodes view, 'Refresh' option is right above 'Mark all episodes as read', and also in part due to me being slightly retarded, I accidentally touched the latter in place of the former. With no confirmation requested and no undo option available, I am now unaware of what episodes I have and haven't heard, and moderately bemused over this situation.

I really wish there were a confirmation step or an undo option to this.

Thank you for your time, attention and a great app.

moved from the "soon closed" issue #458 
It would be nice, if the queue view would get an "refresh" button, too. This is the only reason why i call the "all episode" view.

title: minor update to make the queue the first view. Not dynamic (always goes ...
body:
A minor change that makes the queue the first view. Doesn't try to change behavior based on number of items in queue, because that information isn't available during onCreate() when we need to decide which fragment gets loaded. (navDrawerData gets filled in during loadData(), which happens in onResume() and for other events, but isn't there for onCreate()).

I'd entertain suggestions for how to handle this better...

title: Add an 'Empty Queue' command
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Consider the following use case:
- User is subscribed to a number of podcasts
- User's queue is full with previously downloaded podcasts
- All the episodes in the queue are stale. The user doesn't want to listen to them (they already listened to them, they got behind, whatever).

With the current model the user would have to manually remove all the episodes from the queue, one by one. That can be very time consuming and tedious with a long queue.

If there were a 'empty queue' or 'clear queue' command the user could issue that command, all the episodes in the queue would be removed and then, when the system auto-updates, the queue would be filled with the latest episodes from their various subscriptions.

Worthwhile?

title: Queue should be the default screen, not All Episodes
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
By default I think the 'Queue' should be the first screen the user sees and not 'All Episodes'. The rational is that the user came in to the app for the most common operation: listening to podcasts.  Putting them in 'All Episodes' first makes them take an extra couple of steps to get to what they really want.

I could see only defaulting to Queue if there are actually episodes in the queue.

Thoughts?

title: Download when charging issue 104
body:
Resolves issue #104. The user now has the option of disabling auto-download when the device is running on battery. Like wifi-connected auto-dl, a change in charging status will either trigger auto-dl (if other conditions are met) or cancel auto-dl (if the device is no longer charging).

I tested this on my HTC One M7 running 4.4.3.

I added myself to CONTRIBUTORS (I submitted a couple of other patches previously). I hope that's OK, if not feel free to remove it.

Please let me know if any updates are needed.

title: feed-specific button to hide/unhide not downloaded podcasts
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
First of all I'd like to congratulate for this great podcast app! :-)

I wonder if it would be possible to implement a feed-specific button to hide/unhide episodes which haven't been downloaded yet. Let me give you a short background on that: I usually don't download all podcast episodes from a feed (it would take to much space on my mobile phone) and if there are a lot of episodes it's hard to keep track of which ones are already downloaded (which I preferably would like to listen to) and which are not. This would make it easier to keep an oversight of downloaded files in a feed-specific way.

title: Antennapod data loss after upgrade
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Both me and my wife's antennapod act as if the data has been cleared after a recent upgrade within the past month.  The data in our AntennaPod directory is still there, including cache feed files, images, and the actual media files, but everything in the app is empty.

The data folder in the app is still pointing to the directory we set it to on our respective SD cards.  To clarify, the settings in the app (theme, playback speeds, directory, cache size) are all still there, just the feeds are all gone.  We're both on Cyanogenmod 11 M12.

Luckily we did export our feeds recently, so reimporting those isn't a problem, but is there a way to synchronize them with what is already in the directory?  It thinks nothing is downloaded.

title: Generated filename is the same for every episode and therefore episodes are overwritten
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I am having trouble with the following feed: http://www.ndr.de/info/podcast2988.xml
AntennaPod seems to construct the following filename for every episode: "Echo der Welt - Das Auslandsmagazin.mp3". The download links are in the form of e.g. "http://media.ndr.de/download/podcasts/podcast2988/AU-20141212-1609-3442.mp3".
As it always generates the same filename, only the most recently downloaded episode is really available. AntennaPod shows the availability of all downloaded episodes, but it obviously always plays the same file, which is the most recently downloaded one.

title: IOError: ENAMETOOLONG when downloading episode with long title
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Apparently AntennaPod stores audio files using the episode title as the filename (as opposed to using the original filename from the URL).  If the episode title is too long then it is not possible to download the episode due to a filesystem limitation -- it can still be streamed though.

The typical [limit](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_file_systems#Limits) for a filename on common filesystems is 255 bytes.

title: Please use different controls on lock screen
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,

first of all, thanks for the app.

On the lock screen using Android 5 / Lollipop, the app offers these controls: Play, Pause, Stop.

I'd prefer a different set of controls: Rewind, Play/Pause*, Forward.

(\* The control should change depending on the current state of playback.)

Use case is simple: While listening, I often rewind a few seconds if I missed something during a podcast. Also, I never use "stop", only "pause".

title: Parse podcast duration correctly even with trailing whitespace
body:
The Skeptoid podcast (available on gpodder.net) currently has a specific
episode (titled "Skeptoid #437: Tube Amplifiers") that contains the XML
itunes:duration14:57 /itunes:duration which AntennaPod fails
to parse (and instead hits a java.lang.NumberFormatException which
it prints to stderr every time the refresh button is pressed).
The duration for that particular episode is not correctly showed in
the UI, although the duration for other Skeptoid episodes show up
just fine.

title: 0.9.9.5: Usability regression - touching the tile text no longer opens the "lateral drawer"
body:
With the introduction of 0.9.9.5 when touching the text title 'All episodes'/"Queue"/"Downloads"/... no longer opens the lateral "drawer" which allows switching between the activities. The drawer opens only when touching the icon in the upper left side of the screen.

This is really uncomfortable/hard to achieve for right handed people when using the phone in a single hand, especially if the screen width is large relative to the hand size.

Please bring back the possibility to open the drawer when touching the title of the screen.

title: Hitting 'menu' button force closes in 0.9.9.5
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
At least in JellyBean (4.1.2). Sent several reports. Without menu button, unable to access settings. Previous version was fine.

The fact nobody other has open a bug for this makes me suspect that it does not happen in KitKat or Lollipod?

It produces a java.lang.NullPointerException in class com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow method oneKeyUpPanel line number 1002.

Observed similar behaviour in some other apps after adapted to lollipop (not sure if it's related, but suspicious).

title: Bluetooth Audio not working anymore
body:
In the latest version Antenna Pod stopped playing podcasts through BT. The phone seems to be paired and connected correctly, but plays the podcast through the internal speaker of my nexus 5 (Lollipop). However, When I shutdown the BT Audio device, AntennaPod still notices that the connection was lost, and stops the podcast, even though it was played through the internal speaker.
When I play AntennaPod first, and only then I turn on the BT device, it connects, the music plays through the BT device for ~1 sec, and then switches back to the internal speaker!

All of this used to work 100% a day or two ago.

System Info:
Phone: Nexus 5 with Lollipop.
2 BT devices:
Jabra Cruiser2 configured only for "Phone Audio" and "Contact Sharing"
Generic Chinese A2DP BT to 3.5mm stereo adapter (BT ID is "H163"), configured for "Media Audio"

title: compact mode
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
In the [UI discussion](https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/issues/407#issuecomment-41489319) leading up to release [0.9.9](https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/releases/tag/0.9.9.0) I pointed out some areas of space saving possibilities. Some of those were implement then or during the last few months and IMHO improved the usefulness of AntennaPod a lot.

I had hoped for another round of (esp. vertical) screen real estate savings in [0.9.9.5](https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/releases/tag/0.9.9.5), but alas: no. My perception is that larger and higher-res screens will spread, but for those who are for whatever reason stuck with smaller Android devices like the [Galaxy S2 (480x800px)](http://www.samsung.com/de/consumer/mobile-device/mobilephones/archive-mobile-phones/GT-I9100LKADBT-spec), please add a(n option for) compact mode.

Suggestions on where space can be shaved off individual items in any of the list views so that more items may be visible on the screen:
- move publishing dates and file sizes or play times respectively above and below the download or symbols
- shrink images to the height of 2 lines of main text (favicons in the browser are already much smaller and still server their recognition purpose; also, AntennaPod already has zoomed views for podcast and episode images in their respective views)
- extend playtime indicator line to left and right (matching play time on right below play symbol) so that it can act as a separator between episodes
- remove current separator lines & decrease spacing between items (also in sidebar)
- decrease all font sizes by 1 or 2 points

IMHO, 25-50% more episodes can be made accessible that way and the amount of scrolling reduced by the same margin, without compromising eligibility much.

title: Automatic resume on reconnect with pause-on-disconnect feature
body:
I modified the pause on disconnect option to also resume playback if the audio was originally paused due to a disconnect.  This behavior is implemented for both headphones and bluetooth audio.  A user can disconnect and plug in a pair of headphones and expect the audio to pause and resume, or they could switch from headphones to a bluetooth speaker or car audio system.  There is no effect if the pause on disconnect option is disabled.

I believe this resolves issue #103

label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The scroll position should of the Queue list should be saved and remembered, at least for the session if not in a persistent manner.

I tend to keep quite a lot of podcast episodes in the AntennaPod queue for later listening (20-40 episodes). The current/recent episodes always reside at the bottom. So each time I want to select one of them, I need to scroll down all the way. When I change to the All Episodes view (to trigger a manual refresh for example) and then change back to Queue I have to scroll down **again**. This happens multiple times each day for me, so I'd be glad if this enhancement could be implemented soon. Thanks for working on AntennaPod!

title: Spelling
import/export content manifest & status
label: [Label(name="duplicate"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I migrated to a new phone and had no trouble importing my feeds via OPML, but there doesn't appear to be any way to move my existing content over.  Some can be downloaded again (though it would be nice to skip that), but older episodes are no longer listed in the feeds.

A related feature would be import/export of the status of everything.  What's in the queue, what's been listened to, etc.  That would be useful for the rare full migrations, but if that export file were updated when the app stops, and if AntennaPod watched that file for updates, I could use file sync to keep multiple devices in sync without having to transmit my behavior to a third party service.

title: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hi There

I have been trying to add a certain podcast feed to antennaPod list. It is the podcast for "[Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast](http://feeds.feedburner.com/RichardHerringLSTPodcast)".  Every time I add the feed it thinks every podcast is today.  The next day when I updated the feed it increments the day and shows every podcast as today.  I've had the feed in the app for a week and it does the same thing every day.

The issue looks very similar to an issue reported before, #178, which was marked as won't fix because the was a legal issue with that feeds contents. 

The feed in this case is sourced via a feedburner link, I would have assumed there would have been some legal checks performed on it.  I have check the pubDate values and they are all different dates.  However I did notice that the timezone region is listed as GMT, not something like +0000.

```
<pubDate>Fri, 2 May 2014 10:10 GMT</pubDate>
<pubDate>Fri, 9 May 2014 10:00 GMT</pubDate>
```

I have checked this problem on two separate android device, a Galaxy S3 and a Galaxy Note 3, they both show the same problem.

Galaxy Note 3 - Android 4.3 - 3.4.0-1628120
Galaxy S3 - Android 4.1.2 - 3.0.31-1276773

(oh and thanks for the app, its great :+1: )

title: Persistent notification and lockscreen controls for Android 5.0
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
One of Android 5.0 APIs is the Media playback. Quoting from here, http://developer.android.com/about/versions/android-5.0.html,
"If you are implementing notifications that present media playback status or transport controls, consider using the new Notification.MediaStyle template instead of a custom RemoteViews.RemoteView object. Whichever approach you choose, make sure to set the notification's visibility to VISIBILITY_PUBLIC so that your controls are accessible from the lock screen. Note that beginning in Android 5.0, the system no longer shows RemoteControlClient objects on the lock screen. For more information, see If your app uses RemoteControlClient."

Notification.MediaStyle can be found here: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/Notification.MediaStyle.html

Unfortunately, the solution provided in Issue #405 doesn't seem like it will be supported in Android 5.0 and on.

title: Can't seek backwards by less than 30sec in OGG/OGA files
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
example feed: http://logbuch-netzpolitik.de/feed/oga

Seeking forward is possible, regardless of seek time and [Prestissimo](https://github.com/TheRealFalcon/Prestissimo/) settings, but seeking backwards only works with the former set to 60 or 45sec. If it is lower, playback rewinds only back to a certain frame. Repeated clicking the rewind button enhances this effect. Sounds like a broken record.

[Android's stock music app](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdid=com.android.music) and [Apolllo](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdid=com.andrew.apollo) in CyanogenMod 11M11 are both able to seek backwards normally, so this is not exactly the same issue as #208, but maybe also related to Android's [`<seekTo()>`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/MediaPlayer.html#seekTo%28int%29)

title: Queue podcast when adding it
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
What I'd like is when adding a podcast the option to queue it in chronological order (I.E. Append the podcast to the queue, oldest episode first, newest episode last).

Imagine you had this queue already:-
1. Podcast 1 - Season 5 - Episode 4
2. Podcast 2 - Season 2 - Episode 8

Then added `Podcast 3`, which is has two seasons of 5 episodes each, it'd end up with:-
1. Podcast 1 - Season 5 - Episode 4
2. Podcast 2 - Season 2 - Episode 8
3. Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 1
4. Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 2
5. Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 3
6. Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 4
7. Podcast 3 - Season 1 - Episode 5
8. Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 1
9. Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 2
10. Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 3
11. Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 4
12. Podcast 3 - Season 2 - Episode 5

This would be useful for people who like to listen to the backlog of a Podcast. Maybe also add some advanced options (Reverse order, only add newest X episodes/time, Regex, only add season X-Y,Z), etc...

Maybe also add the option to the podcast's page.

title: Playback/Queue problems
body:
Hey, first off, love AntennaPod. Just have been having some weird issues that seem to be independent of any updates to the app or Android. As far as I can tell, they appeared out of nowhere. The biggest issue is that pushing the play button next to a podcast in the queue no longer plays the podcast. instead, it takes me to the playback screen of the currently playing podcast (which remains paused). I can push the play button in the queue repeatedly and sometimes after a few presses it will take me to the playback screen and I can hit play again and the cast plays, but sometimes it can be upwards of 20 presses. If there is not a podcast currently playing then I can switch to any other podcast. Sometimes I will get an playback error message and then the playback screen will come up empty and I can play a new podcast then.

Another (I'm guessing) related issue is that continuous playback is checked but when a podcast ends and a new one loads, it does not play automatically. Continuous playback is checked in the setttings. 

I'm running version 0.9.9.3 on a Republic Wireless Moto X running Android 4.4.2

title: Automatic podcast download should be limit by number or date
body: The first time you add a podcast, app tries to download all of the entries of the podcast, even the very old ones. That makes an annoying attempt to download episodes that already don't exist (404 error) and notification bar shows the error again and again. A configurable limit by number (since the last one) or by date should be supported. In this way, Antennapod would "forget" the old entries when the automatic download is enabled.

title: "PlaybackService" hangs in status "Will be restarted"
label: [Label(name="needs info")]
body:
Hi AntennaPod-Team,

I observed an undesired behavior of AntennaPod. The "PlaybackService" hangs in status "Will be restarted" (in German: "Neustart wird durchgefhrt"). This happens even if the application has been closed weeks ago and several other applications have been unsed in the meantime.
Please see screenshot attached.

How to reproduce:
1. Start AntennaPod
2. Start playback of a previously downloaded podcast (I use the play-button at the bottom of the screen which starts the most recent played podcast)
3. After round about one hour: Stopp playback (I use the stopp-button at the bottom of the screen)
4. Leave AntennaPod by pressing "back-button" several times (until I'm back on homescreen)
5. Check taskmanager after several days of heavy usage of my device
--> PlaybackService says: 
---- "will be restarted",
---- Size: "0.00 B", 
---- 0 Processes, 1 Service
See screenshot attached.

Expected: AntennaPod and PlaybackService should be closed properly and not must appear in the taskmanager (at least not in this status) 

![antennapod](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8784326/4279541/5dc32f6a-3d22-11e4-91bb-6aefb6a8fc63.jpg)

My setup:
HTC One S, Android Version 4.1.1

Please let me know if you need further information or tests.

Thank you for that great app!!
WF

title: Allow app to still be accessed even after the screen has turned off and locked without unlocking the phone first.
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Hi!

Currently once the screen locks even if the app is the current one filling the screen, one must unlock  the phone to access it. 

Consider making a setting so that you can still access the app even after the phone locks but leaving the app means you now must unlock the phone.

The Mythmote app for android works this way. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=tkj.android.homecontrol.mythmote&hl=en

Maybe you could ask the developer of Mythmote how he programmed this into his/her app.

God Bless!

Frederick

title: Broken episode entries when having 2 podcasts with the same title (case insensitive)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: I recently added a podcast which happened to have the same title as one of the podcasts I already had, except for one letter that was lowercase in one title and uppercase in the other title. Here they are: - http://www.rtl.fr/podcast/la-revue-de-presse.xml (title: "La revue de Presse") - http://cdn-new-europe1.ladmedia.fr/var/exports/podcasts/sound/revue-de-presse.xml (title: "La revue de presse") After refreshing my episode list, I got broken entries, as if AntennaPod mixed the 2 podcasts somehow (title from one of the podcast, with photo from the other podcast for instance). Since podcast infos are kept in files named after the podcast titles on my FAT32 formatted memory card (case insensitive filesystem), my best guess is that when refreshing the whole episode list, the files from one of the podcasts overwrite the files from the other podcast.

This makes use of the existing variable PREF_AUTO_DELETE

title: App keeps device awake
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="needs info")]
body:
Periodically I look at my battery level and it's terribly low early in the day; often the culpret at the top is AntennaPod. In the battery usage details, this awakeness shows up as "Keep awake" and that number is usually however long it's been since I stopped listening to podcasts. Unfortunately, I don't know how to dig any deeper into this issue (as a user), but I am an Android developer and can try suggestions / patches.

Some details about my environment: A stock Nexus 5 running AntennaPod 0.9.9.3 and Prestissimo 1.0. I tend to stop playback by pulling out my headphones (I did that today and noticed this issue).

title: Pause with screen infos
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="needs info")]
body:
I want pause what I'm listening sometimes just to talk with someone and always need open the app to play again.

There is no sense this, since it's my use case most of the time.

Can I press the pause and play again without unlock my phone and open the app?
Also, the notification bar disappear when I pause. Makes more sense show the play button.

Cheers.

title: Add to Queue, then Download
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hello!

In the old UI it was possible to add items to the queue and then select 'download all'. I would appreciate if this behaviour would return as the new one can cause trouble when one wants to download several episodes with different file sizes.

For example, a podcaster released three new episodes with different lengths:
1. Episode One (1:00)
2. Episode Two (0:45)
3. Episode Three (0:30)

Naturally, I would like to listen to the episodes in the correct order, but when I download them, Episode Three will be completed first and added to the queue first so that, in this example, they end up with the opposite order on the queue.

Thanks in advance!

Cheers

AntennaPod 0.9.9.3 however refuses to use it and is instead using the speaker. How can I get AntennaPod to use this Bluetooth headset?

According to Android this headset only offers one profile "Phone audio" and the list under "paired Bluetooth devices" says "Connected to phone audio". According to Nokia's documentation: "The headset is compliant with the Bluetooth Specification 2.1 + EDR supporting the Headset Profile 1.1 and Hands-Free Profile 1.5."

Thank you for AntennaPod!

Dodgy menu display

In the "All episodes" view pressing the device's menu button (not the ... in the top right corner) sometimes results in the menu being displayed in two steps instead of being displayed in full in one go. Unfortunately, I've therefore hit "Mark as read" often already, even though I wanted to "Refresh", because the latter got pushed upwards by another menu entry appearing a fraction of a second later. Unfortunately, I found no pattern of this problem so far. Maybe it appears when the list of all episodes grew larger (ca. 20).

title: Build error: "The SDK Build Tools revision (19.0.3) is too low for project ':submodules:dslv:library'. Minimum required is 19.1.0"
body:
I have the following packages installed:
Android SDK Tools 23.0.2
Android SDK Platform-tools 20
Android SDK Build-tools 20
SDK Platform 20.1

When I run `./gradlew assembleDebug`, it gives the build error

```
Execution failed for task ':preBuild'.
failed to find target android-19 : /Applications/Android Studio.app/sdk
```

Installing SDK Platform 19.3 (alongside 20.1) then gives the error

```
Execution failed for task ':preBuild'.
> failed to find Build Tools revision 19.1.0
```

Installing Build Tools 19.1 then gives the error

```
Execution failed for task ':submodules:dslv:library:preBuild'.
> failed to find Build Tools revision 19.0.3
```

Installing Build Tools 19.0.3 then gives the error

```
Execution failed for task ':submodules:dslv:library:preBuild'.
> The SDK Build Tools revision (19.0.3) is too low for project ':submodules:dslv:library'. Minimum required is 19.1.0
```

I'm not sure how to go from here :(

title: automatic adjustment of update interval
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hello!

I'd like to collect some pros and cons about the default update interval & suggest an "automatic" option.

In my experience (heavy podcast listener, always a screen full for episodes in play-list), all podcatchers that do have a default interval, have a very short one. This causes unnecessary data usage & CPU load, also for the hosters. I'm in a podcast team myself and saw the logs. Many users (same IP & client) appear with hour intervals...

So, I usually activate the maximum pre-configured update interval. In AntennaPod this is 24h. Since there is probably no 1-interval-(range-)fits-all here, how about some kind of adaptive/automatic/dynamic setting? As default, not as yet another option ;-)

For example:
1. Take the existing intervals, but make them mean "remaining playtime in queue), so that in my example, an auto-refresh would be triggered if the playtime drops below 24h (still respecting the "Mobile update"-setting & WiFi filter).
2. Or, make the interval adjust itself to half, third, quarter (Let's discuss what's sensible here!) of queue playtime. Current, or averaged over a sensible time.
3. update feeds individually, when playback of last remaining episode in it starts

Please let me & us know what you think about this.

title: Often does not resume playback from where I was
body:
I love this app! But there's one bug that is getting me on the brink of switching. Not always, but very often, when I come back to an episode that I've started listening to before, it does not resume from where I paused it.

It does not matter if I have played another episode since or if I just paused this episode, closed the app and came back later. Often the seeker is at the correct place, but when I hit play, it jumps either to the very begining of the episode, or to somewhere close to the beginning.

I've had this issue since the previous version of AntennaPod, and on two different phones with both stock Android and Cyanogenmod. I'm using 0.9.9.0 now, and it's the same.

I hope this will be fixed soon. I'd hate to switch to a non-Free podcast app and I really want to be able to recommend AntennaPod to my friends!

Thanks!

However, when using the "Search gpodder.net" functionality, when you're presented with this empty list, it's not obvious that there were really no search results and there isn't [say] a problem with your network connection.

This change explicitly tells the user that nothing was found.

title: Cannot remove episode without file
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
One item of this feed doesn't have a file: http://www.radioeins.de/archiv/podcast/die_profis_benecke.xml/feed=podcast.xml
It looks like this:

```
<item>
    <title>Spiegelneuronen: Jubelzellen im Gehirn?</title>

    <pubDate>Sat, 05 Jul 2014 11:54:47 +0100</pubDate>
    <description>Wer gestern Abend durch die Stadt gelaufen ist, der wird nur wenige Orte gefunden haben, an denen kein kollektives Fußball-Gucken stattgefunden hat. Aber es wird nicht nur geguckt, es wird auch mitgegröhlt, mitgeflucht und mitgejubelt. Ob wir dieses kollektive Mitfiebern wirklich freiwillig machen oder ob wir von einer ganz bestimmten Hirnzelle angeregt werden, das zu tun, was die anderen machen, das beschäftigt derzeit die Hirnforscher in der ganzen Welt. Ob wir solche „Jubelzellen“ wirklich in uns tragen, das weiß Dr. Mark Benecke.</description>

    <itunes:duration>00:05:13</itunes:duration>
    <itunes:keywords></itunes:keywords>
</item>
```

AntennaPod shows this episode as new, but I cannot do anything with the item: ![screenshot_2014-07-09-13-27-54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/181640/3523667/39605954-075d-11e4-8aaf-ffae6a17e203.png)

label: [Label(name="needs work")]

title: D-Pad Navigation inconsistent
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The nextFocus attributes for the layousts seem to be implemented inconsistently with the new UI.  Easiest way to test this, is to setup an Android Emulator, and enable Keyboard input for the the Emulator.   Then launch the application.  Do not use the Mouse to navigate or interact with the application.   Just use the Up/Down/Left/Right and Enter keys to navigate the application.   You'll find that you can't get to some items, others you get to that have embedded buttons aren't clickable or you can't get the to the button itself.

This is causing issues on devices like Android HDMI Sticks, Google TV, and OUYA devices that are primarily D-Pad navigation.  Having to result to the built in touch pad is not a good user experience.

If I get some time, I'll look at providing a patch to address some of these issues for the D-Pad and the related Media Key Codes as well.

title: New UI: Some feedback
body:
Hi,
after the 0.9.9.0 release with the new UI became available on F-Droid I was finally able to test the new UI. Some feedback from my perspective:
- I like that there is finally a view that shows all downloaded items.
- Great that play list manipulation (moving up/down etc.) is much easier now. I seem to accidentally swipe off episodes too easily, but that may be just my clumsy fingers. Deletion on long press or context menu or so might be safer.
- Please bring back display of playing time and possibly release date and podcast name to items in the playlist. This seems to be only available in the Downloads/Finished view. Release date and podcast name should at least be avaibale from the episode detail view. But playing time is quite essential for me.
- One thing that feels really completely wrong is that in the All Episodes view, when trying to scroll up from the top of the list, a refresh of all podcasts is triggered. This alone makes this view completely unusable for me. Please note that this process can take quite some time and it seems that other parts (Playlist etc.) are not accessible at all. (I have a lot of podcasts and not the fastest device on the market.) IMO it should only be triggered explicitly and not accidentally when scrolling a list where one even cannot see whether one is at the top of the list or not. Even worse as when entering the app from the widget and clicking in the upper left of the player one ends up automatically in this view. Also there is the refresh button in the upper right, why should one be able to trigger this in another way? 

Anyway, please keep up the good work and thanks for releasing the software for free.

Edit: It would also be great if the number of contained episodes would be visible again at the top of the list as before.

title: [Idea] Play until end of current episode
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi,
one thing I do perpetually is the following: I switch to continuous play in Settings; play some episodes on my way to work; when I'm approaching work I switch continuous play off to listen to the end of the episode as I prefer to start with a new one on my way back.

So it would be great to have an easier way of switching continuous play on/off, maybe even from the widget or the player.

One idea: Instead of having just the Play button to switch Play<->Pause, make this a three state button: Pause -> Play continuously -> Play until end of episode -> Pause. So when you just want to listen one episode press play twice and the player goes back to pause after the episode automatically; or just press once to play continuously, later press once to listen to end of episode or twice to pause immediately.

This would even remove the need for the continuous play setting entirely.

Edit: I think it only has to implement this: https://developer.android.com/reference/android/media/audiofx/AudioEffect.html. The Vanilla app managed it with 10 lines: https://github.com/adrian-bl/vanilla/commit/141aef2e272d0b5427cedd27af723e332b61fe76

title: Ideas for code refactorings
body:
I have a few ideas for refactorings Id like to run by the project. When I implemented OPML backup I saw some places where I think it would be beneficial for the app to offload functionality to other libraries and services. Less code (and sources of bugs) at the expense (possibly) of less control. Specifically,
1. EventDistributor can be replaced (or backed) with [LocalBroadcastManager](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/support/v4/content/LocalBroadcastManager.html) that ships with the support libaries
   
   This is a small change and would be straight forward to implement. The EventDistributor API could stay the same.
2. Use [Volley](https://android.googlesource.com/platform/frameworks/volley/) (or other library designed to download small files) to download feeds and images (it also does caching)
3. Use the [Download Manager](http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/DownloadManager.html) to download podcasts and videos
   
   Getting HTTP downloads right is not straight forward (AntennaPod has 8 classes for this purpose) and requires threads, locks, background services and notifications to work properly. Download Manager takes care of all that and does retries as well as handles connectivity failures. It is not clear that using Download Manager would work exactly the same as the current solution, but I think it will and Im willing to give it a shot.

I appreciate all the time and effort that was put in to these parts of the app, and would totally understand if there's hesitation in changing them too much. The obvious reason not to is that it currently works. Also, these changes would not change how AntennaPod functions or looks. If, however, you think itd be a good idea to simplify the code base then I would be interested in seeing if we can make it work. What do you think?

title: Option to sort episodes in playlist by release date
body:
I have a whole bunch of podcasts in my AntennaPod with some of them being feeds from radio stations, which generate a lot episodes (several per day) and where I'm only interested in single episodes. Every other day (like once a week or so) I browse through all the podcasts I have in my list and add the episodes I'm interested in to my playlist.

This is of course easiest done by selecting one source and going to all the new tracks there and then proceed with the next source. Therefore I then end up with a playlist that has the tracks in the order in which I have added them, i.e. with lets say 5 tracks from radio station _A_ then two from station _B_ and so on.

Especially with topics that are currently in the news it would be convenient if there was an option to sort the tracks chronologically by their release date. For example a menu (maybe also with other sort orders) in the "organize playlist" view could do that.

title: The new UI.
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
I really like the new UI, but more than how it looks I am concerned about how it works. I am hoping to be able to have AntennaPod work like this: 

All new episodes are downloaded immediately, not with the next refresh like it is today. I also want all new episodes automatically to be added the the queue. And finally I would like to either be able to set which screen it opens to (Queue or New Episodes) or that it opens to the screen you had open when you closed it. I would like new episodes added to the top of the queue by default (at least as an options also. Finally I want episodes automatically deleted when they are played although I can live with the current episode cache method of limited storage use by AntennaPod.

How happy should I be with the new UI in this regard, or are the things I am talking about not part of the redesign?

title: New user interface needs testing

But i would like to make sure that the new interface works reliably and without any major bugs. So it would be awesome if the people who are using the nightly builds anyway or would like to support the development of the app could download the [Test APK](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/45vgg13bmh8jmhp/AAAQGpUiQGdnU9852CRAPslYa/antennapod-newgui-583361b-nightly.apk) from the nightly builds folder to see if it runs on their device. 
Please note that, while the test version should be quite usable at this point, there might still be bugs that only occur on certain devices or with certain podcast subscribtions and therefore haven't been found yet.

If you find any bugs, you can post them in this issue. Please don't forget to add the version number of your Android device.

title: continueing a podcast after restart doesn't work
label: [Label(name="duplicate")]
body:
I have a problem with this app when I interrupt and continue a podcast. 
## Steps to reproduce

The bug appears under different circumstances but here is the easiest method to reproduce goes like this:
1. open a downloaded podcast. 
2. use the seekbar bar to skip to the middle of the podcast
3. use the appication switcher to kill the app. the playback should stop now. ![application switcher](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/842548/2604824/56a3dcf4-bb3e-11e3-84ca-b22e97a49cc3.png)
4. start anteannapod again. the last podcast issue should be in the (bottom) bar now. tap it. the seekbar should still be in the middle.
5. tap the play button
### Expected result

the podcast should continue where it was.
### Actual result

There is like a second of my former position and after the playback jumps to a random point in the beginning of the podcast (in my current case 00:02:01)

title: impossible to disable downloading of episode images
body:
So, apparently the newest version downloads episode pictures. My issue is that most of my podcast provide an image for each episode (although it's apparently always just the logo/image of the podcast itself) and with some feeds containing 100+ or even 300+ episodes, I now have an "images" folder with 100+mb of completely useless copies of a few podcast images, and that was _after_ I quit the update by force-closing the app halfway through.

One example is "Stop Podcasting Yourself".. over 300 episodes and each one has a 500kb 1400x1400px jpg file. So the images from that podcast alone would use up ~150mb on my phone. And that's just one podcast. It's the most egregious example, but it's a problem with many feeds. Judge John Hodgman for example..150x152kb. Especially for people with limited data, actually doing that first refresh with the newest version can really screw you over (luckily I was on wifi). But even then, 100-200mb for pointless episode images is a waste considering the limited storage on most phones.

Additionally it seems like a download queue of 1000+ can crash the app.

There needs to be a way to deal with this and imho it shouldn't be default behavior, especially not on mobile data.

title: feature idea: (randomly) play archive of podcast
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
When adding a new podcast feed, AntennaPod currently treats all existing episodes in that podcast as read. Only the next episode will be auto-downloaded by default. In order to accommodate the (not sure how common) use-case of discovering a new podcast and wanting to listen to it's archive, I suggest adding the options "play archive" to the show-information or already during the "Add podcast" process. If activated, a reasonable amount (maybe 50% of set episode cache size?) of old episodes from that feed get treated as new & therefore automatically downloaded. In chronological order starting with the oldest one. Here, [Podlove Paged Feeds](http://podlove.org/paged-feeds/) should be taken into account.

Another, IMHO less important use-case is wanting to listen to random old episodes from a podcast, or even from all subscribed podcasts. If the above feature idea of archive downloading is accepted, it would hopefully not be a big deal to also add a "random archive download"-option, either to the show information screen of a podcast, or as a general setting.

In any case, the latest episode in a newly added feed should be treated as new, so that it get's shuffled into the waiting list or queue like any truly new episode.

title: Automatic Download directly to the Waiting List. (Feature/enhancement)
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Hi,

I would like an option to have new episodes downloaded directly to the Waiting List and not wait until added to the Queue or until next refresh. It could be a setting under Automatic Download: "Download directly to Waiting List". Personally I would like this to be default behavior. I do not really understand why automatic download is tied to adding to queue or the next refresh like it is now. It works but isn't as automated as I would like it to be. I would like all new episodes download as soon as they come in.

title: Playback and queue corrupts when an episode that was played outside of the queue finishes.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I'm working off the develop branch, fetched two hours ago. Normally I wouldn't write a bug report about the develop branch, but considering you merged it to the master branch 6 hours ago, I think it's fine.

To reproduce this
1. Have an empty queue
2. Go the podcasts tab and play something directly from the list (so without adding anything to the queue).
3. Finish the episode (doesn't matter how: skip, slide, listen)
4. Repeat 2, but make sure it's the same episode
4a. Notice that you can't play the episode.
4b. Notice that the episode is now in the queue, but can't play it from there either
4c. Remove and repeat 4 will result in the same situation.

How to get out of this situation (sometimes)
1. Play a different episode
2. Finish the episode (doesn't matter how: skip, slide, listen)
3. The app should skip to the next episode
4. Sometimes you can play this, sometimes you can't, but when you can and the episode finishes, things will go back to normal.

title: How does the episode cache work?
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
Hi,

How does the episode cache limit actually work? What will happen if you are up to the limit you've set, have auto download set and are adding a new podcast to the queue whichh should be downloaded? Will the oldest downloaded podcast be deleted or will the new episode not be downloaded until you manually delete episodes keeping you under the set limit?

Also is the limit per podcast or total downloaded episodes?

title: Not auto downloading.
body: I'm running 0.9.8.2 on a Moto X with Android 4.2.2. I have auto download set but new podcasts are only added to the Waiting List but not downloaded. Aren't they supposed to be downloaded right away? It's possible I do not fully understand how the Waiting List and auto download works, but I compare to Podkicker Pro where new shows are downloaded as soon as a refresh finds a new episode. I am running Podkicker also to compare and it is downloading the new episodes right away.

title: The AC360 podcast shows 0 bytes episodes
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
The AC360 podcast show 0 bytes episodes that can't be downloaded. Feed works and has full downloadable episodes in other players. Feed: 

http://www.cnn.com/services/podcasting?eref=ac360audio

title: Backup feed list using the Android Backup API
body:
This adds backup and restore of the feed subscriptions (ref. issue #379)

The code backs up the OPML file (not the database) so that we don't need to worry about database versions. The feed list is restored when the app is first started after a fresh install. I added a minimal amount of UI: a simple Toast message showing if the restore was successful.

title: in context menu, disable "move to x"
body: Instead of removing "move to top" and"move to bottom" for first and last item, disable them. I've accidentally removed items from the queue instead of moving them to the top because the "move to bottom" entry went away and shifted the location of "move to top" on the screen.

title: Backup feed list using the Android Backup API
body: I recently had to re-install AntennaPod and lost list of feed subscriptions. Wouldn't it be nice if AntennaPod backed up it's feed list to a remote storage using the [Backup API](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/data/backup.html)? Is anyone working on this, or should I?

title: Fix url path get encoded twice
body:
Hey Daniel,

i had an problem to download files embedded in the feed were the url is already urlencoded. 

Reproduce the Problem:
1. add a new Podcast the "Android Developers Backstage" Podcast from gpodder.net
2. try to download an episode from this podcast
3. the Download failed with a 404

The Problem is in [src/de/danoeh/antennapod/service/download/HttpDownloader.java#L32](https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/blob/master/src/de/danoeh/antennapod/service/download/HttpDownloader.java#L32)

You first create an URL and after that you are creating an URI with all the components of this created URL. By using the multi-argument constructor URI the path of the URL get urlencoded again.
See http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4858108/url-to-uri-encoding-changes-a-3d-to-253d for details

regards,
David

title: Option to export/import database
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
It would be handy to have a way to export the AntennaPod database and import it into a custom build for testing, or when moving between the Google Play and F-Droid builds. As it is now I have to manually keep track of downloaded/played episodes.

This is not a high priority thing for me though.

title: Bad Voltage Podcast Download is not working
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Hallo,

I added the bad voltage podcast with this url: http://www.badvoltage.org/feed/mp3/
The stream is working fine.
When I try to download it i get a notification that the download has finished with a 404.

I get that error on a nexus 7 2013 with android 4.4 and on the htc one x with cm 4.4 nightly.

title: Different playback speed for different podcasts
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Would be great if I there would be a setting for each podcast defining the playback speed, e.g. I could listen to music podcasts in its original playback speeds, whereas I can speed things up for "spoken" podcasts.

title: Make it possible to remove last podcast of playlist
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: It seems impossible to delete the last podcast of the playlist. Even if skipping this episode (effectively completely clearing the playlist), it still can't be removed from within its feed overview. The only options offered are to skip the epidosde (which doesn't make any sense) and to add it to the playlist again.

title: Auto play when app starts
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: [Feature Request] It would be great if you could automatically play your queue when the app is launched. What I want to do is the following: I can automatically launch the app via an alarm app in the morning.  With the auto download feature, I can get the latest podcast that was published and I'd like that to play (or whatever was on my queue) as soon as the app launches.  This feature would need to have a disable/enable option, and likely each feed could be configured to auto play, just like it can be configured to auto download. Thank you!

I think this could be optimized somehow.
It could be related to having many feeds (about 50).

title: gpodder.net: add "Sync now" button / improve update/refresh action
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

It seems like the regular update/refresh action does not sync the subscription list from gpodder.net. I had to update several times, before a new subscription was picked up.

I think that a separate "Sync with gpodder.net" button in the gpodder.net settings would be useful, which would explicitly carry out that action.

Apart from that, the regular update/refresh action could be improved to always sync with gpodder.net, too.

Thanks for a fantastic podcast tool!

Added support for the com.android.music.metachanged
body:
Added support for the com.android.music.metachanged to get music metadata to display correctly on A2DP/AVRCP devices. It seems that without the metachanged intent, the metadata like Feed Title and Episode Title will not be displayed. 
Disclaimer: I don't have Android SDK installed, so I haven't really tested this patch (not even compiled it), but I kept it small and "it should work" (tm).

title: Random restart instead of resume
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Every now and then when I start AntennaPod with a podcast where the playback was paused somewhere in the middle and I hit play, it does not continue from where it was paused but restarts playback from the beginning of the track. In the player view the progress bar and runtime still show the correct values right before starting but as soon as I press play, both jump back to the beginning.

I could not track down if it is related to some special event, but it only occurs if AntennaPod has not been used for at least several hours. I have the suspicion that it could be related to the fact that my phone sometimes (partially?) reboots which I do not necessarily notice every time it happens.

This might be somehow related to #319 but I'm not quite sure if it is the same bug.

title: Support Paged Feeds
body:
I would like to see support for paged feeds. RFC 5005

http://podlove.org/paged-feeds/
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5005

title: Handling of bad XML?
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
My officemate just installed AntennaPod from F-Droid and was attempting to add the podcasts he listens to. He stumbled on:

http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting/includes/whitecoat.xml

"Parser Exception: At line 31, column 54: not well-formed (invalid token).

So, it's definitely an error with the feed. However, some RSS readers (for example, ownCloud News) _do_ parse it, XML error and all. Could some less harsh handling be added so that such podcasts could at least be added, or the error mitigated to some degree?

In this specific case, the error seems to be the & (rather than &) in "Leslee Thompson is the president & CEO of Kingston General Hospital", which is enclosed withing a <description> tag; WebKit throws up the error "xmlParseEntityRef: no name" for that. Would it be possible to just ignore such malformed entities if they're within a description or title tag?

title: [Feature request] Option for normalisation of audio volume after download.
label: [Label(name="duplicate"), Label(name="feature request")]
body: Use case: podcasts recorded by radio broadcasters are extremely quiet.  Listening to these podcasts interrupted by (relatively very loud) car navigation announcements is very uncomfortable.

title: Chrome Cast Support
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Are there any plans for Chrome Cast Support?

title: Case-insensitive ordering of podcast feed list
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: The order of the list of podcast feeds seems to be ordered in ASCII order, i.e. it is case-sensitive. Thus, the position of a podcast named abcdef is after that of ZYXWVU, which seems counter-intuitive to me. It would be better if the order would be case-insensitive, i.e. AABB -> abcdef -> ZYWWVU.

title: Feature request: Jump to time
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Using VLC to listen to the lectures, I have found the option in the player to jump to a particular time quite handy. Could you add something similar to that on VLC for android?

Thanks,
Alex

title: Feature request: jump buttons on lock screen widget
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Sometimes when listening to podcasts one gets distracted a bit, but not intense or long enough to pause the podcast playback, for example when sitting on a train and there's an announcement where one does not know from the beginning if it is important for oneself. In such cases I like to jump back some seconds in the playback where the jump buttons in the player come in quite handy. But it would be even nicer if those buttons were also on the lock screen widget, as this way one would not have to unlock the phone and fire up antennapod to do so.

title: Playback finishes early on Android 4.4.2
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When listening to downloaded audio podcasts with the screen off on Android 4.4.2 the playback stops before the end of the file.  For example, on one of the MP3s from http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/radio4/thpop/rss.xml it stops around 15 seconds from the end when the device is locked, but continues to the end if the screen is on.

I've seen this on a Nexus 5 using version 0.9.8.0 from the Play store, and on an generic emulated device with the current master, develop and playbackservice_rewrite branches.  An emulated Android 4.2.2 image doesn't have any trouble.

title: Media content not shown and not loaded, when added to existing rss item
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Example of rss feed: http://news.tut.by/rss/s~1185.rss. Updated weekly.
Initially, items in feed are populated without media content. This is an announcement.
AntennaPod shows this item with no media content attached.
After one - two days there media content was added.
AntennaPod shows that no media content was attached to this rss item after updating feed.

title: Feature - don't automatically populate queue with new episodes
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: For those that have a large amount of podcasts and only want to queue specific episodes for automatic downloading

title: Last played: sort order
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
IMHO it would make more sense if the last played episode would come first.

Short: reverse order

title: Add '\n' to the list of illegal characters in filenames.
body:
Small fix for this bug https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/issues/68
Based on this rss-fedd http://www.echo.msk.ru/programs/dream/rss-audio.xml

title: Organization
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Needs a way to organize downloaded podcasts by holding and sliding them up or down. An auto to organize them by episode number would be nice as well. The current options of move to the top or bottom are very much limited.

It would be nice to organize the un-downloaded podcasts from old to new as well in case one wants to listen to a pod channel from the beginning.

title: Discussion forum for AntennaPod
body: Is there anywhere to discuss AntennaPod in general, e.g. the overall direction of development. Whether a web forum or a mailing list, it would be good to have something separate from the github issues list.

title: Create website for AntennaPod
label: [Label(name="project issue")]
body: It would be nice if there was a "proper" website for AntennaPod, other than the github page or Play Store page.

title: Remove option regarding headphone disconnect, act as if always ticked
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
Following the principal of not having a user option if the author or software can choose for you, I suggest removing the "Headphones disconnect" option, and acting as if it is always ticked. In other words, make the app always pause when the headphones are removed without giving the user the choice to make the app behave otherwise.

My reasoning is that almost all users will have this option ticked already, making the option redundant and just taking up space in the Settings screen. I cannot see any reason why anyone would want playback to continue when headphones are removed. If for some reason someone wanted to share a good bit of a podcast with a wider audience, they could just press the play button after they remove the headphones.

title: Sudden stops and wrong resume time.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Many times when i want to resume playback it will resume at earlier location than when i left it.

Other times it will stop after a minute of playback. When I try to play again it will start from a very old time of that chapter.

title: AutoQueue instead of AutoDownload
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I don't understand autodownload. The N topmost queued podcast should always be downloaded.

Instead, i'd like to choose certain feeds auto-queued whenever a new item appears.

title: Feature request - auto delete already listened podcasts
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Congrats for your job in this app, its so amazing and for me almost perfect, I don't know if its hard to do or not, but if you could add the auto delete of the podcast when we finish it will be good. Thanks!

title: Auto downloading doesn't download new podcasts immediately but waits for the next interval
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When the automatic download updates the feeds and a new episode is found, that episode is not downloaded immediately. Instead AntennaPod will wait for your custom set update interval (2h in my case).

Leaving the house with an undownloaded episode is a bit annoying, easpecially when the download would have only taken a few seconds on your wifi.

I did not test if that issue appears when setting a high update interval, but if it does one would receive all new episodes only after a high delay.

My personal fix is to regularly check for new podcasts and hitting the update button manully, but I would like AntennaPod to be purely push- and not pull-style.

title: Not an Issue just a Question
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
We have a website with around 100 Media RSS Feeds, would it be possible to use your  to preload these RSS Feeds?

i.e. we create an instance of your App and add these feeds as defaults?

I am new to app development not a programmer full-time so any pointers would be highly appreciated.

title: OPML export: Choose export folder
label: [Label(name="feature request"), Label(name="good first issue")]

title: bugfix: avoid raising audio volume when paused
gpodder.net login light themed popup even with dark theme
body:
When you have the dark theme selected and login to gpodder.net the popup will be in the light theme.

It is a bit annoying because it is very bright, and the text is white on white, because text is white in the dark theme.

title: Video aspect ratio wrong
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When I play videos from this podcast, the aspect ratio is wrong:  http://mediacenter.dw.de/english/podcasts/

Compare it to playback via the build in video player or VLC for Android.

title: Unreadable (White on White) text in gpodder.net Login menu.
body:
gpodder.net service login screen can show white text on white backgrounds while the app is set to use the "Dark" theme. This is most evident when the user inputs text in the login fields. This issue is not seen while the theme is set to "Light."

Device: Samsung Galaxy SII (i9100)
gpodder ver. 0.9.8.0

title: Please make the "include in auto downloads"-option more accessible.
body:
Sorry for double-posting this, but [the comment in the related pull request #293 ](https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/pull/293#issuecomment-27380080) is probably too well hidden ;-)

The feed preference option to include/exclude certain ones from auto downloads is very useful, thank you :-)

However, because a podcast's description can be of variable length and the checkbox is always below it, access is sometimes made harder. Can you please move it to the top of the "Show information"-screen? That way, muscle memory could kick in and help users toggle it quickly.

Having to scroll in order to read a long description is IMHO more natural & common than having to scroll to reach a standard setting.

title: Feature Request: Tapping icon should play episode
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: It would be useful if tapping an episode's icon in the episode view would cause that episode to immediately start playing.  I know that you can click the play icon from the top of the episode details screen but being able to do this from the episode list would be quicker and safer (for example when in a car).

title: Automatic playlists
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi!
Automatic playlists would be nice. At least adding the oldest or newest episodes
automatically to the playlist. For having always the 10 oldest episodes in the
playlist.

title: Importing episodes
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
AP should be able to import already downloaded episodes. Some feeds offer
only the last episodes. But most times you can manually download episodes
from archives

title: Behaviour after episode end
body:
Hi!
Can you add an option to select the behaviour after an episode has ended?
I thought about autodelete.

title: add preference option/list for displaying cover image, show notes or chapter marks
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Currently, the details view of each episode shows the cover image. It would be nice to be able to customize. I for example would like to see chapter marks first, if available.

Thanks and greetings!

title: Adding default stream URL to application
label: [Label(name="question")]
body: How can we pre populate or add default podcast stream urls to application?

title: Failed Download
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body: Downloading of audio file failed if audio URL contains spaces. Streaming is fine.

title: Feature Request: Support for Podlove Chapter Marks
body:
I would love to see support for Podlove's chapter makrs. Additional information can be found on the project website: http://podlove.org/specifications/

What do you think?

Bye
F4l0

title: v0.9.8 plays M4As too slow
body:
I noticed this problem first with v0.9.7.5 with Freakshow's AAC feed: http://freakshow.fm/feed/m4a/ and now again with http://www.raumschiff-rumdenker.de/feed/mpeg-4/.

Episodes are played at maybe 10% of the normal speed. Increasing the playback speed changed something, but even 3x wasn't fast enough to make any speech understandable.

Strangely, the time display looked normal, only the audio was too slow.

title: Crashes often when using Prestissimo and queue is over 20 episodes (and wastes space)
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Since the official release of variable speed support, when the queue is over 20 items and using Prestissimo (speed 1.45x), AntennaPod crashes almost always at the end of playing an episode.

This wouldn't be a big problem since I can keep a queue under 20 items and many of the episodes I listen are around one hour, but when an episode ends the file cleanup doesn't happen and AntennaPod fails to track the file, which leads to disk space waste and a manual cleanup must be done.

title: feature request: play whole queue
body: It would be a great addition to be able to continually play through the queue list.  Thanks for the great work.

title: Feature request: bottom play bar different color
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
I suggest making bottom bar in different color
Reason: to make it different from episodes list

title: Pause button delays for minutes
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
If I play pause button on my headphones when just connected to a wifi network it will actually pause or play several seconds to minutes later.

This only happens when just connected to a wifi network. If I have been connected for a while it will work normally.

I can easily reproduce the problem by start playing, disabling and enabling wifi and let it connect, then pause on headphones.

Tested on 0.9.7.5 as well as develop versions.
Android 4.2.2 (CM10.1 Unofficial).
Samsung GT-i9003

title: prioritise episode details
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Since v0.7.5 (Google Play store build), I have the impression that episode details aren't viewable anymore, if downloads are running in parallel. The display stays blank for many seconds often, and sometimes the app also crashes (although that might be related to me running CM 10.2 nightlies). When no downloads are running, the episode details are displayes as quickly as expected.

It would be great if downloading episode details could be prioritised over other downloads. Thanks and greetings!

title: Add feed preference to include/exclude certain feeds from auto downloads
body: I had to shift a few things around and deleted some of the FeedPreference related stuff to make things easier to work with. Having to load a feed's preferences manually was a pain, it doesn't make sense to work with the preferences without the feed, so just load the feed including its preferences in a single db operation. Apart from that, the code is the same as in the original pull request (#239).

body:
OPML import its not possible in this release.

Import

Feeds imported 

It works in 0.9.7.4. Im using cyanogenmod 7.

title: Bug: fails to build @ f-droid (missing dependency)
body:
apparently there's some dependency missing and so AntennaPod won't build on a "default maven setup". I was particularly interested in the new version because I believe I'm seeing Issue #216.

re 0.9.7.5:
<mvdan> that version doesn't build from source
<mvdan> we would have had it two weeks ago if it did

<mvdan> which came after .4 was released
<mvdan> a default maven setup (which is what we have) doesn't work

<me> but i can pass this all along
