title: Problem with RSS feed
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I use Antennapod on two devices and on one of them, when I try to download a podcast episode, I receive the message "An error occurred when trying to donwload the file: Failed to access the external storage". Also, when I update the episodes list, the download fails and I receive the message "IO error: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-CBN - Podcast - No Div do Gikovate (Invalid argument)"

On the other device, this feed works without any problem. I've already tried to exclude the feed and delete this cache directory but It didn't help although It seems like some cache or temporary files problem... Is there any other directory I may clean or exclude to try to make this feed work ?

Thank you,

Regards,

Renato.

title: All Downloads Fail
body:
Neither can I download episodes nor update podcast feeds. The download log just says: Unknown Error.

Before this happened, I had a similar issue as described in #61 -- AntennaPod could not delete a file properly -- so this might be somehow related.

Thank you very much in advance for helping me on this.

Best wishes

Proedie

title: Allow setting a download folder
body:
I'd like to specify the folder, where downloaded episodes are saved.

My phone memory (and internal SD memory) is used up with all kind of stuff I cannot move but I have an additional SD card with plenty of free memory which I'd like to use to save my podcast episodes.

title: Import OPML file shows text field to user, not title
body:
When importing an OPML file, the text field is displayed to the user when picking which subscriptions to import, rather than the title feed. E.g. with:

```
<outline text="Richard Herring chats with some of the biggest names in comedy" title="Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast" type="rss" xmlUrl="http://feeds.feedburner.com/RichardHerringLSTPodcast"/>
```

the user will see "Richard Herring chats with some of the biggest names in comedy" in the list of subscriptions to import rather then the expected "Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast".

This is more of a problem for entries in the OPML file which either have no text field, or when multiple entries have the same text field.

title: Fix issue #63
body:
If an HTTP request returns an error code 301 or 302, follow redirects to the
new location.

title: AntennaPod does not follow HTTP redirects
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
I had a Podcast feed where AntednnaPod did not download an episode. It only returned HTTP status code 302 as error in the log. HTTP status code 302 denotes a redirect to a new location.

AntennaPod should follow redirects in HTTP downloads.

title: expandable Notifications
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: it would be great to have expandable notifications (Android 4.1+) with Player Controls (also in the Lockscreen they would be awesome). Also a Download Progress Bar in the Notifications would be great!

title: Does not recover from failed file deletion.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
This just occured to me. I had my sd-card mounted in read-only mode (don't ask why) and antennaPod crashed when removing an item. when i restarted the app, the item was indeed removed, but still visible in /sdcard/Android/data/...

I think it would be easy enough if AntennaPod first tries to delete the file, then remove it from the database. That way it will crash before it removes the item from the db.

title: Favorite List
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Please add an option to star (add favorite) episodes. So the users can easily create a list of interesting episodes.  If they want to hear that episode the open the favorite list and can download the episode again.

title: Auto-Download option
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: I'd like AntennaPod to automatically enqueue and download new episodes

title: Ability to view downloaded (not queued) items.
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: One possible solution for this cold be to unify the "downloaded" and the "in queue" state.

title: Unify queue with downloaded episodes.
body: I think there's no reason for a differentiation between "downloaded" and "in queue". It just doesn't seem useful, but rather a hassle to me.

title: Save correct image title
Expand arrow button
body:
Like in this picture: 

http://i.imgur.com/o0dSL.jpg

At the moment its not difficult to hit to button, but it feels a bit "delicate".

title: Feature: Mark episode as unread
body: That feature would be helpful. If a episode is marked as unread its easier to find (bold text etc.).

title: Fixed a typo
Episode not playing - displays "prepare bla"-message
body:
the current episode of pentaradio doesn't start playing.

AntennaPod just displays the same message like after pressing "stream".

"Bereite vor" - "prepare bla"

This Episode:
http://www.c3d2.de/news/pentaradio24-20121023.html

Feed URL:

http://c3d2.de/podcast.xml

title: Last Update ( 0.9.5.3) clears playlist
body:
Last update removes all elements of the playlist. listened an unlistenes episodes.

It's not funny if you lose 30 episode you want to listen. :)

title: Multiselect
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Would it be possible to support multi selection in the episode list-view for example by using long press.

title: Make data directory configurable
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: It would be nice if there was a way to specify the directory where AntennaPod saves the Podcasts, for example /mnt/sdcard/Podcasts instead of the current location. This would be particularly useful for phones with both internal memory (/mnt/sdcard) and an external sdcard (/mnt/extSdCard).

title: New podcasts overwrite existing files if filenames coincide
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: Some feeds give all their audio files the same name (e.g. http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-earth). This will lead to AntennaPod overwriting the existing audio file when a new episode is downloaded, so basically only one episode can be present at any time.

title: Cannot add feed due to "Invalid type"
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Many podcasts cannot be added to AntennaPod because it does not recognize their type. Here are some examples:

http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60secsciencepodcast
http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-mind
http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-space
http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-health
http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-tech
http://www.risky.biz/netcasts/risky-business
http://www.risky.biz/netcasts/rb2

I have not had any problems with other podcasting applications, is it possible that AntennaPod is too strict about the format of the feed?

title: Labels indicating feeds and items "read"/"unread"/"in progress" counts and states
body:
The changes in this branch all revolve about the concept of episodes that were started listening to but aren't finished yet.
- The feed list shows the count of "in progress" episodes in addition to the count of the "new" episodes, both with a colored label so they can easily be distinguished
- The feed item list shows a colored label indicating the "read"/"unread"/"in progress" state. This makes it a lot easier to find "this one episode I think I started listening to but I can't really remember which one it was"
- Episodes that are currently "in progress" can be marked either "new" (and will consequently start from the beginning the next time they are played) or "read"

title: Support feeds which uses HTTP Basic Authentication
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi,

I tried to use a feed which requires HTTP Basic Authentication:
https://couch.fernsehkritik.tv/feed/

But it seems that AntennaPod don't support feeds with authentication. Would be nice to add this feature :-)

Regards
 Bernd

title: Can not import OPML file
body: I put an file called "Podcasts.opml" in the indicated directory, but AntennaPod does not show it in its OPML import activity and I can't import my podcasts. I'm using the Google Play version of AntennaPod.

title: Enhancement: view number of downloaded episodes in list view
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: In Feed list view, there is a number for every podcast which tells the user how many podcast episodes this podcast has in total. But it would be great to see in this list view, how many episodes where downloaded, too.

title: Download: sequential instead of parallel
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi there,

just a minor enhancement request: if you have many downloads, it can take quite a while for the first one to finish as the downloads are parallel. Perhaps you could add an option so the downloads can also be sequential?

title: Removed feedburner specific URL handling
body:
The ?format=xml parameter should not be necessary. It could even cause
problems in case the url already contains a parameter string.

title: Images in shownotes will not display if network is down
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
If there is network connection the app displays pictures in show notes. But if the network connection is down you can change to menu of antennapod and then move back and the images is not there.

Please download and store images in show notes if the episode is downloaded.

title: Reorder objects in playlist easier
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Make it possible to reorder objects in the playlist by long press on the arrow on the right.

Sorry i don't know who the function is named but most music players on Android do it that way.

title: Removed duplicate string resources.
body: There was a duplicate string resource with name "download_error_device_not_found" in all string.xml files.

title: Renamed package de.danoeh.antennapod.miroguide.con
body: On Windows "con" is not a valid filename. I renamed the package to de.danoeh.antennapod.miroguide.conn in order to be able to checkout the code on Windows.

title: gpodder.net Integration
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
It would be awesome if AntennaPod could integrate the gpodder.net webservice.

Here is the API documentation for gpodder.net:
http://wiki.gpodder.org/wiki/Web_Services/API_2

If you have any question feel free to ask on the gPodder mailing list (http://wiki.gpodder.org/wiki/Mailing_List) or on the IRC channel #gpodder on freenode.net

title: Feature Requests
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
1. Notification controls
2. Ability to reorder queue
3. Automatically mark as read if podcast is downloaded
4. Automatically remove from queue if podcast is deleted

Just some ideas that could be implemented in the future.

Thank you

title: Podcast image not loading
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: For the feed at http://podcast.hr-online.de/lateline/podcast.xml the image is not loading. That's not a bug in AntennaPod, because the feed is broken (it contains image tags with empty urls in every single item), but maybe it would be possible to work around that by ignoring image tags that aren't direct children of a channel element.

title: Wrong episode downloaded in "Display only episodes" mode
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: In version 0.9.5.1 (from FDroid, if that matters), if you enable the "Display only episodes" checkbox and then try to download (directly from the list of episodes, either for a single podcast or on the "New" tab) an episode that comes after where a hidden non-episode would have been, you either get the wrong file or no option to download at all.  It's as if it's ignoring the "Display only episodes" option when working out which file to download.

title: [Bug] Hackerfunk Podcast - Audio file is not detected
body:
Hi,

there is a podcast which doesn't work the right way.

http://www.hackerfunk.ch/

Feeds:
http://www.hackerfunk.ch/podcast.php?cat=OGG

http://www.hackerfunk.ch/podcast.php?cat=MP3

AtennaPod makes everything right except that it doesn't notice(d) that there are audio files in posts.

I am not sure whats the problem, but other Catcher works fine (Google Listen, gPodder, Rhythmbox, BeyondPod).

Greetings lof

title: Download torrent-feeds
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
Hi,

it would be nice if AntennaPod was able to download podcasts from torrent-feeds. A directory with some feeds in it can be found here: http://bitlove.org/directory

I understand that this feature is not very important to most users and rather hard to implement, so I will not be disappointed if it gets a very low priority. But I wanted to mention it anyway.

title: add fdroid link
body: At the moment there is no image for that purpose, but i filed a bug report for that on frdoid.org.

title: Change start-tab to "new"
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
I am not a person who changes his feeds every day. But when i start antenna i see all the well known stuff. But more interesting is the new stuff.

In other words: When antennaPod start "new" should be the selected tab.

And btw it looks really nice if the blue bar is symmetric.

title: Video: control bar animation looks wrong
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
If you tab on a video to show the controls, the lower bar moves in from above. That's why there is a white block which appears when the bar is moving.

The control bar should move up from the buttom of the screen.

title: Playlist jumps to the first entry when an episode is listened.
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
When you play an episode from the play list which isn't the first or last, a "bug" appears when you finished one episode.

Normally play lists are played from the top to the bottom, no matter where you start. but AntennaPod jumps to the first entry every time you finished an episode, no matter which item is played.

How it should be: If an episode is listened, the next (means the under lying entry) episode should be played.

title: Feature Request - Clear Notifications
body:
I wonder if its possible to add an option in "settings" to "clear notifications after completed" or something to that effect. I understand they are needed while updating feeds and downloading episodes but it would be great to have them automatically go away when completed instead of having to manually clear them every time.

Thank you

title: More intellegent delete function
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The new auto-delete-function works well, but is a bit to fast / rigorous.  Wouldn't it be better that the user can configure how many episodes should be leave in the storage or how much space antennapod can use?

In GUI:
A simple config dialogue where the user can define something like:

> store 20 episode or 500 MB

Hope my request is understandable ;)

Greetings lightonflux

title: "Recently listened" - Feature request
body:
When i listen to a podcast i just listen, i don't look a the show notes. After i listened a episode completely the episode is removed from the play list. If i want to browse through the show notes i have to retrieve the episode in "feeds"  "podcast name"  "list of episodes".

I think a simply list which provides the last fifteen  episodes which are completely listened would be a great time saver.

BTW: The  "automatic delete"-function should skip items of this list. Therewith it is easy to listen to something again.

Hope my request is comprehensible :)

Greetings lightonflux

title: please add support for homerj.de podcast
body:
http://podcast.homerj.de/podcasts.xml does not work with AntennaPod but seems to work for Apple

Thank you  for  AntennaPod

title: Variable speed playback
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: A lot of times, speakers speak too slowly or too fast. It would be great to have a way to adjust playback speed, especially without a $5 third party library like all other podcatchers do.

title: Feature Request: Importing from Google Listen
body:
One of the annoyances I've had with trying out any new podcast app is that I have to manually re-type in the urls of all of the podcasts that I have already subscribed to in Google Listen. This is true of AntennaPod as well, because few of the podcasts I want are in the Miro guide. I suspect that I am not the only one with this issue. I also suspect (though I don't _know_) that Listen is the most widely used podcatcher on Android.

Perhaps is would help adoption of the app if the user could easily import their existing podcast subscriptions in Listen. I know nothing of what is involved in implementing such a feature, or if it is even possible.

I believe a similar feature exists in Firefox for Android, where bookmarks and cookies can be imported from "Browser".

Thanks for your attention

Tony

PS: None of this would be (as much of) an issue if I could get Firefox (or Browser) to subscribe to a podcast by simply tapping on the RSS link. Perhaps I'm just missing something obvious.

title: Adding podcasts from same source
body:
First off, thank you for your work. I'm glad someone has put together a good open source podcast app to replace Google Listen. Now, on to the problem.

When I add two feeds from the CBC no new entry is created for the second one, but podcasts for the second start appearing in the list for the first.  The CBC seems to be keeping all their XML files in the same directory (and this may be the source of the problem). To reproduce this, add the following feed:

"http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting/includes/spark.xml"

For me it shows up correctly in the feeds tab

Then add

"http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting/includes/writersandco.xml"

No new feed appears, but podcasts for the second feed start to appear in the list for the first. To me this seems to be incorrect behaviour.

 Perhaps the URL used for the first feed is being replaced with the second -- I can't tell from what I'm seeing. You can reverse the order of adding the feeds -- the first feed added appears, the second always gets "added" to the first. If either feed is on a _different_ host (for example NPR) two separate feeds are created and seem to work correctly.

Perhaps the problem is that both of these XML files contain the link to the same site: "http://www.cbc.ca/podcasting", even though they are different and separate feeds.

Thanks again.

Tony

title: Possible Bug - Lockscreen
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body: I have noticed that often when i disconnect my earbuds and then reconnect them the lockscreen controls disappear and i have to force close and restart the app to get them back. Any idea what is causing this?

title: Feature Request - Playback Controls
body: Would it be possible to have rewind and fast forward during playback. Maybe longpress to fast forward/rewind?

title: Possible Bug
body: I noticed that the lockscreen controls are not centered and missing the right button. I can provide screenshot of the issue if needed.

title: Feature Request - Headset Controls
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
First of all, I want to thank you for making the best free podcatcher I have found to date.

I think headset controls would make this app even better. Even as basic as just play/pause would be great.

Also would there be a way to automatically clear the refresh/download notification or an option to not show them at all?

Thanks

title: No Downloadable Files Found for some Podcasts
body:
First of all: Let me thank you for this app, just what I was waiting for!

However there is a small issue with two of my podcasts which might be somehow related to #14. Or maybe not. AntennaPod cannot find downloadable files in the following feeds:
- http://ulm.ccc.de/dev/radio/podcast-ogg.xml
- http://www.duden.de/feed/podcast

In the latter case this might be a problem with the feed since  [SwallowCatcher](http://webworxshop.com/projects/swallowcatcher) cannot handle that one either.

Thank you very much in advance for fixing this issue.

proedie

Firefox and other podcatcher/feedreader have no problems with their feeds.

title: Feature Request
body:
Hi,

in my eyes has your software the most potential to will the best podcast app on android market. :)
1. Playlist Support (minimum Audio and Video Podcast playlist)
2. podcast will delete after listen 
   2.a. mark podcast to hold on the phone
3. "cloud" sync for multiple devices
4. Video Playback (i can not test it on my phone during crashes)

i hope you will bring much more tools on the app.

regards,
Thomas

title: Feature Request: Support downloads via android download manager
body: Since android 2.3 there is this [download manager](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/DownloadManager.html) thing, which handles http downloads. Would it be possible to use the android download manager for downloading podcasts via AntennaPod?

title: Dark Skin
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body: Hey, I'd would be create if Settings could include an option to change the background color to black. Most if not all my apps have that. Thanks!

title: Support for embedded images in MP4 Enhanced Podcast files
label: [Label(name="feature request")]
body:
It would be great if AntennaPod could show pictures embedded in "enhanced podcast" m4a files like the iPhone does.

Example feed: http://www.schoene-ecken.de/feed/podcast/

title: Availability in Google Play
body:
I have Novo7 Paladin tablet: http://www.ainovo.com/novo7paladin-specs.html and I don't see AntennaPod in Google Play on this device. At the same time other podcast managers (podkicker, doggcatcher) are available. Also, I downloaded and installed apk on this device and it works perfectly.

Is there something in android manifest which could be the reason for this?

title: Feature request: Localization
body:
Is wiould be great if AntennaPod would be available in languages other than English.
It could be done using https://www.transifex.com/ for example.
I'd volunteer to translate it to Russian.

title: Feature request: .nomedia file
body: Could you add a .nomedia file to the directory where antennapod stores podcast images and podcasts by default? Because this will prevent the gallery from indexing podcast covers. Besides it will prevent music players from indexing podcasts, which is a usefull thing(at least I think so).

title: The "back button" in the top left corner behaves some kind of strange
body:
I am not so sure if this is a bug or if this is a feature but I think the back button in the top left corner should take me to the previous antennapod screen(even if this is some kind of a duplicated functionality because the android back button alreday does that kind of thing).
For example if you select a podcast in the new screen and press the top left corner button it will take you to the screen which displays all podcasts of this specific podcast and not the previous screen(which was the new screen in this example).

title: Display only those feed items which have a enclosure tag
body: I don't know if this is a bug or if this is planned but AntennaPod also displays me RSS Items which doesn't have a enclosure tag and because AntennaPod is a podcatcher I would prefer it if it would only display those items which actually have a enclosure tag.

title: Playback Problems
body: I am not able to listen to Podcasts in the ogg vorbis format, I can download them with AntennaPod and play them with my music player, but I can't directly play them with AntennaPod.

title: Suggestion: Automatically add downloaded items to queue
body: I always have the problem that I can't find the podcast that I have already downloaded when I am offline. Therefore I asked myself if it would be possible to add an option which would automatically add every downloaded Podcast to the queue?

title: The "Add a new Feed" screen looks some kind of strange
body:
When adding a new feed the text "Type in the URL of the Feed here" is at the same position as the "confirm" and "cancel" which looks somekind of strange...

Here is a screenshot:
![](http://files.neuntausend.org/scrot/antennapod_addfeed.png)

It's probably a known issue but I thought it would be better to report it incase it isn't.
